description: NEWARK, Oct. 5The Re publican floor leader of the New Jersey Assembly said to day that the jailing of a re porter for refusing to answer questions before a grand jury would assure a vote next month on a bill expanding newspaper men's privilege against being forced to divulge confidential sources.

title: Debenture Sales by Thrift Units Urged
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board, in a major policy move opened the door yester day for the nation's savings and loan associations to tap Wall Street for longterm capi tal.

title: Northwest Sells A Goodrich Block
description: Northwest Industries, a com pany that used to be a rail road and now says it has world leadership in manufacturing cowboy boots and jockey shorts yesterday sold a $28million block of B. F. Goodrich Com pany common stock acquired in a bitter takeover bid three years ago.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SCREENING OF ARABS BY U.S. IS CRITICIZED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The head of the Action Committee on American  Arab Relations protested today reported efforts by the Federal Government to search out Arab nationals in the United States who are sus pected of planning terrorism against Israeli citizens in this country.

title: Appoint All the Judges?
description: News Analysis

title: 2 Killed, 3 Hurt as Queens Gas Main Explodes in Test
description: Two workmen were killed and three other persons were injured yesterday afternoon when a newlylaid gas main being tested with highpressure air exploded near a busy in tersection in Jamaica Queens.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: WASHINGTON  The interest of this election will be lost if all one does is observe the two candidates; they are not all that interesting, they are possibly not all that important. American politics is breaking out of many old molds, irrespective of the candidates, and what is of real im portance is that they are not moving in the directions which have so often been predicted.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 5The state told the automobile insurance Industry today that a 15 per cent reduction in premium costs mandated under the new no fault system would be applied across the board to all policy holders despite the in dustry's opposition.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Po litical polls this fall may be having for the first time a bandwagon effect by reassur ing Democrats who are already inclined to vote for President Nixon, Daniel Yankelovich, head of a major survey con cern, told a House Subcommit tee today.

title: Spanish Woolf Set
description: The Greenwich Mews Span ish Theater, now located at 138 East 27th Street, will present Spanish production of Edward Albee's Who's Afraid of Vir ginia Woolf? next Friday. Rene Buch has made the translation and also will direct. The cast will include Silvio Brito, Raul Davilla, Miriam Cruz and Jean Paul.

title: Diners Club Sued on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 5 (AP) A $55.5million lawsuit has been filed in Superior Court against the Diners Club and its subsidiary DQM Club over failure to develop restaurants and hotel facilities aboard the Queen Mary, docked in Long Beach. The suit, filed yester day by Sky ChefsWrather Queen Mary Co., contends that it lost $27.7million in ex penses and anticipated profits when DQM backed out of its 25year lease agreement with the city of Long Beach on July 1, 1970.

title: Teachers in Hawaii Strike For Day in Hiring Dispute
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 5 (UPI)  Hawaii's public school teachers defied a court injunction and walked off their jobs for one day today in the first such strike, in the island state's his tory.

title: From City Hall to the Kitchen
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their at mosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Oil Concerns Set Accord With Five Arab Countries
description: Representatives of five Per sian Gulf oilproducing coun tries and the major Western oil companies reached agreement here yesterday on terms for the five countries eventually to take over control of the com panies' concessions in the area.

title: Amex Chief Favors. Procedural Change  Others Object
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Spokesmen for major stock ex changes clashed today over the extent to which the public should be involved in changing the rules under which ex Changes regulate their mem bers.

title: Wednesday's Fight
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.Jimmy Les ter, 164 pounds San Francisco, and Jos Martin Flores, 159, Los Angeles, drew, 10 rounds.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Oct. 5Vinnie Carlesimo, the St. Peter's College rookie football coach, acknowledged today that his Peacocks probably wouldn't win a game this year after having, failed to beat Manhattan last week.

title: People and Business
description: David Sarnoff, who never went beyond elementary school but who built the RCA Corporation into one of the world's largest tech nological empires, will be memorialized by professor ships in his name at Harvard and the Massachusetts In stitute of Technology. Mr. Sir noff died last December at the age of 80.

title: Seton Hall Soccer Mark Set
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Oct. 5Paul Bushey set a Seton Hall University soccer career scoring record today when his secondhalf goal enabled the Pirates to defeat Kings Point, 10, in a Metropolitan Confer ence Division II contest. Bushey had 38 goals and broke a tie with Zachary Yamba.

title: A Danish Common Man
description: Man in the News

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Financial figures submitted by the Consolidated Edison Company to support its re quest for a $135million im mediate temporary rate in crease were put under fur ther scrutiny at a hearing of the State Public Service Com mission.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: UNION, Oct. 5The police said today that two shots fired late last night into the broadcasting offices of Radio Station WNJR appeared to be connected to the controversy over the station's ownership and format.

title: Burger Aide Linked To a Bid to Weaken Product Safety Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The chief administrative officer of the Federal courts under Chief Justice Warren E. Burger has worked with a Washington drug industry lawyer in an ef fort to weaken the product safety bill now pending befote Congress. He said he was do ing so to avoid an increase in Federal court cases.

title: Brown Is Not Masking Reason for Broken Hand
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 5 (AP)Bob Brown, tackle for the Oakland Raiders, will face the Houston Oilers on Monday night with a broken right hand.

title: Last Ship Leaves Clyde Yard That Built Queens
description: GLASGOW, Scottand, Oct. 5 The last ship that will ever leave the famous shipyard at Clydebank that used to be known as John Brown's was launched today. A few hours later, talks were taking place about the future of the yard as a builder of oil rigs.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5You can hardly pick up a newspaper these days without finding some new evi dence that the freedom of the press is being nibbled away in this country, and what's equally significant, that quite a few people think this is not a bad idea,

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  President Nixon said today that the recently completed Federal investigation of the breakin at Democratic headquarters has been so thorough and complete that it made the 1948 investi gation of Alger Hiss look like a Sunday School exercise.

title: House Votes Road Bill, Bars Transit Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The House of Representatives ap proved tonight legislation that would provide the states and localities with $16.6billion in Federal roadbuilding money over the next two years but allow none of the money to be spent for mass transit. The vote was 263 to 30.

title: The 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) United Air Lines said today that the Democratic Presiden tial nominee, Senator George McGovern, a former bomber pilot, did not take over the controls of his campaign jet liner as indicated in a photo graph taken Sunday showing the Senator in the pilot's seat.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, Oct. 5Three hotel chains are build ing or expanding facilities here and a fourth is looking into the possibility of construction be cause of the area's potential after the sports center in the Hackensack Meadowlands is completed.

title: Penn Central Ticket Agent Killed by High Speed Train
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Oct. 5 A Penn. Central ticket agent was struck and killed last night by a highspeed Amtrak train at the Saugatuck station here.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DENVER, Oct. 5  Over coming an initial reluctance to become involved in the dispute, Sargent Shriver personally lent his support last night to the Colorado Labor Council in its defiance of the political neu trality ordered by George Meany, president of the A.F.L. C.I.O.

title: 3 BIG RETAIL CHAINS REPORT SALES RISES
description: Three major retailing chains, including Sears, Roebuck and Co., the country's largest, yesterday reported Increased sales in September over the same 1971 month.

title: Nadjari Calls Key Target Corruption on the Bench
description: The state's new anticorruption prosecutor said yesterday that allegations and rumors about organizedcrime figures receiving lenient treatment and judges paying for their ap pointments to the bench were areas of special interest to him for investigation.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: LINDEN, N. J., Oct. 5 (AP) The 4,000member Local 595 of the United Automobile Workers in New Jersey announced it was endorsing Paul J. Krebs, the Democratic nominee for the United States Senate, in his race against Senator Clifford P. Case.

title: Sadat Aide Sees Tito
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 5The Egyptian Minister of War, Gen. Mohammed Sadek, conferred here today with President Tito at the end of a weeklong visit reportedly fo cused on arrangements to ob tain spare parts for Egypt's predominantly Sovietsupplied weapons.

title: AMEX CONTINUES DRIFT DOWNWARD
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market in curred their fourth consecutive loss yesterday in continued slow trading.

title: Nikko's $21.1Million Deal For G.T.E. Stock Completed
description: A check for $21.1million was received yesterday by. General Telephone & Electronics Corpo ration from the Nikko Securities Company Ltd., Tokyo, in ex change for stock certificates representing 750,000 common shares of G.T.E.

title: FILIPINO FACTIONS SURRENDER ARMS
description: CEBU, the Philippines, Oct. 3 The two main power factions in this part of the Philippines have submitted quietly to the martial law being enforced un der the leadership of President Ferdinand E. Marcos in Manila.

title: Books of The Times
description: SEMITOUGH. By Dan Jenkins. 307 pages. New York: Atheneum. $7.98.

title: Macy's Opens S.I. StoreIts 7th in City
description: It took Macy's, New York's largest retailer, more than a century to make it to Staten Island. But if the impatient pleas by a crowd of 500 to cut short the opening ceremonies yesterday meant anything, it probably should have gone there sooner.

title: Japanese Print by Haranobu Brings Record $18,000 Bid
description: A private American collector paid $18,000 yesterday for an 18thcentury Japanese print de picting lovers standing in the falling snow, according to Sotheby Parke Bernet, the auc tion house here.

title: DR. MANNING DIES; SLAVIC EXPERT, 79
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 5  Dr. Clarence A. Manning, associate professor of Slavic languages and literature at Columbia University from 1952 until his retirement in 1958, died yesterday at his home, 30 Broadway. He was 79 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Revising the Charter
description: The high quality of appointments just announced for the. Temporary State Charter Revision Commission for New York City, a bipartisan group with strong repre sentatives, from city and state levels of government promises well for its massive assignment.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES RETREAT BROADLY
description: Stock prices broke sharply yesterday with bluechip and glamour issues falling along with the general market. The DowJones industrials dropped 10.01 to 941.30, after attempt ing to rally at midsession.

title: House Votes Road Bill Bars Transit Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The House of Representatives ap proved tonight legislation that would provide the states and localities with $16.6billion in Federal roadbuilding money over the next two years but allow none of the money to be spent for mass transit. The vote was 263 to 30.

title: New ProAbortion Lobbying Group Is Formed Here
description: A new lobbying group, organ ized to oppose the Right to Life movement, said yesterday that, it would fight to defend New York's liberalized abortion law against any attempt in the coming legislative session to encodify into law...the reli gious beliefs of some that a conceptus [the product of fer tilization] is indistinguishable from a child.

title: Song Styles
description: A year ago today, Max Gottfried, who had spent his life building up a trucking business in Babylon, L. I., All Island Delivery Service, indulged himself in a ro mantic fantasy by opening a restaurantsupper club solely to provide a base of opera tions for a singer he and his wife admired. The singer was Aris San, a Greek who fled to Israel as a young man to escape army service and be came one of Israel's leading entertainers. Their club, in which Mr. Gottfried and. Mr. San are equal partners, is the Sirocco, adjoining the Martha Washington Hotel at 29 East 29th Street.

title: Free Press Behind Bars
description: The wedge driven by the United States Supreme Court into the constitutional protection essential to a free press has been dramatically demonstrated this week by the jailing of a New Jersey newspaperman for refusing to answer a grand jury's questions about activities had neither witnessed nor written about.

title: Iraq Says U.S Uses U.N. Veto for Domestic Politics
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5Iraq today accused the United States of using its veto power in the Security Council to serve its own internal polit ical purposes.

title: 5 CONCERNS NAMED AS PAYING BRIBES
description: Five corporations and eight executives were indicted yes terday on charges of having paid $200,000 in kickbacks to a purchasing agent for Fiat, the Italian automobile and air craft manufacturer. The pur chasing agent was indicted on conspiracy and other charges.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sales of Stores Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week were esti mated at $861million, up 10 per cent from the yearearlier $780million. Total retail store sales were put at $8,896,000, 000, up 8 per cent from the yearearlier $8,266,000,000.

title: Market Place: Trader Advises On When to Sell
description: In these days of wild mar ketsmarkets dominated by institutions that will dump stock by the bundle and help bring individual price drops of 10, 20, even 25 per cent in a single; daythe small investor needs guidelines if he is to protect his stock market capital.

title: N.J. Women Golfers Lose To WestchesterFairfield
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., Oct. 5 The Women's Westchester Fairfield Golf Association de feated the New Jersey State Women's Golf Association, 21 to 11, today in their annual team match at the East course at Winged Foot Golf Club.

title: GEORGE HORTON, 97; AD MAN AND EDITOR
description: DUNKIRK, N. Y., Oct. 5 George Reed Horton, a former advertising man, reporter, and editor, died today at his home here. His age was 97.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DEWAIT'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord. Ltd., Syosset, N. YAdvt.

title: TAX AID FOR AGED PLEDGED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  President Nixon disclosed today that the property tax relief for homeowners that he had been promising would be confined initially to elderly persons.

title: President Cautions Hanoi Not to Await Elections
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 President Nixon said today that he was trying to convince the North Vietnamese, presumably through Henry A. Kissinger's private talks, that it would be in Hanoi's best interests to reach a settlement of the war before the election, rather than wait for the possibility of a McGovern victory.

title: Lavelle Says Joint Chiefs Pledged sacking on Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 Lieut. Gen. John D. Lavelle, in a private letter to the Senate Armed Services Committee, de clared that representatives of his Seventh Air Force were specifically told in a meeting last December that the Joint Chiefs of Staff would not question the targets struck on protectivereaction missions.

title: Wide Billon Welfare And Social Security Passes Senate, 685
description: WASHINGTON, Friday, Oct. 6  The most sweeping and costly welfare and Social Secur ity bill in the nation's history passed the Senate early today after eight days of often shrill debate. The vote was 68 to 5.

title: Commodity Price Index Up From the WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 124 from 123 last week.

title: Banks to Shut Monday To Mark Columbus Day
description: Banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed on Monday for the Columbus Day holiday, which is being observed on Oct. 9 this year. Financial markets will be open.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Sizzling steak complete delivered to your door in an hour. DIALASTEAK 5933888, Advt.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Following is the text of a foreign policy statement, en titled A New International ism, issued yesterday by Senator George McGovern and delivered, in part, before the City Club of Cleveland:

title: SOYBEANS HIGHER IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Talk of rain this weekend in the harvest areas apparently spurred some activity and high er prices in soybeans and core futures yesterday.

title: Sea Lion Nips the Baby Whale
description: The baby pygmy sperm whale that has captured the heart of the city since being washed up last week on a beach at Far Rockaway, Queens, found her first en emy in New York yesterday: a sea lion named Breezy.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Oct. 5Transport of New Jersey, the state's big gest bus company, today with drew part of a proposed rate increase that would have cost schoolchildren a total of $700,000 a year in higher fares.

title: The Jackson Amendment
description: A major new complication now clouds the prospects for normalized, expanded SovietAmerican trade and economic relationships. With Senator Henry M. Jackson in the lead, a group of 72 Senators has introduced an amendment that would deny the Soviet Union credits, credit guarantees or most favored nation treatment so long as the U.S.S.R. requires exorbitant ransoms of Soviet citizens wishing to emigrate. The Jackson pro posal endorsed as it is by almost threefourths of the entire membership, serves notice that Congress will not pass the necessary legislation on SovietAmerican trade unless the Russians retreat on the exit permit issue, which primarily affects Jews desiring to emigrate to Israel and the West.

title: The Opera: Reminiscences of Gertrude Stein
description: Gertrude Stein was not a musician, but there was mu sic, as well as wit and wis dom, In her writing. She com posed with words, sometimes to the point of obscuring or ignoring their literal mean ings, but never violating the integrity of their rhythms and colors.

title: Pilot in Jet Crash to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) The National Transportation Safety Board says that Richard Bingham, the pilot of a plane in a crash that killed 22 per sons in an ice cream parlor on Sept. 24, will be asked to testify at a hearing in Sacra mento Oct. 16. The Board, which announced yesterday that it would conduct the hearing, said that about 24 persons were expected to tes tify on the crash, which oc curied after an aborted take off of a 20yearold F86 Sabre jet from Sacramento Executive Airport.

title: MinorityWorker Rally Slated
description: Plans for a noontime rally at City Hall next Wednesday to protest the continuing ex clusion of minoritygroup workers from the construction industry were announced yes terday by representatives of Coalition for Job Equality in the Construction Industry, at City Hall news conference.

title: Private Group Plans Year's Study of State Parole
description: Former Attorney General Ramsey Clark announced yes terday the formation of a pri vate organization to embark on a oneyear study of the parole system in New York State.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Following is the official White House transcript of President Nixon's news conference here today:

title: Focus Is Put on Mentally Ill Inmates
description: The city's Board of Correc tion started a campaign yester day to focus public attention on the problem of the mentally disturbed prisoner in the criminal justice system.

title: ANNAPOLIS PURRS OVER BOAT SHOW
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 5 Another opening, another show ....?

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WACHIPAUKA POND, Glencliff, N.H. The lovely Pleiades hung trembling and glittering in a sky swept clean of clouds by the north wind, and before midnight the top of a mountain to the east was edged with the cold light of a rising, gib bous moon.

title: 3 INDICTED IN KILLING OF PROF. FRIEDMANN
description: A Manhattan grand jury in dicted two young brothers and a third youth yesterday in the murder of a Columbia Uni versity professor who was fatally stabbed Sept. 20 near the university campus.

title: She Brings Her Store To the Desk
description: Carol Sherman is out to save some of the career women of New York from tired feet and frazzled nervesthe kind that come from racing around boutiques and department stores on lunch hours or Saturdays in search of clothes.

title: 2 Fans' Vested Interest In Giant Tickets Upheld
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J. Oct. 5 John Rolio of Morristown and Anthony De Nunzio of Monmouth will be able to see the Giants play at Yankee Stadium this Sunday, but it took a court ruling to get them their tickets.

title: MAYOR DISCOUNTS TALK OF RACE IN '73;No Decision Yet, He Says, as He Tours Long Island
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., Oct. 5 Mayor Lindsay dismissed as enormous speculation today reports that he was testing a beat the bosses tactic for possible use next year in a re election bid.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PASSAIC, Oct. 5Police de partment hearings will begin tomorrow for seven policemen who were charged With 70 in fractions after arresting a City Councilman on a charge of driving while under the influ ence of alcohol.

title: ROZELLE IS URGED TO END BLACKOUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP)  Senator John O. Pastore, Democrat of Rhode Island, called on the National Football League today to end volun tarily its television blackouts of home games that are sold out.

title: Sudan's Cabinet Resigns
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Oct. 5 (Reuters)The Sudanese Cab inet has resigned at the request of President Gaafar alNimeiry after elections for a people's council to draft a new constitu tion for the nation.

title: HelpWanted Advertising Showed a Rise in August
description: The Conference Board report ed yesterday that helpwanted advertising in August rose for the third consecutive month. The board's index on classified help wanted ads gained 1 point in August and stood at 105 per cent of the 1967 base and 20 points above the level of August 1971.

title: Lavelle Says Joint Chiefs Pledged Backing on Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 Lieut. Gen. John D. Lavelle, in a private letter to the Senate Armed Services Committee, de clared that representatives of his Seventh Air Force were specifically told in a meeting last December that the Joint Chiefs of Staff would not question the targets struck on Protectivereaction missions.

title: Columbia Aims for 2d Victory In Row Over Princeton Eleven
description: Ivy League Roundup

title: Meat Inspectors Sentenced
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Two Federal meat inspectors con victed of receiving gifts of meat and meat products were sen tenced to prison by a United States District Court today. Joseph J. Romano was sen tenced to thre months and Rudolph A., Tropeano to two years. Both, have appealed.

title: SADAT SAYS SOVIET THWARTED PEACE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 5 President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said in an interview pub lished here today that he would have accepted a peace ful settlement in the Middle East if the Soviet Union had delivered advanced armament to counter Israeli power.

title: Trawler Is Said to Defect After Eluding Soviet Fleet
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  A Soviet fishing trawler was able recently to elude several ships of the Soviet fleet in the Medi terranean and defect to Greece, Government analysts say, in large part because of the ex pulsion of longrange Soviet reconnaissance planes from Egypt.

title: Jailing of Reporter In Jersey Spurring Move in Legislature
description: NEWARK, Oct. 5The Re publican floor leader of the New Jersey Assembly said to day that the jailing of a re porter for refusing to answer questions before a grand jury would assure a vote next month on a bill expand ing newspapermen's privilege against being forced to divulge confidential sources.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 5  This could be the year of the ele phant in Missouri, the home state of the mule.

title: BRIBERY CHARGED IN AN ARSON CASE
description: Four men were arraigned yesterday on charges of offering a police patrolman a $200 down payment on a bribe in excess of $2,000 as two of the men were waiting to be booked in a police station in the Bronx on charges of firebombing an empty bar and grill.

title: Excerpts From General Lavelle's Letter to Senator Stennis
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Following are excerpts from a letter from Lieut. Gen. John D. Lavelle to Senator John C. Stennis, chairman of the Sen ate Armed Services Commit tee, dated Sept. 26, 1972.

title: Neil Diamond's Show Lends Glitter to Broadway
description: Call it an idea whose time had come, call it the right performer in the right cir cumstances, call it the final stage in the mass popular ization of rock. Neil Dia mond's oneman show at the Winter Garden is all those things, and more. His open ing last night was not only a personal triumph for him, but also a small stimulus in a show business development that may start a few vital juices flowing in that tired old lady, Broadway.

title: Lunar Device Is Tested
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (Reu ters)A lunar divining rod three electronic sounding beams to examine the moon's crust to depth of three fourths of a milehas been tested over the Grand Canyon in Arizona and in Greenland. The device will be used on the Apollo 17 moon flight in De cember.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Com pany has received a $46.5mil lion addition to a previously awarded Air Force contract for TF34 jet aircraft engines, it was announced yesterday.

title: Bars Syrian Diplomat
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The United States has barred from entering the country a Syrian diplomat scheduled to attend the current session of the Unit er Nations General Assembly.

title: U.S Tied With Rumania In Chess Olympic Match
description: SKOPLJE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 5 The United States team to night won one game, lost one and drew two for a tie with Rumania in the ninth round of the chess Olympics here. The winner was Lubomir Kavalek who defeated Florin Gheorghiu.

title: Joint EuropeAsia SST Service Seen
description: The man who heads Britain's major airlines said yesterday that Britain, France and the Soviet Union were deep in negotiations on a pooled Super sonic airline service between Western Europe and the Far East.

title: No Progress in Paris At 162d Peace Session
description: PARIS, Oct, 5  Today's meeting of the Paris peace talks was described, as was last week's, as totally unpro ductive in the view of all four parties. It was the 162d meeting of the talks, which have now lasted for four years and five months.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)Harry Sinden, who left the Boston Bruins two years ago in a contract dispute, rejoined the club today in the new position of managing director.

title: GEORGE COHEN, 66, A DESIGN EXPERT
description: George N. Cohen, who col laborated with the late Frank Lloyd Wright in, the design and construction of the Guggen heim Museum, died on Wednes day. He was 66 years old and lived in Hartsdale, N. Y.

title: Jewish Federation Starts a Campaign For $30Million
description: The Federation of Jewish Phi lanthropies of New York last night stertird its campaign to raise $30million for the sup port of its 130member health, educational and social service agencies.

title: Alex Rose Said to Advise Lindsay to Run for Governor in 1974
description: Alex Rose, leader of the Liberal party, which played a key role in Mayor Lindsay's two successful races for City Hall, has advised the Mayor not to run for reelection next year, according to close as sociates.

title: Business Briefs
description: The National Association of Insurance Agentswhich has sonic 20 cases pending before the Federal Reserve Board against bank holding companies trying to get into the insurance agency businesssaid yesterday that it had filed suit against the Federal Reserve Board itself.

title: The McGovern Foreign Policy
description: News Analysis

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: President Nixon has been endorsed for reelection by 668 daily newspapers while 38 have endorsed Senator George McGovern, according to a survey made by Editor & Publisher, the trade journal of the newspaper industry.

title: Mansfield, in Rush to Adjourn Next Week, Annoys Some Freshmen Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 Within 12 minutes today, the Senate buried the genocide con vention once again, authorized an $11.5million contribution to an international fair in Spo kane, Wash., and transferred 45 acres and a mansion to a nonprofit corporation in Can andaigua, N. Y.

title: A.B.C. and C.B.S. A re Ordered To Answer Charges of Faking
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5.Two of the three major television networks were asked by the Government yesterday to an swer charges that they staged events or depicted faked nici denth as real in their news programing.

title: KIDNEY OPERATIONS DESCRIBED AT PARLEY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 5 (AP) Two operations in which a diseased kidney was removed, repaired and then returned to the human body were reported by a medical school official to the American College of Sur geons today.

title: NYQUIST SETS ASIDE GENEVA SCHOOL VOTE
description: GENEVA, N. Y., Oct. 5 (AP) The State Education Commis sioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, ruled today that Geneva must hold a new election for three seats on the Board of Education.

title: ACCORD UNLIKELY IN SUIT ON Hilt
description: The International Business Machines Corporation and the Department of Justice were scheduled to meet in Washing ton today in a major attempt to work out a settlement of an antitrust suit filed against the giant computer maker al most four years ago. But the prospects of an agreement seemed remote last night.

title: Outside the Theaters, 2 Fiddlers on the Hoof
description: Richard and Rubin will be out in the street tonight, playing their violins in the theater district. People, most ly women, give them quarters, dollar bills. But they are not beggingthey are entertain ing, giving what they call street concerts.

title: 5 CONCERNS NAMED AS PAYING BRIBES
description: Five corporations and eight executives were indicted yes terday on charges of having paid $200,000 in kickbacks to a purchasing agent for Fiat, the Italian automobile and air craft manufacturer. The pur chasing agent was indicted on conspiracy and other charges.

title: Mayor Names New H.D.A. Chief and Relocation Commissioner
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the appointment of a new head of the city's Hous ing and Development Adminis tration and a new $35,000a year Commissioner of its relo cation and management serv ices division, effective Nov. 1.

title: A Lamb Casserole
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Medicaid Fraud Charged
description: TRENTON, Oct. 5 (AP)  A Camden County grand jury Thursday indicted Dr. Robert Kaplan, a Gloucester osteopath, on 30 counts of Medicaid fraud over a ninemonth period.

title: M'GOVERN DETAILS A FOREIGN POLICY TIED TO IDEALISM
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 5Sena tor George McGovern, contend ing that the war in Vietnam will drag on for years if President Nixon is reelected, proposed here today a foreign policy based on international idealism and domestic strength.

title: Phyllis Okin Bride Of Steven Gardner
description: Miss Phyllis Linda Okin and Steven Gardner were Married here yesterday aft ernoon in Temple EmanuEl by Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel.

title: Needham is Angered by Critics of Plan Backed by S.E.C.
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Ex change, yesterday attacked the Antitrust Division of the Justice Department on the issue of who should be allowed to buy seats on the nation's stock exchanges.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY BALKED IN SENATE AS CLOSURE FAILS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Legislation to create an inde pendent consumer protection agency apparently died in the Senate today as sponsors failed for the third time to limit de bate on the bill.

title: Mrs. Martha Morgenthau Dies; Wife of Former U.S. Attorney
description: Mrs. Martha Pattridge Mar genthau, wife of Robert M. Morgenthau, former United State Attorney and former Deputy Mayor, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital for Can cer and Allied Diseases. She was 52 years old and lived at 4725 Independence Avenue, Riverdale.

title: Cliveden, Historic Pennsylvania House, to Be Opened Tomorrow as Museum
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 5 Cliveden, home of the Chew family for two centuries, will be opened to the public Saturday as a museum.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 5 (AP)Mrs. George McGovern made a flat prediction here today that her husband would be elected President and that the absolutely rousing crowd receptions that he had been getting lately were proof of it. Mrs. McGovern called for unity among Democrats in campaign stops in Springfield, Ill., yester day and in Louisville, Ky., earlier today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Alston Signs 20th Pact As Manager of Dodgers
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 5 (AP) Walt Alston, the dean of major league baseball mana gers, was given his 20th one year contract today to man age the Los Angeles Dodg ers in 1973.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. NOMLA BRETECHE, France, Oct. 5 (Reuters) Tommy Aaron of Gainesville, Ga., and Gary Player South Africa shared the firstround lead today in the Lancome trophy golf tournament with cards of 71. Eight of the world top golfers are competing in the fourday event.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (Reu ters)Workers were evacuated from the Democratic national party headquarters today after telephoned bomb threats, the police said.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEWCASTLE, England, Oct. 5 (Reuters)Tony jack lin of Britain widened his lead to two strokes today in the second round of the Dunlop Masters golf tournament at Gosforth Park. He carded a oneunderpar 71 for a 36hole aggregate of 136.

title: Wright Wins Inwood Golf By One Stroke With a 292
description: INWOOD, L. I., Oct. 5  Jimmy Wright, slim 32yearold Oklahomaborn professional, won the Metropolitan Profes sional Golfers Association championship today by one stroke and thereby clinched honors as the organization's playeroftheyear.

title: MISS M'EVOY RIDES TWO SHOW WINNERS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 5Mi chele McEvoy, who measures just about 5 feet tall If she stretches, rode Carnaby Street to the amateurowner hunter championship today at the Philadelphia horse show.

title: Harvard Study Examines Angola Role
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct, 5 Harvard University will release a report tomorrow reviewing its responsibility as a share holder in the Gulf Oil Corpo ration, based on an unusual first  hand study of Gulf's op erations in the Portuguese col ony of Angola.

title: London Times Staffs Peking
description: LONDON, Oct. 5The Times of London announced tonight the appointment of a resident correspondent in Peking. The correspondent, David Bonavia, left London today for the Chi nese capital to open the bureau, He is 32 years old and speaks two Chinese dialects. Mr. Bo navia formerly worked for The Times in Hong Kong and Saigon.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Accident Ties Up Bridge Traffic

title: Aides Press Soviet Trade Talks Despite Warning From Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Secretary of Commerce Peter G. Peterson said today that he had been told to continue nego tiations for a SovietAmerican trade agreement without ref erence to the Senate's warning, yesterday that it would block passage of Such an accord if Moscow did not lift the exit visa tax on Jews and others seeking to emigrate.

title: Music: Richard Wexler in 5th Ave. Concert
description: Richard Wexler played a program of music for unaccompanied violin at lunchtime yesterday.

title: Harper Oil Sought By Peoples Gas Co. In $20Million Deal
description: The Peoples Gas Company is planning to enter the oil busi ness through the proposed ac quisition of the Harper Oil Co. of Oklahoma City for about $20million of common stock. Peoples Gas said yesterday the agreement in principle is sub ject to a definite one and ap proval by its directors. Harper, a closely held company, en gaged in exploration develop ment and operation of oil and gas properties in the South west, earned about $1.3million last year on operating revenues exceeding $7million.

title: Clashes With Reds Reported
description: MANILA, Oct. 5 (UPI)Phil ippine troops killed three Mao ist guerrillas today, captured 20 others and uncovered a sus pected Communist hospital just outside the United States Clark Air Base in scattered military operations, Information Secre tary Francisco S. Tatad re ported.

title: 2 Killed in Ulster Bombings, One Outside a Protestant Pub
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 5 (AP)A bomb exploded outside a crowded pub in a Protestant district of Belfast tonight, killing one person and injuring at least five others.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: It's one of the amazing wonders of the American electoral systemif you'll permit an outsider to say so that the voters ever learn what the candidates think about anything.

title: Nadjari Calls Key Target Corruption on the Bench
description: The state's new, anticorruption prosecutor said yesterday that allegations and rumors about organizedcrime figures receiving lenient treatment and judges paying for their ap pointments to the bench were areas of special interest to him for investigation.

title: Big One Sunday Looks Just Too Big for the Jets
description: About Pro Football

title: JOB DECLINE TIED TO BUILDING STRIKE
description: Payroll employment in the New York and northeastern New Jersey area declined by more than 100,000 between June and July, 1972, reflecting the effect of the construction strike in the city and seasonal cutbacks in manufacturing and retail trade.

title: Rodgers's 66 Sets Tokyo Golf Pace
description: INZAI, Japan, Oct. 5 (AP)Phil Rodgers posted a string of birdies on the front nine today and went on to card a five underpar 66 for the firstround lead in the $300,000 Pacific Masters golf tournament, the richest in the world. The La Jolla, Calif., pro had birdies at the first, fourth, seventh and eighth holes of the 7,207 yard, par71 Sobu Country Club course. He added three birdies on the back nine but also recorded two bogeys.

title: BurnetteHowell Team's 65 Leads, in New Jersey Golf
description: SPRING LAKE, N.J., Oct. 5 Ken Burnette of Tammy Brook and Dick Howell of New ton combined for a 34, 31.65 to take the firstround lead in the 36hole New Jersey propro championship today at the Spring Lake Golf and Country Club. They paced 41 teams over the 6,420yard, par72 course.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (AP)The Civil Aeronautics Board today approved another onemonth extension of the management assistance agreement under which Eastern Air Lines already has provided CaribbeanAtlantic Airlines' Caribair with aid totaling $4.5million.

title: Army Awards Contracts
description: MOBILE, Ala., Oct. 5 (AP) The Army Engineers announced today award of contracts to taling more than $18million for design and construction of nitric acidsulphuric acid con centration plants at three Army ammunition plants. The con tracts were awarded to the Chemical Construction Corpo ration of New York City. The project is expected to require about 20 months.

title: Bobby Fischer Sued For $3.25Million Over Chess Filming
description: Bobby Fischer, the new world chess champion, was sued for $3.25million in State Supreme Court here yesterday for refusing to permit the film ing and televising of his recent match in Reykjavik, Iceland, with Boris Spassky of the So viet Union.

title: NIXON BELITTLES M'GOVERN CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Strik ing back after weeks of silence, President Nixon dismissed with calculated contempt today Sen ator George McGovern's charge that his Administration was the most corrupt and deceitful in history.

title: Soviet Art Show Set for Metropolitan
description: You really need two people, an art critic and a diplomat, to review Soviet Union: Arts & Crafts in Ancient & Today, an exhibi tion that opens tomorrow at the Metropolitan Museum.

title: CURBS RESCINDED IN GASIMPORT BID
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Federal Power Commission, re sponding to protests by the oil and gas industry, rescinded to day price ceilings and other restrictions it had imposed in approving this country's first largescale importation of li quefied natural gas from Al geria.

title: Senate Backs I.C.C. Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) The Senate confirmea today President Nixon's nomination of Chester M. Wiggin Jr., Con toocook, N. H., as a new mem ber of the Interstate Commerce Comission, and Rupert L. Mur phy to a new term on the agency.

title: Uganda and Tanzania Say Tizeir Dispute Is Settled
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Oct. 5 (AP)Tanzania and Uganda have announced the settlement of a dispute that flared up when Uganda's President, Maj. Gen, Idi Amin, accused.Tania nia of invading his country.

title: TV Conductor Sentenced
description: Norman Pawlak, a composer and conductor also known as Norman Paris, was sentenced yesterday to a suspended two year jail term and a $6,000 fine for incometax evasion. He was found guilty Aug. 23 of failing to report a total of $179,000 income from 1964 through 1967. Pawlak was formerly musical conductor for the I've Got a Secret television show.

title: Business Briefs
description: Roy D. Chapin, the president of the American Motors Corporation, said yesterday that the company would have cars powered by Wankel engines in the future.

title: F111'S RAID BASES IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Oct. 6 (AP)The United States command announced yesterday that the controversial F111 fighterbombers had been sent back into combat over North Vietnam after six days of tests.

title: TV Preview
description: Tomorrow evening at, 8:30 oil Channel 13, a new series called Playhouse New York Classics for Today enters the fall schedule of the Public Broadcasting Service, Staged for WNET/13, with Jac. Venza as executive pro ducer, the series is being opened with a 90minute version of Jean Anouilh's Antigone, which is based on, or at least inspired by, the Sophocles classic.

title: Experts Urge Hearings on Sentences Following Trials
description: A conference of lawyers, judges, penologists and crim inologists has recommended that convicted defendants be sentenced at some form of post trial judicial hearing where the prosecutors would be required to show what good it would do to send them to prison.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Senator George McGovern is quietly but urgently searching for huge campaign contribu tions to prevent his Presidential candidacy from sliding into insolvency.

title: Quotas Warmed Over
description: Persistent prodding from Congress and his Democratic opponents finally induced President Nixon to concede another modest relaxation in the costly and discredited oil import quotas.

title: Business Briefs
description: A new clause in the labor agreement between the International Ladies Garment Workers Union and three trade associations has resulted in the formation of a new industry council for promotion of women's and children's coats and suits.

title: Wholesale Prices Show A Small September Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Wholesale prices continued to rise in September, but the rise was the smallest for any month since April, the Labor Depart ment reported today.

title: Postel Assails City Job For Budget Chief's Wife
description: Councilman Robert I. Postel charged yesterday that Mrs. Hanna K. Grossman, wife of the city's Budget Director, had concocted prior work experi ence to hold a series of city jobs for which she was dis tinctly unqualified. Mrs. Grossman is a $17,500ayear human resources specialist.

title: Advertising:
description: Revlon has wafted some more business Grey's way. This time it's the house of EthereaFine Fragrances divi sion. House is what Revlon calls its divisions, and Grey. Advertising, the major Rev Ion agency for a decade, now does most of the advertising for all six of its houses.

title: F111'S RAID BASES IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Oct. 6 (AP)The United States command announced yesterday that the controversial F111 fighterbombers had been sent back into combat over North Vietnam after six days of tests.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 U.S. Pianists Perform Before Chou in Peking
description: The first American pianists to appear in Peking since the founding of the Communist Govetnment in 1949 per formed before an audience of 600 Chinese notables last night in the Central Broad casting Concert Hall in the Chinese capital.

title: KNICKS GIVE NETS A LESSON, 11788
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 5  The Knicks gave the Nets a lesson tonight in some of the things they have been noted for  defense, poise and playing as a unit. At times it appeared to be a class in basketball in struction as the Knicks de feated the Nets, 11788, in the first meeting between New York's entrants in the National and American Basketball. Asso ciations.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TOKYO, Oct. 5 (AP)Cliff Richey of Sarasota, Fla., advanced to the semifinal round of the World Champion ship Tennis tournament today with a 62, 76 victory over Cliff Drysdale of South Africa.

title: DEALS FILL SPOTS ON STATE BENCH
description: Eightyeight of the 97 judges elected to the State Supreme Court in the last five years were nominated jointly by the Democrats and Republicans in deals that guaranteed their election.

title: Quebec and Bilingualism Are Issues Throughout Canada in Campaign for Parliamentary Elections
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 5  As Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau arrived on a reelec tion campaign swing through Prince Edward Island last month, a waitress snapped off a radio that was broadcasting his airport remarks and grumbled:

title: Oil Concerns Set Accord With Five Arab Countries
description: Representatives of five Per sian Gulf oilproducing coun tries and, the major Western oil companies reached agreement here yesterday on terms for the five countries eventually to take over control of the com panies' concessions in the area.

title: New Yorker Is Held By Syrian Regime On Spying Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) A New York City man is being held by the Syrian Government on charges of espionage, the State Department said today.

title: Dance: Jose Limon Interprets Saga of Maximilian and Carlota
description: Jose Limn is much ob sessed with death. His latest work, Carlota, which had its world premiere at the ANTA Theater last night as part of the City Center Amer ican Dance Marathon, is con cerned with Carlota, Empress of Mexico, and her Emperor, Maximilian.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUSIC Let others wrangle over the question of musical pigmentation and what it means; the program at 8 to night is Black People's Music at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafay ette Avenue, Brooklyn (783 2434). The bill, the first of what promises to be several at the academy, is offering a variety of styles and schools for a starter. The Max Roach Quintet will ?? jazz under the guidance ?? Mr. Roach, percussionist and music professor at the Uni versity of Massachusetts. The J.C. White Singers will sing the Gospel tunes they do regularly not far away in Brooklyn at the Institutional Church of God in Christ. Leon Thomas will do his voice rhythmic interpreta tions, and Dane Belany, a Senegalese singer and poet, who performs with sound accompaniment, will make her American debut. Admis sion: $3, $4, $5.50, $6.50.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHEN ALL THE LAUGHTER DIED IN SOR ROW. By Lance Rentzel. 265 pages. Satur day Review Press. $6.95.

title: ROGERS, AT U.N., MEETS EGYPTIAN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 5  Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers met with high ranking Egyptian and Indian of ficials today as he continued his individual talks here with more than 60 of the Foreign Ministers who are attending the General Assembly.

title: President Cautions Hanoi Not to Await Elections
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 President Nixon said today that he was trying to convince the North Vietnamese, presumably through Henry A. Kissinger's private talks, that it would be in Hanoi's best interests to reach a settlement of the war before the election, rather than wait for the possibility of a McGovern victory.

title: Burger Aide Worked With Lawyer for Drug Industry to Weaken Bill on Product Safety
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The chief administrative officer of the Federal courts under Chief justice Warren E. Burger has worked with a Washington drug industry lawyer in an ef cart to weaken the product safety bill now pending before Congress. He said he was do ing so to avoid an increase in Federal court cases.

title: Library Gets Research Chief Grant
description: For what is said to be the first time in its history, the New York Public Library has received a large grant in ef fect endowing a chair. The interest from a grant of $1 million by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation will cover all compensation  salary plus benefitsof the head of the research libraries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Disease Seen
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 5 (UPI)  Most Americans want more pay for less work, William S. Lowe, president of the United States Chamber of Commerce, said to night. We seem to be con fronted with a growing disease that is rampant not only in our own country but also around the world, Mr. Lowe said in an address at the annual meet ing of the Illinois State Chamber of Commerce.

title: MONEY EXPANSION SLOWED IN WEEK;Demand for Business Loans Showed Signs of Gain
description: Monetary expansion slowed this week, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday. At the same time; demand for business loans at major New York banks, which was notably sluggish earlier in the year, showed signs of picking up a bit  a development that some bankers hailed as a possible harbinger of a longawaited upturn in corporate credit de mands.

title: More Storm Aid Asked
description: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development George Romney asked a Senate Ap propriations subcommittee to day for $250million more in urban renewal funds to assist in redevelopment of areas hit by Tropical Storm Agnes. A total of $200million has, been earmarked for such redevelop ment.

title: ARAB LEAGUE SEEKS PEACE FOR YEMENS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 5 (Reuters)  Air raids and artil lery bombardments were re ported to be continuing today in the Yemeni border area as the Arab League attempted to mediate between the two rival republics.

title: M'GOVERN DETAILS A FOREIGN POLICY TIED TO IDEALISM
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 5Sena tor George McGovern, contend ing that the war in Vietnam will drag on for years if President Nixon is reelected, proposed here today a foreign policy based on international idealism and domestic strength.

title: Earl Morse's interest in growing tree peonies led to collecting Chinese
description: James Biddle's passion for Oriental art was born in a Princeton classroom. Senator Hugh Scott's was nurtured on commuter trains. Earl Morse came to collect Chinese paintings in a roundabout way, through horticulture. And, as for Mr. and Mrs. John D. Rockefeller 3d, their se rious acquisitions in Asian art began only after the sign ing of the peace treaty with Japan in 1952.

title: 28 Who Escaped Albania Arrive Here
description: Twentyeight members of an Albanian family who com mandeered a fishing boat and escaped to Greece last year arrived here yesterday aboard the liner Cristofpro Colombo. Sixtythreeyearold Thomas Mallias, along with his wife, four sons, two daughters, a soninlaw, four daughtersin law and grandchildren had overpowered the sixman crew of a stateowned trawl er whose skipper was his son, Vasali and sailed from Himara in Albania to the Greek Island of Corfu.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 5The chief of the Morris County detectives said here today that he would assign three detec tives to a complete investi gation of municipal activities in nearby Mount Olive Town ship.

title: Indian Chief to Be Reburied Near Body of Iowa Pioneer
description: DES MONIES, Iowa. Oct. 5 (UPI)The bones of an Iowa Indian chief who died more than 100 years ago will be reburied near his old friend, Julien Du buque, the state's first white settler.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Oct. 5 (AP)Vice President Agnew praised the nation's youth as having the greatest set of young minds ever in cam paign visits to Iowa and West Virginia today but he rejected the idea of his car rying the Republican banner to college campuses.

title: Queens Housewife, 27, Kills Three Children and Herself
description: The 27yearold wife of a Nassau County patrolman was found shot to death and her three small daughters strangled yesterday afternoon lit an up stairs bedroom of their single family home in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: HOLDUP MAN SLAIN IN QUEENS MARKET
description: An alleged holdup man was killed end a store employe was slightly wounded during a shootout between an offduty policeman and three robbers in a Bohack supermarket in the Ridgewood section of Queens last night.

title: Football in Pennsylvania Survives In Spite of Flood Disaster
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Oct. 5  Three months after the flood waters of tropical storm Agnes brought this northeast ern Pennsylvania area to a standstill, football has be come a source of inspiration and debate among its resi dents.

title: Music: A Bach Stylist
description: As a Bach stylist, Karl Richter may be the most art ful dodger of major issues now before the public. His performance of the B Minor Mass on Wednesday night at Philharmonic Hall, first of four performances there this month by his Munich Bach Choir and Orchestra, Made intelligent and imaginative compromises on such matters as old instruments, choral textures and interpretation. Though it straddled difficult questions in ways that seem apt in this election season, Mr. Richter's Bach struck one as essentially outdated, a thinly disguised child of the 19tthcentury oratorio style.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY BALKED IN SENATE AS CLOSURE FAILS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  Legislation to create an inde pendent consumer protection agency apparently died in the Senate today as sponsors failed for the third time to limit de bate on the bill.

title: NIXON BELITTLES M'GOVERN CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Strik ing back after weeks of silence, President Nixon dismisied with calculated contempt today Sen ator George McGovern's charge that his administration was the most corrupt and deceitful in history.

title: Chicago Skyscrapers Onward and Upward
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 5, AP) Big Stan has become Chi cago's tallest building, beat ing Big John.

title: Henry Dreyfuss, Noted Designer, Is Found Dead With His Wife
description: SOUTH PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 5Henry Dreyfuss, one of the nation's most honored in dustrial designers, was found dead today along with his wife at their home here.

title: Shaped Familiar Objects
description: A pioneer in industrial de sign in the United States, Henry Dreyfuss was respon sible for the looks of everything from clocksBig Ben and Baby Benand cameras to trains and ocean liners.

title: City Aide Told to Testify Before Scott Commission
description: ALBANY, Oct. 5 (AP)The State Court of Appeals decided today that Edwin Greenidge, deputy housing commissioner in New York City, must testify be fore the Scott Commission, which is investigating the city government.

title: TWO WOMEN SLAIN IN HOTEL STABBING
description: Two women were found dead, their throats slashed, at the Endicott Hotel, on. Columbus Avenue at 81st Street, yester day afternoon. The bodies were found by a friend of one of the women, who lived at the hotel.

title: Bridge:
description: In the last decade, many of the younger New York ex perts have acquired zoologi cal nicknames, among them the dolphin, the horse, the rabbit, the rhinoceros, the seal, the snail, the striped tail ape and the whale.

title: Helping the Helpless
description: The Lawrence and Joe are friends. They live in the South Bronx, and both are teen  agers growing up in the, hope lessness of a decaying drug  ridden neighbor hood.

title: Prudential Bank Merger Set
description: Approval of the $600million merger of the Prudential Sav ings Bank into the Broadway Savings Bank under the title of the Prudential Savings Bank, effective Jan. 1, 1973, was given yesterday by the New York State Banking Department and the Federal Deposit Insur ance Corporation.

title: Board Chairman Discounts Genesco Stockholelers Suit
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 5 (UPI) Frank M. Jarman, chairman of Genesco, Inc., said today there was no merit in the class ac tion stockholders suit filed against the company and its accounting firm in New York by Suzanne Bezahler.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Commercial Solvents Corporation announced yesterday it had filed with the Securities and Ex change Commission In connection with its pre viously disclosed public offering of 214,632 com mon shares being sold by certain stockholders. Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. and Shields Securities Corporation head the underwriting group. The com pany's stock closed at 18, down  on the New York Stock Exchange. *

title: Hotels Flocking to Sports Area in Jersey
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, Oct. 5Three hotel chains are build ing or expanding facilities here and a fourth is looking into the possibility of construction be cause of the area's potential after the sports center in the Hackensack Meadowlands is completed.

title: Circle in the Square Honors Levine in New Name
description: The Circle in the Square's new theater in the Uris Build ing at 50th Street and Broad way has been named the Circle in the SquareJoseph E. Levine Theater in honor of the film producer, a longtime supporter of the nonprofit, taxexempt institution founded in 1951.

title: Florida Court Continues Turner Freedom on Bail
description: LAKELAINTD, Fla., Oct. 5 (UPI) A threejudge appeals court today allowed Glenn W. Turner to remain free on bail pending an appeal of a 150day contempt of court sentence handed down when 600 wives of salesmen in the Turner organization created a din outside the courthouse where the millionaire business man was being tried on securi ties fraud charges.

title: Advertising:
description: About 150 people, many of them well known in adver tising land, turned out at the Four Seasons Wednesday for cocktails and a look at the film created by the same team that has brought you campaigns from American Motors, Benson & Hedges, Trans World Airlines, and many, may more.

title: Phyllis Okin Bride Of Steven Gardner
description: Miss Phyllis Linda Okin and Steven Gardner were married here yesterday aft ernoon in Temple EmanuEl by Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel.

title: Treasury Treads Lightly At Outset of Big Funding
description: Credit Markets

title: Chesapeake Bridge Reopens
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va., Oct. 5 (AP)The Chesapeake Bay BridgeTunnel was reopened today to traffic for the first time since a tug and barge slammed into the $200million structure two weeks ago and forced it to close.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The unemployment rate in New Jersey in August was 7.4 per cent after seasonal adjustments, according a report by the state's Department of Labor and Industry. The rate was 7.3 per cent in July.

title: 3 G.I.'s Killed in Week, 4 Wounded, U.S. Reports
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 5 (AP)Three Americans were killed in action in Indochina last week, the highest toll in five weeks, the United States command said today. Four Americans were reported wounded, and one was listed as missing in action. Three others were said to have died of noncombat causes.

title: Opera: Conductor Debut
description: There are plenty of good young American conductors around; the problem is that there are so few opportuni ties to hear them.

title: August Retail Sales Rose 1% Over July, U.S. Finds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (UPI) Retail sales in August in creased about one per cent over July and were 9 per cent ahead of a year earlier, the Commerce Department reported today in a revision of earlier figures.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 6A South Dakota Republican who is a friend of George McGovern remembers seeing him in late 1970, just before he formally announced his candidacy. My gosh, George, the friend said in some dis belief, President! Do you really think you can make it? McGovern answered: Well, 37 other guys have made it.

title: Islanders Make Debut Tonight In L.I. Rink
description: After assurances that his club wouldn't be in the pres ence of the Islanders, Coach Emile Francis prepared his Rangers yesterday for tonight's opening of the National Hockey League season with a peppery workout at Skateland in New Hyde Park, L. I.

title: YONKERS TRACK CLAIMS RECORD
description: YONKERS, Oct. 6A world record involving four purses, each over $100,000, was claimed for Yonkers Raceway today by Ed Parker, the racing secretary at the Westchester County harness racing oval.

title: YOUTH AIDE TOLD TO EXPLAIN BILLS
description: The city's Commissioner of Youth Services, Ted Gross, was summoned back from vacation yesterday to explain a long list of what were called ques tionable and improper ex penses being investigated in his agency, including thousands of dollars in personal loans and restaurant and auto ex penies charged by Mr. Gross himself.

title: POWER CONVERSION SUSPENDED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Securities and Exchange Com mission announced late today the suspension of trading in the stock of Power Conversion, Inc., an overthecounter stock.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW STRAINS OF FLU EXPECTED IN WINTER
description: ATLANTA, Ga., Oct. 6 (AP) New strains of Type A influ enza are likely to appear in the United States this winter, the Center for Disease Con trol reported today.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MASSENA, N. Y., Oct. 6 (AP)  The MontrealLake Ontario portion of the St. Lawrence Seaway will close officially for the season on Dec. 15, but will function on a daytoday basis beyond that date if weather conditions permit. The Welland Canal, linking Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, will also close Dec. 15. The Sault Ste. Marie Canal linking Lake Superior and Lake Huron, will close Dec. 12.

title: South Korean Leader Will Visit Japan
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 6 President Park Chung Hee of South Korea will make a state visit to Japan for six days be ginning on Nov. 13 to meet with Emperor Hirohito and Premier Kakuei Tanaka, it was announced here today.

title: R. D. Laing, Student of Insanity, Now Understands New Yorkers
description: The first time that R. D. Laing, the Scottish psycho analyst famous for suggest ing that insanity may be a sane reaction to an insane world, came to New York, it was more than he could bear. He left two hours after he arrived.

title: Display at Guggenheim Is International in View
description: The exhibition called Amsterdam  Paris  Dssel dorf, currently on view at the Guggenheim Museum, could as easily have been called MilanLondonCopen hagen or New YorkChi cagoLos Angeles. Although the young artists repre sented in the show work in or near the three European capitals, there is nothing dis tinctively local or national about their art. International in character like most con temporary art, it could have been produced anywhere in the world.

title: CLIFF HALL DEAD; RADIO COMEDIAN
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Oct. 6 Cliff Hall, stage and radio come dian who was widely known as the straight man in Jack Pearl's old radio series featur ing Baron Munchhausen, died today at Englewood Hospital of throat cancer. He was 78 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NIGHT LIFE For seven years they've been having jazz vespers on Sunday at St. Peter's Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue and 54th Street (7552691). To cele brate lucky seven (maybe they wouldn't phrase it quite like that) they are going to prolong vespers into a long term nocturne tomorrow.

title: Manufacturers Hanover Shows Sharp Profit Drop
description: Two major New York City banking concerns reported yes terday sharply lower thirdquar ter earnings.

title: May Day Suits
description: A ruling by a Federal District. Court judge In Wash ington should have a salutary effect on police officers who tyrannize innocent bystanders. Judge Gerhard A. Gesell has awarded civil damages to two men who were swept up in the wholly illegal dragnet which District of Columbia police used to counter the May Day disruptions of 1971.

title: NEW SOVIET IMPORTS OF GRAIN EXPECTED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (UPI) The Department of Agricul ture predicted today that the Soviet Union, which bought a record. 400 million bushels of wheat from the United States this year, would probably have to import large amounts of grain for the next three to five years.

title: JUDGE FINDS SEARCH ON CAMPUS ILLEGAL
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 6 (UPI)  A judge has ruled that the police made illegal use of search warrant to look for photographs in a campus news paper office at Stanford Univer sity.

title: A Study of Car Ads Finds Many Claims Badly Substantiated
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Oct. 6 (AP)A Governmentsponsored analysis of automobile advertis ing assertions found that sub stantiation for 65 per cent of them was irrelevant or inade quate, according to a report made public today by New York City's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs.

title: 123 Dead, 680 Hurt As a Fiesta Train Crashes in Mexico
description: SALTILLO, Mexico, Oct. 6 A speeding train crowded with more than 1,500 people jumped the track, near here last night, and officials said that at least 123 persons were killed.

title: Vacation Padding Laid to 64 Policemen
description: A lieutenant, two sergeants and 61 patrolmen assigned to a Bronx precinct were accused yesterday of treating them selves to extra unauthorized vacations of up to 39 days during 1971.

title: ABRAMS APPROVED AS CHIEF OF ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Senate Armed Services Com mittee voted unanimously to day to confirm Gen. Creighton W. Abrams as Army Chief of Staff. It also voted to strip Lieut, Gem John D. Lavelle of another star for unauthorized bombing in North Vietnam.

title: NATO's Future in a More Relaxed Europe
description: News Analysis

title: MARKET RALLIES ON PEACE REPORT
description: Reports of a new Vietnam peace move touched off a light ning rally in stock prices yes terday, turning a losing session into a winner and sending glamour issues aloft.

title: Antiques: Russian Icons
description: Fine examples of Russian icons are being shown in the Soviet Union Acts and Crafts exhibition that has just opened at the Metro politan Museum.

title: Art:
description: Running true to form for. an Asia House exhibition, The Sculpture of Thailand, which opened Thursday, is a beauty. The 80 images of Buddha and Buddhist divini ties on loan from public and private collections (including the Royal Collection) in Thai land, which trace the devel opment of sculpture over some 13 centuries, are being shown in this country for the first time and it is next to impossible to choose one as a favorite discovery over the rest. But there is one head (No. 61 in the cata logue) in the Sukhodaya style from the late 14th or 15th century, on loan from the National Museum, Bangkok, that should be searched out in even the most hurried visit as the apotheosis of the serene and vital spirit that unites these images from the earliest to the latest.

title: Super Bowl Victor; Takes Triple Crown
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 6 (AP) Super Bowl, finishing the first heat with a flat tire and racing threequarters of the second on another blowout, became the sixth winner of trotting's triple crown today when he won the $56,210 Kentucky Futurity.

title: City Warned on Heroin Maintenance
description: A special citizens committee appointed by Mayor Lindsay has recommended that the city not become involved in sup porting or financing a contro versial proposal by the Vera Institute of Justice for an ex periment in shortterm heroin maintenance.

title: Kunstler in St. Croix Case
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, St. Thomas, Oct. 6 (AP)William M. Kunstler said today that he had agreed to defend all five men accused of slaying eight people at St. Croix's Fountain Valley Golf Club on Sept. 6.

title: Connally Under Challenge On Why He Backs Nixon
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 6 (UPI) Former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally planned to lead a Democrats for Nixon group nine months before Sen ator George McGovern won the Democratic Presidential nomi nation, the Texas Secreatry of State, Bob Bullock, said yes terday.

title: Dana Corp. Lists Peak Profit Level
ABRAMS APPROVED AS CHIEF OF ARMY BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Senate Armed Services Com mittee voted unanimously to day to confirm Gen. Creighton W. Abrams as Army Chief of Staff. It also voted to strip Lieut. Gen. John D. Lavelle of another star for unauthorized bombing in North Vietnam.

title: Oakland Hoping to Stop West Losses at 9 in Row
description: OAKLAND, Oct. 6Looking ahead to the start of tomor row's American League pen nant playoff against Detroit, the Oakland A's could adopt, as their rallying cry, The West Will Rise Again.

title: Road Sign Kills Woman
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Oct. 6 (UPI)Mrs. Virginia Manco, 58 years old, of Providence, was killed yesterday when she was hit by a no parking sign that was knocked over by a station wagon.

title: A Nonspeaking Wallace Helps House Candidate
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Oct. 6 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace made a nonspeaking appearance today to help the campaign of a Democratic Congressional candidate. It was the Governor's first such political appearance in Alabama since he was shot.

title: AMNESTY ORDERED BY EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Oct. 6East Ger many announced today a sweep ing amnesty that was expected to bring the release of thou sands of criminals and political prisoners from jail.

title: No Verdict in Wolfson Case
description: A jury of eight men and two women continued deliberating yesterday in the trial of Louis Wolfson, former board chair man of Merritt Chapman and Scott Corporation on charges of perjury and filing of a false financial statement. The jury was unable to reach a verdict by 6 P.M., and was sent home for the night. It is scheduled to retur ntoday at 9:30 A.M., in Federal Court in Manhattan.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (AP) The General Accounting Of fice said today that records of Senator George McGovern's campaign finances had been inadequate in many instances and it referred three possible violations of the Federal cam paign spending law to the Jus tice Department.

title: Business Briefs
description: A courtimposed wall of silence enveloped the Justice Department in Washington yesterday as attorneys for its antitrust division and of the International. Business Machines Corporation convenedalso by court orderto define the complex issues of a multibilliondollar antitrust case filed against I.B.M. almost four years ago. The Gov ernment has maintained it could not yet spell out in final form what it wanted the computermaker to do, but under the court order it must at least present its notions, as Chief Judge David N. Edelstein put it in pretrial hearings.

title: IMMUNITY FORCED ON 3 WITNESSES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 6As part of a Federal inquiry into the activities of political radi cals, three men were given im munity today and ordered to testify to a special Federal grand jury that convened here this week.

title: Peking Gives a Big Banquet for Little San Marino
description: PEKING, Oct. 6China re deemed her pledge to treat all nations equally last night by throwing a banquet in celebra tion of her newfound friend ship with the tiny Republic of San Marino.

title: BUSING FOES SEEK SENATE CLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 A Housepassed bill to pre vent the longdistance busing of students to desegregate schools reached the Senate floor today, and the bill's supporters moved immediate ly to limit the debate.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: N.Y.U. Faculties Back Merger

title: NEW JERSEY
description: BLAIRSTOWN, Oct. 6Late returns from the election showed 220 votes for William Howard Taft and 131 for Wil liam Jennings Bryan today. The ballots from the 1908 election were found in two locked boxes in the basement of the Muni cipal Building during a cleaning.

title: Market Place:
description: Can creditors of troubled Commonwealth United find happiness as shareholders of the Seeburg Corporation the one piece of that shat tered conglomerate that has major value?

title: PEACE RUMORS SPUR AMEX GAIN
description: Another peace rumor sparked a rally yesterday afternoon on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Oct. 6 (Reuters)Dollars were sold heavily on the Tokyo foreignexchange market today in anticipa tion of another upward revaluation of the yen. The Tokyo stock exchange took a sharp plunge because of the revaluation rumors.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Oct. 6Herbert Klein, President Nixon's direc tor of communications, said to day that he supported the en actment of state laws designed to shield newsmen from being forced to divulge confidential sources of information.

title: LA PREVOYANTE NIT BY INFECTION
description: Will a skin infection being suffered by JeanLouise Leves que's unbeaten La Prevoyante cut the fastflying filly's speed this afternoon when she faces tiv, unexpectedly sizable turn out of eight rivals in the $100, 000 added Frizette Sakes at Belmont Park?

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 6  Twin Rivers, a new de velopment in East Windsor, is being placed under a micro scope by a new Rutgers Uni versity study group.

title: 50Story Apartment Building Planned for West 57th Street
description: A 50story residential tower with 1,000 units is scheduled for construction on the north side of 57th Street between Eigth and Ninth Avenues late this year under plans filed with the City Planning Commission.

title: Securities Markets Open For Columbus Day Holiday
description: Domestic securities markets and some commodities markets will be open Monday during the Columbus Day holiday. Cana dian securities and commodities markets will also be closed for the day in observance of the Canadian Thanksgiving holiday. The London securities and metals markets will he open.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Oct. 6Mr. Bridge looked around a wireenclosed visitors' room in the Essex County Jail today and said: About 6:30 at night is the worst time.

title: GRAHAM ON 134, LEADS IN JAPAN
description: INZAI, Japan, Oct. 6 (AP) David Graham of Australia overcame wind and rain to shot a second straight 67 today for a 36hole total of 134 and a fourstroke lead in the $300,000 Pacific Masters golf tourna ment.

title: MRS. ROCKWELL DIES; Y.W.C.A. EXECUTIVE
description: Mrs. Katharine Lambert Richards Rockwell, a theologian and a former executive of the Young Women's Christian As sociation, died yesterday in a nursing home in Hartford. She was 81 years old and until some months ago had lived at 39 Claremont Avenue.

title: ARTHUR A. GREENBERG
description: PATCHOGUE, LI., Oct. 6 Arthur A. Greenberg, owner of a pharmacy here, died of a cor onary attack in his sleep today. He was 56 years old and lived at 55 Roe Boulevard.

title: Legal Aid in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 6 (UPI) A joint legal services pilot program designed to lessen the financial burden of obtaining attorneys was announced yes terday by the Philadelphia Bar Associaton and the Insurance Company of North America.

title: Coast Guard Will Accept Women Officer Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (AP) Women will enter the Coast Guard's officer candidate pro gram next year for the first time since World War II, Sec retary of Transportation John A. Volpe said today.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The Federal Bureau of Investigation has identified a $100,000 cam paign contribution collected by Republican party fund raisers in Texas as coming from a bank account controlled by a Texasbased corporation, The Washington Post reported to day.

title: Winner of $1Million to Keep Modest Life;
description: Mrs. Anna Mizerak, who lives on Social Security with her 76 yearold partly blind husband, put on a new purple dress yes terday and went to a luncheon at the Roosevelt Hotel to collect the first payment of the $1 million New York State lottery that she and her son won two weeks ago.

title: PRICES HERE HIGHER ON JAPANESE PRINTS
