description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Oct. 7 (UPI)David Bowden threw two touchdown passes and Nat Moore swept the ends for two more today as underdog Florida stunned fumbling Florida State, 4213. It was F.S.U.'s first loss in five games.

title: Kinnelon to Mark 50th Anniversary
description: KINNELONIt has moun tains, it has lakes, it's tran quil, it's even excitingno, not Jamaica, but Kinnelon. Borough in Morris County.

title: BRAZIL POLICE SENT TO PROTECT INDIANS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct, 7 (Reuters)The police were sent to the northwestern Rondonia territory today to prevent rub ber workers from attacking a tribe of Indians, a National In dian Foundation source said here.

title: TENNESSEE ROUTS MEMPHIS STATE
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. Oct. 7 (AP) Haskel Stanback ran for three touchdowns today to help power 10thranked Tennessee to a 387 football victory over Memphis State.

title: JUDGE REINSTATES SUIT ON MILK PRICE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Fed eral District Judge William B. Jones reinstated late yesterday a suit by Ralph Nader that al leged that a rise in the Fed eral price support for milk, was linked to $322,500 in dairy farmers' campaign contribu tions to President Nixon.

title: Environment
description: Environmentalists usually find noth ing but fault with the Atomic Energy Commission, but last week they were loudly singing its praises. The Federal agency had moved against an in creasingly serious ecological threat thermal pollution.

title: Point Lookout Loses an Object of Conversation
description: A year ago the major top ic of conversation on the beach in Point Lookout was the sand bar. We all hated it. It kept growing and grow ing and coming closer and closer to our little beach like the heavy in a sciencefiction movie.

title: Hamilton Wins First Game
description: CIINTON, N. Y., Oct. 7 (AP) Kevin Snyder scored in the opening and final periods today to lead Hamilton to its first college football victory of the season, a 2112 decision over Oberlin.

title: Lynne Huggard Wed To Richard A. Heller
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Oct. 7Miss Lynne D. Huggard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vaughn L. Huggard, was married here this afternoon to Richard A. Heller, son of Mrs. Jack Schatzberg, of Fairview and the late Jo seph J. Heller. Municipal Judge Franklin C. Phifer of South Orange performed the ceremony at the Huggard home.

title: Coins
description: PART of the fortune in gold and silver coins and artifacts recov ered from the wreck of a Spanish fleet that floun dered in a hurricane off the Florida coast in 1715 will be auctioned by Schulman Coin & Mint, Inc. of this city. The local company was chosen by the Real Eight Co., Inc., of Melbourne, Fla., to help dispose of the recovered treasure. The first of two sales is scheduled for Nov. 27, 28 and 29 at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel. While parts of the salvaged treasure have already been sold, Mr. Schulman said, we believe we have here the real heart of the collection. We believe the gold alone should bring $1million or more.

title: the traveler's world
description: ELMIRA, N. Y.The fall foliage season is racing up on the Finger Lakes region just as it is on the rest of the northern half of the country, but up here the annual excur sion into the woods for the autumn colors has an extra dimension. Harris Hill, across Route 17 and a couple of miles southwest of the Chemung County Airport, claims to be the soaring capi tal of America, and the Harris Hill Soaring Corporation claims that the best way to see fall foliage hereabouts is from a glider or sailplane. On the basis of my first flight in a glider here they may well be right in billing their fall foliage weekend next Saturday and Sunday as an opportunity to enjoy the autumn color show from an excitingly different perspective.

title: Juniata Triumphs, 170
description: SELINSGROVE, Pa., Oct. 7 (AP)Juanita's defense blocked a punt and picked off two passes today to wear down Susquehanna, 17.0.

title: Dredging Is Giving Lake Carnegie a New Lease on Life
description: PRINCETON  Lake Car negie was artificially created in 1906 through the help of Andrew Carnegie. Sixty  six years later, the lake is being dredged through the gen erosity of an anonymous donor who contributed a mil lion dollars to give it a new lease on life.

title: Judith deBuys Bride in Maryland
description: GARRISON, Md., Oct. 7 Miss Judith Bland deBuys, daughter of Mr. and, Mrs. Wil liam Eno deBuys of Buxton, was married here this after noon to Frederick Lang Mak rauer, son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Lang Makrauer of Boston and Quisett Harbor, Mass.

title: HEARING FINDS MAINE UNREADY IN OIL SPILL
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 7A special Congressional commit tee has heard witness after wit ness testify that nobody was prepared to cope with the 100, 000gallon oil spill that occur red in Casco Bay last July.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: Like Orville Prescott's pre vious volume, Princes of the Renaissance, this popular his tory has a spectacular cast Gregory VII, who became Pope in spite of himself; Frederick I, Barbarossa of the flaming red beard, one of the world's greatest reactionaries; the ironically named Pope Innocent III, who proclaimed the Albi gensian Crusade, which led to the Inquisition; Frederick II, the poetscholar who liberated Jerusalem. The unending sav age violence that characterized the conflicts between Church and State are rendered more vividly than the clash of ideas and personalities. But at all times the author's enthusiasm for his subject, enhanced by his own travels in Italy, keeps the narrative moving. The illustra tions are excellent.

title: Deborah C. Pierce Is Married to Waldo H. Brown
description: OLD WESTBURY, L.I., Oct. 7The marriage of Miss Deb orah Campbell Pierce to Waldo Hayward Brown of Palm Beach, Fla., took place here this afternoon, John Mal loy, Village Justice of West bury, performed the cere mony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Pierce. The bride groom Is the son of Mrs. Charles C. Merkel of Grosse Pointe, Mich., and the late Waldo H. Brown,

title: Television
description: AS public television's Masterpiece Theater returns for another sea son, the sight of quality British TV on American screens has taken on distinct aspects of cozy famil iarity. While hardly breeding contempt, that familiarity is encouraging more cri tical examinations of the British product.

title: Stamps
description: THREE newrate postal stationery items are due from the United Nations on Oct. 16. On Nov. 17 a souvenir card of the Art of the United Nations will be released. For the lat ter, special attention will be given firstday cancellation for collectors having philatel ic accounts with the United Nations Postal Administra tion.

title: Increase in Costs of College Is Slowing
description: Once again, as in every aca demic year since the late nine teensixties, college undergrad uates and their parents are en during a rise in combined charges for tuition, fees and room, and board.

title: MANY INELIGIBLES ARE ABLE TO VOTE
description: At least 60,000 voters who were supposed to have been removed from the city's elec tion rolls will be permitted to vote next month because the Board of Elections, behind in its work all year, was unable to notify them that they were to be dropped, according to a Board official.

title: Physician Is Propd Of Brooklyn Career
description: Half a century of medical practice in Brooklyn, to gether with an association of equal duration at the Brook lyn Hospital  and a lifetime residence in the borough  has given Dr. Edwin Post Maynard Jr., all he could ask for.

title: Williams Beats Rochester On Hexner Field Goal, 30
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Oct. 7Williams defeated Roches ter, 30, in a driving rainstorm today on Mike Hexner's 33yard field goal in the second period.

title: Miss Betsy A. Miller Bride of Louis Radler
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Oct. 7Miss Betsy Ann Miller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Miller of Fairfield, was married here today to Louis Radler, son of Mrs. Benjamin Radler of Forest Hills, Queens, and the late Mr. Radler. The ceremony was performed in Congrega tion Rodeph Sholem by Rabbi Sanford Hahn.

title: Soviet Writer Criticizes McGovern on Trade Issue
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 7 (UPI)A Soviet commentator accused Senator George McGovern to day of blackmail in supporting Congressional efforts to block United StatesSoviet trade agreements because of a new Soviet tax on emigrants.

title: Increase in Deductible Cost Of Medicare Is Cut in Half
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (AP) The Price Commission has cut in half an increase in the hospital deductible cost that Medicare recipients will begin paying next year.

title: Wolfson Case Undecided; Jury Will Try Tomorrow
description: A Federal jury has been or dered to resume deliberations tomorrow in the trial of Louis E. Wolfson, the 60yearold fi nancier. He is charged with lying to, the Securities and Ex change Commission and with filing a false financial state ment for the MerritChapman & Scott Corporation, which he headed.

title: HOUSTON IN 2727 TIE WITH VIRGINIA TECH
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Oct. 7 (AP)D. C. Nobles tossed a 20yard scoring pass to Bryan Willingham with only 1 min utes 15 seconds remaining to day, but Ricky Terrell missed the extrapoint attempt and Houston's favored Cougars had to settle for a 2727 tie with Virginia Tech.

title: Few Youths in Lyndhurst Face Jail in Drug Raid
description: LYNDHURST  Only a small minority of the 88 youths arrested in June in drug raids Lyndhurst and surrounding towns will even tually stand trial, according to County Assignment Judge Morris Pashman.

title: Penguins Beat Kings, 42
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 7 (AP) Thirdperiod goals by Ken Schinkel and Al McDonough lifted the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 42 victory over the Los Angeles Kings tonight in the National Hockey League opener for both teams.

title: BLACK MUSIC SUNG IN FIRST OF SERIES
description: Friday night's Black People's Music, the first of three Joseph Black productions to be held at the Brooklyn Academy of Music over the next six months, featured artists expressing the black experience in Europe and the United States.

title: Alleged Swindler Of Mackell Aides Gets Venue Moved
description: A man charged with grand larceny for having allegedly swindled hundreds of thousands of dollars from people, includ ing some on the staff of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell, has won a change of venue from prosecution in Queens.

title: LS.U. VICTORIOUS OVER RICE, 12 TO 6
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 7 (UPI)Jim Benglis, a senior fullback, ran 23 yards for a touchdown, and Juan Roca kicked field goals of 46 and 53 yards tonight to give seventhranked Louisiana State a 126 victory over previously unbeaten Rice.

title: Texas Downs Utah State
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 7 (UPI) A secondteam halfback, Tommy Landry, scooped up a fumbled lateral and raced 55 yards for a touchdown tonight to lead 10thranked Texas to a 2712 comeback victory over Utah State.

title: Cinderella and a giggling crab
description: By the time I was 48 pages deep into this Treasury, I was reading aloud to a willing listener. I had found a handful of stories I had al ways known, and had fallen into the awful day of Fritzl and Liesi and the phrase Na, na! What's gone is gone. I had come to the rich laughing de tail of these BriggsofBriggs pic tures, and was sailing stopless through this glorious book.

title: First Storm of Autumn Dumps Record 3 Inches of Rain on City
description: The Atlantic Coast's first ma jor, storm of autumn blitzed up from the South and strafed the metropolitan area with gale force winds' and a record rain fall yesterday morning.

title: CARDIN DOWN NORTH STARS, 30
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 7 (UPI) Ken Dryden, the Montreal goalie, opened the season with a shutout tonight as the Cana diens defeated the Minnesota North Stars, 30.

title: Woman Survives Plunge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 7 (AP) The police said that a 26 yearold woman, Yvonne Ver non, jumped from the Missis sippi River Bridge yesterday, dropped 171 feet into the river and survivedthe third person ever to live after such a plunge. Ten other persons have died in similar leaps.

title: AMERICAN ENVOYS IN MOSCOW IRKED
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 7In the period of blossoming relations between the United States and the Soviet Union, the closeto thevest diplomatic style of the White House is demoralizing the career diplomats at the American Embassy who must conduct relations with Moscow over the long run.

title: Opener at Shea Stadium
description: After nine games on the road, count ing preseason, the New York Jets come home for their Shea Stadium opener to day. They will face the Miami Dolphins and right away its a very crucial game.

title: Cody's Airmen Give Concert With Byrds
description: Friday night's rock concert at the Academy of Music was neither good nor bad, neither memorable nor immediately forgetable. It was, in short, one of the meatandpotatoes programs that must suffice for fans in those stretches between appearances of the likes of Randy Newman, the Kinks and the Who.

title: A creator and seller of dreams
description: The prospect is irresistible: A. J. P. Taylor on his close friend Lord Bea verbrook, a great historian on one of the great figures in 20thcentury British history. In his preface Taylor writes, I am no Boswell. I am a narrative historian, and goes on to quote Kenneth Young's judgment of the manuscript, which he takes as a compliment, You have written a history of Beaverbrook, not a biog raphy. Approaching the end, he is at pains to make his point again: I am a narrative historian, not gift ed in analysis.

title: N.B.A. Opens Season Tuesday
description: The National Basketball Association begins its 27th season Tuesday night, and the Los Angeles Lakers, the league champions last sea son, may find it tougher making the playoffs.

title: OAKLAND IS VICTOR ON MARQUEZ'S HIT
description: OAKLAND, Oct. 7  Al Ka line's home run in the top of the 11th inning wasn't surpris ingsuperstars are supposed to get big hits in key situations. But the single by Gonzalo Mar quez in the last of the 11th shocked the Detroit Tigers.

title: Bridge
description: Traditional sayings are just about as unreliable in bridge as they are in life. Those who snatch at a bird in the hand, ignoring the possibilities of two in the bush, often have reason to regret their lack of foresight.

title: Wyoming Seminary Wins
description: KINGSTON, Pa., Oct. 7 Wyoming Seminary, unable to pass successfully, turned to a strong rushing game and de feated Cheshire, 186. Wyoming has won all three of its games while the Connecticut school lost for the first time in three starts.

title: COLLEGE IN NEWPORT PURCHASES ESTATE
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Oct. 7 Wakehurst, one of Newport's estates, was purchased this week for $200,000 by Salve Regina College, the 25yearold Roman Catholic women's col lege that owns several other estates In the exclusive Ochre Point section of Newport.

title: Hawks Sink Leafs, 31
description: TORONTO, Oct. 7 (UPI) Dennis Hull scored the deciding goal at 17:01 of the first period tonight as the Chicago Black Hawks defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 31, in their open ing game of the 56th National Hockey League season.

title: At 78, a Beekeeper Finds He's Too Busy for Retirement
description: SADDLE RIVERAt a time of life when many retired people fold their tents and silently steal away to warmer climes, this borough has a 78yearold who juggles his time between maintaining a farm, pursuing a career as a beekeeper and commuting by car several days a week to lower Manhattan to help his son manage a family business.

title: New York
description: It's going to be one hell of a politi cal year in this city, the New York politician said.

title: Ann L. Fertig Fiancee Of Robert Freedman
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Oct. 7 Mr. and Mrs. Felix C. Fer tig have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Ann Louise Fertig, to Robert Lawrence Freed man. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert J. Freed man of Rockville Centre, L. I.

title: L.I. Quaker Fair Empties Attics and Purses
description: WESTBLTRY, L.I.One young couple lugged an old wooden washing machine from Canada to put it on display at the fall fair on the grounds ?? the West bury Friemis (Quakers) Meet ing, but most of the wares that went on sale were do nated by people who rum maged through their attics, barns and garages in search of discarded treasure.

title: From the Space Age to the Tasaday Age
description: MANILA: From the airport of the bustling little Filipino city of Surallah, the helicopter heads east ward across a sundrenched, jadecolored plain pat terned with busy villages, motor roads and fields of rice and corn. Then it gains altitude sharply to skim over the towering, jungle  covered mountain ranges of southern Mindanao.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: But Mack Shouldn't Be Knifing Weill
description: WHEN stage business calls atten tion to itself, there's some thing the matter with it. I seem to have spent a week fighting my way past just such idle windowdressing in an effort to get at the perfectly sound materials behind it.

title: Intern Teachers Get Feel of Career
description: SOUTH ORANGE  Seton Hall University has estab lished a program that gives any student taking a course in education a chance to taste what highschool teach ing is like.

title: Apartment Proposal Stirs a Dispute in East Brunswick
description: EAST BRUNSWICK  A proposal to build 368 apart ment units and 53 onefamily homes on: a wooded site bordering Milltown is the focus of a bitter dispute here

title: PRESIDENT PRODS CONGRESS TO PASS SPENDING CEILING
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 President Nixon, clearly trying to put pressure on Congress, said today that placing a $250 billion ceiling on Government spending would provide ab solute insurance against a tax increase next year.

title: New York
description: Three weeks ago today, Priscilla Marbury Ryan was left a widow at 43, when her husband, Representative William F. Ryan, succumbed to cancer. This week, her grief notwithstanding, Mrs. Ryan will begin four weeks of intensive campaigning against one of the bestknown politicians in the na tion, Representative Bella S. Abzug, who last June unsuccessfully chal lenged Representative Ryan for the Democratic Congressional nomination in the West Side's 20th C. D.

title: Columbia Names Trustee
description: Judge Charles M. Metzner of the United States District Court for the Couthern District of New York has been named an alumni trustee of Columbia University. He succeeds Dr. Frode Jensen, whose sixyear term expired last month. A 1931 graduate of Columbia Col lege, Judge Metzner received his law degree from the Co lumbia Law School in 1933.

title: Detroit News Backs Nixon
description: DETROIT, Oct. 7 (UPI)The Detroit News endorsed the re election of President Nixon to day, describing him as an able and in some respects brilliant Chief Executive.

title: State Democratic Factions Fail to Unite on McGovern
description: Although they have publicly patched up their differences, supporters of Senator George McGovern and New York Democratic leaders appear to be long on unity talk but short on genuine cooperation in the Presidential campaign.

title: SCOUT FUND CHIEF TO RETIRE DEC. 31
description: It was probably around 1942, said Aaron D. Duberstein, di rector of finance services for the Boy Scouts of America, Greater New York Councils, when he approached Nathan Ohrbach, the department store chief, to ask his participation in a $238,000 Boy Scout fund raising drive. But Mr. Ohrbach, Mr. Duberstein recalled, said he wasn't interested in raising peanuts for so worthy a cause.

title: ECOLOGICAL RULING STUNS CALIFORNIA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 7  Most California communities have stopped issuing major building permits because of a State Supreme Court ruling that the effect of such projects on the environment must be in vestigated first.

title: E. K. Dey Marries Odile Alquier
description: Miss Odile Alquier of BievilleenAuge, Normandy, France, was married there yesterday afternoon to Ed ward Knapp Dey of New York. Mayor Franois de Gaalon performed the cere mony in the town hall. A religious ceremony took place later in a Roman Cath olic church in Crevecoeuren Auge. It was performed by a Roman Catholic priest, Abbe Rene Langlois, assisted by a Protestant minister, the Rev. George Jackson of Montreal.

title: Athens Agrees to Grant Special Status to Sixth Fleet Servicemen and Families
description: ATHENS, Oct., 7  Greece has granted to the United States servicemen and their de pendents who will settle here under the new homeport plan the same privileges enjoyed by other American military per sonnel in this country.

title: THOMAS EXCELS
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Oct. 7Smashed by topranked Southern California last week, Michigan State gave Notre Dame, another unbeaten college football power, its stiffest test of the season today before Irish power prevailed in the fourth quarter for a 160 victory.

title: The house was haunted
description: Hintlesham Hall, a 30room manor house complete with moat and orangery on 12 acres in Suffolk, England, is a stunning relic of a bygone era. Its history stretches back to 1568, when it was built by a soninlaw of the Duke of Norfolk. In its long life, the house has gained a classical facade. Two of its owners, one in the 17th century and another a century or so later, had gone bankrupt while living there. By 1971, the mansion was vacant (but for three amiable ghosts) and the estate went on the auction block. I had never seen a house like it, said its new owner, Robert Carrier, the food critic, author and restaurateur, whose Carrier Cook Shops introduced many Britons and Americans to gour met cookery. The building combined everything in one marvelous house a stately front, Tudor back and Queen. Anne interiors that are almost Fed eral. Nowadays Carrier is busy re storing the galleries, staircases (the one below dates from 1680), and the huge columned hall, right, to their 18th century magnificence. The second story will house his own apartments. One of its features is the gallery, left, that is both study and informal dining room. But to defray the maintenance costs of this architectural white elephant, Carrier will open part of the house as a private dining club where the em phasis will be on dining in an intimate homelike setting (vignette above). He also hopes to reinstate the summer arts festival which had once been an event at the mansion. The transplanted American from Tarrytown, N. Y., seems pleased by the challenge of restoring the building as a home and business: It will give me something to do for the next 20 year.

title: FUND FOR P.O.W.'S IS RIDDEN BY DEBT
description: WARREN, Mich., Oct. 7 Trustees of the Sergeant Sex ton Fund to aid prisoners of War have voted for, an inde pendent audit of the fund's books alter disclosure that the fund was $1,110.58 in, debt and had not spent any money to help prisoners.

title: The People Who Lived It Recall Democratic India's Imperial Past
description: The Maharani of Jaipur is sitting on a white sofa; she is dressed in a bottle green chiffon sari and her hair is down and carelessly brushed. She wears no makeup and needs none; she has the kind of good looks that beautiful women have when they decide to grow old beautifully.

title: Missouri Bows, 1716
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Oct. 7 (UPI) Brent Blackman con nected on a 54yard touchdown pass play with Steve Pettes on fourth down with 1 minute 38 seconds left in the game today to give Oklahoma State a 1716 Big Eight Conference victory over Missouri.

title: LIONS' KICK FAILS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 7 Princeton and Columbia opened the Ivy League football season today, and each team took a giant step sideways, playing a scoreless tie on a slippery field before about 10,000 spec tators at Palmer Stadium.

title: SHOP TALK
description: CEDARHURST, L. I.All it takes is a leisurely stroll down Central Avenue, the main thoroughfare of this middleclass community of 7,000 people, plus side trips down Spruce Street and Cedarhurst Avenue, to see why Cedarhurst is the prin cipal shopping locale for the Five Towns region of Nas sau County.

title: B25 Wreckage Found In a Savannah Swamp
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Oct. 7 (UPI)The Air Force says its investigation of the wreckage of a World War II bomber found in a swamp near Sa vannah, Ga., on Sept. 1 has been closed.

title: Mrs. D. H. Eyre Will Remarry
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Oct. 7 Mrs. Dorothy Hurt Eyre of Palm Beach, Fla., and South ampton, L. I., and Hickman Price Jr. of Newport and Macat, Brazil, plan to be married in Palm Beach late next month.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Once upon a time there was a big elephant who ruled over the animal kingdom for four long years, surveying the uni verse from his big flying machine, ap pearing occasionally on television and preaching the gospel of peace, pros perity, law and order.

title: Music: New Encounters
description: When Pierre Boulez took over the music directorship of the New York Philharmon ic last season, one of the experiments he introduced was a series of four Prospec tive Encounters. They were informed explorations of con temporary music, held in au ditoriums in Greenwich Vil lage. Their purpose was largely educational, as the conductor tried to lead his audiences into a better un derstanding of current trends and styles.

title: Disentangling Stravinsky from Stravinsky
description: Who was Igor Stravinsky? The first performances of The Firebird and Petrushka in 1910 and 1911 got him a prominent place on the musical landscape, and the row at the The Rite of Spring premiere in 1913 made him so famous that even people with minimal awareness of music knew who he was. There was, however, little knowledge of or even curiosity about Stravinsky the man. He gave polite interviews, wrote a bland autobiography, and published a stiff, constrained series of lectures on the Poetics of Music. But for the public, Stravinsky himself took on threedimensionality, texture and fla vor only with the publication in 1959 of Robert Craft's Conversations with Igor Stravinsky. In the years that followed, Craft continued work on the portrait in a series of dia books and articles.

title: National Cancer Plan
description: Both the atom bomb and the first manned landing on the moon were the products of extensive advance plan ning whose successful implementation brought spec tacular results. Now, under the authority of last year's National Cancer Act, an immense effort is under way to apply the same technique against cancer. With the participation of large numbers of scientists, physicians and other relevant personnel, a comprehensive national cancer plan is being formulated.

title: Alfred Extends Skein to 13 By Downing Union, 160
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Oct. 7  Alfred University won its 13th consecutive football game and third this season, 16.0, in the rain over Union today.

title: Recordings
description: WHAT in the world is that strange, pa godalike structure towering there be side the record player? As we move closer we see that this teetering monument is nothing but one reviewer's stack of recently released pi ano records. Let's pick a few of the more interesting ones off the top so that passersby will not be in danger of a horrible burial alive under vinyl.

title: Basket Case
description: The reported prediction of an American diplomat last year that an independent Bangladesh would become an international basket case has been fulfilled, at least for the short run. Since the end of the IndianPakistani conflict that gave the Bengalis their freedom last Decem ber, the new nation has been on the receiving end of one of the most massive relief operations in history.

title: Miss Gerhart Wed Upstate
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Oct. 7Miss Virginia Hamilton Gerhart, an urban planner, was married here this after noon to William Cooke Mason, a mechanical engi neer. The Rev. Morgan C. Sil baugh, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Evor Roberts, minister of the church.

title: Death Toll Rises to 172 In Mexican Train Wreck
description: SALTILLO, Mexico, Oct. 7 (AP)The death toll in the train wreck near here Thurs day rose to 172 late today as rescue crews, working nonstop for two days, cut their way to two flattened passenger cars buried in the rubble.

title: HARVARD SUBDUES BOSTON U., 33 TO 14
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 7 Paced by two touchdowns by Ted DeMars, Harvard's football team rolled up 31 points in the first 16 minutes of the first half today and went on to 3314 triumph over Boston University.

title: Grambling Victor, 2718
description: GRAMBLING, La., Oct. 7 (UPI)Rod Tureaud carried 22 times for 219 yards and a fourthQuarter touchdown today to lead Grambling to a 2718 upset victory over Tennessee State. Tureaud gained more than half of Grambling's 423 total yards, 138 of which were gained passing.

title: If You Go ...
description: ... to Kashmir, remember that it is pretty close to the roof of the world, so start planning your trip now but don't make it until early May at the soonest. And since Kashmir, because of its temperate climate, is best visited between May and October, a trip there does not fit in too well with visits to other parts of India, which seasoned travelers tend to avoid in summer. So it is well to pair Kashmir in a single trip not with India but with other central Asian countries like Afghanistan or Nepal.

title: Law
description: The trial was in its fourth month, the jury in its sixth day of delibera tion when it sent a message out to the judge: it was hopelessly dead locked. The note was read to the prosecutor and the defense lawyer.

title: Cynthia Kent Betrothed
description: DOWNINGTOWN, Pa., Oct. 7 Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Trim ble Kent have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Cynthia Louise Kent, to James Eric Rudy, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Forney Rudy of Chevy Chase, Md.

title: IN THE NATION
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 7Two wildly enthusiastic crowds, at the Iowa State Fairgrounds in Des Moines and in the cavernous old railway terminal here, must have given George McGovern some real confidence in what he had said earlier yesterday to a smaller group in the Polish Museum of Chi cago:

title: Jan Rothrnan Fiance Of Debra E. Greene
description: Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Greene of Brooklyn and Mohegan Lake, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Debra Ellen Greene, to Jan Rothman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Roth man of Sea Cliff, L. I. A June wedding is planned.

title: Windmill Is Built in Milford
description: MILFORD  Sixtyfour yearold Foul Jorgensen is completing a sevenstory windmill on Adamic Hill Road in Holland Township to fulfill a childhood dream that goes back half a cen tury to his native Denmark.

title: Miss Beverley Sharp Engaged To Dr. James Andrew Borger
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Oct.7 Mr. and Wm. Alleyne Carle ton Howell have announced the engagement of Mrs. Howell's daughter, Miss Beverley Sharp, to Dr. James Andrew Borger, son of Dr. and Mrs. Bruno Borger of Nashville, where his father is a chemical engineer.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Governor Names 2d Task Force To Study Financing of Colleges
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday the appoint ment of a task force to study the financing of higher educa tion in New York State, the second such organization he has created in 11 months.

title: Swing man on the Supreme Court
description: The opinions of the United States Supreme Court are important to police chiefs, Federal administra tors, officials of regulated industrial companies, union leaderspersons who cannot do their jobs unless the Court resolves important constitutional and statutory ambiguities. But the Court also has a less specialized audience and a broader function. The audience is the aware citizenry, and the func tion is to define shared values, to point a national direction and to remind the nation of underlying commitments, longer than the moment, that are the very essence of a constitutional government.

title: BOMB IN CAR KILLS WOMAN IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 7A woman was killed and six persons were injured by a bomb that exploded in a parked car in the Roman Catholic area of Lower Falls here today.

title: Saigon Radio Renews Attacks on McGovern
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 7The United States Embassy has again protested a series of attacks on Senator George McGovern that were broadcast on South Viet nam's Government television and radio stations this week, an embassy spokesman says.

title: WORKERS FAVOR SHORTENED WEEK
description: The threeday and fourday work weeks have won what appears to be unanimous ap proval from employes, man agement and the union of Group Health, Inc., according to Dr. George W. Melcher Jr., president of the nonprofit concern.

title: The Presidential Character
description: At the turn of the century, character would generally have meant moral fiber. A person either had character, or he didn't. (Of course, there was also the town character, a humorous twist of the term.) The publication in 1900 of Freud's The Interpretation of Dreams symbolized the new definition gradually accruing to the word: character now meant one's basic nature, one's total personality, perhaps as it twined itself around a central core.

title: The World
description: Drunks, lovers of street adven tures, people with criminal records. These were some of the terms used in the Soviet press last week to describe the eight young men who went on trial in Lithuania's Supreme Court. The charges: leading two days of rioting in the city of Kau nas last May 18 and 19. From the of ficial accounts it was difficult to rec ognize the supposedly nationalistin spired young people involved in the incidents.

title: DARTMOUTH BEATS HOLY CROSS, 17 TO 7
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 7 (AP)Chuck Thomas raced 78 yards for a touchdown early in the third period today, breaking open a close contest, as Dartmouth defeated Holy Cross 177 at raindrenched Fitton Field.

title: NEW STRAINS OF FLU EXPECTED IN WINTER
description: ATLANTA, Ga., Oct. 6 (AP) New strains of Type A influ enza are likely to appear in the United States this winter, the Center for Disease Con trol reported today.

title: Artists Reach Heights in Brooklyn
description: For the last three week ends, more than 100 artists have been displaying their works on the Brooklyn Heights Promenade against the background of the gray Manhattan skyline.

title: Carolyn Collins Becomes Bride
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Oct, 7 Miss Carolyn Marie Collins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Collins 2d of New Rochelle, was married here today in St. Augustine's Ro man Catholic Church to Michael V. Kostiw, son of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Kostiw. of Elmira, N. Y. The ceremony was performed by the Revs. Vincent McShane and Miro slav Myshchyshyn.

title: New York Botanical Garden Dedicates New $2.5Million Research Building
description: The New York Botanical Garden, something like a plant that has outgrown its pot, last week dedicated a new $2.5million building to house some of its increas ing research and educational activities.

title: Buffalo News Backs Nixon
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 7 (AP)The Buffalo Evening News endorsed today the reelection of Presi dent Nixon. The newspaper, which describes itself as inde pendentRepublican, also sup ported Mr. Nixon's candidacy in 1968. In an editorial, The News said that the President had proved his competence in managing the vast Federal bu reaucracy and effectively gov erning this nation.

title: Ariel Bybee Plans Bridal
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 7 Ariel Bybee, a soprano with the San Francisco Opera Company, and John Neylan McBaine, president of the board of directors of the Western Opera Theater here, plan to he married in late pecember.

title: DR. C. H. THOMPSON
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., Oct. 7. Dr. C. Hudson Thompson, chief of surgery at Horton Memorial Hospital, died in the hospital yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 56 years old and lived in nearby Circleville.

title: Frizette Is Taken By La Prevoyante
ANTIQUES
description: LAMBERTVILLE  Anyone driving too fast through this 19thcentury town, past the gingerbread houses and across the bridge that spans the Delaware, might easily miss that extraordinary bow backed Windsor in the win dow of H & R Sandor, Inc.

title: Plot Thins in Princess Graustark Stor
description: Princess Graustark may not be the fastest 2yearold filly in America, but at least she's going to get a chance to show what she's got.

title: Tilton Stops Berwick
description: TILTON, N.H., Oct. 7Tilton romped over Berwick, 260, to day for its second consecutive victory. Tilton has held its opposition scoreless in both games, while it has rolled up 37 points.

title: Victorian Oedipus manqu
description: At age 15 Beverley Nichols dis solved a bottle of aspirin in a bowl of soup and served this lethal po tion to his father, who, unaware of the Victorian Oedipus he had reared in his mansion at Torquay, vomited the mess up, and continued with battle in hand and thumb stuck through his fly from the inside to terrify and bully his longsuffering wife and adolescent sons.

title: FLAMES VANQUISH ISLANDERS, 3 TO 2
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 7 The National Hockey League came to the suburbs tonight at the Nassau Coliseum, and, when the game was over, Boom Boom Geoffrion was kissing old friends and Phil Goyette was complaining that his boys didn't bounce the opposition out of the way.

title: Family Fund Gives Kidney Patients Machines and Help
description: MILLBURN  Ruth Gott scho died 12 years ago be cause her kidneys were dis eased. Today, 150 persons in New Jersey, are alive because of her.

title: City Patrolman, Accused Of Raping Girl, Suspended
description: Patrolman James J. Farley of the 17th detective district robbery squad was suspended yesterday by Police Commis sioner Patrick V. Murphy after the patrolman was arrested in Suffolk County and charged with raping a 15yearold girl last June.

title: ADM. KIRTLAND, 79, ALABAMA SKIPPER
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Oct. 7Vice Adm. Fred D. Kirtland, retired, who commanded the battleship Alabama during World War II, died yesterday in St. Francis Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 37 Orchard Farm Road in Port Washington.

title: Concern's Mistake Costly
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 7 (UPI) The Texas Supreme Court ruled Wednesday that an El Paso concern must pay $2,680 plus lawyers' fees for four million adhesive price labels the owner mistakenly ordered from the Monarch Marking System Com pany. The owner of Reed's Photo Maret, Inc., had intended to order 4,000 labels but mis takenly ordered four million.

title: City Liberalized Abortions Held Enormous Success
description: Health Services Administrar for Gordon Chase yesterday pronounced the city's first two years of liberalized abortion an enormous success, and as serted that the experience had conclusively demonstrated the safety of abortion on a mass scale.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 7Christians, Bud dhists and Jews, banded together in common cause to preserve a valley sacred to Hawaiians, have won a partial victory in Federal court here.

title: Late Cortland State Drive Beats Montclair By 1310
description: CORTLAND, N. Y., Oct. 7 Driving 67 yards in the final moments, Cortland State Col lege won its third football game in four starts today, downing Montclair State, 13.10.

title: Unbeaten Massachusetts Defeats Vermont, 33 to 14
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Oct. 7  Two secondhalf touchdown passes from Piel Pennington to. Steve Schubert today lifted the undefeated University of Massa chusetts football team to a 33 14 victory over the University of Vermont. Pennington hit Schubert on passes of 7 and 35 yards in the opening five minutes of the third period as the Minutemen overcame a 14 10 Vermont halftime lead and rolled to their third victory of the campaign.

title: COED KILLINGS SPUR BOSTON U. INQUIRY
description: BOSTON, Oct. 7The sepa rate unsolved killings of two Boston University coeds, ap parently within the same week, have jolted the giant Common wealth Avenue campus and sparked an intense investiga tion by local private and Federal investigators.

title: No Mass Transit
description: In one of the least glorious moments of the 92d Congress, the House of Representatives has approved a bill providing billions for highways and not one cent for mass transit. The House as a whole might well Piave voted to divert some $700 million of Highway Trust funds to subways, bus lines and the like, but it did not have the chance. The amendment to accomplish that purposeand thus square the House bill with one already passed by the Senatewas ruled out as not germane. The responsibility for that ruling rests with Speaker Carl Albert of Oklahoma.

title: More Equal Incomes Called Key To LatinAmerican Development
description: BOSTON, Oct. 7A more equitable distribution of in comes, even at the price of slower rate of overall growth, is becoming the main priority in the development of Latin America.

title: 100,000 TO MARCH ON COLUMBUS DAY
description: Columbus Daynow a legal national holidaywill be ob served tomorrow, marked by the closing of many public and business facilities and high lighted by the traditional mam moth parade up Fifth Avenue.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: PARIS, Oct. 7  A sleek orangeandwhite train 304 feet long and powered by two pairs of gas turbines reached a speed of more than 190 miles an hour on a stretch of track near Bordeaux recently.

title: AARON POSTS A 67, LEADS WITH 209
description: PARIS, Oct. 7 (AP)Tommy Aaron rocketed into a four stroke lead after the third round of the $33,000 Lancome Golf Tournament of Champions today with a fiveunderpar 67. At the 54hole mark Aaron was seven under par at 209.

title: In Memoriam: A Drug Film
description: MORRISTOWNA mother whose son wanted to make the world a better place in which to live before his acci dental death three years ago, has inspired a new film about drugs and children as a memorial to him.

title: The World
description: MANILAAfter experiencing mar tial law for two weeks, most Fili pinos seem convinced that President Ferdinand Marcos is in firm and ef fective control of the country and is determined to carry out a widerang ing renovation of government and so ciety. But if the present is clearcut and well understood, the future is far less certain.

title: Georgia Pacific Is Struck
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., Oct. 7 (AP)Union workers struck the Georgia Pacific Company paper mill here this morning, after a week of contract talks at which union officials said little progress had been made. Union officials said the 650 members of two locals of the Pulp and Sulfide Paper Makers at the plant voted unanimously last night to begin the walkout at midnight. The workers have been without a contract since Oct. 1. Negotiations were sched uled to resume on Tuesday.

title: An exception among diplomats
description: I don't see how a memoir could be better; even if you aren't inter ested in the subject at hand, the language carries you along. And the story here toldwith all action subject to the finest Ken nan introspection  is both impor tant and absorbing. Covered in this second volume are the origins of the Korean War; the cold war mystique of Acheson and Dulles; Moscow in 1952 in the last months of Stalin; how Kennan got thrown out of the Soviet Union for an unguarded re mark in a Berlin airport; the Mc Carthy attack on old friends; the con vulsion of the cold warriors over Ken nan's Reith Lectures proposing disen gagement in central Europe; and his service in Yugoslavia under Kennedy. All of it is graced by the Kennan style; all is stamped with the Kennan foreignpolicy trademark.

title: N.B.A. Unveils Some New Rules
description: Several new rules will be in effect during the 197273 National Basketball Asso ciation season.

title: Notes: Diversion Aloft
description: AS if movies magazines and six or eight channels of recorded pro gram material ranging from clas sical music to foreign language lessons were not enough to relieve bore dom on long airline trips, various flight crews are devising additional ways to entertain passengers. One of the new est is letting them eavesdrop on con versations between the cockpit and ground control. The decision is the pi lot's but if he chooses and his plane is equipped for it, he can put the conversations on the plane's public ad dress system or feed them into the plane's audio entertainment console.

title: Eatontown Organist Plays Music to Repair Bikes By
description: EATONTOWN  You can buy a bicycle here or have one repaired and enjoy a live organ recital at the same time. AM culture does not end with music at the Mahns family bicycle emporium on Route 35 here, for a private museum is being opened on its newly constructed upper level.

title: Education
description: Catholic schools in the United States are closing at a rate of more than one a day. They are financially hardpressed, and their continuing hope is that help will be forth coming from the government, at one level or another.

title: M'GOVERN ASSAILS NIXON ON ECOLOGY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Sen ator George McGovern, in major policy statement, accused President Nixon today of hav ing steadily retreated under the pressure of special inter ests from a pledge of total mobilization to prevent fur ther deterioration of the na tion's environment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: JEANNE EVERT WINS IN QUALIFYING TEST
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Oct. 7 (AP)Jeanne Evert, 15year old sister of the tennis star, Chris Evert of Fort Lauderdale, easily passed her first qualify ing test today for the $100,000 Virginia Slims championship.

title: COLORADO REPELS KAN. STATE, 3817
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Oct. 7 (AP)Mark Cooney, a gangling 224pound tackle, ran 69 yards with an interception for a fourthquarter touchdown that gave 12thranked Colorado the lift it needed to defeat Kansas State, 3817, today in a Big Eight Conference football game.

title: School for Deaf Is Enlarged
description: HACKENSACK  An 8 yearold boy shows his teacher the tree toad he has brought to school.

title: Kansas Tops Minnesota, 3428
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 7 (AP) David Jaynes flipped three touchdown passes, two to Bruce Adams, as Kansas defeated Minnesota, 3428, today.

title: Late Army Rally Beats Lehigh, 2621
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Oct. 7 Army salvaged a football vic tory in the last four minutes against Lehigh on this blustery, rainy afternoon, 2621, after the Engineers had overcome a 20 point deficit.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Kashmir Houseboats: The Unhurried Life
description: SRINAGAR, IndiaA small black and white bird with a ruffle around its neck is singing. He has perched on the shuttered win dowsill of my bedroom in this rented houseboat, a veritable floating villa, peered in and decided I have slept long enough. I have. Outside, the sur face of Dal Lake, the Pearl of the Vale of Kashmir, turns slowly from gray to blue as the sun clears the peaks of the Himalayas. The first shi karas, the water taxis of Kashmir, be gin crossing the lake. The first to call is the baker's shikara with the banner Best Bread and Cakes flapping gently in the breeze.

title: Joanne Vosko Is the Fiancee Of Law Student
description: The engagement of Miss Joanne Ave Vosko to Mitch ell Zuckerman, has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Lyon Vos ko of Nassau, the Bahamas, formerly of Montreal. Mr. Zuckerman's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Morton Zuckerman of Tuckahoe, N.Y., and Ogon quit, Me. The wedding has been planned for the spring.

title: CONFEREES STUDY JOB SAFETY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7Con gressional money managers who had no part in writing pending health and safety legis lation will decide next week how many of the nation's 60 million working men and wo men will be denied the protec tion of Federal standards that now apply to all.

title: Dance
description: THERE is nothing that annoys the rest of the country more than any hint of New York elit ism even in cultural areas where New York happens to be elite. When I deplored in this column two weeks back the presence of three regional companies at the New York Dance Festival, quite a few correspondents jumped on me, some in rather color fl language. I was not ob jecting to these companies because they did not come from New YorkI don't even happen to come from New York myselfbut because they were amateurs in a pro fessional situation.

title: Graft Charges Rare in Western Europe's Judiciary
description: LONDON, Oct. 7Charges of corruption similar to those lev eled against American judges are rarely heard in Western Europe, with its older societies that emphasize merit rather than politics.

title: Laura Mooney Wed to Geoffrey W. Bott
description: Miss Laura Charlotte Moo ney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Mooney of Forest Hills Gardens, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Geoffrey William Bott. He is the son of William Bott of WestonSuper Mare, Somer set, England, and Mrs. Mil dred Bowell, of Bristol, Eng land.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, Oct. 7Vice Pres ident Agnew spoke today at the Ninth PolishAmerican Con gress convention and won an enthusiastic, reception that re flected the growing appeal of the Republican party to the country's white ethnic commu nity.

title: Survey Shows That Restrictions on News Media in Major Countries in Latin America Have Increased
description: The formal imposition of censorship, or other moves toward restraints on the pres entation of news, have gained strength this year in major LatinAmerican countries, ac cording to an Associated Press survey taken before next, week's meeting in Chile of the InterAmerican Press Associa tion.

title: Sarah Robins Jesup Is Married to Francis J. Rue 3d
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Oct. 7  Miss Sarah Robins Jesup, a senior at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania, was married here this afternoon to Francis Jamison Rue 3d, who was graduated with the class of '72 from Penn. The ceremony was performed in St. Michael's Lutheran Church by the Rev. Grant A. Morrill of St. Mark's Epis copal Church.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Catholic Collection Today to Aid Blacks

title: At Long LastOr Is It?
description: MOST people, including the resi dents of Sydney, Australia, prob ably won't believe it until they see it, but the Sydney Opera House really expects to open a year from now It has already been under construction for 13 years, and it will cost close to $100 million by the time it is finished. The constant necessity of postponing the completion date was occasioned by its unusual design; by a dispute between the architect, Jorn Ut zon, and building authorities so that he walked out on the job, and by the increasing costs, some of which were met by lotteries. Despite its spectacular exterior and location, the constantly inprogress opera house became a stand ing joke in music circles. Even people from Sydney would take a kind of wry pride in their infamous problem child and would tell with relish about the latest miscalculation in planning or construction.

title: Can Do Plant Trains Handicapped
description: HACKENSACK  The plant is so diversified, you can come back in a few days and see a completely dif ferent set of jobs, Anthony Raffaele said as he sat at his desk in his neat office that is nestled in a trim building on a quiet residen tial Hackensack street.

title: Scientists Ponder Past and Future of Mars From Mariner 9 Data
description: Were there once rivers, lakes and floods on Mars?

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate Armed Services Committee cast ballots last Friday on the question of who was responsible for what in the Lavelle Affair, and the resultat least to the committee's criticswas predictable. On the basis of evidence accumu lated during months of investigation and weeks of hearings, the committee decided that Lieut. Gen. John D. La velle was solely responsible for order ing and covering up some 20 or more unauthorized bombing attacks on North Vietnam.

title: BUILDER PRESSES MIXEDUNIT PLAN
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y., Oct. 7A major Westchester county builder who was thwarted earl ier this year when he tried to build a plannedunit develop ment in the northern part of the county is now waging a hardsell campaign to build one here in the southern part.

title: JoAnn Dubeck Wed to D. W. Farley Jr.
description: CALDWELL, N. J., Oct.  Miss JoAnn. B. Dubeck, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank J. Dubeck of West Caldwell, was married here this morning to Donald W. Farley Jr. of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Farley of Metuchen. The Rev. Eugene Schwartz performed the cere mony in the St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church.

title: Candidate Asks Phone Calls
description: SPRINGFIELD, Vt., Oct. 7 (AP)  The Democratic candi date for governor, Thomas Salmon, has announced that he is setting up a 24hour tele phone marathon to put himself in direct contact with Vermont voters. He said Wednesday that Vermonters could call him at toll free number for the 24hour period ending at midnight tomorrow.

title: To Club Members' Relief, the Luncheons Have Nothing to Do With Charity
description: Sixty women were gathered for lunch and for many it was an unusual occa sion. There wasn't a worthy cause in sight or, as far as could be ascer tained, even in mind.

title: Spock Urges U.S. to Close All Military Bases Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (UPI) Dr. Benjamin Spock said to day that the United States should close all its 3,000 mili tary bases abroad but should not become isolationist.

title: India Seeks to Save Bird, The Bustard, From Flying Out
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 7 (Reuters) One of India's rarest birds, the great Indian bustard, is to be protected in a special desert sanctuary in the state of Rajas than, the Indian Express news paper has reported.

title: Calm Returns to Troubled Newburgh
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Oct 7 Heavy rains today put a damper on the sporadic outbreaks of rock and bottle throwing by small, roving groups of black teenagers that started Wednes day.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Hopes for peace in Vietnam sent stock prices soaring briefly on Friday afternoon, thereby providing a bright interlude for a market that spent most of last week gazing at the dark side of the moon.

title: Medical Aides Training on L.I.
description: The man in white greets the middleaged woman en tering his office much as any physician would. He asks the same questions and gives her a complete physical examina tion But he is neither a physician, an interne nor a medical studenthe is in training to be a physician's associate, a member of a new medical profession de signed to ease the critical shortage of physicians.

title: GROTON IS VICTOR AS LODGE STARS
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Oct. 7  Cabot Lodge, the son of Henry Cabot Lodge, passed twice to William Sheeline for touch downs to lead Groton to a 25 8 victory over St. George's to day. The LodgeSheeline touch down plays covered 45 and 70 yards.

title: Spinney Hill Is Changing Quietly
description: MANHASSET, L. I.  In 1872, Joseph F. Spinney, a commission merchant with offices at 37 Exchange Street in Manhattan, bought two acres of land on the high ground near the Cowneck Peninsula, had a church built for $21,000 and presented it as a gift to the Great Neck Methodist Episcopal Church.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Adventures of Mole & Troll
description: The best thing to come along in friendships since Kenneth Grahame made Mole and Ratty immortal has been Arnold Lobel's two I Can Read books about Frog and Toad. It's a tough act to follow, though, and Tony Johnston's Mole and Troll never quite reach the heights. Com parison is inevitable, for Mrs. John ston, intentionally or not, has pro duced a book that follows exactly Lobel's style and format. The four stories in this See and Read Book explore the tiny trials of Mole and Troll's day to day existence. Mother's Day finds Troll making a dress for his grandmother with Mole as a model. When Grandma Troll turns out to be one mole taller and three moles fatter than her dress form she is presented with flowers instead and the garment put on a scarecrow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I am so tired of selfpity ing, whiny women complain ing of their lot in the suburbs [Suburbia? It Has Draw backs, Sept. 24]. Let's face it: you get what you ask for, what you attract and, to say the least, what you're worth.

title: Miss Halstead Has Nuptials
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 7 Miss Janet Ellen Halstead, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. D. Gordon Halstead, was mar ried this afternoon to Church ill Gibson Franklin, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Frank lin of Darien. The Rev. Dr. Donald Fisher Campbell performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church.

title: SPASSKY ASSESSES. ERRORS IN HIS LOSS
description: In a Moscow interview in which he analyzed some of the mistakes he made in losing the world chess championship to Bobby Fischer, Boris Spas sky said that he was willing to meet the American grand master again.

title: Reds Are Hurt by Foul Play
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 7  Sparky Anderson, the 38 yearold manager of the Cin cinnati Reds, is a reasonably mildmannered man who had not been thrown out of any of his team's 155 games this summer. But today he got the thumb in the opening round of the National League play off from an old antagonist, Umpire Ken Burkhart, a for mer pitcher for the Reds.

title: HalfHour Air Tours of Island Thrill Viewers
description: BOHEMIA, L.I.I've al ways wanted to fly and now I'm really doing it, said 13 yearold Ronnie Beutemnuller of Jericho, as he was pre paring to board if flight, that would take him on a tour of Long Island.

title: BUCKNELL DEFEATS GETTYSBURG, 23 TO 0
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Oct. 7 Bucknell University's football team scored 17 points in the first half today and went on to defeat Gettysburg, 230. It was the third victory for the Bisons in three outings. Gettys burg's wonlost record is now 103.

title: City Union Backs McGovern
description: By a mail ballot, Social Service Employees Union Local 371, has endorsed Senator George McGovern's Democratic candidacy for President. The union, with 12,000 members in 21 city agencies, said 2,795 bal lots had been cast for Mr. Mc Govern, with 585 for President. Nixon and 538 for no endorse ment.

title: DELAWARE TROUNCES LAFAYETTE BY 270
description: NEWARK, Del., Oct. 7 (AP) Delaware, topranked among small colleges, unleashed its sophomore halfback, Vem Rob erts, and showed a tenacious defense today to rout Lafayette, 270.

title: Purdue Stops Iowa, 240
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Oct. 7 (AP)Purdue's defense bottled up Iowa in its own territory to day and the Boilermakers punched out a 240 Big Ten Conference victory.

title: CLEMSON BEATEN BY GEORGIA TECH
description: ATLANTA (AP)Eddie Mc Ashan tossed a pair of touch down passes to a sophomore flanker, Jim Robinson, and ran for another score today, in leading Georgia Tech to a 319 college football victory over Clemson.

title: He seemed not totally human
description: Vaslav Nijinsky was 20 years old when Paris first saw him dance. The year was 1909, the ballet was Le Pavillon d'Armide, and, during the pas de trois with Karsavina and Bal dina, instead of walking off the stage he chose to leap off. According to Karsavina, No one of the audience could see him land; to all eyes he floated up and vanished. A storm of applause broke; the orchestra had to stop. The following season he was the Negro Slave in Schehdra zade, and Carl van Vechten wrote: This strange, curious, headwagging simian creature, scarce human, wrig gled through the play, leaving a long streak of lust and terror in his wake. Then he was the Petrushka whom Cyril Beaumont described as a pup pet that sometimes aped a human being; and as the Harlequin in Car naval he was again a headwagging creature, but a sprite: by most ac counts sly, feline, the very soul of mischief.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Religion
description: Do you want to know what Hasi dism is? asks the Baal Shem Tov, the 18thcentury founder of the movement, in a story retold by Elie Wiesel in Souls on Fire. And then in true Hasidic fashion he proceeds to tell a story himself.

title: Hotchkiss Is Victor, 200
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Oct. 7 Brian McNally scored two touchdowns today, both on 1 yard plunges, and Hotchkiss blanked Williston, 200, for its second straight victory. Mike Bauer accounted for the other touchdown for the winners on a 6yard run.

title: For a British Beer, It's Time, Gentlemen
description: CARLISLE, England, Sept. 29It was noon in the Jo vial Sailor, one of the oldest pubs in town, and Stanley Fiddler, 59 years old and a man who loves his bitter, was on his fifth pint of the morning. He was angry and he was sad.

title: FrenchEnglish Lexicon Speaks Franglais Aussi
description: Ren Ledsert has spent a quarter of a century edit ing Harrap's New Standard French and English Diction ary, but he is still astonished at the confusion of species on both sides of the Channel.

title: City to Seek Bids on Garage in Queens
description: In an attempt to reduce the number of cars entering Manhattan the city will soon begin to advertise for bids for the construction of the first commuter garage in Queens  to be situated where Jackson Avenue inter sects Queens Plaza.

title: Stony Brook Scores
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., Oct. 7 Stony Brook converted a last quarter fumble into a touch down and edged Dalton, 60 today. The fumble recovery came on the 10yard line and the touchdown was two plays later on an 8yard run by Ran dall Ellison.

title: Architecture
description: IT HAS been suggested that we frequently leave our readers out on a limb, drawing their at tention to crises of the en vironment and conscience without telling them how it all carne out. This column, therefore, is dedicated to those who keep score.

title: PITT CONQUERED BY RUNE 386
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 7 (AP) David Lee intercepted two passes and recovered a fumble in the second quarter to start Tulane toward a 386 victory over Pitt tonight in an inter sectional football battle.

title: Movies
description: DIRECTOR Martin Ritt, whose Sounder presents  poignant picture of Black sharecroppers struggling to survive in the South during the Depression, will focus on contemporary Black Southerners in his next film, Conrack.

title: Air Force Triumphs
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Oct. 7 (UPI)  Joel Carlson scored three firsthalf touchdowns, one on a pass from Rich Haynie, and Haynie threw two more touchdown passes and ran for a score in the second half today to lead Air Force to a 5213 victory over Colorado State.

title: United Aircraft Tries to Pull Up
description: Problems: You're one of the world's leading aircraft companies  a major jet engine builder. Your sales have dropped from $2.49bil lion in 1968 to $2.02billion 1971. You incurred a $43.9million loss last year.

title: 13 HOSTAGES FREED; YOUNG CAPTOR SHOT
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Oct. 7 (AP) Thirteen people held for ransom by a teenaged gun man scrambled unharmed to safety today after an unarmed police jude expert talked his way into the house and an other officer shot the youth in the neck, the police said.

Mankind's attitude toward nature has been one of rapine and destruction; he rejects the growth theory and asks for tenderer care of earth, sea and air by business and govern ment; in separate chapters he examines the damage done by radiation, pesticides, garbage, mining and so on. All quite familiar by now.

title: Nixon Assails Drug Abuse
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (AP) President Nixon has desig nated the week beginning Oct. 15 as Drug Abuse Prevention Week. He called for a national effort to banish drug abuse from American life. Mr. Nixon said today that the full power of the Government had been mobilized to provide rehabili tation and treatment of drug addicts and to cut off supplies of illegel narcotics.

title: Russo Going to Copenhagen
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 7 (UPI) Anthony Russo Jr. was given court permission yesterday to leave for Copenhagen to attend a civilian inquiry into the Unit ed States war crimes in Indo china. He is scheduled to go On trial in a few weeks with Dan iel Ellsberg in the Pentagon papers case.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 7Senator George McGovern was reunited here today with his onetime running mate, Senator Thomas F. Eagleton, for a joint attempt to confront the credibility issue headon.

title: Movies
description: IF you walk into a room full of movie nutsif you can find a room full of movie nuts these daysand drop the names James Herbert and David Rimmer, nobody is likely to help you pick them up. Probably not even the most knowledgeable enthusiastthe friend, say, who is studying, really studying, the career of Joseph 11. Lewis (Gun Crazy, Terror in a Texas Town, etc.); or the specialist who can read almost as much from each frame of Stan Brakhage as the filmmaker put inwill have heard about Rimmer or Herbert.

title: Andover Trims Choate
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., Oct. 7Andover won its first game, 180, over Choate. Choate has lost twice.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Compromise Jericho Housing Plan Wins the Qualified Approval of Long Time Opponents at a Hearing
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I.A scaleddown version of the controversial plan to build multifamily housing units in Jericho has won the quali fied approval of the various civic groups that have op posed it for about a year.

title: Gunmen Halt Bus On Coast and Rob Its 31 Passengers
description: EVERETT, Wash., Oct. 7 (UPI) Robbers held up the 31 pas sengers of a Greyhound bus last night in a style reminiscent of the stagecoach robberies of the old West.

title: Jazz: Duke Opens Yale Fund Drive
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 7A weekend convocation of the conservatory without walls, the first event in Yale Uni versity's recently established $1million Duke Ellington Fellowship Program, began last night with a concert and a bomb threat.

title: Child to Dr. Helen McNeil
description: A daughter was born Sept. 19 at St. George's Hospital in London to Dr. Helen Mc Neil, former assistant profes sor of English at. Hunter Col lege here, and Nathan Silver, 9 New York architect, author and architectural critic now in practice in London. Dr. McNeil, an authority on the work of William Blake, chose as her daughter's given name Liberty, a feminine personifi cation in one of Blake's poems. The child will be known as Liberty McNeil Silver.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: NEWARK  For the first time since the Institute of Jazz Studies was founded 20 years ago, it is now headed by a professional jazz musi cian. He is Chris White, a bassist who was a member of Dizzy Gillespie's group for many years and who is still an active freelance musician.

title: C.C.N.Y. DEDICATES SCIENCE BUILDING
description: Dr. Robert E. Marshak, the president of the City College of New York, yesterday dedicated his school's new 14story Sci ence Hall to the students.

title: 150 Marine Scientists From the U.S. and Canada Exchange Ideas in Conference
description: GREENPORT, L. I.  A threeday conference on the culture of marine inverte brate animals, known as mariculture, was held at the Greenport Theater this week. It was sponsored by the Middle Atlantic Natural Sci ence Council, Inc., Adelphi University, the State Univer sity of New York at Stony Brook, and Suffolk County Community College.

title: TAIPEI PRACTICE ON JAPAN TRADE
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Oct. 7  Notices posted throughout the city by the Taiwan University Students Association urigng a boycott of Japanese goods pro claim that Japan's abrogation of her peace treaty with Na tionalist China has restored the state of war between the two countries.

title: Dr. Susan W. Liebowitz Is Married
description: Dr. Susan Wendy Liebo witz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Liebowitz of New York, and Dr. Dan Wil liam Luedke, son of Mr. and Mrs. William P. Luedke of LaCrosse, Wis., were married yesterday afternoon in the library of the Manhattan Club in the Barclay. The Rev. Stephen Wade of St. Mi chael's Episcopal Church per formed the ceremony.

title: Limon Pursues His Visions
description: I CAN remember when Jose Limon was the King, and we, his fervent sub jects, tried to dance and to think about dance the way we thought he would have wanted us to. Not that he cared: he was occupied with his private vision of art and tired out from the hard work necessary to articulate it. When he talked to you, his eyessolid black pits in the marvelous Indian skull seemed fixed on a point either deep inside himself or miles behind you.

title: 1600 B.C. FRESCOES FOUND IN AEGEAN
description: ATHENS, Oct. 7A series of small frescoes found on the Aegean island of Thera will give archeologists a glimpse of daily life of some 3,500 years ago.

title: Weekly Columnist Informs arid Leads
description: MAPLEWOODThis town and neighboring South Orange share a common school system and the week ly NewsRecord, with an ed itorialpage fixture that for almost 26 years has tried to shake the communities out of suburban complacen cy.

title: Coak Leads Lawrence
description: GROTON, Mass., Oct. 7Wil liam Coak, Lawrence's stand out runner, scored the touch down today, that enabled his Ream to beat Rivers Country Day, 60. It was first victory in two games for Lawrence.

title: World News Briefs
description: TRIESTE, Italy, Oct. 7A youth who tried to hijack an Italian airliner to Cairo was found shot dead aboard the empty aircraft today.

title: Thomas Desmond of Newburgh, State Senator 28 Years, Is Dead
description: Former State Senator Thom as C. Desmond of Newburgh died Friday night in Boston while on a visit to the Massa chusetts Institute of Technol ogy. His age was 85.

title: Britain Still Holds Key for E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS  If a Dutch family goes on a camping trip in southwestern France, passports and automobile pa pers must still be presented at the frontier a decade and a half after the European Economic Community was founded.

title: World News Briefs
description: GOTTINGEN, West Germany, Oct. 7The police today called off a search in Lower Saxony for an American deserter wanted in connection with the slaying of his two military es corts and a train cleaning woman.
