title: YUGOSLAVIA LOSES TO HUNGARY IN CHESS
description: SKOPLJE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 7 Hungary today defeated Yu goslavia 2 to 1 in one of the crucial matches of the chess Olympics here.

title: 73MILE SAIL WON BY POTTER'S KETCH
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 7 One of the roughest, wettest and fastest of the Indian Har bor Yacht Club's 17 Stratford Shoal overnight races for the Windward Cup was won today by John T. Potter's Equation, out of SeawanhakaCortinthian Y. C. at Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: Opera: An Aida With Vitality at Met
description: Verdi's Aida is one of those thricefamiliar operas that often get dispatched with routine performances, but the Metropolitan Opera's presentation of the work on Friday night, the first of the season, happily escaped that fate.

title: Survey in 8 States Finds When and Where Farm Residents Are Likely to Suffer Accidents
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 7A wise farmer, anxious to maintain his health, would do well to stay off his tractor on summer Saturdays around 2 P.M., ac cording to a new study, of farm accidents made by the Nation al Safety Council.

title: Mr. Brick's Image Scores Upset Victory at Calder
description: MIAMI, Oct. 7 (AP)H. A. Blancke's Mr. Brick's Image closed fast along the inside to score an upset victory today in the Azalea Handicap at Calder Race course.

title: The World
description: UNITED NATIONSThe General Assembly hall was full. Diplomats from the other 131 membernations were anxious to hear where Communist China stood after a year in the world organization.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Foreigntrade zones, gen erally thought of in relation to Atlantic, Pacific of Gulf port cities in the United States, are spreading inland.

title: October
description: We speak of The Color now, and think we may go out and see it some afternoon. But it is more than a Sunday spectacle. It is a thousand vistas, ten thousand hills, hori zonwide. It changes day to day, even hour to hour. And it is never the same one year to the next.

title: The World
description: LONDONWell done. A great day for Europe. Thus did British Prime Minister Heath last week greet the news that Denmark, by an overwhelm ing vote, had approved membership in the European Economic Community. The majority of 63.5 per cent Yes to 36.5 per cent No went a long way toward lifting the gloom that had settled over the capitals of Western Europe the week before, when Norway's citizens rejected membership.

title: Nathan Peace Ship Stops for Drydock En Route to Mideast
description: Abie J. Nathan's floating radio station Peace logged the first dozen miles of a planned 5,100mile voyage to the East ern Mediterranean last week from West New York, N.J., to a New Brighton, S.I., ship yard, under tow.

title: N. C. State Two Duke
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Oct. 1 (UPI) Stan Fritts a sophomore full back, pounded out 133 yards and two secondquarter touch downs today to lead North Carolina State to a 170 vic tory over Duke.

title: Jennifer D. Starr Is Married to Dennis W. Horning
description: HULETTS LANDING, N. Y., Oct. 7Miss Jennifer Dela plaine Starr, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Louis M. Starr of Darien, Conn., and Huletts Landing, was married here this morning to Dennis Wil son Horning, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth W. Horning of Royersford, Pa.

title: PARLEY EXAMINES HEALER METHODS
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 7A conference of specialists inquir ing into the laying on of hands and other unorthodox forms of healing has been told here that a healer lacking selfconfi dence could drain a subject of energy instead of aiding him.

title: 2d Gorilla Born Here Reportedly Doing Well
description: New York's animal enthu siasts can now count their blessings in pairsa second gorilla has been born in cap tivity, this time at the Bronx Zoo.

title: 33 Thais Jailed for Graft
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 7 (AP)The ruling National Ex ecutive Council has sentenced 27 military officers and six government officials to prison terms ranging from seven to 25 years for corruption. The of ficials were convicted of ex torting money from men seek ing to avoid the draft.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WEST VIRGINIA TOPS WILLIAM AND MARY
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Oct. 7 (AP)  Danny Buggs and Kerry Marbury each scored three touchdowns today as West Virginia capitalized on critical William and Mary errors to roll up a 4934 foot ball victory.

title: A Psychiatrist's Head
description: Dr. Martin Shepardauthor of Games Psychiatrists Play and The Love Treatmentis a man of many cravings as this autobiography attests. He wants to be loved and admired, and he wants to provoke; he wants to tell it the way it is that is, the way he sees it. He wants to express himself sexu ally when, where, how and with whom he chooses, and he wants to help other people to do the same. He wants to stop the war, to reform prisons and to snake up the psychoanalytic establish ment, and he wants to be in the forefront of the human po tential movement. He wants to help his beloved, mortally ill father die a good death, and he wants to straighten out his relations with the rest of his family. The list could be ex tended, but it would be inac cessible to explanation unless it included his attitudes towards certain feelings.

title: HUNTER TITLE WON BY GILL'S GELDING
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 7  Harry Gill of Collegeville, Pa., has made his reputation by producing some of the leading show jumpers in the country the likes of Idle Dice, Brendan and Nanticoke.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONIn his lonely quest for the Presidency, Senator George McGovern must sometimes wonder whatever happened to that once lusty chorus of Congressional liberals who helped him orchestiate the issues of his candidacy.

title: He collaborated in his own undoing
description: When Jackson Pollock died in an auto crash in 1956, he was already at the age of 44one of the most famous painters in the world. He had been showing his work, and re ceiving serious critical attention, for nearly 15 years. As early as 1943, the Museum of Modern Art had bought one of his picturesThe SheWolffor its permanent col lection. For part of the difficult war years of the 1940's, he had a patron and dealer who paid him a regular stipend, and the most important crit ics of the period consistently hailed him as a significant new talent.

title: Unhappy in its own way
description: What a story! This admirable book, a study of the social genesis of madness, manages to combine the facts of a casehistory and the at mosphere of a fairy tale, a bad fairy tale of chilling deterioration and dis aster. Laura Scott and Eliot Carpen ter (these are pseudonyms), descend ants of old and stable American families, met and married in a Cali fornia city in the early years of this century. If Grandfather Carpen ter had a genius for making the right investment at the wrong time, Grandfather Scott had achieved ty coondom. His soninlaw was deter mined to do so too, and indeed he was able to provide all the advan tages for his beloved wife and three attractive children, Virginia, Eliot Jr. and Amy.

title: Pop
description: ONE of the more irritat ing practices of record companies like Colum bia, Decca and RCA, that own most of the classic Swing of the thirties and for ties, is the constant rerelease of the same handful of big band golden oldies over and over again. By actual count, RCA has reissued Tommy Dorsey's Song of In dia and Marie 37 times, I'll Never Smile Again 34 times, Boogie Woogie 32 times, and Opus # 1 29 times. Yet the same company holds back dozens of Dorsey beauties that collectors crave gems that have never been issued on microgroove like Swing High and Swing time Up in Harlem (slashing Ziggy Elman and blazing Buddy Rich), Do I Worry (tasty Sinatra with the Pied Pipers), Little Man With a Candy Cigar (lovely, plain tive Jo Stafford), Puddle wump, At the Fat Man's and That's It (superb Char lie Shavers), and Out of This World (Stuart Foster's rich baritone and Buddy De Franco's lilting clarinet).

title: Trinity Eleven Hands Bates 24th Loss in Row, 250
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 7Trinity College limited Bates to two first downs and minus 8 yards in total offense today as the Bantams scored a 250 victory. It was their first victory in two starts.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Music
description: THE other night found me at the St. James Theater, to have (hopefully) relaxing evening with Two Gen tlemen of Verona. Such impos ing credentials: Tony Award for 1972; Drama Critics Award for 1972.

title: The Nation
description: Senator McGovern may have failed to push the Vitnam issue onto center stage, but it still hovers in the wings of the campaign. Pres ident Nixon mentions it from time to time, usually to make the point that he is offering Hanoi everything short of American surrender. Mr. Nixon returned to this theme at his news conference last week, say ing that his talks with the North Vietnamesepresumably through Henry A. Kissinger's private trips to Parishad reached a sensitive stage and that he was trying to persuade them that it would be unrealistic on their part to bank on the possibility of a McGovern vic tory. And Mr. McGovern, in a major address in Cleveland last week, called the Vietnam war the central affliction of American society without, however, adding visibly to national alarm.

title: Income Level Low in Hudson
description: Fewer than onefifth of Hudson County's 160,000 families had an annual in come exceeding $15,000 in 1970, according to the Cen sus Bureau.

title: World News Briefs
description: PARIS, Oct. 7An angry struggle that may lead to a strike has erupted on tje news paper FranceSoir after the re moval of its executive editor. Robert Villers.

title: Someone's in The Kitchen  With Music
description: ONE night a soprano crawls out from under a piano to sing a con temporary song. An other night a cellist is lying on a bed of television sets playing her instrument while the audience mills around. Another night a chorus of 20 people is wandering around the room making strange gurgling sounds with their voices. Another night musi cians are creating loud repe titious electronic sounds while images of the musi cians are fused with abstract patterns on television screens. If you haven't heard any concerts like these late ly, it is only because you haven't been attending The Kitchen, which is where they take place.

title: From Maud to Claire to Chloe
description: IF a great filmcan be defined as one that celebrates, among other things, the variety of human behaviorthe battles given up in solitude, sheep ishly, as well as those heroically pursued and as one that increases our aware ness that intellect may not always be in perfect union with emotion, then Eric Rohmer's new French comedy, Chlo in The Afternoon, must be a far great er film than Jan Troell's Swedish epic, The Emigrants.

title: GRAND PRIX POLE GOES TO STEWART
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y., Oct. 7An allday mess of rain and fog disrupted today the second day of qualifying for tomor row's running of the United States Grand Prix, with the result that the starting grid was organized on the basis of yesterday's time trials. The few drivers who ventured practice in today's adverse conditions turned in lap times dramatical ly slower than yesterday's.

title: Meet at Yankee Stadium
description: With an attitude of suspicious optim ism, or optimistic suspicion, or possibly just plain apprehensive confidence, he New York Giants will face the New Orleans Saints at Yankee Stadium to day at 1 P.M. as a 10point favorite.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New &Novel
description: One February day in the changeless equatorial year two secret powerful men climbed down from a Douglas DC6B at Los Remedios airfield, where a Mercedes Benz of striking an tiquity was waiting to take them to the governor's palace in this provincial capital. So begins another of Norman Lewis's beautifullystaged sa faris into the nature of evil in faraway places.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: SAUDI ARABIA, Qatar, Kuwait, Iraq and Abu Dhabi reach agreement with Western oil companies that will eventually give them control of the producing concessions in their countries. . . . Federal Power Commission rescinds price ceilings and other restrictions on imports of liquefied natural gas from Algeria. . . . Volkswagen raises price 1973 cars by average of 1.7 per cent. . . . United States car sales in final third of September rose 23 per cent from last year's level.

title: G.O.P. Gives Wives Tips On Political Etiquette
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (AP)  The National Republican Congressional Committee has some advice for candidates' wives: Watch your cigarettes, don't chew gum and never look bored, And bow your head during the entire invo cation.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 7 (AP) Gary Knutson, the Kentucky tailback, had a spectacular run ning game but it remained for the Wildcat defense to pull 1713 Southeastern Conference victory over Mississippi State tonight.

title: ARKANSAS RALLY TOPS T.C.U., 2713
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Oct. 7 (UPI)Joe Ferguson, his fum bling Razorbacks trailing by 13 points, rallied his club with four touchdown passes to give Arkansas a 27.13 victory over Texas Christian tonight. The victory extended Arkansas' winning streak over the horned frogs to 14 years.

title: Headliners
description: In Washington last Sunday, Zubin Mehta (left) had trouble getting past plainclothesmen guarding Kennedy Center though he insisted the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra would be handicapped without the presence of its conductor ... But in Tokyo, the 1972 Miss International beauty pageant did go on without Ronit Gafni, Miss Israel. Organizers of the contest apologized for withdrawing their invitation to Miss Gafni, but they said they were more concerned about pub lic security than hurt feelings. ... These were but two inci dents reflecting the continued concern, here and abroad, over the threat of Arab terrorism. On Sept. 5, the day 11 Israeli athletes fell victim to Arab guerrillas in Munich, Presi dent Nixon promised that adequate security measures would he taken to protect Israelis in the United States. Last week, Government sources indicated that the promise was being kept. A major effort is underway to identify possible terrorists among Arab residents and to intensify screening of travelers from Arab nations arriving in this country.

title: Michelin Fights Back
description: PARISAs Western Europe Makes uneven strides toward its longsoughtafter single market economy, a major cluster of tire manufactur ing companies is being or ganized by the Michelin Com pany and some of the Con tinent's largest banks.

title: Exit Welfare Reform
description: Few exercises are more painful, now that the Senate has buried welfare reform, than to reread the two elo quent messages President Nixon sent to Congress early in August 1969 urging a dramatically new approach to end the colossal failure that public welfare had become.

title: Wesleyan's Ground Attack Sets Back Bowdoin, 22 to 6
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Oct. 7Behind the running of Steve Sadowy and Toni O'Brien, Wes leyan University downed Bow doin College, 226 today for its first victory of the season.

title: Body of L.I. Man Recovered
description: CLEMONS, N.Y., Oct. 7 (UPI)  The body of Vjacheslav Pelse, 62 years old, bf Com mack, L.I., was recovered from Lake Champlain today after he drowned in a boating accident near this Washington County village. The state police said the investigation was continu ing into why Mr. Pelse, of 5 Evelyn Drive, fell overboard while boating with three friends last night.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7,  Five million passengers have now ridden the Metroliner, and Federal officials, pleased with the success of the dem onstration project that started just over two years ago, will recommend soon that the Government back $500mil lion in loans to further im prove passenger train service in the Northeast Corridor.

title: Yosemite Parking Lot Going
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Oct. 7 (AP)In a cere mony marking the continuing deemphasis of autos in the Yosemite Valley, the National Park Serviae director, George B. Hartzog Jr., broke up a small piece of asphalt heralding the retirement of a parking lot. The ceremony at the visitors center at Yosemite Na tional Park Wednesday started demolition of a 289space park ing lot at Yosemite Village.

title: MT. VERNON BOWS TO WHITE PLAINS
description: True to tradition of show business, Poly Prep and Horace Mann decided the show must go on and met in the mud, rain, and wind yesterday.

title: SLAIN MAN TAPED SUSPECTS' TALKS
description: STERLING, Conn., Oct. 7  A witness, murdered here be fore he could testify in a Federal case involving a theft of Army rifles, had taped con versations with two men ac cused in the case three weeks before he was killed.
