title: CAPITAL HOLDING IN MERGER PACT
description: Merger News

title: SHOP TALK
description: Who ever heard of a posh jewelry shop offering neck laces, bracelets, pins, rings, pendants and cuff links rang ing to $5,000, with only four tiny diamonds in the entire establishment?

title: Intruder's Attempt To Approach Pope Detailed by Vatican
description: ROME, Oct. 9A man clad in the white vestments of missionary bishop and wear ing a golden cross got into the papal summer residence at Castel Gandolfo one day last month and tried to approach Pope Paul VI.

title: Hughes Scores the Military On DrugTesting Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP) Senator Harold E. Hughes, Democrat of Iowa, said today that there was falsification, manipulation and inaccuracy in the armed services, drugtesting programs.

title: Politicians Woo Italians at Columbus Parade
description: A plethora of politicians of disparate political persuasions clustered together yesterday on a buntingdraped wooden stand on Fifth Avenue, sharing one thing in common in this elec tionyear: a belief in the effi cacy of the ItalianAmerican vote.

title: Uganda's Crisis Seems to Be Abating, But the Underlying Problems Persist
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 9 As Uganda celebrated the 10th anniversary of her independ ence today, observers in East Africa and concerned residents were convinced that the coun try's real problems were those of leadership.

title: Good Chance Seen For House Backing Of Spending Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP) President Nixon's top eco nomic advisers said today that there was a good chance that the House of Representatives would approve on Tuesday the President's requested $250bil lion ceiling on Federal spending.

title: South Yemen Charges Sana Forces Take Island
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, Oct. 9 (Reuters)  Yemeni troops have occupied a South ern Yemeni island in the Red Sea after naval and air at tacks in which many civilians were killed, a Southern Yem eni Government spokesman said here today.

title: A'S CAMPANERIS FINED SUSPENDED
description: DETROIT, Oct. 9The Oak land A's and the Detroit Tigers lost their shortstops today for the rest of the American League pennant playoff, whether it ends tomorrow with an Oak land victory or continues to Wednesday or Thursday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: SPARTA, N. J., Oct. 9The bowandarrow deer hunt ing season opened Saturday at 6:30 A.M. for 30,000 Jersey ans who have been stocking up on Super Hilbre, Bear and Bodkin points for the last few months in anticipation of an opportunity to bag a whitetail.

title: Screen: Far Out Shorts
description: Far Out is entirely justi fiable as an allinclusive title for the program of short sub jects that opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum. The eight shorts are indeed far out but, aside from a few, the collection  which stresses the freewheeling imagina tion of its creatorsmay strain a viewer's imagina tion to the point of apathy.

title: Grand Union Plans Store
description: The Grand Union Company will open the newest and most modern supermarket in its more than 500unit chain to day on Route 17 at Linwood Avenue, Paramus, N.J. The new store contains 40,000 square feet of space, includ ing 27,000 square feet for selling purposes. There are parking facilities for more than 700 cars.

title: RAIDERS TRIUMPH OVER OILERS, 340
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 9 (AP) Daryle Lamonica, the Oakland) quarterback, broke up a slop pily played game with touch down pass plays of 16 and 27 yards as the Raiders routed the Houston Oilers, 340, in the Astrodome tonight.

title: CRISIS IS DECLARED IN VIRGINIA FLOODS
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 9 (AP) Gov. Linwood Holton proclaimed a state of emergency today in parts of Virginia hit by last week's flood and said early esti mates of damage were in excess of $19million.

title: IRIS BRMIN WINS YORKERS FEATURE
description: YONKERS, Oct. 9  Fifth choice in the field of nine 2 yearold pacing fillies bred, in this state, Iris Barmin was squeezed through an opening along the rail by Del Insko, the driver, and won the $106,886.19 New York Sires Stakes feature at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: KISSINGER'S TALKS IN PARIS CONTINUE; A 3D DAY PLANNED
description: PARIS, Oct. 9 Henry A. Kissinger and his deputy, Maj Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., met privately with North Viet namese negotiatois here for the second day today, and anoth er session was scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IIILLARY JUDD ALEXANDER: 30 years old today.

title: RICH STAKES WON BY PHIPPS'S FILLY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Oct. 9It took 1 3/16 miles and 12 min utes to decide the $100,000 Matchmaker Stakes today, with Ogden Phipps's Numbered Ac count coming up the winner at the Atlantic City course. The East Acres' Alma North actual ly finished first but was dis qualified and placed third.

title: Gulf's Directors Approve WriteOff of $250Million
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that its directors had approved the sale or with drawal from certain marginal or unprofitable operations with a resulting extraordinary writeoff for 1972 of about $250million.

title: A. Winifred Kaltenbach, 85, ExDirector of Nursing, Dies
description: CHARLESTOWN, R. I., Oct. 9 A. Winifred Kaltenbach, di rector of nursing at the Ameri can Hospital in Paris from 1926 to 1929 and at Babies Hospital, New York, from 1929 to 1937, died Thursday at her home here. Her age was 85.

title: Mexican Train Crew Denies Drinking Caused Disaster
description: SALTILLO, Mexico, Oct. 9 (UPI)Members of a Mexican railroad crew today denied that tequila and women had caused the deaths of 208 persons in the second worst train wreck in Mexico's history. They charged they were being made scape goats for a disaster caused by brake failure.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Overhaul of Army Planned For Training and Combat
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (UPI) Army Secretary Robert F. Froehlke said today that the Army needed to be reorganized to improve its training program and insure a higher level of combat readiness.

title: Equity Financing
description: An initial offering of 275,000 shares of Hill In dustries Inc. common stock, at $8 per share, has been completed through a group of underwriters headed by the Rauscher Pierce Securities Corpora tion and Earp Kenney & Smith, Inc. The company, with headquarters in Hillsboro, Tex., manufactures tufted broadloom carpet for residential and com mercial use. Most of the proceeds from the stock sale will be used to establish a new carpet mill the Midwest, the underwriters said.

title: 2 Special Elections Due For Conneticut Legislature
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 10 (UPI) Special elections have been called by Gov. Thomas J. Mes kill to fill two seats in the Connecticut Legislature.

title: American Party Candidate Barred From State Ballot
description: Representative John Schmitz of California, the American party's candidate for President, was barred yesterday from New York State's ballot in the Nov. 7 election.

title: Youth Agency Inquiry to Be Expanded Beyond Audit
description: Human Resources Adminis trator Jule M. Sugarman said yesterday that his inquiry into the troubled Youth Services Agency would go beyond a reply to the City Controllers critical audit and include an overall examination of the youth pro gram.

title: SEVER PRICE UP ON SPECULATION
description: Speculative buying pushed up silver futures prices yesterday in moderately active trading of 3,040 contracts.

title: U.S. Sues Realty Operator Over Rent Increases Here
description: The Government filed a $235,000 punitive damage suit here yesterday against Nehring Brothers, Inc., one of the city's largest realestate management operators, charging the company had raised rents in violation of the Federal eco nomic stabilization program.

title: Senate Contest
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 10A day and night 11monthlong hand shaking campaign tour of Texas appears to have given Bare foot Sanders of Dallas, a former White House assistant, a strong chance to defeat Republican Senator John G. Tower in the November election.

title: EUROPEANS HAIL END OF BANK RATE
description: PARIS, Oct. 10The burial of the Bank of England's bank rate, which had become an an achronism after 270 years, will make it easier for Europeans to map a common strategy against inflation, central bankers and economists in several conti nental centers said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Bridge: Swiss Team Championship Decided Over the Weekend
description: A basic principle of dis carding is to retain adequate length in any suit in which declarer or dummy is known to have begun with four or more cards. Adequate in this context means a length equal to that stilt held by the opposition. A declarer who bears this in mind can often draw the right conclu sion about the distribution in the end game.

title: Pay Cut for Macy Workers
description: The Federal Pay Board has altered a contract between Macy's New York stores and the Retail, Wholesale, Department Store Workers Union and re duced to 5.5 per cent a 7 per cent wage rise negotiated fol lowing an eightday strike in April. The disallowed portion of the raise amounted to $2 a week. Involved in the decision are 8,256 union members and 4,125 nonunion employes. The negotiated increase after the board's action amounts to $8 a week.

title: New 10c Ferry System Turns Out Easy Sailing
description: Staten Island ferry riders adjusted quickly to the new system of oneway toll col lection that went into effect yesterday.

title: Residence of Jordan Envoy To U.N. Robbed by 2 Men
description: The Manhattan residence of Jordan's permanent representa tive to the United Nations was ransacked and robbed last night by two men who had overpow ered a guard.

title: About Motor Sports
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y., Oct. 10For a driver to finish his first allout year of Grand Prix racing with pole position and a Second place in Canada, thirds in Britain, South Africa and Austria, a fourth in Italy and a fifth in Spainthat's not a bad way to go. Peter Revson, who has just compiled that rec ord in elegant style, was not really disappoint ed with his show ing, but he would have liked to have had just one checkered flag.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PATERSON, N. J., Oct. 10 Radio station WPAT and the Paterson Coalition for Media Change, a group of 30 civil rights and activist organiza tions, announced today that the station had agreed to provide more news and publicaffairs coverage of the city and to hire additional minoritygroup per sonnel.

title: FOE NEAR SAIGON SAID TO BE RINGED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Oct. 11A South Vietnamese military spokesman said yesterday that Government forces were making no direct effort to oust the small groups of Communist infiltrators still holding on in hamlets 20 miles north of Saigon.

title: Mutual Fund Industry Sets $1.5Million for Promotion
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) The mutual fund industry is planning a $15million adver tising campaign during the next year to try to sell the public that mutual funds are in good shape despite recent setbacks.

title: Lowell Building Destroyed
description: LOWELL, Mass., Oct. 10 (AP) An explosion blasted pieces of plate glass over the heads of 40 to 50 children on their way to school this morning as a twostory commercialresiden tial building was destroyed here. The cause of the explo sion was not determined. A traffic controller, Geraldine Henderson, was injured, but her injuries were minor.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cahill Reported Ready to Push For an Antiphosphate Measure
description: TRENTON, Oct. 10Admin istration officials reported to day that Governor Cahill will push next month for final legis lative approval of a controver sial measure that would give New Jersey the power to ban phosphates from detergents and other cleaning agents.

title: Battered Laotian Tribe Fears U.S. Will Abandon It
description: SITE 288, Laos, Oct. 5Years ago, before the North Vietnam ese first shelled this village with their big guns, Yong Dua Mua was a great chief among the Meo people. He had rich rice fields on the high moun tains, pigs, chickens and a doz en water buffalo.

title: A.T. & T. Is Sued by Makers Of Telephone Equipment
description: SAN ANTONIO, Oct. 10 (AP)  Five telephone equipment concerns filed a $25million antitrust suit here today against the American Telephone and Telegraph Company system.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Thousands of college stu dents in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, on campuses traditionally among the most liberal in the country, are dis couraged and disillusioned over Senator George McGovern's Presidential campaign.

title: Need Seen for Commissioner
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 10 George F. Berlinger, New York State Welfare InspectorGener al, said here today that the latest scandal in New York City's Youth Services Agency emphasized the need for a full time Commissioner of Social Services.

title: Catholic Member of Ulster Force Is Slain
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 10A Roman Catholic fa ther of 12 children was killed in the border town of Newry this morning as he was leaving home for work.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fischer and Spassky in Double  Knits
description: Sports of The Times

title: PENSION PLAN ABUSE BY MILITARY HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., releasing figures on the retire ment of generals and admirals, said today that it appeared there may be abuse of the sen ior officers' pension system.

title: Goodby, Pension Reform
description: After a long series of actions intended to provide greater financial security for the elderly, the Senate has perversely buried the measure that promised the longest step of all toward improved protection in old age. This is the bill drafted after three years of study by the Senate Labor Committee to correct defects in the private pension plans on which over 30 million workers rely.

title: Manson Shifted to Folsom
description: FOLSOM, Calif. Oct. 10 (AP) Charles M. Manson has been transferred from San Quentin to Folsom Prison as part of the dispersal of Death Row prison ers in California. Manson was convicted last year of firstde gree murder in the slaying of Sharon Tate and others in Los Angeles in 1969.

title: MONOXIDE DETECTED IN A DISTANT GALAXY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10A naval scientist said today that a cloud of carbon monoxide gas, which has been found in earth's Milky Way galaxy, had been detected for the first time in a distant galaxy.

title: Nixon at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Oct. 10 (AP)President Nixon flew to night to his Camp David retreat in the Maryland mountains, where aides said he would spend tomorrow reviewing do mestic matters.

title: DONALD WING, 68, YALE LIBRARIAN
description: Donald G. Wing, emeritus as I sociate librarian of Yale Uni versity and compiler of the Wing catalogue of early Eng lishlanguage books, died Sun day at his home in Woodbridge, Conn. He was 68 years old.

title: Hughes Tool Asks Court To Void T.W.A. Award
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  Charles Alan Wright, a tall, squareshouldered lawyer from, Austin, Tex., sought to convince the Supreme Court today that the Hughes Tool Company should not be forced to pay a judgment of nearly $170mil lion to Trans World Airlines.

title: Tallest Hotel to Be Built In Atlanta for $50Million
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 10John Portman, architect, disclosed today plans for construction of he world's tallest hotel, the Peachtree Center Plaza, a 70 story glassplated tower that would dominate Atlanta's growing skyline.

title: MRS. LARKIN LEADS BY SHOT WITH 81
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Oct. 10  Mrs. Vincent Larkin of Nassau, the 1971 winner, led after the opening round of the 22d Women's Metropolitan Golf Association senior champion ship today with an 81 over the par71, 5,539yard course at the Piping Rock Club.

title: Soviet Fights a Lag in Computers
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 10A sophis ticated electronic computer re cently ordered by a Soviet Gov ernment agency was kept stored in packing cases for as long as six months for lack of personnel needed to operate it.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Dr. Margaret Mead, the an thropologist, characterized the Nixon Administration's environ, mental policy yesterday as let 'em eat promises, let 'em drink, promises and let 'em breathe promises as long as it doesn't cost any money and doesn't go against special interests.

title: Mexicanos Is Preferred
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 10 (AP) Most MexicanAmericans in the Southwest prefer to be called Mexicanos, says the University of Texas Center for Communication Research. A re port from the center said that Mexicanos was the term se lected by 43 per cent of the persons interviewed in Texas, Arizona and California.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ATHENSIn the most famous ora tion of all time, Pericles, honoring Athenian dead in the Peloponnesian War, said: The whole earth is the tomb of famous men; and their story is not graven only on stone over their native earth, but lives on far away, without visible symbol, woven into the stuff of other men's lives.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: RIVER EDGE, N. J., Oct. 10Even when Anthony (Teata) Semiz goes bowling with friends, strangers turn to watch the pins fly.

title: POLICE HERE ACT TO HELP ADDICTS
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yester day a new experimental pro gram aimed at keeping narcot ics addicts out of the city's clogged criminaljustice system.

title: Rehnquist Defends His Role in Decision On Spying by Army
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Jus tice William H. Rehnquist said today that there was no impro priety in his participation in a Supreme Court decision last June although he had previous ly testified on the matter as a Justice Department official.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Industrial growth and its un welcome byproducts are raising anxieties about the way busi ness organizations are working to serveor injurethe public good. Criticisms of business are coming thick and fast from every side. But what are the critics really saying?

title: COURT, 8 TO 1, BARS OHIO TUITION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Supreme Court struck down, 8 to 1, today an Ohio plan for direct tuition grants to parents of children in private and parochial schools. The plan had been considered a testing ground for new methods of public aid to churchrelated schools.

title: 76ers Get Counts of Phoenix ln Deal Also Involving Bucks
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10 (AP)The Philadelphia 76ers obtained Mel Counts, 7foot center of the Phoenix Suns, today and sent Gary Gregor to the Milwaukee Bucks in a National Basketball Association trade.

title: Rohmer and Ray Discuss Filmmaking
description: A spotlight strikes one high, precariouslooking opera box, and the director of the film stands up and takes a bow. It is the 10th New York Film Festival in Alice Tully Hall and as is usual these days the director, not the actor, is the star.

title: Theater: Happy Tsimiss
description: For the women, usually mature, often portrayed in Yiddish theater, the positions taken by Women's Lib may represent something of a re treat. They are wise, sche mers (for good things of course) and usually they manipulate their men like marionettes. Which brings us smoothly to The Rehbitzen From Israel, the new Yiddish musical that opened last night at the Mayfair Theater, 235 West 46th Street.

title: Navy Flier Killed in Crash
description: NORFOLK, Va., Oct. 10 (AP) A Navy jet carrying three crewmen on a training flight crashed and burned on the edges of the Dismal Swamp about 50 miles southwest of here today. A Navy spokesman said one body was recovered but the other two crewmen aboard the A3 Skywarrior were missing. None of the men has been identified.

title: SERIES OF STRIKES POSSIBLE AT G.M.
description: DETROIT, Oct. 10  A num ber of threatened strikes, should they materialize, could cripple production by the General Mo tors Corporation before the week is finished.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: In a rare move among cor porate executives, the presi dent of Liggett & Myers Inc. has denounced the Presidential candidacy of Senator George McGovern and endorsed the reelection of President Nixon in a letter sent to 45,000 com pany shareholders.

title: Kissinger Stays On in Paris For 4th Day of Talks Today
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  Henry A. Kissinger met in Paris with North Vietnamese repre sentatives today for the third day, and then instead of re turning to Washington as ex pected remained for a fourth successive meeting tomorrow.

title: Blast Lifts Manhole Covers
description: An underground explosion sent four manhole covers fly ing into the air at 67th Street and Woodside Avenue in Wood side, Queens, shortly before 2 P.M. yesterday and shattered close to 100 windows in homes and apartments in a threeblock area fire and police spokesmen said. The police said there were no injuries and that no fire fol lowed the blast, the cause of which was still being investi gated.

title: Anglophiles Flock to Churchill Film Premiere and Party
description: The city's better Anglo philes were at the movies last night. They went to Columbia's twin theaters on Second Avenue to see their royal highnesses, the Duke and Duchess of Kent, and two living, breathing Church ills. The film was Young Winston, the story of Sir Winston Churchill's early life.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 10Two major featurefilm theaters closed here and two others closed in New Brunswick to night, marking the continu ing decline of the downtown sections of older cities and the continued growth of the suburbs.

title: COLEMAN STRIKES EPSTEIN AS GREAT
description: DETROIT, Oct. 10 (UPI)  Joe Coleman wasn't thinking about setting any records to day. He was just trying to throw strikes.

title: WALKER CAUTIONS BANKERS ON RATES
description: DALLAS, Oct. 10Charis E. Walker, Deputy Secretary of the Treasury, called on the na tion's bankers here today to keep the interestrate struc ture just as low as it can be.

title: Retail Sales in September Fell 1.5% Below August
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Re tail sales in September fell about 1 per cent below the revised August level, the Com merce Department reported today.

title: File on Drivers Opposed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Oct. 10 (AP)The American Civil Lib erties Union today threatened a court test if the state estab lished a planned license system that could give the police ac cess to a central picture file of motorists. Benson A. Wol man, executive director of the group's Ohio affiliate, said that such a file would violate Ohio constitutional restrictions on how fees and tax money may be used.

title: Son Kills Father in Accident
description: MOORE, Tex., Oct. 10 (UPI) James Gullion, 38 years old, a Department of Public Safety narcotics officer, was acciden tally shot and killed by his son during a hunting trip yester day. The authorities said the two were walking through some woods when the boy's shotgun accidentally went off, striking the father in the chest.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The main objection to George McGovern's de tailed Vietnam peace plan is that it is too specific and too onesided. Pre sumably, he put it forward tin the hope of gaining support among the antiwar voters in this country, but he went so far in meeting Hanoi's war aims that he may actually have lost more sup port by his TV speech than he gained.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 10Three of six counts in the indictment accusing Maj. Gen. James F. Cantwell of misusing his office by having state employes im prove his private property were dismissed in Mercer County Court today.

title: POLICE HERE ACT TO HELP ADDICTS
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yester day a new experimental pro gram aimed at keeping narcot ics addicts out of the city's clogged criminaljustice system.

title: RANGERS TO MEET CANUCKS TONIGHT
description: Coach Emile Francis of the Rangers hopes that two days of home cooking and two ex tra hard practices will have affected a turnaround in the play of his team, which makes its home debut of the 197273 National Hockey League sea son tonight against the Van couver Canucks at Madison Square Garden.

title: Unugly American Helps Tribesmen
description: SITE 288, Laos, Oct. 5 He is loud, aggressive and gregarious. He slaps people on the back, gets noisily drunk and takes off his shirt in public when he's hot.

title: Reinstatement Is Ordered by Scribner For 2 Supervisors Ousted by Fuentes
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner ordered yesterday that the local board of Com munity School District 1 on the Lower East Side reinstate two acting principals who were re moved last week by the district superintendent, Luis Fuentes.

title: Linde Develops New System
description: The Linde division of the Union Carbide Corporation said yesterday that it had developed a new modular oxygenactivat ed sludge treatment plant for smaller communities and indus trial sites. Using the principles of the company's Unox system for the oxygenation of waste water, the new units make oxy gen wastewater treatment more economical for smaller communities requiring a range of 500,000 to six million gallons a day, the company said.

title: 11 Floors May Be Added to the Empire State
description: The owners of the 102story Empire State Building, the Co lossus of the skies for almost 40 years and about to be rele gated to the indignity of third place among the world's high est buildings, are exploring the possibilities of adding 11 stories and making the build ing once again the world's tallest.

title: Lepers Near Danang Report Repulsing a Vietcong Raid
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Oct. 10 (Agence FrancePresse) Lepers armed with rocks and clubs have repulsed a Vietcong attack on their colony near here, a military source said to night.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME GAINS
description: In steppedup activity, prices rose yesterday for the third consecutive session on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market.

title: Advertising: A DataRich Label
description: Richard G. Landis, the president of Del Monte, the nation's biggest canner, kicked off an exceedingly nutritious morning at the Plaza Hotel with big news about a new labeling pro gram.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Oct. 10 (AP) A United States District Court judge ruled today Representa tive Henry Helstoski, Demo crat of New Jersey, had been violating his Congressional franking privileges in mail ing hundreds of thousands of voter surveys and news letters to his constituents at the taxpayers' cost.

title: Dave Bancroft Dies at 81
description: Dave Bancroft, who starred at shortstop for the Phila delphia Phillies and the New York Giants and was elected to the Hall of Fame last year, died Monday night at the ape of 81. Deltails on Page 46.

title: BETJEMAN NAMED AS POET LAUREATE
description: LONDON, Oct. 10Sir John Betjeman, Britain's most popu lar contemporary poet, was named Poet Laureate today.

title: People and Business
description: Ben W. Heineman, who last week sold a million of the B. F. Goodrich shares that his Northwest Industries, Inc., bought in 1968 and 1969, acknowledged yesterday his mistake in trying to take control of the big rubber company. In an informal talk at the Union League Club to institutional representatives lunching as guests of Moore, Schley & Cameron, a broker age firm, he mentioned one reason for the failure of the attempt despite the purchase of 2.4 million shares.

title: Charge by Mrs. Abzug
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) Representative Bella S. Ab zug, Democrat of Manhattan, said today that private inves tigators for her had found evi dence that wiretaps had been placed on her Washington and New York Congressional of fices.

title: 11 Schools for Retarded in State Face Cut in Funds, Biaggi Says
description: The 11 state schools for the mentally retarded stand to lose $36million in Medicaid funds this year because they have not met Federal standards, Mostly involving the number of nursing personnel, Representa tive Mario Biaggi charged yes terday.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 10  The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Pilot Talked to Pentagon Before Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The young pilot whose testimony was pivotal to the Navy's denial of unauthorized bombing of North Vietnam told a Senate committee, in testimony re leased today, that he had had a series of meetings with high ranking Pentagon officials be fore appearing before the com mittee.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal On Illegality of Election Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) The Supreme Court let stand to day a ruling that it is uncon stitutional to exclude represen tation for the Bronx, Queens and Staten Island on the New York City Board of Elections.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WIFE GETS 20 YEARS FOR L.I. SLAYING ROLE
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Oct. 10 Mrs. Constance Bilodeau, who was promised a reduced sen tence of 15 years by the Dis trict Attorney's office was sen tenced here today to up to 20 years for her role in the slay Iing her husband.

title: COURT, 8 TO 1, BARS OHIO TUITION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Supreme Court struck down, 8 to 1, today an Ohio plan for direct tuition grants to parents of children in private and parochial schools. The plan had been considered a testing ground for new methods of public aid to churchrelated schools.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP)The Chrysler Corpora tion and the American Motors Corporation have been asked to supply the Price Commission with more information on their proposed price increases on 1973 models, further delaying a decision on their requests. A commission spokes man said today that the two companies were asked provide further clarification of economic information submitted to the agency as the result of public hearings conducted on the request.

title: 18 Inmates and a Guard Injured in Rikers Fight
description: Eighteen inmates and a guard were injured Monday when members of two Black Muslim factions fought each other at the Adolescent Remand Shel ter on Bikers Island, it was learned last night.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 700,000 shares of the Atlantic City Electric Company common at $21.875 was made yesterday by an underwriting group managed by Blyth Eastman Dillon, Lehman. Brothers and Merrill Lynch. The company's stock was up  21 on the. New York Stock Exchange.

title: Father Tows 3 Sons 12 Hours, But They Drown During Swim
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Oct. 10 (UPI)A 41yearold man, towing his three deadsons, reached shore today after swimming through the night in stormy seas when his boat sank off Chappaquiddick Island. The man's father also died.

title: Israel Reports Jewel Theft
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 10 (AP) A consignment of diamonds valued at more than $500,000 was stolen from an Air France jetliner carrying the stones from Israel to Hong Kong, the head of Israel's Diamond Ex change said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Britain Follows U.S. Lead On Charter Flight Reform
description: Britain followed the lead of the United States yesterday in putting forward new charter flight rules that would make lowcost transocean flights available to anyonenot just members of clubs, unions or other organized groups.

title: P.&G. Cites Effort to Curb Phosphates
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 10The Procter & Gamble Company has spent more than $85million to date in its efforts to bring to consumers lower phosphate de tergents that are both safe and effective, Howard J. Morgens, chairman of the board, told shareholders at the annual meeting here today.

title: Sutton, the Media Man, Stirring Controversy
description: The colors of black na tionalismred, green and blackare part of the new look at The New York Am sterdam News. To the casual reader who sees them dis played in headline type, they suggest that Harlem's oldest weekly newspaper, tradition ally a moderate voice, may have become, under its new owners, a champion of black militancy.

title: Notes on People
description: Ralph Ginzburg, the maga zine publisher, was released from the Allenwood prison farm at Lewisburg, Pa., and indicated immediately that he would not accept freedom quietly. Mr. Ginzburg was freed after having served eight months of a threeyear sentencethe result of pro tracted courtroom skirmish ing that began in 1963 with his conviction for sending obscene materials through the mail.

title: 3 Die in Blast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 10 (Reuters)Three bodies were recovered from the re mains of a house in the Catho lic Lower Falls district of Bel fast tonight after an explosion set fire to five houses, the Brit ish Army said.

title: Turner Attorneys Cause Delay in Trial As Judge Quits Case
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Oct. 10 (AP)Lawyers for Glenn W. Turner kept up a fusilade of legal moves today that caused a temporary delay and the naming of a second judge in his securitiesviolations case.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 10 (AP)The National Associa tion of Intercollegiate Athletics announced today that two Alabama colleges, Jacksonville State University and Birming ham Southern, had been placed on probation in baseball.

title: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay Attend Holing Through of 63d St. Tunnel
description: Crouching close together deep under Welfare Island yesterday, Governor Rocke feller, Mayor Lindsay and Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, touched off an explosive charge that marked the official holing through of the 63d Street tunnel.

title: U.S. Aides Cite Reports
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  United States officials said to day they understood President Chiang had spent a number of days at a hospital several weeks ago for treatment of a bronchial congestion, possibly pneumonia.

title: NoFault Insurance Law Is Approved by Michigan
description: LANSING, Mich., Oct. 10A limited nofault automobile in surance program has been ap proved by the state Legislature, aligning Michigan with four other states that have enacted nofault laws.

title: COUNCIL LIBERAL NOW A DEMOCRAT
description: City Councilman Charles Taylor, who was elected three years ago as the Liberal party candidate in the Fifth Council manic District in Harlem, an nounced yesterday he had switched to the Democratic party.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Oct. 10 Vice President Agnew ques tioned both the ethics and the efficacy of Senator George Mc Govern's campaign rhetoric here late last night in a care fully researched, meticulously written speech that focused al most entirely on the words of the Democratic Presidential nominee.

title: Hundreds of Eagles Are Killed in West By Electric Lines
description: DENVER, Oct. 10The ea gle, which has been harassed over the years by pesticides and indiscriminate predator control, is now being acciden tally electrocuted.

title: Des Moines Eases Rule On Graves
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 10Mrs. Douglas Frederick's handwrought concrete mark ers will again grace the tiny graves of her infant son and daughter in Glendale Ceme tery here, despite a city ordi nance requiring granite or bronze markers.

title: Belmont Races Delayed By Fire
description: Seven fire trucks, including two hookandladder units were added starters at Belmont Park yesterday. Their appear ance was made necessary by a fire of undetermined origin that delayed the program by 55 minutes.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: POMPTON PLAINS, Oct. 10 It was five long minutes of plain horror, a Brooklyn driver said today at the bed side of Abraham Levy, the Israeli tourist who was mauled by a lion yesterday afternoon at Jungle Habitat in West Milford.

title: Insurance Rebate Due
description: BOSTON, Oct. 10 (AP) A rebate of about 27 per cent on premiums paid by Massachu setts motorists in 1971 for compulsory bodily injury auto mobile insurance will be an nounced tomorrow by Goy. Francis W. Sargent.

title: Film Fete
description: A certain amount of ad vance publicity, and the use of two stars like Jane Fonda and Yves Montand, has given rise to the question whether Tout Va Bien (Just Great is the official translation) would be more of the new, post1968 JeanLuc Godard, or would indeed be a return to the manner of the good old days that used to upset the gentlefolk but that now seems so mellow  in films like Alphaville, Weekend and Sympathy for the Devil. The answer is un equivocally yes and no.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 11 Schools for Retarded in State Face Cut in Funds, Biaggi Says
description: The 11 slate schools for the mentally retarded stand to lose $36million in Medicaid funds this year because they have not met Federal standards, in volving the number of nursing personnel, Representative Ma rio Biaggi charged yesterday.

title: Merrill Stubbs, 67, Industrialist, Dead; Head of Ivy Corp.
description: Merrill Stubbs, investment banker and industrialist, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 720 Park Avenue. He was 67 years old and lived also in Essex, Conn.

title: NEGRO COLLEGES VOICE OPTIMISM
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 10 Presidents of 40 predominantly black, private colleges conclu ded the annual meeting of the United Negro College Fund to day with some optimism in the face of towering financial prob lems.

title: Strike of 2 Million in Italy Canceled at Last Moment
description: ROME. Oct. 10Almost two million industrial work ers were scheduled to walk out today, but the unions called off the stoppage at the last moment.

title: HouseSenate Panel Approves Gateway
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  SenateHouse conferees agreed today on the creation of a Gate way National Recreation Area at the entrance to New York Harbor, but refused to name the urban park for the late Representative William F. Ryan.

title: Account Disputed
description: WEST MILFORD, Oct. 10 Kerry Smith, a Jungle Habitat spokesman, said today that Witnesses tell us he [Mr. Levy] was leaning out of the window, beckoning the lion.

title: Pennant Game Today Is Rare Confrontation
description: When the Pittsburgh Pi rates and Cincinnati Reds play one game today to set tle the championship of the National League, they will be engaged in one of baseball's rarest confrontations: a sin gle game in which either team is guaranteed the pen nant if it wins.

title: Youth Agency Inquiry to Be Expanded Beyond Audit
description: Human Resources Adminis trator Jule M. Sugarman said yesterday that his inquiry into the troubled Youth Services Agency would go beyond a reply to the City Controllers critical audit and include an overall examination of the youth pro gram.

title: Connecticut Apportionment Appeal to Be Heard
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 10The United States Supreme Court agreed unanimously today to hear an appeal in a case chal lenging the constitutionality of Connecticut's legislative reap portionment plan.

title: TEXTBOOKS HAILED ON VIEW OF NEGRO
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 10  For the first time, the role of the Negro in American history is being fairly and adequately treated in school textbooks in this country, according to a study commissioned by the American Federation of Teach ers.

title: McKenzie Ruling Delayed In Lawsuit Against Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 10 (AP) United States District Judge A. Leon Higginbothamis ex pected to decide before Thurs day night whether John Mc Kenzie, exBoston Bruin star, will be able to play and coach for the Philadelphia Blazers of the World Hockey Associa tion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PANARCTIC, MOBIL DISCLOSE GAS FINDS
description: Gas discoveries in Canada were announced yesterday by the Mobil Oil Corporation and Panarctic Oils, Ltd.

title: McGovern on Vietnam
description: Senator George McGovern's address to the nation on the Vietnam war is a strong indictment of a politically bankrupt and morally ruinous policy. The Nixon Admin istration's failure to win the peace in Vietnam  four years after it was elected on a pledge to do so  and its continuance of the war up to this moment is one of the major issues of this campaign.

title: Toronto Visitor Is Raped And Robbed by 3 in Cab
description: A 22yearold Toronto woman visiting New York was enticed into a cab in midtown early yesterday and raped and robbed of $190 by the driver and two friends, the police said.

title: Books of The Times
description: TWO LOVE STORIES. By Julius Lester. 180 pages. Dial. $4.95.

title: Sicily's Gandhi on a Mission Here
description: It was Columbus Day, and the car struggled in the molasses of midtown traffic, seeking to get around a mile of streets blocked by the parade. Unruffled Danilo Dolci talked about the school he would build in. Partinico.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hawks Conquer Braves
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 10 (UPI) Pete Maravich scored 34 points and Lou Hudson added 32 to pace the Atlanta Hawks to a 120109 victory over the Buf falo Braves in the opener for both clubs tonight.

title: Betjeman: Almost Uniquely Qualified
description: An Appraisal

title: Foreman Stops Foe in 2d
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 10 (AP) Unbeaten George Fore man knocked nut unranked Tommy Sorrels in 1 minute 5 seconds of the second round tonight in their scheduled 10 round heavyweight bout. The fight was widely booed at the end, with cups, papers and other missiles thrown by fans into the ring.

title: Knicks Rout Sonics in Opener, 11389
description: Brilliant was the word for the New York Knickerbockers last night as they opened their 27th National Basketball Asso ciation season with a 11389 rout of the Seattle Super Sonics.

title: Nixon Asks Shipbuilding Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) President Nixon asked Con gress today to vote $175million in supplemental funds for sub sidized ship construction. In documents sent to Capitol Hill, the Administration noted that Mr. Nixon had promised to seek extra funds for additional ships if industry response to the construction program sur passed estimates.

title: ExSenator Bush Eulogized At Services in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Oct. 10Flags in the state flew at half staff today as funeral services were held for Prescott S. Bush, former Senator from Connecti cut and father of George Bush, the United States Representa tive at the United Nations.

title: M'GOVERN DETAILS PLAN TO END WAR ON INAUGURATION
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10Senator George McGovern detailed to night his plans for withdrawal from Vietnam, including a visit to Hanoi by his Vice President to speed the return of American prisoners.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Tyler Chase kicked a rec ord five field goals and con verted once to account for 16 of Brown's 28 points in the Ivy League victory over Penn last Saturday. The senior from Orange, Conn., who kicks soccer style, was named the kicker on the Eastern College Athletic Conference's weekly allstar squad. Bruce Watson of Mil ford, Del., was another Brown performer who was named back of the week for his con tributions in the game that ended Brown's 11game, two season losing streak. Watson ripped the Penn line for 124 yards and a touchdown on 32 rushes.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WEST MILFORD, Oct. 10 Kerry Smith, a Jungle Habitat spokesman, said today that Witnesses tell us he [Mr. Levy] was leaning out of the window, beckoning the lion.

title: Wife of a P.O.W. Held Since '64 Seeks Divorce
description: OAKLAND, Calif. Oct. 10 (AP)The wife of the first American pilot shot down in Vietnam and captured by the North Vietnamese is seeking a divorce, the family at torneys confirmed today.

title: Mayor Bertram H. Aitken Of Bridgeton Is Dead at 63
description: BRIDGETON, N. J., Oct. 10 Mayor Bertram H. Aitken, who had served five terms since 1940 and also had been acting prosecutor and deputy attorney general, died last night at Bridgeton Hospital after being stricken at a council meeting. His age was 63.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: DES MOINES, IowaThe quality of justice under Richard Nixon is poorer than at any time in our modern his tory. The failure to provide justice has serious consequences. Justice re leases creativity, spurs action and generates harmony. Injustice causes anger and frustration. It makes life intolerable and bereft of dignity. In justice breeds violence and sows seeds of rebellion.

title: Battered Laotian Tribe Fears U.S. Will Abandon
description: SITE 288, Laos, Oct. 5Years ago, before the North Vietnam ese first shelled this village with their big guns, Yong Dua Mua was a great chief among the Meo people. He had rich rice fields on the high moun tains, pigs, chickens and a doz en water buffalo.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon's proposals for a $250billion ceiling on Federal ex penditures with Presidential authority to cut any programs above this limit, currently being debated by the Con gress, has been raised during a polit ical campaign and is thus subject to predictable partisan attack. Senator Humphrey, for example, has called it an election year ploy; a perversion, of prudent fiscal management; a cover up of a failure to halt inflation, etc.

title: VINCENT H. RIORDEN
description: Vincent H. Riorden, a public ity writer and former newspa per reporter who lived at 184 West Fourth Street, died yester day of pneumonia in New York Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: Cadets Top Lions in Soccer
description: Rick Neske of Army scored after a scramble in front of the Columbia net with 5 minutes 41 seconds left in the game to give the Cadets a 32 soccer victory over the Lions yester day at Baker Field. The victory was the fourth for unbeaten Army. while Columbia's mark is 22.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 President Nixon will not risk losing the Democratic and in dependent support that has given him a commanding lead by pressing for the election of Republican majorities in Con gress during the remaining month of the campaign, accord ing to one of his key aides.

title: Grimsley Scared as Ever
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 10 (AP) Before going out to face the Pittsburgh Pirates in a pressure situation today, the Cincinnati lefthander, Ross Grimsley, was scared as ever.

title: U.S. AID MAY SAVE DAYCARE CENTERS
description: A new United States Senate action could help New York City keep 423 daycare centers to which it has already been committed, the city's Human Resources Administrator said yesterday.

title: Marichal Has Operation
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 10 (UPI)  Doctors at Stanford Medical Center said today that surgery performed on Juan Marichal and Jim Ray Hart of the San Francisco Giants yesterday was successful. Mari chal was operated on for cor rection of a lumbar disc in the lower back. Hart went into surgery for correction of a tear in the lateral cartilage of, the left knee.

title: Business Briefs
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 10 (UPI)President Salvador Allende Gossens has signed a decree giving Chile complete control over the sale of her copper. Mr. Allende made the announcment last night to a crowd of cheering supporters as Chile's response to what he called the imperialist insolence of the Americanowned Kennecott Corporation.

title: COURT TO REVIEW ESTATETAX CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) Refusing to review six out of seven businessrelated cases on its docket today, the Supreme Court let lower court rulings stand as the final word on sev eral controversies.

title: Meany to Speak at Banquet
description: George Meany, president of the AFLCIO, will be the featured speaker at the fall meeting of the Aluminum As sociation banquet in the Wal dorfAstoria Hotel on Oct. 26. The meeting will be attended by leading industry executives from 70 companies in the United States. A new presi dent will be elected at the Oct. 27 meeting.

title: Britain Gets Negative Income Tax Plan
description: LONDON, Oct. 10The Gov ernment proposed today a rad ical new approach to the pay ment of welfare benefits. It suggested making them part of the income tax system.

title: PANMUNJOM TALK SET FOR TOMORROW
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 10 North and South Korea have agreed to hold the first meeting of their joint coordinating com mittee at the armistice site of Panmunjom on Thursday.

title: 11 Floors May Be Added to the Empire State
description: The owners of the 102story Empire State Building, the Co lossus of the skies for almost 40 years and about to be rele gated to the indignity of third place among the world's high est buildings, are exploring the possibilities of adding It stories and making the build ing once again the world's tallest.

title: INTEGRATION ORDER IN ATLANTA FOUGHT
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 10 (UPI) The Atlanta school board voted last night to appeal to the United States Supreme Court new desegregation order that some educators predict would result in an almost allblack public school system through flight of whites to the suburbs.

title: Opening Into Space
description: President Nixon has announced that the United States will provide launch facilities for any nation or interna tional organization wishing to orbit a satellite for peaceful purposes.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OMAHA, Oct. 10 (AP)The Nebraska Football Hall of Fame organization is withdrawing from membership in the National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame, H. W. (Hub) Monsky, the group's president, said today.

title: China and West Germany Establish Diplomatic Ties
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Oct. 11, (Reuters)China and West Germany today agreed to establish diplomatic relations immediately in a joint com muniqu signed in Peking, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency reported.

title: Dave Bancroft, Star Shortstop For Phillies and Giants, Dead
description: SUPERIOR. Wis., Oct. 10 (AP)Dave Bancroft, who as a rookie shortstop helped spark the Philadelphia Phillies to their first pennant in 1915. died last night in a hospital here. He was 81 years old and had been elected to Baseball's Hall of Panic last year.

title: Mylai Figure Asserts Army Would Oust Him
description: LINCOLN, Neb. Oct. 10 (AP)  Capt. Eugene M. Ko touc, who was acquitted of charges stemming from the killing of South Vietnamese civilians at Mylai, said today that the Army was trying to dismiss him because it want ed to purge all persons as sociated with the 1968 inci dent.

title: BULLETS TRIUMPH OVER CAVALIERS
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 10 (AP) Elvin Hayes scored 20 points, pulled down 23 rebounds and blocked six shots in his Balti more debut as the Bullets de feated the Cleveland Cavaliers, 10290, tonight in the National Basketball Association opener for both clubs.

title: HOUSE APPROVES DEBT CEILING BILL IN NIXON VICTORY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The House of Representatives, ig noring arguments that it was giving away to the President powers granted exclusively to Congress by the Constitution, approved tonight a $250billion ceiling on Federal spending in the current year.

title: SALES ARE SLOW IN BOND ISSUES
Mauling by Lion at Preserve: Five Long Minutes of Horror
description: POMPTON PLAINS, N. J., Oct. 10It was five long minutes of plain horror, a Brooklyn cab driver said today at the bedside of Abraham Levy, the Israeli tourist who was mauled by a lion yesterday afternoon at Jungle Habitat in West Milford.

title: THOMAS LANPHIER, AVIATION PIONEER
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 10 (AP) Thomas G. Lanphier, a retired Army colonel who helped Charles A. Lindbergh plan routes for the country's first passenger airline, died yester day at the Naval Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: String Band
description: There are string quartets and string quartets, but none are quite like the Putnam String County Band, which played Monday evening at the Washington Square Methodist Church, 135 West Fourth Street.

title: Fireman Wins Contest To Name Zoo's Gorilla
description: A fireman who said his his wife had always wanted a daughter won the contest yesterday to name the female baby gorilla born at the Cen tral Park Zoo.

title: Business Briefs
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 10 (UPI)Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton said today that the results could be devastat ing if the United States did not take steps to avert the energy shortage facing it. In a talk to the Producers Coun cil, he added that a failure to avoid a deficit in the na tion's energy supply in the coming years could have serious consequences to our position in the world, to our economy and to our very way of life.

title: HARRY L. MAGEE, LED CARPET FIRM
description: BLOOMSBURG, Pa., Oct. 10  Harry L. Magee, former chairman, president and treas urer of the Magee Carpet Com pany, died at the Bloomsburg Hospital yesterday of a com plication of diseases. He was 71 years old.

title: Sears' Belt Massager Stirs Shock Warning
description: CHICAGO, Oct 10 (AP) Sears, Roebuck & Co. issued a warning today that a belt massager sold between De cember, 1969 and Oct. 4, 1972, was potentially unsafe.

title: RIGGING OF MARKET IN EGGS IS CHARGED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) Two companies and seven in dividuals were named today by the Agriculture Department in a complaint accusing them of trying to rig the Chicago egg futures market two years ago.

title: City Strives to Save RentRise Exemptions for Aged
description: The City Council went into arace with the State Court of Appeals yesterday to save rent increase exemptions for many thousands of elderly tenants in the city.

title: Kissinger Stays On in Paris For 4th Day of Talks Today
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  Henry A. Kissinger met in Paris with North Vietnamese repre sentatives today for the third day, and then instead of re turning to Washington as ex pected remained for a fourth successive meeting tomorrow.

title: UNION CHIEF URGES TEACHERS' MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 David Selden, president of the American Federation of Teach ers called today for a single, powerful union of all teach ers to save our school sys times in what he said was likely to be another four years of the Nixon Administration.

title: Pro Coaches Exude Confidence
description: About Pro Football

title: Jeanne Evert Advances In Tennis at Boca Raton
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Oct. 10 (AP)Jeanne Evert, 15yearold sister of Chris Evert, qualified for the championship round of the $100,000 Virginia Slims ten nis tournament today with a 64, 64 victory over Jill Cooper of Britain.

title: KERN DETAILS PLAN TO END WAR ON INAUGURATION
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10Senator George McGovern detailed to night his plans for withdrawal from Vietnam, including a visit to Hanoi by his Vice President to speed the return of American prisoners.

title: Sears' Belt Massager Stirs Shock Warning
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10 (AP) Sears, Roebuck & Co. issued a warning today that a belt massager sold between De cember, 1969 and Oct. 4, 1972, was potentially unsafe.

title: Chiang Absent From Taiwan Ceremony
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Oct. 10  President Chiang Kaishek did not take part today in the an nual National Day ceremonies for the first time since the Chi nase Nationalist Government withdrew to Taiwan in 1949.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (UPI)Senator Philip A. Hart, the chairman of the Senate antitrust subcommittee, intro duced a bill today to change tax laws that, he said sanctioned multibilliondollar mergers and encouraged companies to close plants in areas of high unemployment.

title: About Motor Sports
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y., Oct. 10For a driver to finish his first allout year of Grand Prix racing with pole position and a second place in Canada, thirds in Britain, South Africa and Austria, a fourth in Italy and a fifth in Spainthat's not a bad way to go. Peter Revson, who has just compiled that rec ord in elegant style, was not really disappoint ed with his show ing, but he would have liked to have had just one checkered flag.

title: HOUSE APPROVES SPENDING CEILING IN NIXON VICIORY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The House of Representatives, ig noring arguments that it was giving away to the President powers granted exclusively to Congress by the Constitution, approved tonight a $250billion ceiling on Federal spending in the current year.

title: Musica Sacra Program Packs 64th St. Church
description: Not all of New York's best musicmaking goes on in the standard concert halls. The. series known as Musica Sacra, given at the Central Presby terian Church, Park Avenue at 64th Street, is about as worthy a project as could be desired, Obviously the word has got around, because the church was packed on Mon day night for the opening of its third season.

title: Study Doubts Value of Diet Pills And Calls for Strict U.S. Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10A panel of medical consultants advised the Government recent ly that diet pills are of clini cally trivial value and should be strictly controlled.

title: Antigraffiti Bill Is One of 4 Gaining Council Approval
description: The City Council passed four bills yesterday aimed at graf fiti, paid municipal lobbyists and licensed and unlicensed street peddlers. The bills grew out of months of public and legislative frustration, anger and alarm.

title: Coleman Snaps Playoff Mark, Fanning 14
description: DETROIT, Oct. 10  Ike Brown hadn't had a hit since Sept. 2, Bill Freehan hadn't played since Sept. 21 and Joe Coleman hadn't pitched such an important game since I lost in the high school playoffs.

title: Patman Bids 4 Nixon A ides Testify on Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 Representative Wright Patman announced today that the House Banking and Currency Committee wand meet Thurs day in another attempt to in vestigate the breakin and alleged bugging of the Demo cratic headquarters.

title: Canadian Unemployment Up
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 10 (UPI) Canada's unemployment rate rose to 7.1 per cent of the labor force in September, the highest) monthly figure in more than 11 years, the Government reported today. Last September's figure was 6.9 per cent.

title: Patman Bids 4 Nixon Aides Testily on Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10  Representative Wright Patman announced today that the House Banking and Currency Committee would meet Thurs day in another attempt to in vestigate the breakin and alleged bugging of the Demo cratic headquarters.

title: Need Seen for Commissioner
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 10 George F. Berlinger, New York State Welfare InspectorGener al, said here today that the latest scandal in New York City's Youth Services Agency emphasized the need for a full time Commissioner of Social Services.

title: Harlem Minister Is Named To Head a McGovern Group
description: The Rev. A. Kendall Smith, pastor of the Beulah Baptist Church in Harlem, has been named executive coordinator of the religious community for Senator George McGovern's state campaign organization.

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON DEFENSE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 An antiwar amendment was dropped by Senate and House conferees as they reached agreement tonight on a com promise $74.3billion defense appropriations bill.

title: Soap Operas: Same Time, Same Station, but a Neve Boss
description: Can a former twirling champion from a small min ing town in Illinois find hap piness as the head of all soap operas at a great big television network?

title: S.E.C. ALTERS RULES FOR OIL SECURITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission adopted new rules today enlarging the present ex emption for certain kinds of oil and gas securities from stock registration requirements.

title: LUTHERANS FEAR A LOSS OF VALUES
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 10The American Lutheran Church end ed its biennial convention here today after voicing its deep concern over what it called a national retreat from past commitmen ts to human values.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 10 (AP) Figures released today by the State Department of La bor and Industry estimate that New Jersey's popula tion had grown by 131,000 people since the 1970 census was reported.

title: H. DICK COHEN
description: PARSIPPANY, N. J., Oct. 10 (UPI)11. Dick Cohen, a for mer magistrate of Passaic, was found dead, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday in a room at the Garden Motor Lodge here. He was 67 years old.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: RAPID CITY, S. D.Your junior Senator, who aspires to the Presidency, has made known throughout the United States that he would cut our defense budget to the bone. It would mean a strippeddown defense estab lishment. Senator McGovern has pledged to cut $30 billion, or 35 per cent, from our present levels of defense spending and halt the development of new weapons systems. He would, in actuality, leave us with nuclear re taliation as our only response to a con ventional attack, or even a threat of attack, from another world power; and he would crd, through unilateral dis armament, our hopes of achieving mutual arms reduction and world peace.

title: Duncan, 60, Quits Equity Because of His Health
description: Angus Duncan, executive secretary of the Actors Equity Association for more than two decades, has re signed, effective Dec. 31, for reasons of health.

title: McGovern Indochina Peace Plan
description: News Analysis

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Oct. 3:

title: Texas Concern Takes an Option On Controversial Carolina Site
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Oct. 10 South Carolina officials an nounced today what they hope will be a happy ending to what once was a major environmen tal controversy in the state.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION

title: Henry Varnum Poor, Lawyer And Former Yale Dean, Dies
description: Henry Varnum Poor, a promi nent lawyer, a diplomat and former associate dean of the Yale Law School, died yester day at his borne, 15 Longview Road, Port Washington, L. I. He was 58 years old.

title: U.S. CHESS PLAYERS LOSE TO BULGARIANS
description: SKOPLJE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 10The United States team dropped its fourth match in succession today, losing to Bul garia, 2 to 1, in the 13th round of the chess Olympics. Lubomir Kavalek lost to Milito Bobotzov. Pal Benko drew with Gheorghiu Tringov, William Martz drew with Ivan Radutov and George Kane drew with Nikola Padevski.

title: Vladimir Nebylitsyn Dies; A Soviet Psychologist, 42
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 10Vladimar D. Nebylitsyn, a prominent So viet psychologist, died recently in an accident, details of which were not disclosed. He was 42 years old.

title: Double That by 1982 Is Also Predicted
description: The General Electric Com pany looks for sales this year to reach $10billion, Fred J. Borch, chairman and chief exe cutive officer, told 700 stock holders yesterday at an infor mation meeting in Denver.

title: 3 Intriguing Dances Given by Solomons Show Incisiveness
description: There is a lean incisiveness in Gus Solomons Jr.'s choreog raphy and in his own scalpel slender person while he dis sects space with precise econ omy, using fastidious move ment and discreet stillness. His company presented three in triguing new works Monday evening at the Cuhiculo.

title: V. D. Blues on WNET Spurs Calls for Guidance on Disease
description: More than 15,000 people called Public Television station WNET Monday night following the broadcast of the special V. D. Blues program, asking for guidance on how to deal with their own venereal disease problems and for general infor mation about syphilis and gon orrhea.

title: Democrats Lose TV Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (AP) An appeal by the Democratic National Committee for free television time to respond to three appearances by President Nixon in 1971 was rejected to day by the Supreme Court.

title: Poet to the Sovereign
description: Man In the News

title: Of Rivers ...
description: President Nixon has only a few days left to decide whether to signal an end to the pollution of American waterways or gravely to set back the cause of the nation's environment.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Following is the transcript of Senator George McGov ern's taped television address last night on Vietnam:

title: U.S. AID MAY SAVE DAYCARE CENTERS
description: A new United States Senate action could help New York City keep 423 daycare centers to which it has already been committed, the city's Human Resources Administrator said yesterday.

title: Harvard Names Unit to Deal With Its Shareholder Role
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 10 Harvard University an nounced today that a fourman subcommittee of its principal governing body, the Harvard Corporation, would decide all future questions of the univer sity's responsibility as a cor porate shareholder.

title: Bulls Down 76ers
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10 (UPI) Kennedy McIntosh and Bobby Weiss sparked a fourthquarter rally that gave the Chicago Bulls a 9589 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers tonight in an N.B.A. opener.

title: Stage: Theatrical Curiosity of Behan's Hostage
description: Brendan Behan's The Hos tage is a theatrical curiosity nowadays perhaps more cu rious than theatrical. Last night it joined the repertory of the City Center Acting Company, which is now in the happy throes of its first season at the Good Shepherd Faith Church at Lincoln Cen ter. This company has cer tainly been courageous in its choice of repertory. Here the courage savored of the foolhardy.

title: KATZ ASKS INQUIRY INTO WALSH SHIFT
description: Councilman Leon A. Katz asked the City Council yester day to investigate the possi bility of a major conflict of interest in the acceptance by Albert A. Walsh of a position with the National Realty Com mittee.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE 3D DAY IN A ROW
description: The stock market made a modest advance for the third consecutive session yeterday, but late profittaking erased some of the early gains as trad ing increased.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Court Upholds Loitering Ordinance

title: Screen: Young Winston Sketches Lion as a Cub
Police Widows Get $30,000
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Oct. 10 (UPI)  Gov. Edwin Edwards presented $30,000 yesterday to the widows of two deputy sheriffs killed in a Jan. 10 shootout between the police and Black Muslims. Paulette Hancock Vandervelde, widow of Ralph Hancock, received $20,000, and Brenda Wilder, widow of Ralph Wilder, re ceived $10,000.

title: Market Place: Policing Efforts Of N.A.S.D. Hit
description: Is it possible that the dra matic fall of Power. Conver sion, Inc., from the lofty heights of 40 bid to 5 bid in two days of overthecounter trading late last week could have been prevented by more effective policing of the mar ket by the National Associa tion of Securities Dealers?

title: EXECUTIYES ASKED TO HELP MUSEUM
description: Arthur Dean, a former Unit ed States disarmament nego tiator now practicing law in the city, listened intently last night as Dr. Dorothy E. Bliss ex plained her research on the hormones of land cubs. Joseph Cullman 3d, board chairman of the Philip Morris Company, watched as Dr. Richard Van Gelder ran slides of mammals facing extinction.

title: Sea Barrier for Plum Island
description: NEWBURYPORT, Mass., Oct. 10 (AP)The Army Corps of Engineers is building an 800 footlong sand barricade along the Plum Island shoreline as protection against high tides and surf during winter storms. The barrier is expected to be completed within a week.

title: TWO WOMEN HERE GET LETTER BOMBS
description: Two New York women long prominent in American Zionist affairs have received letter bombs similar to a bomb that killed an Israeli Embassy offi cial in London last month. Both women opened the letters, but the bombs did not explode.

title: Cambodia Losses Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 10 (AP)The Cambodian com mand reported today that four Government posts were overrun yesterday south of Pnompenh on Route 2 near the South Viet namese border.

title: . . . Highways
description: The billboard lobby never gives up. Congress can pass a law as it did in 1965 restricting the number of billboards in the countryside. After years of delay Congress can even appropriate money to pay for bringing the billboards down even though no money is properly due billboard owners who, after all, merely exploit road created by public funds. None of this makes any difference. The billboard interests keep working away.

title: Defense Lawyer Wants Nad jars To Supersede Mackell on Case
description: A defense lawyer asked the Appellate Division yesterday to order the state's new anticor ruption prosecutor to supersede District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell ofiQueens in the han dling of a case in which at least nine of Mr. Mackell's staff mem bers reportedly were involved.

title: Clemente Gets 2 Hits Allowed by Grimsley
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 10  The Pittsburgh Pirates made more errors than hits today as they took a 71 mauling from the Cincinnati Reds, putting the Na tional League pennant up for grabs in the final game of the playoff here tomorrow.

title: International Net Up
description: Stronger demand in most paper markets and higher prices contributed to the sharp profit gains reported yesterday by the International Paper Com pany and the St. Regis Paper Company for the third quarter and first nine months of this year. These increases contrasted with depressed levels of the 1971 periods.

title: RANGERS TO MEET CANUCKS TONIGHT
description: Coach Emile Francis of the Rangers hopes that two days of home cooking and two ex tra hard practices will have affected a turnaround in the play of his team, which makes its home debut of the 197273 National Hockey League sea son tonight against the Van couver Canucks at Madison Square Garden.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 10 The dispute between Edward J. Bloustem, the president of Rut gers University, and Ralph A. Dungan, State Chancellor of Higher Education, over college budgeting procedures may be ending.

title: ATTILIO CATTANI, 72, AN ITALIAN DIPLOMAT
description: MILAN, Italy, Oct. 10Am bassador Attilio Cattani, in 1948 the head of Italy's first delegation to the Organization for European Economic Co operation and 10 years later Italy's first envoy to the Euro pean Economic Community, died here of a heart attack yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three Bills Passed By City Council

title: U.S. SUED BY TWO IN BERRIGAN CASE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 10  Sister Elizabeth A. McAlister and Prof. William C. Davidon sued the Federal Bureau of In vestigation and the Justice De partment in Federal District Court here today, charging il legal electronic surveillance.

title: Bank America Makes Bid For GAC's Finance Unit
description: Merger News

title: U.S. Sues Realty Operator Over Rent Increases Here
description: The Government filed a $235,000 punitive damage suit here yesterday against Nehring Brothers, Inc., one of the city's largest realestate management Operators, charging the company had raised rents in violation of the Federal eco nomic stabilization program.

title: A U.S. AIDE GIVES PLEDGE ON P.O.W.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10In an apparently conciliatory ges ture toward North Vietnam, a Defense Department official pledged today that released American prisoners of war would have nothing further to do with Vietnam combat ac tivities.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Urban Renewal Planned in Peekskill

title: Fireman Wins Contest To Name Zoo's Gorilla
description: A fireman who said his his wife had always wanted a daughter won the contest yesterday to name the female baby gorilla born at the Cen tral Park Zoo.

title: SENATE BARS VOTE ON SCHOOL BUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Senate refused today to take a direct vote on legislation de signed to prevent crosstown busing to desegregate the pub lic schools.

title: It's as If Home's Decor Had Signature of Vera And a Ladybug Symbol
description: CROTON, N. Y.The dining room ell, with the table set for lunch, was distraction enough: the stone floor and severe wooden table a background for a sunny harmony of oranges and yellows in the flowers, the napkins, the placemats. Even the hostess wore yellowa printed pants suit strewn with poppies and touches of wildflowers.

title: Generator Contracts Set
description: Combustion Engineering Inc., has received contracts val ued at more than $30million to provide two 550,000kilowatt steam generators for the Okla borna Gas and Electric Com pany. The two units will be installed at the Muskogee, Okla., generating plant 150 miles east of Oklahoma City. The first unit is scheduled for early 1977 and the second year later. pany. The two units will be installed at the Muskogee, Okla., generating plant 150 miles east of Oklahoma City. The first unit is scheduled for early 1977 and the second year later.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 10 (UPI)The Cleveland Cavaliers reduced their roster to the National Basketball Association limit of 12 for tonight's season opener by suspending Lenny Wilkens, placing two players on waivers and another on the injured list.

title: Treasury to Pay Rail Loan
description: The House Appropriations Committee yesterday approved the Treasury's repayment of a $12million 6 per cent loan of the bankrupt ErieLacka wanna Railway. The loan, held by private investors, was guar anteed by the Government in 1957. Proceeds from the bor rowing were used by the rail road for capital improvements.

title: In Canada, Campaign Giving Is Secret
description: TORONTO, Oct. 8A public ly owned corporation here gives $50,000 to a political party, and its stockholders never find out.

title: Rehnquist Defends His Role in Decision On Spying by Army
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Jus tice William H. Rehnquist said today that there was no impro priety in his participation in a Supreme Court decision last June although he had previous ly testified on the matter as a Justice Department official.

title: OSCAR GREENE
description: Oscar Greene, who built a business out of his invention in 1937 of a method of printing indelible ink on cloth tape, died early yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital after an accidental fall two weeks ago. He was 86 years old and lived at 115 East 86th Street.

title: ...Oceans ...
description: The polar bear is the world's largest meateating ani mal and also one of its most mysterious. Scientists have only begun to understand the polar bear's capacity to adapt itself to the Arctic cold, to long periods without food, to both land and water environments, and to mi grate vast distances by getting aboard ice floes which are, so to speak, going its way.

title: Stauffer Sees Profit Rise
description: Roger W. Gunder, vice chair man and chief executive officer of the Stauffer Chemical Com pany, said yesterday that the company expected to improve its earnings this year by more than 25 per cent over the 1971 total of $24.9million, or $2.48 a share. Mr. Gunder attributed the anticipated improvement to stronger demand for a broad range of products, most no tably the company's proprietary line of plastics, flame retard ants and biodegradable pesti cides.

title: University Administration in Spain Quits in Protest
description: MADRID, Oct. 10The ad ministration of the University of Valencia resigned today as resistance increased against a Government crackdown on Spain's college world.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Oct. 10 (AP)Britain's Joe Bugner knocked out the defending champion, Jurgen Blin of West Germany, in the eighth round tonight and won the European heavy weight title for the second time.

title: Irish Minister, at U.N., Urges AllIreland Solution on Ulster
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 10Ireland' Foreign Min ister said today that there was no way that the pieces could be put together again to have permanent stability in a setting involving Northern Ireland alone.

title: Dock Workers End Strike in Honolulu And Return to Jobs
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 10 (AP) Union picket lines were with drawn and longshoremen re turned to work today, ending a threeday strike that shut down Honolulu docks for the first time in 23 years.

title: SIRES STAKES WON BY LADY LOVE ME
Personalities: Garden Books Booker Oct. 20
description: Kim Booker, whose father fought in Madison Square Garden in the late nineteen thirties, will get his first chance in a main bout Oct. 20. The 24yearold Booker will face Bobby (Boogaloo) Watts of Philadelphia as a substitute because Watts's original opponent, Rodrigo Valdes of Colombia, pulled out of the scheduled 10 round middleweight bout for no apparent reason. Valdes faces possible disciplinary action by the New York State Athletic Commission, a Garden spokesman said yes terday. The No. 5 middle weight in the World Boxing Association rankings, Valdes was found to be in perfect health by a commission doc tor. Booker has a 131 record, while Watts is 1621.

title: Governor Names 10 to Aid City Democrats for Nixon
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday the ap pointment of 10 borough coordinators of Democrats for Nixon, part of the Republican Presidential campaign organ ization in the state.

title: Arabs See Cause at the Brink of Despair
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 11 Arab leaders, spurred to frank ness by their numerous dis agreements, have acknowledged that disunity has brought their cause against Israel to the brink of despair.

title: Pirates Are Beaten, 43; Bench's Clout Ties Score
description: CINCINNATI; Oct. 11The Cincinnati Reds won the Na tional League pennant on a wild pitch today when they, rallied for two runs in the last half of the ninth inning to de feat the Pittsburgh Pirates, 43.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 11 (AP)  Ron Anderson and Bill Hicke scored two goals each tonight at the Alberta Oilers opened their World Hockey Associa tion schedule with a 74 vic tory over the Ottawa Na tionals.

title: FUTURES IN GRAIN SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Thinking about the condition of crops in the Soviet Union exerted a twoway influence on commodity futures markets yes terday. The grains moved up in price; the metals moved down.

title: Artificial Insemination For Dogs Shows Gains
description: News of Dogs

title: Music: National Symphony's Eclat
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 The National Symphony Or chestra scored three solid hits with its concert at John F. Kennedy Concert Hall last night. It opened its 42d sea son with clat, dedicated the imposing Filene Organ in the Concert Hall and introduced a handsome new work com posed by John La Montaine for the organ dedication.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
