description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 17 (AP)I haven't heard any complaints about it, Dick Williams, the Oakland A's manager, said today in referring to his frequent trips to the mound to talk with his pitchers during the World Series. There is no limit to the number of times a manager can call a conference during a Series, as long as he doesn't make a farce out of it, he said.

title: IMMUNITY OF G.I.'S OFFENDS GREEKS
description: ATHENS, Oct. 17The political cartoonist of the Athens paper Vima described how Greeks view the judicial immunity that American servicemen enjoy in Greece.

title: 5 Children Among 7 Hurt In a 3Way Crash in Queens
description: Seven persons, including five schoolchildren, were injured yesterday when a truck hit private car, which in turn hit a parked school bus in Rego Park. Queens.

title: Norwegian Cabinet Of Minority Parties Sworn by the King
description: OSLO, Norway, Oct. 17A threeparty minority coalition led by Lars Korvald, chairman of the Christian People's party, was sworn in by King Olav V today.

title: ACCORD RATIFIED BY 2 GERMANYS
description: BONN, Oct. 17West Germany and East Germany today exchanged notes of ratification of a traffic treaty designed to increase greatly the movement of people between the hitherto hostile states.

title: Prison Guards Back Nixon
description: The New York City Correction Officers Benevolent Association endorsed President Nixon for reelection yesterday, saying that the President had assured equal justice for all through his United States Supreme Court appointments. Leo C. Zeferetti, president of the 3,000 member group, said he had asked other prison guards throughout the country to endorse Mr. Nixon and VicePresident Agnew.

title: Many Cities to Cut Taxes Under Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17Though that was not really the idea behind the whole thing, many communities around the country plan to use the money they get under the new Federal revenuesharing program to reduce taxesproperty taxes in almost all cases.

title: Mailer Finds Book Is No Advertisement for Himself
description: Norman Mailer, the author of The Naked and the Dead, has lodged a protest against the publication of a novel that depicts an intellectual named Norman Mailer being shot dead while he is partly naked.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES CLEAN WATER BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Oct. 18President Nixon vetoed last night the Federal Water Pollution Act of 1972.

title: FAIRFIELD ADVANCES IN POLO TOURNAMENT
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 17The Fairfield County Hunt Club's B team scored on a No. 1 penalty with 30 seconds to play and defeated West Hills of Long Island, the defending champion, 1312, tonight in the first round of the Sherman Memorial fivegoal indoor polo championship at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club.

title: HOWARD U. GREETS JAMAICAN TROUPE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 We conic here from the former slave plantation isle of Jamaica to bring you grounabon, Brother Sam told the Howard University audience, his last words almost lost in shouts of (approval.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW JERSEY
description: ENGLEWOOD, Oct. 17The Englewood City Council voted tonight to turn over 8,000 square feet of Depot Park in the center of town to the Art Center of Northern New Jersey, a nonprofit group that began here 16 years ago.

title: PROTEST STRIKES SPREAD IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 17Protest strikes against the policies and performance of Chile's Marxistoriented Government spread today. But the army, the key to power in the country, remained faithful to President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: Trafficker in Opium Ousted
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Oct. 17 (AP)A South Vietnamese field commander was removed today for trafficking in opium. Friends said his army pay of S80 a month was not enough to support his wife and 12 children. Col. Nguyen Thanh Yen, deputy commander of Military Region I, was censured ordered into retirement and given three months leave with pay.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: In addition to carrying about 200 offensive variations in his head as quarterback of the undefeated Dartmouth football team, Steve Stetson now has the figurative weight of several awards as a result of his outstanding performance against Princeton last week in Hanover, N. H. Stetson, who appears Lo perform better in the socalled pressure games, was named Ivy back of the week. He also was named to the Eastern College Athletic Conference's weekly allstar team. In addition the 6foot, 185pound senior from Laconia, N. H., was tapped for the Gold Helmet Award, presented each week to the top college player in New England by sports writers of that region.

title: SENIOR CITIZENS HELP AQUEDUCT
description: There were 4,871 senior citizens at Aqueduct yesterday for the second day of the fall meeting. They provided some relief to the declining attendance situation at New York's thoroughbred track.

title: Javits Advises Lindsay to Stay And Focus on Running the City
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits declared yesterday that New York City was in such terrible itrouble and that there was so much to do here that Mayor Lindsay should not be thinking of running for another office.

title: U.N. Committee Urges a Ban on Napalm
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 17A report for the Secretary General prepared by a committee of experts recommended today that the General Assembly work out measures for the prohibition of the use, production, development and stockpiling of napalm and other incendiary weapons.

title: Yamani Is Delegated
description: KUWAIT, Oct. 17Five Persian Gulf oilproducing countries have decided to send Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, Saudi Arabia's Minister of Oil and Minerals, back for new talks with major Western oil companies on the proposed ownershipparticipation agreement affecting existing oil concessions.

title: Delaware Tops Poll
description: Delaware was the unanimous choice yesterday for the third straight week in balloting for the Lambert Cup, presented at the end of each college football season to the outstanding Division II team in the East.

title: Nixon to Ask for Harsher Laws To Deal With Narcotics Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (UPI) Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst announced today that the Nixon Administration would ask Congress for tough new narcotics laws.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GLAMOUR ISSUES LEAD STOCK RISE
description: The stock market, with glamour issues bounding ahead, finally put together enough favorable developments yesterday to produce what some Wall Streeters called 'a trading rally.

title: Series Game Off
description: A rainstorm postponed the third game of the World Series between the Oakland A's and Cincinnati Reds in Oakland last evening. The teams will play tonight at 8:30, New York time. Oakland leads the four  of  seven  game series, 20. Details on Page 31.

title: Two Die in F4 Crash
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Oct. 17 (UPI)An Air Force F4 fighter jet crashed while flying as a chase plane during a test mission over the desert about 10 miles north of here yesterday, killing both crewmen. The Air Force identified the men as Capt. John D. Evans, 32 years old, of Farmington, Iowa, and Lieut. Col. Joseph P. Waters, 40, from New York City.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon met with a group of foreign labor leaders and with his National Advisory Council on Drug Abuse Prevention. He had separate appointments with Jeanne Squire, Columbus, Ohio, president of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, and Carl Laughlin, Clarksburg, W. Va., president of the American Dental Association.

title: Criticizing the President
description: The shallowness of President Nixon's commitment to freedom of opinion, of speech and of press is divmatically illustrated by the extemporary talk he gave Monday to relatives of American prisoners of war in Vietnam. It is in fact the repeated evidence of the Administration's apparent willingness to erode the basic Constitutional guarantees of the First Amendment that forms one of the weightiest arguments against the President's reelection.

title: Finley, Kuhn Disagree Over Those Bonuses
description: OAKLAND, Oct. 17 The running battle between Commissioner Bowie Kuhn, a lawyer by profession, and Charles O. Finley, an impulsive newsmaker by choice, continues full blast with a dispute over the $5,000 bonuses that Finley has promised three of his Oakland players.

title: Port Notes
description: The days when cargo shippers bypassed the Port of New York in favor of other Atlantic ports because of the high cost of doing cargo business here may be numbered.

title: Diplomat Who Was Injured In Hanoi Arrives in Paris
description: PARIS, Oct. 17 (Agence FrancePresse)  Pierre Susini, the French Delegate General in Hanoi who was seriously burned in an air raid last week, arrived here today after a 23hour flight by way of Vientiane, Laos.

title: Transamerica's Net Climbs Sharply
description: Sharply higher earnings were reported yesterday by the Transamerica Corporation in the third quarter, lifting profits for nine months to record levels.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 The White House announced today that President Nixon would pay a second political visit to New York State next week amid other signs that his campaign  a rather placid affair so far  would soon pick up momentum.

title: House Contest
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey, who is seeking his seventh term in Congress, says that Republicans across the country are like sharks this year.

title: Girl, 12, Accidentally Shot By 2 Housing Patrolmen
description: Two Housing Authority patrolmen trying to kill a dog suspected of being rabid last night accidentally shot and wounded a 12yearold girl standing near the doorway of her home at 3.06 Astoria Boulevard in Queens, the police reported.

title: MURTAGH PRESSES GRAFTJURY DRAW
description: Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday convened special sessions of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan and Queens to call on county clerks to begin the process of selecting grand juries to hear evidence of corruption in the city's criminal justice system.

title: Turk Broda, Hockey Star Dies; Maple Leafs Goalie 14 Years
description: TORONTO, Oct. 17Turk Broda, a star goalie for the Toronto Maple Leafs hockey team and twice winner of the Vezina Trophy as the best goaltender in the National Hockey League, died tonight after a massive heart seizure. He was 58 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: EDMONTON, Alta., Oct. 17 (UPI)An Edmonton Eskimo defensive end. Dick Suderman, died of a brain hemorrhage yesterday 24 hours after he collapsed in a downtown restaurant and two days before his 32d birthday. A spokesman for the University of Alberta Hospital's neurological unit said the hemorrhage did not appear to be related to Suderman's playing in a game against the British Columbia Lions Saturday night.

title: HENRY H. BONTECOU OF LORD & TAYLOR
description: Henry H. Bontecou, a senior vice president of Lord & Taylor, the New Yorkbased store chain, died of cancer yesterday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 45 years old and lived at 829 Hollow Tree Ridge Road, Darien, Conn.

title: Cooke Explains Rockefeller's Invitation to Dinner
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke issued a statement yesterday explaining why Governor Rockefeller had been invited to the Alfred E. Smith dinner in the light of Mr. Rockefeller's veto of a bill that would have repealed the state's liberalized abortion law.

title: FarRanging Charges Pour In On Council Civil Service Inquiry
description: The City Council committee investigating misuse of provisional city employes  those without Civil Service statushas received a wide variety of charges that include a city commissioner's sleeping pude in his office during working hours and the intervention of city officials to quash statutoryrape charges against two city employes.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLUMBIA. S. C., Oct. 17 (AP)The head football coach at the University of South Carolina, Paul Dietzel, has confirmed that he dismissed two players for smoking marijuana. The university's student newspaper, the Gamecock, had said Ike Houck, an offensive guard from Mount Lebanon, Pa., and Brian Nemeth, a tight end from Clearwater, Fla., were dropped.

title: U.S. to Fund Union Pacific In GasFromCoal Project
description: The Union Pacific Corporation and the Bureau of Mines yesterday announced a twoyear field project in Wyoming that will test the feasibility of producing gas by burning coal underground. Such gas could he used as fuel for onsite power plants, a Bureau of Mines spokesman said.

title: Penguins Defeat Islanders, 50
description: UNIONDALE, L. I. Oct. 17There were bad signs tonight at the Nassau Coliseum. First, the organist manhandled the national anthem. Then the welldrilled Pittsburgh. Penguins showed little respect for their hosts and sailed to a 50 victory over the Islanders.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: FREEHOLD, Oct. 17John C. Kohl, the State Transportation Commissioner, testified today that Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin had asked him to throw out bids on a highway project as a favor to a contractor who was described as a friend, supporter and contributor to the Republican party.

title: Dispute Mars Opening Of Peace Talks in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Oct. 17 (Reuters)Preliminary peace talks between the Government and the proCommunist Pathet Lao got off to an unpromising start here today with a heated clash over the Laotian national flag.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 Judge John J. Sirica of United States District Court today set the start of the trial of the seven men indicted in the bugging of the Democratic National Committee headquarters here for Nov. 15, a week after the national election.

title: Shriver Takes to the Road on an OldFashioned Tour
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Oct. 17New Jersey, a state that has no major television station, provided a new lesson in oldfashioned political techniques today for Sargent Shriver, the Democratic VicePresidential nomineti.

title: Abrams Arrives in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Oct. 18 (Reuters) Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the United States Army Chief of Staff, arrived here today for talks with South Vietnamese and American officials on the progress of the war.

title: 433 Audubon Originals Going on Display for Firs
description: The entire known collection of the original watercolors by John James Audubon for his Birds of America will go on exhibition for the first time today at the NewYork Historical Society.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 17  The, Connecticut Supreme Court today rejected an appeal from the Democratic party that the General Assembly elections set for Nov. 7 be postponed or called off.

title: American Letters And Silver Bring $214,030 at Sales
description: Historical American letters and autographs went considerably over presale appraisals yesterday at Sotheby Parke Bernet, 980 Madison Avenue. In another gallery, a simultaneous sale of early American silver had as its principal attraction a rare sauce boat by Paul Revere, which brought $26,000. Both auctions ushered in a week of sales of American historical or artistic interest.

title: BELFAST VIOLENCE ANGERS MILITANTS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 17Militant Protestants broke off all relations with the British Army today after a night of rioting in East Belfast in which two civilians were killed and five injured.

title: Art Historians at CUNY Score Sale of Metropolitan Paintings
description: A group of prominent art historians has added volume to the growing chorus of criticism against the recent sale of important modern paintings by the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: F.B.I. HERE RAIDS A GAMBLING RING
description: F.B.I. agents conducted 13 raids and served at least subpoenas yesterday in an assault on what Federal law enforcement officials described as the biggest gambling and shylocking operation in Brooklyn.

title: Advertising:
description: A couple of weeks before the beginning of Xerox's latest and perhaps most costly series of TV specials the corporation will run an ad in five national magazines to drum up viewer interest.

title: Memo of Explanation
description: WASHINGTONMy recollection is that the first time I learned of the existence of the case of Laird v. Tatum, other than having probably seen press accounts of it, was at the time I was preparing to testify as a witness before the subcommittee [on constitutional rights] in March, 1971. I believe the case was then being appealed to the Court of Appeals by respondents. The office of the Deputy Attorney General, which is customarily responsible for collecting material from the various divisions to be used in preparing the department's statement, advised me or one of my staff as to the arrangement with respect to the computer printout from the Army data bank, and it was incorporated into the prepared statement which I read to the subcommittee. I had then and have now no personal knowledge of the arrangement, nor so far as I know have I ever seen or been apprised of the contents of this particular printout. Since the printout had been lodged with the Justice Department by the Department of the Army, I later authorized its transmittal to the staff of the subat the of the latter.

title: Storm Wipes Out Third World Series Contest
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 17The third game of the World Series was postponed tonight when a heavy rain and hail storm drenched the Oakland Coliseum just before the A's and Cincinnati Reds took the field.

title: FOUR NATIONS ASK UNITY ON COPPER
description: PARIS, Oct. 17 (UPI)Four major copperproducing nations called today for measures of solidarity and defense to fight a French court order freezing payment on a shipment of. Chilean copper.

title: Posts Reported Overrun
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia. Oct. 17 (AP)  North Vietnamese forces reportedly overran three Government garrisons off Route 5 today and brought their drive to shut down the vital rice road within 18 miles of tbe capital.

title: GOLD SAYS MAFIA HAS INFILTRATED 200 BUSINESSES
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney, Eugene Gold, said yesterday that his electronic surveillance of a Mafia headquarters in a Canarsie junkyard had turned up the names of 200 New York businesses infiltrated or dominated by orga nized crime.

title: Fund Pool Urged to Replace Ads on Children's TV
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 17 Opponents of television commercials directed to children today unveiled the broad outlines of a report calling for the gradual elimination of such advertising.

title: Utilities and Industries CorpFiles Registration Statement
description: The Utilities and Industries Corporation (Delaware) announced yesterday the filing of a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering a proposed exchange offer of securities with the Utilities and Industries Corporation (New York) and with the 61 per centowned Colonial Sand and Stone Company, Inc.

title: Underground Sea on the West Coast May Augment Colorado River Flow
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 17Government scientists recently drilled a deep hole in the southern California desert and struck a big pocket of hot, brackish water. They were delighted.

title: F.B.I. HERE RAIDS A GAMBLING RING
description: F.B.I. agents conducted 13 raids and served at least 15 subpoenas yesterday in an assault on what Federal law enforcement officials described as the biggest gambling and shylocking operation in Brooklyn.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP AS TRADING GAINS
description: A sharp drop in the stock of RPS Products highlighted activity on the American Stock Exchange yesterday as prices finished mixed in steppedup trading.

title: Blackout Blamed on Boys
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 17 (AP)Two 15yearold boys were charged today with vandalizing a substation of the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation and causing a blackout that affected 1,400 customers in this Syracuse suburb Sunday night. The names of the youths were withheld.

title: China After Mao
description: There have been conflicting reports of what Premier Chou Enlai said about China's succession problem when the Premier met with a group of American newspaper editors recently. One version had Chou spotlighting Yao Wenyuan, the relatively youthful Shanghai Communist party leader.

title: RAIDERS BEATEN IN OVERTIME, 43
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 17 (AP)Skip Krake slammed in a shot from 8 feet out at 6 minutes 9 seconds of a suddendeath overtime to give the undefeated Cleveland Crusaders a 43 victory over the New York Raiders in a World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: Phone Company Told To Halt Some Work
description: The Public Service Cornmission has told the New York Telephone Company to stop installing equipment that would make it possible for subscribers to be charged far directoryassistance calls until the commission rules upon whether the charges are to be allowed.

title: Five IRT Riders Injured As Train Stops Suddenly
description: Five persons were injured, none seriously, and southbound service on the West Side IRT was disrupted last night when a train developed a shortcircuit and had to make an emergency stop, the Transit Authority said.

title: POLES SIGN PACT ON PREWAR BONDS
description: Poland has agreed to work out a plan for settling about $41million in bonds dating from the 1920's.

title: Robert Hass, 31, Wins Yale Poetry Contest
description: The Yale University Press has named Robert Hass as the 1972 winner of the Yale University competition for younger poets. Stanley Kunitz, Pulitzer Prizewinning poet and judge of the contest, described the selection as a big, stronghearted, earthy book, in the tradition of Whitman and Nerucla.

title: Prison Guards Back Nixon
description: The New York City Correction Officers Benevolent Association endorsed President Nixon for reelection yesterday, saying that the President had assured equal justice for all through his United States Supreme Court appointments. Leo C. Zeferetti, president of the 3,000 member group, said he had asked other prison guards throughout the country to endorse Mr. Nixon and VicePresident Agnew.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17The Vietnam peace talks are now reaching the critical point where an interim peace agreementnot a final settlementmay be under serious discussion.

title: Common Market Curb on Produce Angers 18 African Countries
description: PARIS. Oct. 17  A dispute that involves some of the funmental issues of economic relarelations between developed and developing countries has arisen between the European Economic Community and its 18 associated territories, mostly former French colonies, in Africa.

title: Merger News
description: The Bendix Corporation saidl yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire the mobilehome and recreationalvehicle businesses of the Boise Cascade Corporation for $68million in cash.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Press On Regardless, the Sports Car Club of America's version of the Monte Carlo and East African Safari rallies, takes on still more luster this year. Recognized in 1970 and 1971 as an international event on the sporting calendar of the Federation Internationale de l'Automobile, the highspeed, hardrunning POR reaches the ultimate this season, qualifying as one of the nine events counting for the International Rally Championship for Makes. This is rallying's counterpart to the World Championship for Makes in road racing, and no other rally in the Western Hemisphere has ever achieved this status.

title: Hale Boggs's Plane Hunted Along South Alaska Coast
description: ANCHORAGE, Oct. 17More than 100 private planes joined 40 military aircraft, when weather cleared today, in searching along the rugged southern Alaska coast for missing plane carrying the House Democratic leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana; Representative at Large Nick Begich, Democrat of Alaska, and two other men.

title: South Korea Chief Orders Martial Law
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 17President Park Chung Hee proclaimed martial law tonight throughout South Korea, suspended part of the Constitution, dissolved the National Assembly and suspended all political activities.

title: The Albany Three
description: The State Legislature handles such vitally important issues as home rule powers for the cities, which cover topics ranging from permission to build housing to authorization for deployment of New York's policemen in four shifts instead of three. The Legislature decrees land use regulations; it provides for zoning; it adopts marital, abortion and divorce laws; it apportions state aid to elementary, secondary and higher education fixes the guidelines for administering federally funded programs for welfare and health care.

title: Market Place:
description: It is big and fat and the format is dull. But the content is fascinating. It is the quarterinchthick registration statement of the Hughes Tool Company just filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Richardson C. Bass Weds Miss Turley
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Oct. 17  Miss Kimball Turley, daughter of Mrs. Peggy Grenz of Irvine, Calif., was married at the Town Hall here today to Richardson C. Bass, son of Mrs. George R. Gibson of New York and Amagansett and the late Basil N. Bass. Town Justice Sheppard Frood performed the ceremony.

title: Garber Voted Top Pitcher In International League
description: ROCHESTER, Oct 17 (AP)A 14game winner, Gene Garber cf the Charleston Charlies, has been named the most valuable pitcher in the International Baseball League.

title: Former Envoy for Nixon
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 17 (AP)Raymond R. Guest, former Ambassador to Ireland, said today that he was no longer a Democrat because the Democratic party has left me. He annouced that he would support the reelection bid of President Nixon. Mr. Guest, who lives in King George County, Va., campaigned for the EisenhowerNixon Republican ticket in 1952 and 1956.

title: Advertising:
description: Before going off to Tarrytown, N. Y., for a fourday session of future planning, the board of directors of J. Walter Thompson sat down and chose three new members, elevated three more men to the rank of executive vice President and broadened a few other responsibilities.

title: Tito Apparently the Victor In Dispute With Serbians
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 17After weeks of behindthescenes conflict, President Tito appeared today to have outmaneuvered the leadership of the Coinninist party in Serbia in a dispute about political and economic power in the six Yugoslav republics.

title: Mrs. Pinkerton Wed to John H. Marshall
description: Mrs. Louise Cutter Pinkerton of East Islip, L. I., was married here yesterday afternoon to John Hunt Marshall of Dedham, Mass. State Supreme Court Justice Irving Kirschenbaum performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: JAMES W. BOLTON
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., Oct. 17 James W. Bolton, the son of Joe Bolton, host of children's television programs for WPIX in New York, died of a heart attack at his home here on Friday. He was 22 years old.

title: People and Business
description: The Israeli military man who gave his name to the BarLev linethe defensive system of fortifications on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal  was in New York yesterday to talk about the economic development of his country. In his speech to the AmericanIsrael Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Gen. Haim BarLev  who is the new Israeli Minister of Commerce and Industrystressed the return on capital available to investors in businesses in Israel.

title: 100% Quota Continued
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 17November will be just like the previous seven months in Texas oil fieldsrunning wide open.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., Oct. 17The Garden State Women's Golf Association team from New Jersey recorded 24 points today to win a triangular, Nassau system, meet with TriCounty of Westchester and Cross County of Long Island at the Crestmont Country Club.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (AP); The American Civil Liberties Union Foundation filed a $1,125,000 lawsuit today on behalf of a Massachusetts woman who contends her telephone calls were intercepted by Republican security forces at the party's national convention.

title: 4 White Navy Men Injured: 11 Blacks Held at Subic Bay
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 17 (AP)Pour crewmen were injured in an apparent racial clash yesterday aboard the United States Navy oiler Hassayampa at Subic Bay in the Philippines, Pacific Fleet headquarters reported today.

title: ForgetMeeNot
description: Senator Sam Ervin is reportedly surprised to learn that Army spying is far more extensive than he had first imagined. I am surprised, too. My sister tells me that she heard on tele vision that a schoolboy, who phoned the Kremlin to get information for term paper is still on the records. I want to make a full and frank confession. I made that call back in 1956 when I was in high school.

title: Official of Al Fatah Shot Dead in Rome
description: ROME, Oct. 17A Libyan Embassy employe, a Jordanian who is believed to have been a member of Al Fatah, the Palestinian guerrilla organization, wds shot dead last night outside his suburban apartment.

title: MERRILL LYNCH REPORTS NET OFF
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith and E. F. Hutton & Co., two of the nation's largest investment houses, issued thirdquarter financial reports yesterday that underscored the earnings squeeze in the brokerage industry.

title: Braves Down 76ers, 122114
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 17 (AP)Dick Garrett and Randy Smith led a 42point surge in the third quarter that propelled the Buffalo Braves to a 122114 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in the National Basketball Association tonight.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 17 (UPI)The heavyweight contender, George Foreman, and his manager, Charles Sadler filed an $11million suit today against a New York promoter, Martin Erlichman. Foreman contends Erlichmen failed to carry out terms of a contract that included puhlciizing Foreman, getting him a $50,000 job with Ford Motors and personal appearances with Barbra Streisand.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DETROIT, Oct. 17 (UPI)A $21.5million lawsuit has been filed against three unnamed physicians for failing to notify the Detroit Lions wide receiver, Charles (Chuck) Hughes, of a heart condition that, the suit said, led to his death during a professional football game last Oct. 24. Sharon L. Hughes of El Paso, Tex., the player's widow, charged that Hughes was not informed of his condition after a May, 1971, examination at Henry Ford Hospital.

title: COLLAPSE OF SPAN KILLS 3 ON COAST
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 17 (AP)A 100foot high freeway bridge under construction collapsed today, killing at least three workmen.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates displayed no clear trend yesterday as a large mass of financing moved through the underwriting processes and Presidential adviser Henry Kissinger's decision to go to Saigon was announced. Prices for corporate issues, aided by what were seen as revived prospects for peace in Vietnam, forged ahead to gains of as much as  point. Treasury securities crept to slim advances.

title: TRADING IS QUIET FOR COMMODITIES
description: Commodity futures markets) were generally quiet yesterday, with few notable price changes.

title: Notes on People
description: After 33 years in the United States, W. H. Auden went hack to his native England to live near his old school, Christchurch College at Oxford University. The 65yearold poet, who became a United States citizen in 1946 thereby disqualifying himself for appointment as Britain's poet laureate, said he had left New York's Greenwich Village after 20 years because he was getting old, lonely and afraid of being mugged.

title: Canarsie Parents Block Black Pupils From Entering School for 2d Day
description: About 150 Canarsie parents blocked the steps of John Wilson Junior High School yesterday, preventing, for the second day, 34 black children from entering the school.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Cahill said yesterday that he was appointing a special prison task force in New Jersey to determine how the state could isolate about 125 hardcore, incorrigible inmates who, he said, were attempting to destroy his efforts to reform the state's penal system.

title: Nationalists in Portuguese Africa Tell U.N. of Gains
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 17Two leaders of Affrican nationalist groups in Portuguese territories have told the United Nations that they are achieving significant battlefield successes and simultaneously expanding their capacity to govern themselves.

title: Airlines Challenge New Charter Rule
description: Pan American World Airways and Trans World Airlines charged yesterday that a controversial new charter flight regulation of the Civil Aeronautics Board will cost them at least $100million annually in lost revenues.

title: City Worker Linked To Narcotics Inquiry Slain Outside Home
description: A day after he apparently agreed to cooperate with Federal narcotics investigators, a city water inspector was shot to death yesterday morning.

title: Pilot Once Lost License
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Oct. 17 (UPI)Don Jonz is described as a real pro pilot, but eight years ago the F.A.A. revoked his commercial certificate after he had brought an overloaded plane down on a freeway.

title: JUSTICE TESSLER OF STATE COURT
description: State Supreme Court Justice Harold Tessler of Queens, died) of a heart attack yesterday Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 17113, Mayfield Road, Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Hale Boggs's Plane Hunted Along South Alaska Coast
description: ANCHORAGE, Oct. 17More than 100 private planes joined 40 military aircraft, when weather cleared today, in searching along the rugged southern Alaska coast for missing plane carrying the House Democratic leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana; Representative at Large Nick Begich, Democrat of Alaska, and two other men.

title: BATTLE CONTINUES ON ATTICA RECORDS
description: Federal Judge Lee P. Gagliardi held a hearing here yesterday on the question of whether the Attica Commission must turn over its records to a special prosecutorinvestigator. At the conclusion of the hearing, Judge Gagliardi asked the parties to submit written papers next Tuesday.

title: Smith Advances in Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 17 (AP)Stan Smith of the United (States. Nastase of Rumania and Manuel Oranles of Spain, frontrunners in the 1972 Grand Prix tennis standing, scored firstround victories in the 20th Count of Godo trophy tournameet today.

title: CONGRESS PASSES BILL ON BENEFITS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 The 92d Congress, stumbling toward adjournment, passed and sent to the White House today a $6billion welfareSocial Security bill stripped of the President's welfare reform proposals.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The problems of the New York Stock Exchange bear a certain resemblance to New York's medallion taxi industry. Both are cartels whose monopolies have been broken by outside competition. In the case of taxis, gypsy cabs are the outside force. New York today has some 11,500 medallion taxis and 16,000 gypsy cabs. With such competition, the value of owning a medallion  in effect, the extra prof it to be gained from fixed meter charges and protected access to the taxi markethas shrunk from a onetime peak of $25,000 to zero. In recent months, 350 medallions have been turned back to the Taxi Commission as worthless.

title: Pitt Lineman Sacks Wrong Quarterback
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 17 (AP) Glen Hyde, Pitt's 240pound defensive tackle, has been ordered not to give any more friendly bearhugs to his team's quarterbacks.

title: Blazers Beat Bucks, 111108
description: PORTLAND, Ore. Oct. 17 (AP)Sidney Wicks hit 6 points in the last two minutes tonight as the Portland Trail Blazers upset the Milwaukee Bucks, 111108. Wicks, who led Portland with 33 points, connected on a 20foot jump shot with 1:56 left to give the Blazers a 107106 lead.

title: Monday Night Fights
description: LondonLes Stevens, Reading, England, knocked out. Mike Boswell, Youngstown. Ohio, 4 rounds, heavyweights.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York City municipal hospitals registered nurses appear to be backing away from their vow not to perform any nonnursing functions, a spokesman for the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dear Oscar Signs Kneeland
description: Richard Kneeland has been signed to star in the title role of Dear Oscar, the new musical based on the life of Oscar Wilde, opening Nov. 13 at the Playhouse Theater, 359 West 48th Street. Donald Saddler will provide the choreography for the Caryl Young and Addy 0. Feiger musical.

title: MURTAGH PRESSES GRAFTJURY DRAW
description: Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday convened special sessions of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan and Queens to call on county clerks to begin the process of selecting grand juries to hear evidence of corruption in the city's criminal justice system.

title: Transit Authority Auction Gets Takers for All but Box Full of Dentures
description: Anyone who left a watch on the subway or a bus last year and did not bother to inquire at the Transit Authority's lost and found departmentforget to It probably was sold yesterday at the authority's biannual for three solid hours, a professional auctioneer Abe A. Friedman, droned on I'm bid a dollar. Do, I hear two, two, two, three, three, three, three and a half ? Sold, three and a half.

title: Transit Authority Gets Federal Grant Of $40Million More for Subway Cars
description: The Federal Government made a $40million grant to the New York City Transit Authority yesterday for new subway cars.

title: Cabaret
description: Since Aliza Kashi, the Israeliborn singer, arrived in this country five years ago, she has appeared on the Mery Griffin Show 179 times, according to her publicity. This would suggest that she has some talent as a talker, an assumption that is borne out during her current performance in the Empire Room of the WaldorfAstoria.

title: Krol Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, Oct. 17 (AP)John Cardinal Krol, Archbishop of Philadelphia, flew here today for a conference with Pope Paul ??? after ending a sixday tour, of Poland.

title: Bridge: The Holder of the Best Hand Should Sometimes Be Quiet
description: Some players feel insulted when they have the best hand at the table and the opponents impertinently keep bidding. It is often a wise policy to swallow such insults; those who react indignantly generally end up with bloody noses.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (UPI)The Department of Agriculture today set the 1973 cotton price support 19.5 cents per poundthe same as this yeardespite pleas for a rise because of tumbling 1972 prices.

title: SHACKAMAXON TEAM WINS GOLF PLAYOFF
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., Oct. 17Mr. and Mrs. Sam Sidorakis of Shackamaxon combined for a net 82 to defeat Mr. and Mrs. James Postell of Suburban in a playoff for the sixth annual New Jersey State Golf Association's mixedfoursomes championship today at the Somerset Hills Country Club.

title: 2 Soviet Envoys Argue With Princeton Crowd
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 17 A crowd of about 140 Princeton Upiversity students argued heatedly for half an hour tonight with two Soviet officials to protest the treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union.

title: Dr. Henry L. Roberts Is Dead; Taught History at Dartmouth
description: HANOVER, N. H., Oct. 17Dr. Henry L. Roberts, professor of history at Dartmouth and a leading scholar on Eastern Europe, died today in Gifford Memorial Hospital in Randolph, Vt. He was 56 years old and lived in Rochester, Vt.

title: AHMANSON OFFERING IS OVERSUBSCRIBED
description: The initial public offering of 3.6million shares of H. F. Ahmanson Sc Co. common stock, at $28 a share, was oversubscribed yesterday, managers of the underwriting group announced.

title: POLES SIGN PACT ON PREWAR BONDS
description: Poland has agreed to work out a plan for settling about $41million in bonds dating from the 1920's.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: FORT WORTH, Oct. 17Senator George McGovern declared here today that the Nixon Administration could not brush away the invasion of Democratic National Committee headquarters last June and alleged political sabotage against the party as pranks and capers.

title: Undercover Agent Tells of Cuba Trip With Red Youth Unit
description: MIAMI, Oct. 17 (UPI)  A Congressional subcommittee heard an undercover sheriff's deputy testify yesterday how he infiltrated and went to Cuba with the Venceremos Brigade, a United States Communist youth movement.

title: DRIVE IS ORDERED ON FALSE ALARMS
description: Calling false fire alarms criminal, Mayor Lindsay disclosed yesterday that he had asked the Police Department to direct auxiliary police patrols to pay special attention to firealarm boxes in precincts reporting the most false alarms.

title: Kringle Leads Seniors Golf By Three Strokes With 72
description: NEPTUNE, N. J., Oct. 17Ed Kringle of the Lincoln Park Driving Range posted a par 72 today to take the firstround lead in the sixth annual New Jersey Professional Golfers Association, seniors championship at the Jumping Brook Club.

title: Books of The Times
description: Is something not worth doing worth doing well? Consider these three novels by writers who have long since established their abilities to do what they do well.

title: De Mau Mau Gang Fugitive Gives Himself Up in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 17 (UPI)A fugitive member of the De Mau Mau gang, sought on a murder warrant in an investigation of the executionstyle slayings of nine persons, walked into the chambers of a Criminal Court judge today and gave himself up.

title: 14 Lawyers Suing to Invalidate Bar's Finding on Judge Dembitz
description: A group of 14 lawyers sued in State Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday for a judgment declaring invalid, erroneous, and null and void the finding by the State Bar Association that Judge Nanette Dembitz of Family Court was not qualified at the present time to be a candidate for the State Court of Appeals.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: An effort by blacks focusing exclusively on black voters in the state  an effort that has been in the planning stages for three weeks  finally got rolling yesterday when the new Black Mobilization Committee scheduled its first rally, to be held tomorrow in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: Bipartisan Endorsements in Bronx Hurting Democratic Assembly Campaign
description: A series of bipartisan endorsements by Bronx Democrats and Republicans have jeopardized three Democratic Assembly seats in a year when Democrats are trying to win control of the lower house.

title: NIGERIA GETS READY FOR ARTS FESTIVAL
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Oct. 17The second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture in November, 1974, in Nigeria is expected to cost approximately $30million and attract 11,000 participants and more than 100,000 visitors from overseas.

title: Business Briefs
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Oct. 17 (Reuters)The Bundesbank warned today that West Germany could face further increases in bank rate following the recent rise to 3 per cent from 3 per cent.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of two million common shares of the Pennsylvania Power & Light Company at $24.25 per share was made yesterday by an underwriting group managed by The First Boston Corporation and Drexel Firestone, Inc. Net proceeds will be used to retire short term debt incurred to provide interim financing of construction. The company's stock was up  at 24 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: White House Weighs IndustryAid Unit
description: A high White House aide said yesterday that the Administration was considering proposing the creation of an agency to guarantee loans to the aerospace and other industries to help finance development and initial production of technologically advanced products. The aide, William M. Magruder, added, however, that such loan guarantees cannot be pure Government subsidy.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Dynamics Corporation received two Navy awards totaling $36.2million for work on nuclear submarines, it was announced yesterday.

title: Mrs. Patricia Matisse, 49; Aided Husband at Gallery
description: Mrs. Patricia O'Connell Matisse, wife of Pierre Matisse, the New York art dealer and son of Henri Matisse, the painter, died Sunday at Midtown Hospital, Her age was 49 and she lived at 167 East 64th Street.

title: David Marmolstein Dies at 72; Cloak and Suit Industry Head
description: David Marmolstein, impartial chairman of the cloak and suit industry in this city, died yesterday at his home. 25 Central Park West. He was 72 years old.

title: A Poetic Entity in Art From Philadelphia Museum
description: Everyone knows that Philadelphians are more reserved than New Yorkers. They are also more poetic, if we can trust the evidence of Philadelphia in New York, an exhibition of 90 modern works from the Philadelphia Museum of Art opening today at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Output Up by 0.6% in September
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 Government agencies today reported solid gains in industrial production and personal income for September. The advances, however, were a little below the average rate of improvement earlier this year.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKENSACK, Oct. 17Andrew Maguire, Democratic candidate for Bergen County Freeholder, charged today that construction of a county sewer system had cost three times as much as it should and called for an investigation of the work of the consulting engineer for the project.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17The Republicans are businesslike, the Democrats are glum, and the voters are largely apathetic. But one man, perhaps one of the few, is actually having fun this election season. He is John D. Lofton Jr., the editor of a rambunctiously partisan Republican publication, a sortofweekly newsletter entitled Monday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 17Governor Cahill announced the nomination today of the Rev. Victor R. Yanitelli, a Jesuit who is president of St. Peter's College in Jersey City, as a New Jersey commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Cocker Fined in Drug Case
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Oct. 17 (AP)The British popular star Inc Cocker and five others in his entourage were fined $360 tach today for possession of Indian hemp, while a seventh defendant, Felix Venancio Falcon, aged 27, of Miami, was tined $720 for possessing heroin and the equipment to use it.

title: The Stage: Women Beware Women
description: The City Center Acting Company's production of Thomas Middleton's Women Beware Women, which last night joined the company's current repertory season, is billed as the first professional staging of the play in the United States. By reviving this unjustly neglected classic, the group is performing a valuable service for the contemporary audience.

title: MISS KUSNER WINS PUISSANCE CLASS
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 17 Kathy Kusner piloted her speed horse, Nirvana, to victory in the international puissance class tonight at the 27th annual Pennsylvania National Horse Show.

title: Jumbo Jet. Malaysia Horse. To Run in Rich Laurel Race
description: LAUREL, Md., Oct. 17 (AP) Jumbo Jet, the champion of Malaysia and Singapore, was added to the field today for the $50,000 Washington D. C. International to be run Nov. 11 at Laurel Race Course.

title: ARMED GUARDS SHOT, ROBBED OF $13,000
description: Two young gunmen shot and wounded two armed payroll, guards in a West Side building) yesterday and escaped with, $13,000.

title: Mayor Terms Slaying of Woman A Senseless, Cowardly Deed
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that he was profoundly shocked at the slaying of a 32yearold Brooklyn woman Monday evening as her 12yearold son watched helplessly.

title: 2CAR MAKERS WIN PRICE INCREASES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17The Price Commission authorized the Chrysler Corporation and the American Motors Corporation today to increase prices on 1973 model cars to cover the cost of federally required safety and antipollution equipment.

title: Cahill Will Appoint Panel on a New Jail For Incorrigibles
description: TRENTON, Oct. 17Governor Cahill said today that he was appointing a special prison task force to determine how the state could isolate about 125 hardcore, incorrigible inmates who he said were attempting to destroy his efforts to reform the state's penal system.

title: Manila Says It Holds 4 for a Plot to Kill President Marcos
description: MANILA, Oct. 17 (UPI)The Philippine Government announced today that at least four persons, including two foreigners, had been arrested by military authorities for involvement in what was said to have been a Communist assassination plot against President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: Uganda Exiles in Rural Britain: A Difficult Time for Both Sides
description: STRADISHALL, England, Oct. 12  The passengers climbed into the untended taxi at Bury St. Edmunds railroad station. A moment later the driver appeared, eating cookies from a bag. Stradishall camp? Have you the fare? he inqutred. I don't mean to be rude. But sometimes I take them there and they don't have the money. Oh, they pay, but they have to go in and hunt up friends to borrow from, and I've waited there as much as an hour.

title: PLOT CHARGED TO 2 IN YABLONSKI DEATH
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 17 (AP)Two officials of the United line Workers were indicted by Federal grand jury here today on conspiracy charges in the 1969 murder of Joseph A. Yablanski, the union insurgent lader.

title: CITIBANK INCOME SURGES BY 23.3%
description: The First National City Corporation, the most profitable banking concern in the country, reported yesterday that its operating earnings surged 23.3 per cent in the third quarter.

title: Segretti Is Linked to Calls To White House in Spring
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 17Donald H. Segretti, the man identified in news reports as a key figure in a campaign to sabotageDemocratic political activities, has been linked to a number of telephone calls made last spring to the White House and to the home and office of a man indicted in the Watergate bugging incident.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Krol Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, Oct. 17 (AP)John Cardinal Krol, Archbishop of Philadelphia, flew here today for a conference with Pope Paul VI after ending a sixday tour of Poland.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Oct. 17New Jersey, a state that has no major television station, provided a new lesson in oldfashioned political techniques today for Sargent Shriver, the Democratic VicePresidential nominee.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17Two new public opinion polls, taken in California and Minnesota, show President Nixon with large leads over Senator George McGovern going into the last month of the Presidential campaign.

title: Romney Hails Court Record
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 17 (AP)George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, told a conference of the International Chiefs of Police here today that President Nixon's appointments had shaped a Supreme Court that evidenced as much concern for therights of victims as for the rights of criminals.

title: GOLD SAYS MAFIA HAS INFILTRATED 200 BUSINESSES
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney, Eugene Gold, said yesterday that his electronic surveillance of a Mafia headquarters in a Canarsie junkyard had turned up the names of 200 New York businesses infiltrated or dominated by organized crime.

title: Pace Corps Quits Uganda
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (AP) The United States has quietly withdrawn all Peace Corps volunteers from Uganda, officials acknowledged today. They declined to say whether the volunteers had been ordered to leave.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe French role in seeking to accommodate and even facilitate peace in Indochina has been consistently invisible, discreet and sometimes effective. Neither this role nor its objectives are understood by many Americans.

title: TV Review
description: Thought and care have gone into A Great American Tragedy, tonight's ironically labeled topical drama special at 8:30 on the American Broadcasting Company network. And a 50yearold man, abruptly dismissed after 20 years from a highly specialized job, does have a real problem these days finding his kind of job. That's the $35,000ayear kind.

title: Rain and Debris Add Strain To Barriers Holding Oil Slick
description: PIUTE FARMS, Utah, Oct. 17 (UPI)Rainwashed debris has added extra strain to barriers holding an 186,000gallon oil slick from spreading into Lake Powell.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Ducks Beat Cubs Six, 65
description: SOUTH YARMOUTH, Mass., Oct. 17 (AP)Michel Letourneau scored his second goal to break a tie at 11:25 of the third period tonight and give the unbeaten Long Island Ducks a 65 victory over the Cape Cod Cubs.

title: Stylish Afro Boutique in Harlem Is Closing
description: The Ashanti Bazaar, a stylish African boutique that flowered in Harlem during the black cultural renaissance of the late nineteensixties, then withered during the economic recession of the early seventies, is closing its doors at the end of this month.

title: BERNARD SALTZMAN, HOTEL OPERATOR, 56
description: Bernard Saltzman, owner of the Diplomat Hotel and operator of other hotels here and upstate, died of a heart attack last evening at his office in the Diplomat, 108 West 43d Street. He was 56 years old and lived at 50 Black Heath Road, Lido Beach, L. I.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17Henry A. Kissinger's talks in Paris have raised not only hopes in Washington, but also many questions, for which there are some clear answers, and an even larger number of guesses, surmises and I don't knows.

title: Slumping Laver Toppled In Vancouver 1st Round
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 17 (AP)Slutnpridden Rod Laver was ousted by Ismael ElShafei of Egypt, 36, 61. 60, in the first round of the Rothtnan's $50,000 international tennis tournament yesterday.

title: Figure in a Narcotics Inquiry Is Slain
description: A day after he apparently agreed to cooperate with Federal narcotics investigators, city water inspector was shot to death yesterday morning.

title: Policeman Hero Honored
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 17 (UPI)A New Orleans police officer who saved a small boy from drowning in the Mississippi River was named policeman of the year today at the 79th annual International Association of Chiefs of Police Conference. Jake Miller, a canine handler, was honored at the meeting here attended by more than 5,000 police chiefs from 60 nations.

title: Dow Chemical and Avon Advance
description: The Dow Chemical Company reported yesterday a 20 per, cent increase in earnings and a 16 per cent gain in sales for the quarter ended Sept. 30, making it the best third period in both respects in the company's 75year history.

title: Kennedy Sparks Chaps in Triumph Over Nets, 10193
description: DALLAS, Oct. 17  Gene Kennedy, a secondyear man from Texas Christian, hit for 21 points, equaling his pro career high, to lead the Dallas Chaparrals to a 10193 victory over the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: 2 Groups Accuse Greece on Torture,
description: GENEVA, Oct. 17Two private international agencies accused the Greek Government today of continuing the torture of political prisoners up to the present day.

title: Man in the News
description: It was 2:30 A.M. It was an hour when most people are asleep, especially men like Charles Joseph Hynes, who is accustomed to rising early, reaching his office in downtown Brooklyn around 7:45 A.M. and not returning home until nearly 8 P.M.and then frequently working some more. But in his 13  room Victorian home in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn, Mr. Hynes could not sleep. It was Monday morning, and a year's work was reaching a climax as more than a thousand policemen moved into position to subpoena hundreds of suspected underworld figures.

title: JUSTICE POWELL OUT OF FALSTAFF CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (AP) Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr. has disqualified himself from Supreme Court consideration of a suit by the Justice Department against the Falstaff Brewing Company.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Rudi Gernreich opened the rites of spring on Seventh Avenue yesterday with laughhe sent a mannequin into his showroom in a dress with four sleeves.

title: Big Order for Turbines Placed With Westinghouse
description: The Southern California Edison Company reported yesterday that it has issued letters of intent to the Westinghouse Electric Corporation covering eight combined cycle electric power plants with a total value of about $200million, These are reportedly the largest single order ever placed in the gas turbine industry.

title: Segretti Is Linked to Calls To White House in Spring
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 17Donald H. Segretti, the man identified in news reports as a key figure in a campaign to sabotage Democratic political activities, has been linkedto a number of telephone calls made last spring to the White House and to the home and office of a man indicted in the Watergate bugging incident.

title: INELIGIBLES RISE ON WELFARE HERE
description: The city's latest report of ineligibility among welfare families under Federal standards here is 7.5 per centmore than double its earlier reports of 3.5 per cent under Federal quality controls.

title: 2 Mau Mau Gang Fugitives Give Selves Up in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 17 (UPI)Two fugitive members of the De Mau Mau gang, sought on murder warrants in an investigation of the executionstyle slayings of nine persons, surrendered to authorities tonight.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Bright, warm, witty and often moving are Gene Hill's essays in his A Hunter's Fireside Book (Winchester Press, 162 pps., illustrated, $4.95).

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Oct. 18 (UPI)Mario Morales, a sophomore reserve on the Midland Lee High School football squad, died last night five hours after he and four other players were felled by lightning during practice. The other players got back on their feet quickly after the bolt felled them, but the 16yearold Morales did not.

title: STANLEY SELONICK
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 18Stanley E. Selonick, former executive vice president of what is now the Palm Beach Company, clothing manufacturers, died here today at the age of 72.

title: How Billingharn Made It to the Series
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 18 The newest candidate for the baseball Hall of Fame is an easygoing, slowtalking character out of Winter Park, Fla., who might never have got to play in a World Series if Bowie Kuhn had been willing to give up Donn Clendenon to the world of business. His name is John Eugene Billingham, and it was partly because of a curious exchange of players dictated three years ago by the baseball commissioner that he was here this evening to stop the Oakland A's, 10, on behalf of the Cincinnati Reds.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Judge Refuses to Release Bridge

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Oct. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)Chartchai Chionoi, former world flyweight champion, and currently the No. 5 contender in the World Boxing Association rankings, knocked out Mexico's No. 3 flyweight, Esteban Rangel of Puebla, in 2:30 of the second round tonight.

title: Moscow Zoo's Panda Dies of Heart Ailment
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 18 (Reuters)  The Moscow Zoo's giant panda, AnAn, has died. Twelve weeks ago ChiChi, the London zoo's panda, died. Attempts to mate them had been unsuccessful.

title: Anshutz Painting Sets American Auction Record
description: Steelworkers Noontime, a painting by Thomas Pollock Anshutz, a work that art specialists have termed unique and a textbook picture, posted an auction record last night for an American painting, $250,000.

title: 30 in Bronx Gangs Scrub Graffiti From IRT
description: About 30 South Bronx youth gang members, armed with nylon cleaning pads and spray bottles of acid and ammonia solution, scrubbed graffiti from a threecar IRT Times Square shuttle train in Grand Central Terminal yesterday morning.

title: CEASEFIRE OFFERED BY THE PATHET LAO
description: TOKYO, Oct. 18 (AP)A Peking radio broadcast said today the proCommunist Pathet Lao had proposed a ceasefire coupled with a promise to release prisoners of war.

title: G.O.P. MOVE KILLS ROAD FUND BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The Nixon Administration engineered tonight the defeat of legislation that would have extended Federal highway programs for one year and provided operating assistance for local mass transit agencies for the first time.

title: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title

title: Ulster Protestants Confer With Army, Raising Hopes for Amity
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 18Hopes of ending the shooting between militant Protestants and the British Army rose today after leaders of the Ulster Defense Association talked for two hours with Army commanders.

title: Fleischmann Panel Urges Family Voice on Schools
description: A farreaching reorganization of the way public schools in New York City and the state are runto give parents the power to select principals and families the opportunity to choose which schools the children should attendwas proposed yesterday by the Fleischmann Commission on education.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of Oct. 11 entitled McGovern on Vietnam, and James Reston's column entitled McGovern's Peace Terms, represent two irreconcilable views within The Times. It seems to me that one faction sees Senator George McGovern as a selfrighteous idealist who can do no wrong despite his fumbling, stumbling and rumbling all over the political spectrum. The other faction, led by Mr. Reston, sees him as a politically naive person who presumes by trusting in the Lord and our adversaries we can extricate ourselves from Vietnam without tarnishing our national leadership image in the world. It must have been a very tortuous decisionmaking process for The Times to endorse the cause of George McGovern, but now that you are stuck with him you are looking sillier and sillier every day.

title: Insurance Rate Cut Asked
description: BOSTON, Oct. 18 (UPI)The Massachusetts auto insurance industry proposed today a reduction of $6.4million in 1973 auto insurance rates, a figure that would still allow the companies to increase profits 500 per cent. But the companies asked that one area, compulsory liability, he increased 6.8 per cent, which equals $5.6million more revenue.

title: HANOI DELEGATION IN PARIS SAYS U.S. IS INTRANSIGENT
description: PARIS, Oct. 18North Vietnam's delegation to the Vietnam peace talks said at a news conference here today that the Nixon Administration's position remains erroneous and intransigent.

title: HUNT NARROWED FOR BOGGS'S PLANE
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Oct. 18The search for the missing plane carrying the House Democratic leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, and three others centered tonight on fogshrouded Peril Strait in southeast Alaska and Portage Pass, near Anchorage.

title: Bottle Containing Poison Stolen at Willowbrook
description: An eightounce plastic bottle containing a chemical said to be a deadly poison was taken from the Willowbrook State School on Staten Island yesterday. The police were notified last night when search of hospital buildings failed to turn up the missing chemical, bromthymol blue.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: Circumstances having brought me to the condition known as retirement, Senator McGovern's economic views concern me considerably.

title: Four Suspects in Court
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 18 (UPI)Four haggard  looking young men, accused members of the De Mau Mau gang, appeared in court today to answer charges of mass murder in the Chicago area.

title: Into the Homestretch
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 18Sargent Shriver, the Democratic VicePresidential candidate, Is in town for a businessmen's breakfast tomorrow morning and the sponsors say it is already oversubscribed. Even though Mr. Shriver is well known in Chicago business and political circles, that may be one more indication that things are picking up for the McGovernShriver ticket.

title: Indian and Pakistani Report Progress in Kashmir Talks
description: NEW DELHI. Oct. 18 (AP)An Indian and a Pakistani general reported today what might he a breakthrough on implementing a peace agreement between con t heir count ries.

title: News of Dogs
description: Hernando de Soto, the Spanish explorer, is famous for discovering the Mississippi River in 1541. Now there's a de Soto, 431 years later, who has won fame in another areathe Caribbean dog world. Largely through his efforts, the Dominican Kennel Club has been accepted as a member of the International Canine Federation and it will hold its first federation show Oct. 28 and 29. He is Dr. Nelson de Soto, a physician, a former president of his country's Academy of Pediatrics, teacher at Santo Domingo University medical school, and a chief at the Robert Reid Hospital in Santo Domingo. But he still finds time to breed and exhibit dogs and serve as secretary of the kennel club.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (UPI) Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that election of Senator George McGovern would be a disaster for this country's drive against crime.

title: Rangers Outplay Bruins In 7to1 Rout at Garden
description: Excitement, the kind that binds fans together when they see a spectacular, quality hockey game, finally came to New York last night after a plethora of scrambling contests.

title: True Knight Rallies to Capture $58,500 Jerome
description: Performing in a style befitting his name, True Knight of the Darby Dan Farm scored a thrilling victory in the $58,000 Jerome Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Kotouc Wins a Review
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (AP) The Army said today that it was reviewing a decision to dismiss Capt. Eugene M. Kotouc, who was acquitted of charges that he maimed and murdered a prisoner at the time of the My Lai massacre.

title: Ham Reports Pilot Contact
description: NEVADA CITY, Calif., Oct. 18 (UPI)A ham radio operator here reported today he had talked with the pilot of a crashed Cessna that may have been carrying Representative Boggs and the pilot told him, All in the plane were injured just this side of Juneau.

title: Mrs. Onassis Plans To Campaign for Pell
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. Oct. 18 (AP)For the first time since the assassination of President Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis will campaign, the office of Senator Claiborne Pell announced today.

title: Toll Rises to 6 in West After Bridge Collapse
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 18 (AP)The bodies of three workmen entombed in a 100ton slab of concrete were found today by rescue workers who used jackhammers to rip through debris of a fallen 100foothigh freeway bridge section. The discovery brought the death toll to six.

title: 2 HOUSING AIDES CITED IN BRIBERY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (UPI) Two officials of the Philadelphia office of the Federal Housing Administration were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of bribery and conspiracy.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TOKYO, Oct. 18 (UPI)Japan's own version of the World Series begins here Saturday, with the Yomiuri Giants favored to win their eighth straight Japanese national championship. The Giants, who won the Central Professional Baseball League pennant for the eighth consecutive season, will take on the Hankyu Braves, champions of the Pacific League, in a bestofseven series.

title: Bridge: Good SqueezePlay Technique Among Ottilie Reilly Legacies
description: The demand for competent bridge instruction always exceeds the supply, so the recent death of Ottilie Reilly will be keenly felt. She was the doyenne of New York bridge teachers, and thousands of students were indebted to her for their first steps toward enjoyment of the game.

title: CASEY OUTLINES DISCLOSURE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18Asserting that to maintain credibility with investors, management has to tell it like it is, the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission outlined today new disclosure requirements the agency is contemplating.

title: Protest in Rhode Island
description: CRANSTON, R.I., Oct. 18 (UPI)About 100 guards at the Adult Correctional Institutions staged a sickout today to protest difficulties in contract negotiations.

title: The Bigger Europe
description: There will be much to celebrate when nine heads of government of the enlarged European Economic Community open a twoday session today in Paris. Even with Norway's recent decision to stay out, the ninenation Community will be the strongest trade entity in the world. It has overcome formidable obstacles to achieve expansion; and even before their actual accession in January, the new membersBritain, Denmark, Irelandwill bring fresh ideas and energies to reinforce those of the original six.

title: Goldberg Is Off Board
description: Arthur Goldberg, the former Supreme Court Associate Justice, resigned as a director of Trans World Airlines yesterday after unsucessfully trying to establish an independent committee of outside directors to review the actions and recommendations of management.

title: PENTAGON FINDS DE MAU MAU LINK
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (UPI) The Pentagon said today it had found isolated instances where a black organization called De Mau Mau had existed at United States military installations, but nothing to link the organization with racial disturbances or other disciplinary trouble.

title: House Contest
description: OYSTER BAY. L. I., Oct. 18. Although four names will confront voters in Nassau and Suffolk Counties when they elect a Representative for the first time from the new Third Congressional District, political leaders see the contest as only a twoway race.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Front Page 2  No Title

title: Two Washington Fugitives Held in Florida
description: PUNTA GORDA, Fla., Oct. 18 (UPI)Two men who escaped from a Washington jail on Oct. 2 while being held on murder charges were back in custody somewhere in the Charlotte CountyDeSoto County area of southwest Florida today, Sheriff Jack Bent of Charlotte County said.

title: Earnings Slump at Securities Firms
description: Reynolds Securities Inc., and the First Bost on Corporation, two major investment houses, provided further evidence yesterday of the thirdquarter earnings pinch in the securities industry.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Oct. 18In broad, brusque strokes, Vice President Agnew painted today a portrait of Senator George McGovern as a naive, inconsistent, incompetent man who would lead America into apocalyptic isolationism and economic chaos.

title: SOVIET EXIT FEES WAIVED FOR SOME
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 18  Nineteen Jewish families in Moscow were unexpectedly given permission today to emigrate to Israel without paying the heavy exit visa fees that Soviet auauthorities have required of emigrants since midAugust.

title: Court Takes Twins From Mother With Low I.Q.
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 18 (UPI)  The State Supreme Court ruled today that 4yearold twin girls must he placed up for adoption because their mother had such a low intelligence quotient that she was unable to give them proper care and attention.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES REGISTER A GAIN
description: Rain on the Western plains and freezing weather in Maine and Minnesota influenced some higher prices in commodity futures trading yesterday.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Howard University received all except one firstplace vote and totaled 431 points yesterday to retain its ranking as the nation's top collegiate soccer team. St. Louis University, the only other team tb receive a firstplace vote, finished second with 398 points.

title: Hansberger Quits Posts
description: Robert V. Hansberger resigned yesterday as chairman, chief executive officer and a director of the Boise Cascade Corporation. Mr. Hansberger, 52 years old, took over as head of the company in 1957 when it was created from a merger of two Northwest lumber companics and guided its development into a billiondollar diversified operation in the fields of paper products, land development, engineering, packaging and other fields.

title: CANADIENS HELD TO 44 DEADLOCK
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 18 (UPI)Frank Mahovlich scored with 59 seconds remaining tonight to give the unbeaten Montreal Canadiens a 44 tie with the St. Louis Blues.

title: Christmas Holiday Is Called OH For Justices in 10 More Counties
description: Justices in 10 countiesincluding Brooklyn, Queens and Nassau and Westchester Countieswere added yesterday to the list of those who will work during the Christmas season.

title: Confession Obtained Through Drug Use Is Voided by Court
description: LE MARS, Iowa, Oct. 18 (UPI)Within the next two days, Ernest J. Triplett will pack his few personal belongings, get into a state car and travel to his new home.

title: Woman Stabbed to Death In Her Borough Park Home
description: A young Brooklyn mother of two was found stabbed to death in her apartment yesterday, according to the police.

title: Albert Stockli, ExChef Director Of Restaurant Associates, Dies
description: Albert Stockli, a Swissborn chef who made his reputation here as the youthful culinary director of Restaurant Associates and then became a partner in the Stonehenge Inn in Ridgefield, Conn., died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived in Sherman. Conn.

title: No Denial
description: In recent weeks. The Washington Post, Time magazine and other publications have aisclosed details of how officials in the White House and in the Committee to Reelect the President apparently planned and paid for a complex, secret campaign of surveillance, sabotage and espionage against their political opponents. The details as reported have been appalling. It is sad and almost incredible that high officials of the Federal Government could even contemplatemuch less carry outsuch degrading maneuvers.

title: Consumer Optimism Gains
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 18 (AP)Consumer optimism improved greatly between May and September 1972, approaching its highest point in 20 years, the Survey Research Center of the University of Michigan's Institute for Social Research reported today.

title: US, SAYS 2D F111 IS LOST IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Oct. 19 (AP)The United States command reported yesterday that a second. F111 swingwing fighterbomber had been lost over North Vietnam, and it listed the two crewmen as missing.

title: JOHN M. MITCHELL, AN ALCOA EXECUTIVE
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 18John M. Mitchell, executive vice president for primary products, allied products and international operations for the Aluminum Company of America, died today after a long illness in Shadyside Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: It seems to me that you have made a very weak case for George McGovern in your recent editorial endorsing him for the Presidency of the United States.

title: Personal Finance
description: A recent case decided in the United States Court of Appeals points up the dangers and the expense that can be involved in jointly owned property.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKENSACK, Oct. 18For the Democrats in Bergen County, this year's election is an issueoriented appeal to get rid of the big bosses. For the Republicans, it is simply a set of numbers that could add up to the largest plurality by any party in the county.

title: U.N. Unit Says Israel Violates Arabs Rights in Seized Areas
description: UNITED NATIONS, Oct. 18A three  member committee charged in a report today that Israel was continuing to violate the rights of Arab inhabitants in territories occupied in the June, 1967, war. It said there had been a mass displacement of 11,000 Arab residents and spoke of new Israeli settlements in occupied areas.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Cordial crowds and politicians who professed cautious optimism publicly  which they shade somewhat privately greeted Sargent Shriver yesterday on a curtailed New York, campaign tour.

title: Kissinger Begins Talks With Thieu in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Oct. 19Henry A. Kissinger and Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the new Army Chief of Staff, and four other American officials began intensive discussions with President Nguyen Van Thieu this morning in Saigon.

title: Scribner Gets Writ To End 3Day SitIn At Canarsie School
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner won a court injunction last night ordering two dozen Canarsie parents to end their sitin at John Wilson Junior High School that has kept the Brooklyn scohol closed for the last three days.

title: Advertising: Samples at Movies
description: There are a lot of companies around whose only function is to get samples of products into the hands of consumers.

title: Merger News
description: The managements of the Houston Natural Gas Corporation and the Pioneer Natural Gas Company announced yesterday agreement in principle to merge Pioneer into Houston Natural.

title: LEO G. CARROLL, ACTOR, 80, DEAD
description: Leo G. Carroll, the versatile Britishborn actor known to millions for his portrayals of Cosmo Topper in television's Topper series and as the spymaster Mr. Waverly on the Man from U.N.C.L.E. series, died after a long illness Monday at Presbyterian Hospital in Hollywood. He was 80 years old.

title: Rochester Girl. 18. Accused Of Killing Her Brother. 17
description: ROCHESTER, Oct. 18 (UPI) An 18yearold Rochester girl was charged with firstdegree manslaughter last night after she allegedly stabbed her younger brother to death during an argument over whether their family radio would be tuned to the World Series, the police said.

title: Rev. Ralph Gorman Dies: ExEditor of Sign Was 75
description: UNION CITY, N.J., Oct. 18The Rev. Ralph Gorman, C.P., author and former editor of The Sign, the national Roman Catholic magazine, died yesterday of a heart attack in Scranton, Pa. He was 75 years old.

title: Equity Financing
