description: Teledyne, Inc., yesterday announced it will accept all of the approximately 8.9 million common shares tendered in response to its offer to purchase its own stock at $20 per share. The offer expired Monday and the company said payment will be made as soon as practicable. The company's stock closed yesterday at 201/4, up 31/4 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Chinese Doctors on American Tour, Report Housewives DoortoDoor Campaign Has Cut Birth Rate
description: The birth rate in Shanghai, China's largest city, has declined sharply in recent years as a result of an intensive campaign in which housewives, trained as health workers, go from door to door with birth control information and five contraceptives.

title: Police Suspend Lieutenant For Alleged Link to Mafia
description: A 58yearold police lieutenant was suspended from the city force last night for allegedly associating with mobsters in a Canarsie junkyard trailer that Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold has identified as a secret Mafia meeting place.

title: Service for Vera M. Dean
description: A memorial service for Vera Micheles Dean, an authority on international affairs, who died Oct. 10, will be held at 2 P.M. today at the Tillman Chapel of the Church Center for the United Nations, 777 United Nations Plaza. Mrs. Dean served for 30 years as research director and editor of the Foreign Policy Association. Dean Dick Netzer of the New York University Graduate School of Public Administration will preside.

title: MINORITY JOB PLAN SET FOR CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 18 (AP)The United States Department of Labor announced today a new plan to employ almost 10,000 minoritygroup workers in the Chicagoarea construction industry by 1976.

title: ALIENATION HELD SPIRIT OF TODAY
description: Elizabeth Holtzman, who defeated Representative Emanuel Celler for the Democratic nomination in Brooklyn's 16th Congressional District, said yesterday that the public viewed this country's political system with contempt.

title: Rome Police Suspect Feud in Slaying
description: ROME, Oct. 18A police official hunting the men who shot and killed Weil Abdel Zuaiter, the Libyan Embassy clerk said to have been the top agent in Italy of Al Fatah, the Palestin: ian guerrilla organization, said today that his killing might have been a result of a feud between factions of Palestinians.

title: Sandusky Ducks Domres Query
description: It's hard to tell exactly what effect the dismissal of Dan McCafferty and the elevation of John Sandusky to the head coaching post will have on the Baltimore Colts until they come into Shea Stadium to face the New York Jets on Sunday, but meanwhile, Sandusky is making the most of a ticklish situation.

title: Cabby, Shot Twice, Dies After Hitting a Building
description: A gypsy cab driver died last night after he was shot and his cab crashed into a building under construction in Brooklyn, the police reported.

title: Pacers Beat Stars, 107103
description: Indianapolis, Oct. 18 (UPI)Mel Daniels scored from 10 feet out with 28 seconds remaining tonight to lead the Indiana Pacers to a 107403 victory over the Utah Stars in to American Basketball Association contest.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Inmate in a Wheel Chair Escapes Bellevue Hospital
description: A 26yearold inmate in wheel chair, wearing a hospital gown and with an intravenous bottle attached to his arm, has escaped from Bellevue Hospital, the Corrections Department disclosed yesterday.

title: BRISTOL IS SELECTED TO MANAGE PHILLIES
description: OAKLAND, Calif., (AP)Dave Bristol has been selected as manager of the Philadelphia Phillies, the Associated Press learned today.

title: San Diego Paper for Nixon
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Oct. 18 (AP)The San Diego Evening Tribune, a member of the Copley group, endorsed President Nixon's reelection bid today, describing him as the candidate best qualified to tie up the loose ends in Southeast Asia.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: Letters on the Presidential Race

title: ES, AND RUSSIANS SIGN AGREEMENTS TO WIDEN TRADE
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 18The United States and the Soviet Union reached agreement today on a sweeping trade package that includes payment by the Russians of $722million in World War II LendLease debts and the extension by President Nixon of Governmentbacked credits for sales to Moscow.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, N. J., Oct. 18The state police will send a new tactical patrol unit into Warren County tomorrow to help the area cope with a rapidly rising crime rate as it changes from a sparsely settled agricultural sector into suburbia.

title: Norman Mailer Asks Correction of Quote
description: Norman Mailer, the author, said yesterday that he had been quoted incorrectly in an account of his objections to publication of a novel by Alan Lelchuk that depicts an intellectual named Norman Mailer being shot dead.

title: Jimmy Bostwick Enlarges Lead in Open Court Tennis
description: James F. C. Bostwick defeated his older brother, G. H. (Pete) Bostwick Jr., three sets to one, for the second time in three days and drew within one set of supplanting him as the world open court tennis champion yesterday at the New York Racquet and Tennis Club.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: When a Democrat for Nixon says I'll vote holding my nose, but McGovern is not a big enough man to be President, or I don't like him, but there is no viable alternative, or an uncommitted Democrat says McGovern doesn't turn me on, such remarks are liberalese for I'm doing alright the way things are, and can't take a risk of any change in the status quo.

title: EMERSON VICTOR OVER STILWELL
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 18 (UPI)  Roy Emerson of Australia advanced to the quarterfinals of the $50,000 Rothman's tennis tournament with a 60, 67, 61 victory over Graham Stilwell of, Britain.

title: Lavine Says Relief Ineligibility Rate Could Be Higher Than City Reported
description: The State Social Services Commissioner, Abe Lavine, disclosed yesterday that New York City had classified as indeterminate 7.3 per cent of the cases in its latest report on welfare family eligibility, leaving them out of its count of ineligibility.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: Senator McGovern made a good presentation of his foreign policy on television Oct. 11. However, it is obvious that he is caught up in his own idealism. I wish the world would conduct itself according to the JudeoChristian ethic as McGovern seems to assume it does. If we can hardly live up to it here, what hope has the Communist world?

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: TAMPA, Fla., Oct. 18About 60 telephone calls were made from the phone of Donald Segretti or with his credit card this spring and summer to two young Floridians now serving as Republican campaign managers.

title: Oakland Symphony Zeroes In for Instrument Landing
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 18Oakland began as a nest of squatters trespassing on the rancho of Don Vicente Peralta about 120 years ago, and ever since then the city has been looking over its shoulder as if eviction were imminent. This civic attitude of apprehension mixed with guilt was in evidence today as residents apologized for yesterday's cloudburst, which drowned out the first World Series game ever scheduled for the East Bay area, and quaked over the possibility of another flood this evening.

title: Saigon Publisher Gets 5 Years, $75,000 Fine
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 18 (Agence France  Press) The harshest penalty for violation of the press code was imposed yesterday on a Saigon publisher by a military court.

title: Lovely and Wise Heroine Summoned to Help the Feminist Cause
description: As lovely as Aphrodite as wise as Athenawith the speed of Mercury and the strength of Herculesshe is known only as WONDER WOMAN.

title: HotLine Shows in Canada Play Role in Campaign
description: TORONTO, Oct. 18Besides the rounds of crosscountry traveling, the formal speeches and the Main Street handshaking, the leaders in Canada's election campaign have a political obligation that President Nixon and Senator George McGovern do not shareappearances on openline radio and television programs.

title: CITY IS PLANNING TO ADD 25 NURSES
description: The city's Commissioner of Health said yesterday that his agency was hiring 25 new public health nurses to rectify shortage so severe it has left half of the schools in one Bronx district without any nursing service since September.

title: Stage: From Madrid, Lorca's Yerma
description: Of all Federico Garcia Lorca's tragedies of blood and honor, it was Yerma, that story of fertility and sterility, that parable of life and death, that I have always found the most difficult to comprehend. Always, that is, until last night, when, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the Nuria Espert Company from Madrid opened a very brief season of the play, in the staging by Victor Garcia that has understandably won plaudits from all over the world.

title: Business Briefs
description: Harold D. Uris, the builder, has signed a contract sell the land and two office buildings on the square block bounded by Lexington and Third Avenues between 46th and 47th Streets. The sale price was understood to $50million.

title: Chess: Can the Russians Find a Star That Will Outshine Fischer?
description: The Soviet Union badly wants to recover the world chess championship it held for 24 years before the brilliant Bobby Fischer took it from Boris Spassky in their match in Iceland. Even now, it seems impossible to name a more promising challenger than Spassky for Fischer's crown. Yet the chances are that Fischer would sock it to him harder the second time around.

title: Books of The Times
description: MUSEUMS AND WOMEN AND OTHER STORIES. By John Updike. 282 pages Knopf. $6.95.

title: Leaders Meet on Eve Of Market Conference
description: PARIS, Thursday, Oct. 19 (Agence FrancePresse)European leaders met privately among themselves and with their French hosts last night on the eve of the conference of leaders of the enlarged European Economic Community.

title: LEAFS RALLY TOPS PENGUINS, 4 TO 3
description: TORONTO, Oct. 18 (UPI)Norm Ullman and Denis Dupere scored within a 33second span in the second period tonight to pace the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 43 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Reds Win, 10, on 3Hitter, A's Now Lead Series, 21
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 18The Cincinnati Reds finally revived in the third game of the World Series tonight and scored a 10 victory over the Oakland A's behind the threehit pitching of Jack Billingham and Clay Carroll. Only seven hits were made in the game, all singles, and none of the three scrounged by Oakland even left the infield. The only time anybody bunched as many as two in one inning came in the seventh, when Tony Perez and Cesar Geronimo did the bunching for the only run of the night.

title: Business Briefs
description: ROTTERDAM, Oct. 18 (Reuters)A court revoked seizure order today on a cargo of Chilean copper aboard a West German freighteronly to reimpose it following a request by lawyers for the Americanowned Braden Kennecott Corporation.

title: President, in Shift, Plans Weekend Speech on Radio
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (AP) The White House said today that President Nixon would make the third in his series of paid political radio broadcsts over the weekend, rather than tomorrow, as indicated earlier.

title: CONGRESS QUITS AFTER OVERRIDING WATER BILL VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The Democraticcontrolled 92d Congress adjourned today after a final defiant encounter with President Nixon on the spending issue.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 19  More than $92million in Federal funds have been awarded to the state in the last 10 years for Manpower Development and Training Act projects sponsored by the New Jersey State Training and Employment Service.

title: American's Profits Fall
description: Sharply improved thirdquarter earnings were reported yesterday by Trans World Airlines, while American Airlines reported sharply reduced earnings for the same period.

title: Extortionist Misinformed
description: DALLAS, Oct. 18 (AP)The police reported that an attempted extortion at the Village Bank failed today. A switchboard operator said she had received a call from a man demanding $10,000 for the safe return of the wife of a bank vice president. That particular vice president is not married.

title: RIYERA CASE STIRS CRITICISM OF A.B.C.
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union yesterday came to the defense of Gerald() Rivera, the WABCTV reporter who was reprimanded by his employers last weekend for making partisan political speeches on behalf of Senator George McGovern.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: I heartily commend you on your recent endorsement of the candidacy of Senator George McGovern for President.

title: It's MushroomHunting TimeAnd a Time for Renewed Caution
description: In the city, rain makes puddles. In the woods, it makes mushrooms spring up through the autumn leaves, providing free and very special food for the cook who knows what to look for.

title: Appliance Shipments Rise
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 18 (UPI) September shipments of home appliances were up 7 per cent from a year ago to 2.46 million units, the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers reported today. Thirdquarter shipments were up 11 per cent to 7.76 million units, and for the nine months they were up 10 per cent to 23.76 million. However, sales of air conditioners in September were down 31 per cent from a year ago and sales of home washers were off 4 per cent.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., Oct. 18The marquee explains Embassy Hall: Bingo seven days a week. Occasionally, it even mentions the third Thursday of the month, the night Embassy Hall becomes New Jersey's only boxing arena.

title: Praise for Train Commuters
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 18 (AP)  Commuters coming in by train to the Reading Terminal were congratulated today by a group of 9yearold pupils, who thanked them for not driving smogproducing cars instead. Their teacher, Kathleen Smith of Ryclal Elementary School in Abington, said her charges are very conscious of pollution problems.

title: Piaget Sees Science Dooming Psychoanalysis
description: Jean Piaget the Einstein of child psychology, flew in from Geneva Tuesday and gently shook up an admiring throng of specialists at the City University of New York.

title: Eastern College Football
description: Ed Farrell, a 38yearold former Rutgers end who is in his third season as the head football coach at the University of Bridgeport, is happy but fatalistic about his team's 15game winning streakthe longest current string in college football.

title: Mrs. McGovern Fatigued Campaign Plans Canceled
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 18 (UPI) Mrs. George McGovern was taken ill again tonight and canceled plans to resume campaigning in Ohio, Pennsylvania and New York with her husband. Campaign aides said she was suffering from fatigue and a headache.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 18 (AP)The New Jersey Labor Department sail today that beginning Nov. 3 unemployed workers in the state would lose the opportunity to collect 13 additional weeks of jobless benefits.

title: City Teacher Pensions Called Unacceptably High
description: Benefits offered to teachers under New York City's swollen pension system have reached an unacceptably high cost to taxpayers, the Fleischmann Commission has concluded.

title: 2 PLEAD GUILTY HERE IN FIAT PAYOFF CASE
description: Two business executives pleaded guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to participation in a fraudulent scheme to pay off a purchasing agent for the Fiat Corporation.

title: Riessen Conquers Alexander by 76, 63
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 18 (AP)  Sixthseeded Marty Riessen got strong competition from young John Alexander of Australia on the way to a 76, 63 victory over his unneeded opponent in the first round of the Rothman's $50,000 international tennis tournament yesterday.

title: No End Seen for Newark's Fiscal Crisis
description: TRENTON, Oct. 18  New Jersey legislative leaders reported today that the city of Newark was facing a financial crisis that next month's legislative session might be unable or unwilling to resolve.

title: Removal of Fuentes Supporters From Local Unit Asked in Suit
description: A suit has been filed in State Supreme Court seeking the removal of five of the nine members of the controversial Community School Board 1, which is under fire from Jewish social action groups for having hired Louis Fuentes as district superintendent.

title: McNamara Asks Direct Poverty Attack
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 18Robert S. McNamara, presddent of the World Bank, told the Economic and Social Council today that hundreds of millions of people in the world were faced with daytoday deprivations that degrade human dignity to levels which no statistics can adequately describe.

title: Racial Fight Shuts Schools
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C., Oct. 18 (AP) The Asheville City School Board closed all public schools Ifor the remainder of the week today after fighting broke out between whites and blacks at two schools. Eight pupils were reported injured, none seriously, officials said. The cause of the trouble was not known.

title: Theater: The Bourgeois Gentleman
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 18 It the opening minutes of the Yale Repertory Theater's first production of the season, The Bourgeois Gentleman, a portrait of Moliere is removed from the stage. Following this act of discretion there is an act of indiscretion. The Bourgeois Gentleman is removed from the stage.

title: CONGRESS QUITS AFTER OVERRIDING WATER BILL VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The Democraticcontrolled 92d Congress adjourned today after a final defiant encounter with President Nixon of the spending issue.

title: 29 JuniorHigh Students From Brownsville Learn a Harsh Lesson on a Bus
description: Some of the 29 black junior high school students waiting in the chilly, halfdarkness early yesterday morning had heard the phrases racial balance and school busing on television, but did not know what they meant.

title: ARGENTINE BOMBINGS GO ON ACROSS NATION
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 18 (AP) Scores of bombs exploded across Argentina today in observance of a Peronist anniversary, but there were no reports of further casualties.

title: Housing Starts Showed A Decline for September
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 Housing starts declined in September to an annual rate of 2,352,000, the Commerce Department reported today. Activity diminished both for singlefamily houses and multipledwelling units.

title: Compromise Seen in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Oct. 18The communique issued at the end of Premier A;'iz Sidky's visit to Moscow is interpreted by diplomatic observers here as a compromise.

title: YEMEN CHIEF REPORTS A CEASEFIRE ACCORD,
description: SANA, Yemen, Oct. 18 (Reuters)Leaders of Yemen and Southern Yemen agreed today to a new ceasefire in their border fighting, Premier Mohsen alAini of Yemen announced.

title: Personalities: Nicklaus Is Going After a $300,000 Summit Year
description: Jack Nicklaus, seeking to become golf's first $300,000 moneywinner in a year, was among the competitors in the $150,000 Kaiser international tournament that began with a proamateur event yesterday in Napa, Calif., over soggy fairways. Nicklaus, who has won six tournaments and $280,482 in official earnings, was returning to competition for the first time in five weeks. He said that despite his long layoff he was tired. I just spent all day Monday walking around 36 holes in the mud and rain on the course I'm building in Columbus, Ohio. I don't know if I can get around here.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Presidential politics, for many of us, has become an area of life cordoned off by shock, grief and pain. Again and again in the past decade we have been touched and wounded by the political process as we had not been wounded before. It is not indifference but the numbness of mourning that lies behind the apparent apathy observers have noticed during the election campaign.

title: Scribner Gets Writ To End 3Day SitIn At Canarsie School
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner won a court injunction last night ordering two dozen Canarsie parents to end their sitin at John Wilson Junior High School that has kept the Brooklyn school closed for the last three days.

title: Music: Treger's Romantic Revival for the Violin
description: One thinks of recordings of the great romantic violinists of the pastSarasate, Kubelik, the young Elman and Heifetz, Vecsev. Kreislerthose heroes of bow and finger, extroverted, glorying in technique, proud to show it off, concentrating on the instrument more than the music, projecting Self as much as composer.

title: Dance: Marathon Debuts
description: Two highly interesting dance companies, each multiracial in membership and led by a black choreographer, shared the newest bill Tuesday night in the continuing American Dance Marathon, sponsored by the City Center at the ANTA theater.

title: Segretti Apparently Tried To Join McGovern's Drive
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 18A young lawyer who has been linked to an alleged campaign of political espionage against the Democrats apparently volunteered to work for Senator George McGovern in the California ptimary last June.

title: FOES OF MALL PLAN PICKET AT WHITNEY
description: Several dozen pickets surrounded the Whitney Museum of American Art last night at the opening of its Frederick Law Olmsted show to protest the inclusion in rehabilitation plans for the Central Park Mall of what the demonstrators called an arena pit and the Parks Department calls a 10inch depression.

title: People and Business
description: The American Cyanamid Company, which hasn't had chairman for four and a half years since the retirement of John Allegaert, has one now. He is Clifford D. Siverd, 60, who moves up from president and continues as chief executive officer.

title: Canadian Output Is Down
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 18 (Reuters) Canada's index of industrial production fell 0.8 per cent in August from July to 192.3, Statistics Canada said today. The index has been falling since June, but the figure in August was up 3 per cent from a year earlier.

title: Business Briefs
description: DALLAS, Oct. 18 (AP)President Nixon was asked today to remove domestic crude oil price increase restrictions at the earliest practicable time.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President had a morning meeting with Japanese Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira. The President met with Soviet Trade Minister Nikolai S. Patolichev to discuss a trade agreement reached by the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Tams Gain First Victory
description: MEMPHIS, Oct. 18 (AP)The Memphis Tams used a balanced scorinc, attack to score their scoring first Basketball Association victory of the season tonight, beating the Dallas Chaparrals, 9989.

title: U.S. AND RUSSIANS SIGN AGREEMENTS TO WIDEN TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The United States and the Soviet Union reached agreement today on a sweeping trade package that includes payment by the Russians of $722million in World War II LendLease debts and the extension by President Nixon of Governmentbacked credits for sales to Moscow.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: Pity the poor youths of 1972.

title: JAILING OF NEWSMAN UPHELD IN MARYLAND
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 18 (AP)The Court of Appeals upheld yesterday the civil contempt citation of a Baltimore Evening Sun reporter who refused to tell a grand jury the name of a store in Ocean City where he had been offered marijuana.

title: SHARE PROFIT OF $65 REPORTED BY C.&N.W.
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 18 (AP) The Chicago & North Western Transportation Company, in its first full quarter of employe ownership, earned $65 a share, the railroad announced today.

title: Haverstraw Widow Killed In Plunge as Rescue Fails
description: HAVERSTRAW, N.Y., Oct. 18 (UPI)A 50yearold woman, reportedly distraught over the recent death of her husband, died after a plunge from a secondstory window of her home here last night.

title: Segretti Apparently Tried To Join McGovern's Drive
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 18A young lawyer who has been linked to an alleged campaign of political espionage against the Democrats apparently volunteered to work for Senator George McGovern in the California primary last June.

title: Common Market's Central, Bankers Discuss AntiInflation Steps
description: PARIS, Oct. 18The men, who manage the currencies of the nine countries of the enlarged European Common Market met today to discuss what they could do jointly to put the clamp on everrising prices in their countries.

title: AMERICAN ELECTRIC CITES PROFIT GAIN
description: The American Electric Power Company and subsidiaries reported yesterday new highs in earnings for the three and nine months ended Sept. 30.

title: U.S. and Soviet Astronauts Meet on Joint Manned Space Shot
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 18United States and Soviet astronauts have taken part for the first time in preparatory talks for the joint manned space mission scheduled for 1975.

title: Ruskin Studying Meal Bills Gross Reportedly Charged to City
description: City investigators are looking into restaurant bills reportedly running into thousands of dollars run up and charged to the city by Ted Gross, the former Youth Services Commissioner.

title: A Complex Art That Resulted in Worthy Furniture
description: Who but the 17thcentury American furniture buffs and amateur craftsmen could possibly be interested in an exhibition entitled The Art of Joinery?

title: Continental Can Sets WriteOff
description: The Continental Can Company announced yesterday a major redeployment of facilities, which it said would involve a writeoff of $120million after taxes.

title: Midwest Board Studying Continental Illinois Drop
description: The Midwest Stock Exchange is investigating trading over the last week in shares of the Continental Illinois Corporation, the parent company of Chicago's largest bank, officials of the exchange said yesterday.

title: ARGENTINIANS TAKE LEAD IN TEAM GOLF
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 18 (AP)Argentina took a threestroke lead today after the first round of the amateur men's team golf championship.

title: 5 BY 2 MAKES DEBUT AS DANCE SERIES DUO
description: New dances are a regular feature of Choreoconcert's enterprising series now entering its sixth season at the New School, but on Tuesday evening it also presented the debut of a tiny but energetic new company 5 by 2.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: With winter still weeks away, the first snowflakes of the season made an impromptu appearance in Central Park yesterday at 2:40 P.M. The National Weather Service reported very light rain mixed with a few light snow flurries, despite a ground temperature of 46 degrees.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: The Nixon Administration and its apologists frequently suggest that the crimes apparently committed at the Watergate should not be investigated further because there is a political motivation behind the inquiries.

title: Stars Douse Flames, 60
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 18 (UPI)Bill Goldsworthy and Dennis Hextall scored two goals each for Minnesota tonight and Cesare Maniago posted his first shutout of the season, 6.0, over the Atlanta Flames.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Judges in 10 countiesincluding Kings, Queens, Nassau and Westchesterwere added to the list of those who will work during the Christmas season. The move toward working during the holiday season was begun last week when the Appellate Division for the First Department revoked the traditional twoweek holiday for State Supreme Court justices in Manhattan and the Bronx. The latest additions affect the Second Department.

title: Nixon Meets Tokyo Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (AP) President Nixon told Japan's Foreign Minister, Masayoshi Ohira, today that the United States placed great importance on close consultation with Japan on the security situation in Asia. He gave this assurance, according to Ronald L. Ziegler, the Presidential press secretary, during a 50minute meeting at the White House in which Mr. Ohira reported on the recent visit to Peking by Premier Kakuei Tanaka.

title: State Bar Defends Dembitz Decision, But Shift in Rating Practices Is Urged
description: The State Bar Association is sticking to its rating of Judge Nanette Dembitz of the Family Court as not qualified at this time for the Court of Appeals, but may change its rating procedures for futdre elections.

title: Fleischmann Report Excerpts
description: From our studies and deliberations we conclude, first, that the financing of education in New York State, the major financial operation, indeed, of our state and local governments, is in serious disarray. The tax burdens on residents of different areas are highly uneven and discriminatory: they are so established that some localities, even when willing to make extraordinary effort, are unable to provide themselves with good quality educational services at the same time that their more fortunate neighbors are able to avail themselves of expensive programs at low local tax rate:

title: City Inspectors Are Training to Use Meter in Enforcing the New Antinoise Code
description: The sounds city inspectors will have to deal with intruded regularly yesterday as a dozen of the inspectors sat in an improvised'classroom learning the complex technical knowledge they will now need to enforce the new noise code that went into effect this month.

title: Credit Markets
description: The credit markets generated a wide variety of developments yesterday but still failed to break their recent pattern in which interest rates have edged gradually, almost imperceptibly, upward.

title: Smith, Nastase Gain
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 18 (AP) Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., beat Jose Garrero of Spain, 62, 62, today and advanced to the quarterfinals of the Spanish international tennis championships.

title: HIJACKING SUSPECT CAPTURED IN OREGON
description: ENTERPRISE, Ore., Oct. 18 (UPI) A Portland man accused of hijacking a private plane in McCall, Idaho, was captured today three miles north of this northeastern Oregon community.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports of changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The lists include the following:

title: Chilean Pact Prevents Spread Of Walkouts to Bus Transport
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 18The beleagured Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens kept a wave of protest strikes from spreading to public bus transport today, and armed military patrols escorted trucks carrying essential supplies through the country.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: FREEHOLD, Oct. 18  Two associates of Michael Manzo testified today that the contractor had told them he paid 10 big ones to the Republican party in New Jersey in 1970 to have bids on a $600,000 highway contract thrown out so he could submit new bids.

title: Whalers Defeat Aeros, 41, As Webster Gets 3 Goals
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 18 (UPI)Tom Webster scored three goals tonight as the New England Whalers overpowered the Houston Aeros, 4.1, in a World Hockey Association contest.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 18 (AP) Frank Markoe Sibley Jr., who said be commandered a United Air Lines jet Aug. 18 to protest the Vietnam war, was found guilty today of air piracy.

title: Manescu Relieved As Foreign Minister In Rumania Shuffle
description: VIENNA, Oct. 18 (Reuters)Corneliu Manescu has been released from his post as Rumania's Foreign Minister, the Rumanian press agency Agerpres reported today from Bucharest.

title: CRIME STUDY SEES HIGH ARREST RATIO
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 18A comprehensive study by three University of Pennsylvania criminologists indicates that one of every three boys born in Philadelphia in 1945 was arrested at least once before he was 19 years old.

title: WILLIAM MAKEPEACE
description: NORWALK, Conn., Oct. 18William H. Makepeace, former president of the New Canaan Bar Association, died Monday at Norwalk Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 22 Mill Road, New Canaan.

title: BirthCurb Pill for Men Being Tested by Doctors
description: A new method of birth control involving yearlong pills for men was described yesterday to visiting doctors from China, whose own scientists have pioneered methods to put a lid on the population explosion, The Associated Press reported.

title: 2 OFFICIALS ON L.I. AGREE TO TESTIFY
description: ISLIP, L. I., Oct. 18A deputy Suffolk County attorney and a town official said here today that they would testify before a Brooklyn grand jury under a waiver of immunity after having been subpoenaed in the investigation into Mafia activities.

title: JACOB M. GORDON
description: Jacob M. Gordon, a member of the City's Board of Assessors from 1962 to 1964 and a former Eastern representative of the Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen, died Tuesday night of a heart attack at his home in Forest Hills, Queens. He was 70 years old.

title: Bombing Study Not Closed. Stennis Tells the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (AP) Senator John Stennis, chairman of the Armed Services Committee, formally asked the Pentagon today to explain its plans for followup action in the wake of the panel's inquiry into unauthorized bombings of North Vietnam.

title: MURRAY TAYLOR, 76, LAWYER AND PIANIST
description: COBALT, Conn., Oct. 18Murray Taylor, retired New York lawyer and concert pianist, died today of cancer at Middlesex Memorial Hospital, Middletown. He was 76 years old.

title: An Advocate of Change Seeks U.S. Olympic Job
description: Six years ago, Robert J. Kane told a meeting of the United States Olympic Committee board of directors that playing national anthems for goldmedal ceremonies was in poor taste.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: ISSUES 1972
description: CLEVELANDWhat is it that gives one such an eerie feeling about the 1972 Presidential election? The choosing of a President should be a joyous, exultant event in our selfgoverning society, the very epitome of democracy.

title: First Pennsylvania Reports 11.4% Rise In Operating Income
description: The First Pennsylvania Corporation, the parent company of the First Pennsylvania Banking and Trust Company and several other consumerfinance, mortgagefinance and investment  managment subsidiaries, reported yesterday, that its operating earnings in, the third quarter rose 11.4 per cent to $9.8million, or 78 cents a share, from $8.6million, or 70 cents a share, in the yearearlier period.

title: Black Activist Given 34 Years On Carolina Disorder Charges
description: BlIRGAW. N. C., Oct. 18 (UPI) Ben Chavis, a black activist was given sentences of up to 34 years in prison today after being convicted of charges stemming from racial disorders in Wilmington last year.

title: Columbia Sets Up Taxi Service To 125th Street Rail Station
description: Columbia University has established a shuttle car service between its Morningside Heights campus and the railroad station at 125th Street and Park Avenue in reaction to the murder of a professor who was walking to the terminal four weeks ago.

title: PHILIPPINE PRELATES PROTEST TO MARCOS
description: A letter to President Ferdinand E. Marcos of the Philippines from 16 Roman Catholic archbishops and bishops there expressing alarm over his imposition of martial law was made public here yesterday by the Rev. Joseph A. O'Hare, associate editor of America, a Jesuit publication.

title: TV: The Explorers Is a Benefit of Access Rule
description: Opponents of the Federal Communications Commission's primetime access rule, which transferred programing control of a halfhour nightly from the networks to their affiliates, are fond of pointing out that the rule has done little or nothing to improve the quality of television fare. Its most noticeable accomplishment has been a new regurgitation of old game shows.

title: LocalGovernment Expert To Direct Charter Panel
description: The Temporary State Charter Commission for New York City has selected Louis Lauer, a recognized nonpartisan expert in the workings of local government, to be its general counsel and executive director, City Hall sources said yesterday.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: May I congratulate you on your lead editorial of Oct. 11 McGovern and Vietnam. While James Reston weakly laments the Vietnam alternatives which the two Presidential candidates present to usNixon's endless and heartless continuing of the war, and, echoing Administration propagandists, McGovern's policy of surrenderyou courageously call for an affirmative national response to Senator McGovern's moving statement of the moral issue of the war.

title: A Massage Parlor With Many Extras Is Raided by Police
description: An East Side massage parlor that offers its clientele color TV, sauna baths and bubbling champagne, rubdowns by lovely togaclad girls, and perhaps more than thatall in an ambiance that strives for Romanic luxurywas raided by police early yesterday morning.

title: MISS SANDERS SINGS WITH A CHEERY ELAN
description: Felicia Sanders, who was singing songs by Jacques Brel long before most. Americans were aware that he was alive and well and living anywhere, is back in town at the Rainbow Grill. And, as usual, she has a Brel tidbit or two in her reper tory; although times having changed, they are now the familiar elements in her program rather than the discovery they once seemed.

title: MARKET EXTENDS ITS LATEST RALLY
description: The stock market moved higher yesterday, extending a trading rally that caught fire Tuesday.

title: HEALTH VIOLATORS ARE LISTED BY CITY
description: The foodprocessing establishments, including nine restaurants, were cited yesterday by the Health Services Administration for failing to correct violations of the Health Code after two inspections.

title: HANOI DELEGATION IN PARIS SAYS U.S. IS INTRANSIGENT
description: PARIS, Oct. 18North Vietnam's delegation to the Vietnam peace talks said at a news conference here today that the Nixon Administration's position remains erroneous and intransigent.

title: CleanWater Bill Is Law Despite President's Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The Senate and House representatives overrode today President Nixon's veto of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act of 1972, which thus becomes law and authorizes $24.6billion over three years to clean up the nation's lakes and rivers.

title: Seoul's Military Chiefs Back President
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 18 Major commanders of South Korea's 600,000man armed forces held an emergency meeting here today and pledged to support fully the imposition of martial law announced yesterday by President Park Chung Hee.

title: Teamsters and Builders Agree; Only One Union Still on Strike
description: One of the last two of 13 strikes that have held up $2billion worth of construction here since July 1 was settled yesterday as the teamsters Local 282 reached an agreement with members of the Building Trades Employers Association.

title: REA Express Strike Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (UPI) The head of the Railway Clerks Union said today that, there would be a nationwide strike beginning at midnight tomorrow if a contract is not reached before then with REA Express.

title: SOVIET EXIT FEES WAIVED FOR SOME
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 18  Nineteen Jewish families in Moscow were unexpectedly given permission today to emigrate to Israel without paying the heavy exit visa fees that Soviet auauthorities have required of emigrants since midAugust.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18If President Nixon is reelected he is going to get those bums on welfare.

title: FRANCIS C. ROSSI
description: HAMDEN, Conn., Oct. 18Francis C. Rossi, a founder in 1931 and former president ofl the old Community Bank and Trust Company here, died yesterday in a convalescent home. He was 89 years old. When the bank was merged with the Second National Bank of New Haven in 1961, Mr. Rossi became chairman of that institution's advisory board.

title: HUNT NARROWED FOR BOGGS PLANE
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Oct. 18The search for the missing plane carrying the House Democratic leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, and three others centered tonight on fogshrouded Peril Strait in southeast Alaska and Portage Pass near Anchorage.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18Nearly half the $1.8million reported cost of the Republican National Convention earlier this year was paid for by defense contractors, other large corporations doing business with the Government, and businesses regulated by Federal agencies, according to a financial disclosure statement required by law and filed here by the Republicans today.

title: Florida A.F.L.C.I.O. Votes Endorsement of McGovern
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Oct. 18 (AP)George McGovern, the Democratic Presidential nominee, and his running mate, Sargent Shriver, were endorsed today by the Florida A.F.L.C.I.O.

title: MOST ISSUES GAIN IN OTC TRADING
description: The overthecounter market posted its best performance in weeks yesterday as most issues advanced in steppedup trading. The NASDAQ industrial index rose 0.93 to 125.33, its biggest daily gain since Sept. 27 when it gained 1.80.

title: American Cyanamid Lifts Net; Smith, Kline and Ethyl in Gains
description: The American Cyanamid Company reported yesterday that its net income for the third quarter totaled $24.4million, or 50 cents a share, compared with $19.4million, or 40 cents a share a year ago.

title: ANTIWAR EXG.I.'S INDICTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 (AP) A Federal grand jury accused seven members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War and another man of conspiring to attack police officers and station houses with automatic weapons, fire bombs and other devices in Miami last August, the Justice Department announced today.

title: Billie Holiday Fans Turn Out for Film Premiere and Benefit Fete
description: The supper party after the Lady Sings the Blues premiere the other night was a subway crush of black and white biggies in pursuit of food, drink and each other.

title: G.O.P. LEADER TO RUN FOR HUGHES'S SEAT
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Oct. 18Madison and Onondaga County Republican party leaders today selected Martin S. Auer as the nominee for tsate snator in the 49th District.

title: Screen: Billie Holiday:'Lady Sings the Blues' Stars Diana Ross
description: "Lady Sings the Blues," the first of what threatens to be a series of so-called entertainments based on the life and hard times of the late, truly great Billie Holiday, poses a tough question: How is it possible for a movie that is otherwise so dreadful to contain such a singularly attractive performance in the title role?It's not as if Diana Ross floats above the film, always remaining somehow disconnected from it, in that superior way that some actors affect when they find themselves in the vicinity of garbage. The former lead singer of the Supremes is on-screen from start to finish, which is to say almost endlessly, but her only apparent limitations are those imposed on her by a screenplay and direction seemingly designed to turn a legitimate legend into a whopper of a clich.Sidney J. Furie, the director and the three people credited with the screenplay, cannot use the basic truth of their facts as a defense of the film, although the facts have been generalized to protect the innocent (and the people who wouldn't give releases to the producers). They've made trite and meaningless such things as the child rape, indentured servitude in a Harlem whorehouse and an addiction to drugs that eventually contributed to Lady Day's death at age 44. It all becomes ridiculous.Witness the way they introduce one of Miss Holiday's most successful songs. Time: late 1930's. Place: somewhere in the South, though the terrain looks like Lake Tahoe. Miss Holiday is on a big-band bus tour when she suddenly finds herself witnessing a lynching. She staggers back in terror. On the soundtrack we hearcan it be?it sounds familiar, but yetyes, it is! The opening bars of "Strange Fruit!" This Billie Holiday has what might be called a prescient ear.Under such imbecilic circumstances, it's not yet possible to tell whether Miss Ross is a good actress, but she's an actress of exceptional beauty and wit, who is very much involved in trying to make a bad movie work.Most important, her singing of the more than a dozen songs once sung by Miss Holiday is a talented, very intelligent singer's homage to a jazz style of a sophistication never, since matched by anyone. "Them There Eyes," "What a Little Moonlight Can Do," "Fine and Mellow"almost all of the great Holiday numbers are there (except, if I remember correctly. "Billie's Blues") and they are about as good as you can get, barring the real things.At times, they may even match the real things, at least some of those numbers Billie recorded late in her career when the phrasing was all that was left of a voice that had once had the kind of purity and assurance that could turn the seedy old Onyx Club on 52d Street into a shoe-box shaped center of the performing arts."Lady Sings the Blues" opened yesterday at the Loew's State 1 and Loew's Orpheum Theaters.

title: OFFICER APPOINTED TO TOP KENTON POSTS
description: Lorence A. Silverberg, former president of the McCroryMcLellanGreen stores division of the McCrory Corporation, has been named chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Kenton Corporation.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 18 (AP)Seven members of the Minnesota North Stars hockey team have beeh arrested at an Atlanta lounge on charges ranging from public drunkenness to creating a turmoil.

title: Sports of The Times
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 18John (Blue Moon) Odom has not been sleeping well the past few nights. Nominated to be the starting pitcher for the Athletics in the third game of the World Series, he already has found the rain postponement gravely distressing.

title: Teachers Union Is Neutral
description: Rankandfile members of the United Federation of Teachers decided yesterday not to support either major candidate in the 1972 Presidential campaign, according to United Press International. Approximately 50 per cent of the Union's 72,000 members were polled in the eightday referendum. Of the total, 15.565 were in favor of endorsing either Senator George McGovern or President Nixon but 21.181 felt that the union should take no position.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WEST PATERSON, N. J., Oct. 18 (AP)Governor Cahill said today that Federal revenue sharing would give the state a fighting chance to present a balanced budget next year without the need for new or increased taxes. He told the Passaic County Republican organization here that although we have practiced every possible economy, we do not know yet whether we will be able to balance the budget without new taxes in the face of builtin mandatory increases in costs.

title: Named as Suspects in Mob Slaying
description: Two men described as members of organized crime were named by the state police yesterday as suspects in the slaying of Carlo Lombardo, whose body was found alongside Route 17 near Monticello last summer.

title: Fleischmann Panel Urges Family Voice on Schools
description: A farreaching reorganization of the way public schools in New York City and the state are runto give parents the power to select principals and families the opportunity to choose which schools the children should attendwas proposed yesterday by the Fleischmann Commission on education.

title: Lindsay to Press Utilities In Drive to Fix Potholes
description: Mayor Lindsay vowed yesterday to bring an awful lot of pressure to bear on utilities, because, he said, they are failing to do an adequate repaving job on streets they tear up for underground installations or repairs.

title: Steinkraus Victor in Jumping; U.S. Lead Grows at Penn Show
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 18 The last was first tonight when the international jumping ended at the 27th annual Pennsylvania National horse show.

title: RECAPITALIZING PLAN OF CURTIS IS BACKED
description: Holders of more than 75 per cent of the 6 per cent subordinated debentures of Curtis Publishing Company have approved a recapitalization plan that may rescue the company from its financial troubles by erasing $11.5mililon of dividend arrearage on preferred stock and $2.5million of deferred interest on debentures, it was announced.

title: CITY SEWER BILLS ARE HELD ILLEGAL
description: A State Supreme Court justice has ruled invalid a City Charter section under which property owners have paid an estimated total of $185million in the last 10 years for streets and sewers.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The essence of the Administration's recent counterattack to charges that some of President Nixon's assistants created or at least condoned a network of political espionage and disruption has been to denounce the charges and the newspapers that print them without explicitly discusing or denying the charges. Behind this strategy lie two assumptions that tell much about the Administration's perceptions of the voters and the newspapers that serve them. Judging by recent interviews with Mr. Nixon's aides, these assumptions seem to be widely shared in his inner circle.

title: Freedoms Fund Elects 4
description: VALLEY FORGE, Pa., Oct. 18 (AP)The Freedoms Foundation here has elected four New York men to its Council of Trustees, Gen. Harold K. Johnson, the president, announced today. They were Frank R. Barnett, Col. James W. Gerard, James R. Withrow Jr. and Charles Wohlstetter.

title: Drexel Declines Comment
description: Archie E. Albright, president of Drexel Firestone, Inc., member firm of the New York Stock Exchange, declined yesterday to confirm or deny reports of merger negotiations between his firm and Shields & Co. He described the reports as exaggerated.

title: Market Place: Under Pressure Amex Specialist
description: Here's the diary of an American Stock Exchange specialist on a day to remember. On Tuesday just before noon, the specialist was suddenly offered in excess of 10.000 shares of the Shulman Transport Enterprise3.

title: ORLANDO WILSON OF CHICAGO POLICE
description: POWAY, Calif. Oct. 18 (AP), Orlando W. Wilson, who reinforced a worldwide reputation in criminology by cleaning up the Chicago Police Department after a burglary scandal, died of a stroke at his home here today. He was 72 years old.

title: 2 Shows Celebrate Olmsted's Talent
description: If the two major exhibitions running concurrently at New York's Whitney Museum and the National Gallery in Washington do not establish the protean talent of Frederick Law Olmsted, Charlton Heston will have to play him. Frederick Law Olmsted's New York opens at the Whitney today and Frederick Law Olmsted, U.S.A. opens at the National Gallery on Saturday. The New York show will run through Dec. 3, and the Washington show through Jan. 7. After that a combined version will he circulated for two years by the American Federation of Arts, cosponsors with the Olmsted Sesquicentennial Committee, which has sparked a yearlong celebration of Olmsted's birth.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18The Price Commission has Issued subpoenas to two more companies, the Medford Corporation and the Santiam Lumber Company, requiring that their presidents testify at the commission's hearing tomorrow on lumber prices.

title: Harry Heher, ExJersey Justice And Democratic Chairman, Dies
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J., Oct. 18 (AP)  Harry Heher, a former State Supreme Court Justice and chairman of the New Jersey State Democratic Committee, died yesterday at the Morris Hall Health and Rehabilitation Center here. He was 83 years old.

title: Fairfield in Polo Semifinal
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 18The Greenwich Pitchforks, with a fatherson combination, will meet the Fairfield County Hunt Club's B team tomorrow night in the semifinal round of the Sherman Memorial indoor fivegoal polo tournament at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club. Adie Von Gontard Jr., and his son, Adie 3d, will team with Frank Mortimer for the Pitchforks. Clint Vogel, Bob Sturzbecker and George Hass will play for Fairfield.

title: House Contest
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Oct. 18Judging by the billboards, radio and television commercials and what the political experts are saying, all of Indiana this fall seems awash with love for Richard Nixon and the Republican party.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: George McGovern promised, in the primaries, to run a campaign on the issues. And he did, setting forth clear positions on total Vietnam withdrawal, a $1,000 per person welfare program, amnesty for those who refused to fight in Vietnam, and greater individual freedoms (legalization of marijuana and abortion). Regretfully, however, as soon as he got the Presidential nomination, McGovern began changing these positions, equivocating and hedging on previously clear positions. Finally he gave up altogether campaigning on the issues (which had admittedly grown very blurred and amorphous), and has now turned to a straightout personal assault on Mr. Nixon. Using the most extreme and emotional rhetoric, McGovern is concentrating all his anger on the person of the President, rather than on his record. McGovern has descended from the issues to a lowroad campaign of false charge and smear. It is an unpleasant spectacle, and one that ultimately can only hurt McGovern.

title: No End Seen for Newark's Fiscal Crisis
description: TRENTON. Oct. 18  New Jersey legislative leaders reported today that the city of Newark was facing a financial crisis that next month's legislative session might be unable or unwilling to resolve.

title: Police Suspend Lieutenant For Alleged Link to Mafia
description: A 58yearold police lieutenant was suspended from the city force last night for allegedly associating with mobsters in a Canarsie junkyard trailer that Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold has identified as a secret Mafia meeting place.

title: Letters on the Presidential Race
description: To the Editor: Your Oct. 1 editorial arguing for McGovern on the basis of leadership capacity was far from reality. I found myself looking for some tongueincheek aspect.

title: Spending for the Future
description: The President's attempt to get Congress to yield him the authority to cut the budget in any way he saw fit to hold it under a $250billion ceiling has fortunately failed.

title: RALLY BY COUGARS DOWNS COLONELS
description: LOUISVILLE, Oct. 18 (AP)The Carolina Cougars, led by Billy Cunningham, overcame a 20point thirdquarter deficit tonight and beat the Kentucky Colonels, 105100, in an American basketball Association game. The victory was the fourth for the unbeaten Cougars.

title: In a Suburb of Paris, Kissinger in the Yard
description: CHOISYLEROI, France. Oct. 18 (UPI)Rene Joubaud, a retired factory worker, stood outside the front gate of his modest home at 13 Rue d'Arthe in this Paris suburbhe nodded toward the tightly shuttered house next door, No. 11, which is four blocks from the headquarters of the North Vietnamese delegation to the Paris peace talks.

title: Notes on People
description: If you have wondered what became of Austin J. Tobin following his retirement earlier this year as executive director of the Port of New York Authority, you might find it interesting that he has enrolled in the socalled Paunch Corps, said Charles H. Brown, vice president of the International Executive Service Corps. Mr. Brown said in an interview that Mr. Tobin, who retired after heading the Port Authority for 30 years, had completed Paunch Corps assignments to advise the ports of Taiwan and Singapore on how to improve and develop.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Owners of Cadillacs prefer President Nixon to Senator George McGovern 84 per cent to 11 per cent, but among Ford owners the margin in Mr. Nixon's favor drops to 67 to 20 per cent, a poll of car buyers indicated yesterday.

title: Trick Play. Produces Conflicting Statements
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 18 Like everything else ever since this World Series started, the trick play the A's sprung on the Cincinnati Reds in the eighth inning brought forth conflicting statements.

title: Rockets Down Squires
description: DENVER, Oct. 18 (UPI)Mary Roberts scored 27 points to lead the Denver Rockets to a 115109 American Basketball Association victory over the Vireinia Souires tonight.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, Oct. 18Senator George McGovern pledged here today to restore economic health to the nation through full employment and a philosophy that would put people first.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18Recalling President Nixon's earlier enthusiasm for debates by Presidential candidates, Senator George McGovern offered today to pay for national television time for a series of debates before the election, but Mr. Nixon turned him down.

title: G.E. to Build Virginia Plant
description: WINCHESTER, Va., Oct. 18 (AP)  General Electric announced plans today to build an electric lamp plant on a 126acre site at Kernstown, just south of Winchester. Cost of the land, building and equipment will total about $20million, G.E. said.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets 6at 3:30 P.M. on complaint by Senegal of Portuguese aggression.

title: Other Reports Issued
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, the nation's largest rubber fabricator, has excuecied a billion dollars in sales fur the second successive quarter, the company announced yesterday. The increase raised earnings for the third quarter and nine months to new highs.

title: Fischer's Mother: Busy Life Far From Chess
description: One of he current celebrities on the stump for Senator George McGovern is a blueeyed woman with closely cropped gray hair named Dr. Regina Pustan, who is campaigning, she says as a woman, a doctor and an American.

title: Scotto and Gedda Enliven Sonnambula
description: It is possible that as long as there are sopranos who can bring distinction to the title role of La Sonnambula the Bellini work will keep turning up in the repertory. It was revived by the Metropolitan Opera in a new production nine years ago for Joan Sutherland, and it was brought back again Tuesday night as a vehicle for Renata Scotto. She and her tenor, Nicolai Gedda, made it seem worthwhile.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 18Controversy over New Jersey's proposed $650million transtation bond issue heated up today.

title: College Course in Football
description: PROVO, Utah, Oct. 18 (AP)Utah Technical College is offering a fully credited course one night a week on how to understand football. The course, costing $13 and allowing one hour of credit, will deal with types of offensive plays, methods of defensive play and game strategy.

title: EGYPT'S PREMIER ENDS SOVIET TALK
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 18Premier Aziz Sidky of Egypt flew home today without any new public pledges of Soviet military or economic aid or a fixed date for a visit to Cairo by the Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid I, Brezhnev.

title: The Issues at Albany
description: Beyond the urgent necessity of democratizing the Legislature by reforming its obscurantist rules, as discussed on this page yesterday, there are many other significant issues on which New York legislative candidates ought to be required to state their position before Election Day.

title: In Hanoi, Topic Is War, Not Peace
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Oct. 18We must consider the front still nearer than peace, one senior Hanoi official said, apparently summing up the mood here at the moment.

title: Trailer. Dwellers Complain Of Rent Gouging in. Parks
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 16Trailer park dwellers, pinched by a serious space shortage created by the booming market in mobile homes, are complaining of rent gouging, dictatorial living regulations and exorbitant fees for moving into or out of a park.

title: Carpet Cleaner, 72, Slain In $10 Robbery of His Shop
description: The 72yearold operator of a carpet cleaning store in upper Manhattan was found bludgeoned to death early yesterday in the shop he had operated since 1934.

title: Operator of Trailer Park Sued by U.S. on Rentals
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI) The Government filed suit today against an operator of a California mobile home park for allegedly raising fees illegally and threatening to evict tenants who refused to pay them.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Democraticcontrolled Congress, which adjourned yesterday, never quite found its place in histcry as it alternated between confrontation and docility, between cooperation with and defiance of a Republican President.

title: WHAT DOES QUALITY LIFE INSURANCE
description: COST $100.000 Yearly Renewable & Convertible Term, annual premium, age 40. $383.00. EuII details, rates your age, call or have your agent call North Atlantic Life, Jericho, N.Y. (316) 9356900.

title: An Appraisal
description: It must seem extraordinary that among that remarkable group of great masters who have provided the decisive impulses to the literature of our time in the last halfcentury, only two Germans should have been given the Nobel Prize. Neither Rilke nor Hofmannsthal, neither Musil nor Broch were ever serious candidates; only Thomas Mann andthough a Swiss citizenHermann Hesse received the award.

title: Agnew Introduced at Rally By Indicted Union Leader
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Oct. 19 Vice President Agnew appeared at a Republican rally today with a labor leader indicted last week on charges of having misused union funds.

title: $8.6Million in Debentures Of Newberry Co. Turned In
description: Samuel Neaman, chairman and chief executive officer of the McCrory Corporation, announced yesterday that about 58.6million principal amount of 6 per cent convertible, subordinated debentures of the J. J. Newberry Company had been surrendered for exchange in response to McCrory's exchange offer. The offer, which, expired yesterday, had been made in connection with the Sept. 1 merger of Newberry and a McCrory subsidiary.

title: Park Said to Plan Changes To Extend Tenure in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 19President Park Chung Hee intends to revise the South Korean Constitution so that he may remain in power for at least another 12 years, wellplaced sources said today.

title: Five Killed in Car Chase
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 19 (UPI)Five members of a Palos Hills family were killed last night when their car was struck by car driven by a teenager who went through a red light while Cook County Sheriff's policemen were chasing him for ignoring an earlier red light. Killed were Sotoris Papadopoulos, 45 years old, his wife, Stella, 31; a son, Peter, 6: a son, Thomas, 8, and Mrs. Papaclopoulus's mother, Mrs. Athena Mantonanakis, 50.

title: Heinrich Boll Wins Nobel for Literature
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 19The 1972 Nobel Prize for Literature was awarded today to Heinrich Boll for his contribution to a renewal of German literature in the postwar era.

title: NORDIQUES RALLY TO BEAT WHALERS
description: BOSTON, Oct. 19 (AP)Renald Leclerc scored two consecutive goals in the final period, including the tiebreaker with 3 minutes 54 seconds remaining, as the Quebec Nordiques posted a 4.3 World Hockey Association victory over the previously unbeaten New England Whalers tonight.

title: MexicanAmerican Inspector
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 19 (AP)The Unitel States Customs Bureau has hired four Americans of Mexican descent as inspectors at the TijuanaSan Ysidro, Calif., border. It says 31 more will be hired. The hirings this week follow the recommendation of a Congressional committee that held hearings here in March investigating allegation of brutality by inspectors.

title: Accused Lieutenant Silent Pending Trial
description: The police lieutenant suspended Wednesday for allegedly tipping off mobsters that their Brooklyn trailer was bugged said yesterday that he could make no comment on the charges.

title: Habib Summoned to Saigon
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 19 The State Department said today that Philip C. Habib, the United States Ambassador to South Korea, had been summoned to Saigon to join Mr. Kissinger in his intensive talks with President Thieu.

title: DONALD F. AGNEW
description: Donald F. Agnew, who retired in 1968 as a buyer for F. W. Woolworth Company here, died Wednesday in Doctors Hospital, Sarasota, Fla. He was 65 years old and lived in Denville, N. J.

title: Mrs. McGovern Will Rest
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 19 (UPI)Senator George McGovern said today that his wife. Eleanor, was just exhausted and was breaking off her political campaign temporarily to get more rest.

title: Airline Losses Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI) In a financial report to the Civil Aeronautics Board, the nation's major airlines said today they may be facing another round of industry profits followed by losses.

title: U.S. JOB POLICIES FOR G.I.'S SCORED
description: MlNEOLA, L. I, Oct. 19A special and as yet unpublished report for the United States Department of Labor says that this country does not have a comprehensive policy or set of policies designed to deal with the employment problems of returning veterans, particularly during periods when these problems are the most pressing near the end of major military actions.

title: Short Interest on New York Stock Exchange Declined in Latest Month to the Lowest Level Since July 14
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange, a widely watched technical ingredient in the stock market outlook, fell 138.011 shares in the month ended Oct. 13, the Big Board reported yesterday. The decline was the second in two months and, according to sonic technical analysts, represented a negative factor in the outlook for share prices.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS In a symbolic sense this week's meeting of the nine government chiefs of Europemeaning the newly enlarged Common Marketshould represent a punctuation mark in contemporary progress. Perhaps it might serve as a semicolon in the sentence that began with the 1957 Treaty of Rome, banding together the Community's first sir members and leading into an unknown future.

title: SPACE ITEMS SALE IS STUDIED BY F.B.I.
description: LAMARQUE. Tex., Oct. 19 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Justice Department today were looking into the sale of space items and technical material relating to two Gemini space flights, spokesmen for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said.

title: SOVIET SIGNS DEAL FOR ARC FURNACES
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 19Representatives of the Soviet Union have signed a contract worth in excess of $15million with the SwindellDressler Company, a division of Pullman, Inc., that is reported to be the largest single order ever placed for electric arc furnaces.

title: Notes on People
description: According to the Adriatic coast legend, King Richard the Lionhearted of England was shipwrecked on an island off what is now Dubrovnik, Yugoslavia. According to dispatches from Dubrovnik yesterday, Queen Elizabeth II and her official party were blown a kiss by President Tito as they left Belgrade airport bound, they thought, for Titograd, the capital of the Republic of Montenegro.

title: PALMER, KNUDSON LEAD KAISER GOLF
description: NAPA, Calif., Oct. 19 (AP)Arnold Palmer, fighting one of the longest slumps of his long career, cut 6 strokes off par with a 66 and tied George Knudson for the firstround lead today in the $150,000 Kaiser International golf tournament.

title: NIXON VICTORY SEEN, BUT AS A PARADOX
description: The current Presidential popularity polls indicate that President Nixon is not very popular but is going to win by a landslide, presenting a startling paradox, James Reston, a vice president of The New York Times, said yesterday in an address at the annual luncheon of the Fifth Avenue Association.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.6 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 124.8 from 124.2 last week.

title: IMASUPER, $820, WINS AT AQUEDUCT
description: The Brookfield Farms Imasuper and Mrs. Stephen C. Clark Jr.'s Tap the Tree engaged in a duel worthy of a better setting, from the standpoint of weather and attendance, at Aqueduct yesterday. While a slim crowd of 13,589 customers looked on, in the quite uncomfortable, clammy atmosphere, the Brookfield campaigner prevailed, beating Tap, the Tree by a nose.

title: Real Growth of G.N.P. Drops to 5.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The national economy continued to grow strongly in the third quarter of this year, although at a markedly slower pace than in the second quarter, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A senior citizen for a long time, I must protest at the form enclosed with the September Social Security check. This form tells us that President Nixon signed into law a statute enacted by Congress increasing Social Security 20 per centbut it does not tell us that Mr. Nixon, a Republican President, was strongly in favor of and vigorously urged only a 5 per cent increase, and that the 20 per cent increase, which he fought, was passed by a Democratic Congress.

title: BIAGGI AND FIND CALLED IN INQUIRY
description: Representative Mario Biaggi of the Bronx and the man who preceded him in Congress, State Supreme Court Justice Paul A. Fino, have been questioned by Federal authorities about alleged abuses involving private immigration bills.

title: Foe Reoccupies 2 Hamlets Near Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Oct. 20  North Vietnamese troops reoccupied yesterday at least two hamlets near Saigon from which they had been driven earlier in the week.

title: A Tiny Life Is Saved
description: Last January a baby was born in a hospital 50 miles from New York City. Three She was placed in a portable incubator and rushed here, to one of the great medicalcenter members of the United Hospital Fund.

title: Business Briefs
description: ROTTERDAM. the Netherlands, Oct. 19 (Reuters)The President of the Rotterdam District Court ruled today that the Kennecott Copper Corporation should be allowed to seize a West German freighter in port here with disputed cargo of 1.250 tons of copper from Chile. A bailiff was sent to execute the order just as the ship was putting out to sea.

title: Memorial Service Today For Mrs. Metcalfe Walling
description: A memorial service will be held at 7:30 P.M. today at St. Matthew's Episcopal Church, Bedford, N. Y., for Mrs. Frances Slosson Holliday Walling, the wife of L. Metcalfe Walling, director for North Africa of the International Executive Service Corps.

title: POLITICIANS CITED IN MAFIA INQUIRY
description: A handful of Brooklyn political figures will be subpoenaed before a rackets grand jury as a result of evidence arising from the surveillance of a Brooklyn trailer identified as a clandestine Mafia meeting place, wellplaced informants said yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: LIMA. Peru, Oct. 19 (AP)A United States petroleum company and a Japanese consortium are negotiating with the Peruvian Government for exploration and development contracts in Peru's wild southeastern jungle, the state petroleum company. Petroperu, announced today.

title: 10 Defendants in Narcotic Case Interrupt Trial to Plead Guilty
description: Ten men and women accused of operating a major narcotics factory, where investigators seized 16,000 envelopes of heroin two years ago, interrupted their trial in State Supreme Court yesterday to plead guilty.

title: Boy, 16. Is Shot to Death In a South Jamaica Park
description: A 16yearold sophomore at John Adams High School in Queens was shot to death early yesterday while walking through Baisley Park in South Jamaica, Queens.

title: Manila Uprooting Thousands in Drive Against Guerrillas
description: CAUAYAN, the Philippines, Oct, 19The Philippine armed forces are uprooting thousands of villagers in a region through which small bands of guerrillas roam and moving the refugees to towns and villages securely in Government control.

title: COOP IS PROPOSED FOR FOREST HILLS
description: The controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, would be limited to veterans and the elderly and be made a lowincome cooperative under a proposal worked out by the Community Planning Board and supported by Borough President Donald R. Manes.

title: POUND BATTERED BY SELLING WAVE
description: LONDON, Oct. 19 (AP)The British pound was hit today by a wave of speculative selling that forced it down 1.8 United States cents to its lowest level in nearly two years.

title: Defense Begins Its Case in CourtMartial for Grenade Slayings in Vietnam
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Oct. 19After a twoweek delay, the defense began its case today in the courtmartial of Pvt. Billy Dean Smith, the 24yearold black draftee accused of killing two white officers in Vietnam.

title: Dubious Data
description: Will tomorrow's citizens be subject to difficulties in job placement, government benefits or the opening of routine charge accounts because of a minor peccadillo in their youth or an adolescent traffic arrest recorded a vast computerized databank somewhere? This is the issue confronted in a comprehensive study, Databanks in a Free Society, directed by the National Academy of Sciences.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP AS VOLUME EASES
description: Bausch & Lomb, a glamour favorite on Wall Street earlier this year, plummeted 8 points to 28 as the market's most active issue yesterday. This dramatized the overriding importance of earnings in a market that posted a modest overall decline.

title: Court Voids Appointments To District School Boards
description: In the most farreaching decision on school decentralization since the system was instituted in the city two and a half years ago, a State Supreme Court justice ruled yesterday that every community school board vacancy to which an appointment has been made must now be filled by an election.

title: Commonwealth Edison Raises Profit and Offers to Buy Stock
description: The Commonwealth Edison Company reported yesterday that net income for the first nine months rose to $128.6million, or $2.32 a share, from $106million, or $2.12 a share, in the 9 months ended Sept. 30, 1971. Revenues rose to $848.6million from $736.7million.

title: Cloud Over the Chiefs
description: Although the Senate voted 84 to 2 to confirm the appointment of Gen. Creighton W. Abrams as Army Chief of Staff, the former commander of United States forces in Vietnam has become a member of the Joint Chiefs under a cloud that shadows the entire Pentagon hierarchy.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: TAMPA, Fla., Oct. 19Democratic political sources here say that saboteurs, as yet; unidentified, played havoc with the party's Presidential primary in Florida last winter.

title: CANADIAN RIDERS ACHIEVE A SWEEP
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 19Canada, after losing to the United States team in six straight international jumping events at the Pennsylvania National horse show, swept the first three places in the faultandout competition tonight.

title: Business Briefs
description: GENEVA. Oct. 19  The Latin American countries secured an overwhelming vote in a United Nations agency tonight in support of Chile's protest against the Kennecott Copper Corporation's moves in foreign courts to block the sale of copper from its nationalized Chilean mines. With only Greece joining the United States in opposition in the final vote, the Latin American resolution in which Kennecott was not actually named, was adopted by the Executive Board of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development by 39 to 2, with 23 abstentions.

title: PALMER, KNUDSON LEAD KAISER GOLF
description: NAPA, Calif., Oct. 19 (AP)Arnold Palmer, fighting one of the longest slumps of his long career, cut 6 strokes off par with a 66 and tied George Knudson for the firstround lead today in the $150,000 Kaiser International golf tournament.

title: Bodyguard Indicted on Perjury About Killing of Eboli
description: Thomas Eboli's bodyguardchauffeur was indicted yesterday on charges of lying about what he did, what he saw and to whom he spoke in the six hours before the Mafia chieftain was slain on July 16 in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn.

title: Henry T. Volkening, a Partner In Literary Agency, Dies at 70
description: Henry T. Volkening, a leading literary agent, died Wednesday of cancer at his home, 1088 Park Avenue. His age was 70.

title: Rocky Practices Touch downs
description: A whistle blows, the enemy's suicide squad moves forward, the crowd roarsand Rocky Thompson of the New York Giants braces himself for football's most spectacular play.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: A clammy mixture of rain and snow soaked the metropolitan area yesterday, creating nasty driving conditions and more than one case of the sniffles.

title: Nastase and Kodes Reach Barcelona Net Semifinals
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 19 (AP)Iife Nastase of Rumania defeated Tom Gorman of Seattle, 64, 56, today and advanced to the semifinals of the Spanish international tennis tournament.

title: Swedes Try Icing the Buck
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 19 (UN) The Swedish Ice Hockey Association, concerned over increased scouting from the professional leagues in North America, announced today the formation a supporting fund for Swedish players. If any international professional club shows interest in a player, his Swedish club now will have chance to put up the required money to keep the player.

title: MRS. T. E. LIEBERMANN
description: Mrs. Miriam Moore Liebermann, a Bergen County (N. J.) welfare leader and the wife of Thomas E. Liebermann, an investment banker, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, after long illness. She was 42 years old and lived at 252 Engle Street, Tenafly, N. J.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Stillwater fly fishing for trout does not offer the excitement of angling on a stream or river, but it has its own particular challenge and fascination.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: 3 Hurt in Waterfront Explosion A tractortrailer exploded at the loading dock of the Crown Central Petroleum Corporation on the Elizabeth waterfront, starting a fire in which three persons were injured.

title: E.E.C. TO SET UP MONETARY FUND
description: PARIS, Oct. 19The political leaders of the enlarged) Common Market decided today) to establish a European monetary cooperation fund next, April 1.

title: Wet Snow Arrives Here Early
