Herren performed the ceremony in the Southern Hills United Methodist Church. The bride's father is director of research with Ebasco Services, Inc., in New York.

title: Stamps
description: THIS weekend, the Society of Philatelic Americans and the War Cover Club have held their annual conventions at SEPAD, the 33d annual exhibition of the Southeastern Pennsylvania and Delaware Associated Stamp Clubs. Staged at the Sheraton Hotel, Philadelphia, the show has also been the site of the sale of the most recent souvenir card of the Bureau of Engraving and Printing, illustrated herewith.

title: Westfield Museum Recreates 18th Century Life
description: WESTFIELD  If Sabra Miller could be around on Nov. 4, she would feel right at home again in her 18thcentury farmhouse.

title: Views of the Review
description: It was with a sense of disbelief that I saw certain names in the ad in The Week in Review Oct. 15 listing 45 academics supporting President Nixon for reelection. Leaving aside the question of their support, what reason did the signers have to make propaganda for Mr. Nixon at this juncture? The polls point already to a victory for the President. Why help to make it a landslide? Do the signers really believe that a landslide victory by Mr. Nixon is in the best interest of the country?

title: Eurodollar Doldrums
description: LONDON  Of the 37 American banks with full branches in London, more than half arrived during the late nineteensixties with one main purpose: to gain access to the burgeoning Eurodollar market of which London was, and still is, the primary center.

title: Telephone Co. to Give Scores Daring Series
description: The New York Telephone Company will provide World Series scores on telephone number 6371212.

title: More taste for the deal than the ideal
description: In 1972, George Meany has been starcrossed or bedeviled by some malicious sprite. A militant critic of Nixon's economic policies who treated the President with majestic contempt at the A.F.L.C.I.O. Convention, Meany enjoyed, early in the year, an unwonted popularity among liberals. Yet Meany will probably be as responsible as anyone for the President's impending reelection, not because of his neutrality in the campaign but because of his insistence on supporting Hubert Humphrey's foredoomed candidacy, thus helping to make McGovern's nomination inevitable. Paradoxically, Meany was not fond of Humphrey either, as Joseph Goulden points out, Meany's nickname for H.H.H. was Mushhead. It has been a year of stupefying ineffectiveness for a man who calls himself a realist, a performance of blunder and bobble which has reduced Meany to a position of embittered impotence.

title: Countryman
description: Long autumn or short, early spring or late, wet summer or dry, the countryman leans with the wind and accepts the weather. He, has learned that he must accept the day as it comes and wait on the season. And on the bad days he has time to examine his own purpose and identity, something he has little time for on the good days.

title: G.O.P. Tries Cheers and Chats on Youth,
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21In a high school auditorium in suburban Virginia, a disk jockey divided the teenaged audience into three sections and set them cheering in competition. In a Harvard common room, a young man talked about John F. Kennedy.

title: MARKET ACHIEVES TWO KEY RESULTS
description: PARIS, Oct. 21 The nine national leaders of the enlarged European Common Market, who set up a schedule early today for reaching a degree of political Integration by 1980, achieved far more than had been expected of the meeting.

title: Kruczeks Have Child
description: STURBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 21A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Thomas P. Kruczek on Tuesday in the Harrington Memorial Hospital, Mrs. Kruczek, a music educator, is the former Miss Dorann Ellen Kirp. The child, whose father is director of music for the Southbridge school system, is named Hadley Faith.

title: He Can Recall a LongAgo Long Island
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L. I.The paint on the old clock tower at Heyday Stables is peeling and the clock itself has stopped at 13 minutes to 11. But for Nate Townsend, the stables supervisor, riding instructor and selftaught horse doctor, it's later than that.

title: 5 CHILDREN INJURED IN E. 102D ST. FIRE
description: Five young brothers and sisters were critically injured early yesterday when a twoalarm fire destroyed the interior of a fivestory tenement at 169 East 102d Street, in East Harlem.

title: Memoirs of a Not Altogether Shy Pornographer
description: Bernard Wolfe's career has been long, original and, unfortunately, largely a secret one among a generation of American writers with less compelling experiences but greater compulsions toward selfdramatization. He left Yale to be a secretarybodyguard to Trotsky in Mexico. He wrote popular magazine piecesany kind of hashmeat prose that could feed him. He wrote a highlyregarded future novel, Limbo. In Really the Blues, which is just being reissued, he wrote a popular romance of the life of Mezz Mezzrow, the jazzman, in which a mixture of blackwhite gossip, marijuana and sexual adventuring made the actual, living Mezzrow an early model of so many imaginary characters to come.

title: Art
description: FOR much of his career, the American painter, John Marin, cast himself in the role of professional old salt, scouting up and down the Maine coast in search of motifs for his bracing watercolor views. His letters to his dealer, Alfred Stieglitz, published several years ago in The Selected Writings of John Marin, offer the running lifecommentary of a perennial Yankee, full of local yarns and Down East dialectthough Marin was, in fact, born in Rutherford, N. J., in 1870.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM In the 26 months since the Suez Canal ceasefire went into effect, the intermittent fighting between Israel and her Arab neighbors has followed a seemingly inflexible pattern. Each guerrilla raid across the frontier, or Arab hijacking of an airliner, has brought a prompt and punishing Israeli response, usually in the form of air strikes or ground assaults into Lebanon and Syria.

title: California Politicians Give Dakotan a Chance to Win
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 21On the wall behind the desk of Lyn Nofziger, the overseer of President Nixon's campaign in California, someone has written a series of numbers: April 15D 5,134,178, R 3,398,716.

title: Rockefeller Family Fund Issues Venture Philanthropy Report
description: The Rockefeller Family Fund yesterday announced grants totaling $814,950 during 1970 and 1971 in what the fund's president, David Rockefeller Jr., termed venture philanthropy.

title: G.O.P. Official Is Quoted On Aid to Yorty in Primary
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 21 (AP)  The Los Angeles Times reported today that a Republican National Committee official, John D. Lofton Jr., aided Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles during the New Hampshire Presidential primary.

title: Voters Get Little Choice in Supreme Court Election
description: Nearly half the State Supreme Court vacancies in the city will be filled Nov. 7 without any choice by the voters.

title: Rio Paper Prints an Attack By Senator on Censorship
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 21 (AP)A former head of the Brazilian Press Association has appealed to President Emilio G. Medici to stop censorship in this country. His remarks were not censored and came out this week in one of Rio's leading papers.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: As a French major in high school, I was a member of several international organizations; when I entered college I thought almost constantly about hove I would spend my junior year abroad. Now that I am back my mind returns again and again to my experiences, and that is why I was so deeply affected by your article, Summing Up: What Travel Abroad Meant to 5 Young Americans (Travel section, Oct. 8).

title: Memphis State Victor
description: IRVING, Tex., Oct. 21 (AP)David Johnson blocked an extra point attempt and preserved a 76 victory by Memphis State over North Texas State today.

title: City Council Meetings Open to Public Listed
description: Following are meetings of City Council committees at City Hall that are open to the public this week:

title: New Sheepshead Bay Plan
description: The scene is a little like a small French fishing village. Trawlers come and go at their own leisurely pace. There are small cafes on the waterfront where the seafood is delicious and the beer inexpensive but good. Near the waterfront, there are even stretches of marshland and sand dunes that draw the bathers in the summer.

title: POP
description: ARGENT: All Together Now (Epic KE 31556). There's always been a gripping fascination to Argent's music. It has an eerie, icy quality that summons up the silverblue colors and transparent textures of winter. Argent albums have been known to bring relief to stuffy Manhattan apartments in the worst days of July. Don't laugh until you've tried it.

title: Clashes Flare Near Saigon And in Central Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 21 (AP) Fighting flared Saturday from the Central Highlands to the outskirts of Saigon today.

title: Bowdoin Loses 4th Game
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Oct. 21 (AP)  Williams handed Bowcloin its fourth loss of the football season today, 357.

title: Gallup Poll Finds Students Evenly Split on Election
description: A new Gallup poll says college students, who previously favored Senator George McGovern's Presidential candidacy by almost two to one, are now almost evenly divided between him and President Nixon.

title: Everybody's grandpa as a born Machiavelli
description: Other Presidents are described in melodramatic terms as a mixture of the lion and the fox. But Eisenhower?just like the Herblock drawings of him, sappy amiable pigeon, with a straggle of happenstance ivy in his beak. Even his equivalent of Air Force One was stiltedly called the Columbine. The man's rubberoid features, totally without menace, might have graced any TV puppet's body on a wacky kids show of the fifties. Granted, some lightning of idiot good luck touched everything he triedpoker, soldiering, writing, investing, campaigning, reigning, grinning. (His grin was an investment.) But he was the last person the journalists of his day would blame for his successes. You just can't beat the gods at their most whimsical. If they wanted to lift up everyone's kidgrandpa to personify the Age of Geritol, who could thwart them?

title: Jets Catch Colts Today at Crossroads
description: To pass or not to pass? That is the question for Weeb Ewbank, head coach, as his New York Jets prepare to face the Baltimore Colts for the second time this season today at Shea Stadium.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: The nation's first new jetport in almost four yearsand one that some aviation leaders say may be among the last jetports built in this countryis scheduled to open Nov. 11 at Kansas City, Mo.

title: PENN VANQUISHES LEHIGH BY 30 TO 27
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Oct. 21Adolph Bellizeare, a sophomore halfback, equaled a University of Pennsylvania onegame rushing mark today as he led the Quakers to a 3027 victory over Lehigh.

title: Law
description: A number of states over the years have passed legislation aimed at transforming prisons from crime breeders to reformers of men. For the most part the legislation has been pieoemeal. Massachusetts is attempting to do the job in one lump through its omnibus bill, the Corrections Reform. Act of 1972, which went into effect last Monday. Its purpose: don't just change the big prisoneliminate it.

title: Article 21  No Title
description: BUFFALO. Oct. 21 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks defeated the Buffalo Braves, 91.63, in the National Basketball Association tonight, holding the Braves to 7 points in the first quarter and to 4 in the third. Oscar Robertson scored 27 points to lead the Bucks. John Hummer's 12 was high for the Braves.

title: Giants Play Cardinals; Aim for Fourth in Row
description: Two major obstacles loom in the path of the recently revived aspirations of the New York Giants todaythe St. Louis Cardinals and the law of averages.

title: Life in the onesex Kingdom of Arden
description: The indomitable faith of an earlier generation in business and empirebuilding is gone forever. So is Elizabeth Arden, and we have a lot to be grateful for on both counts. In life, she may have prepared the face to meet the faces that she met; in death, her mask is ugly. She ruled a queendom within the empire of beauty, where slaves to vanity, insecurity, loneliness and status revered their monarch and made her exceedingly rich. According to Fortune, Arden earned more money than any other woman in America. To call her Miss, as the title does, is to accept the sentimental gentility she reverted to between bouts of temper tantrums and power mania.

title: Education Goes On for. Pregnant Girls
description: PATERSON  An eighthgrader called a social worker here last week to tell her she had just been made patrol captain in her school, a job she had long wanted.

title: 202 Residents, 296 Voters
description: LAKE CITY, Colo., Oct. 21 (AP)Hinsdale County, an area roughly the size of Rhode Island, has an official population of 202, but 296 persons have registered to vote Nov. 7. County Clerk Gene Vickers explained that the seemingly inflated figure stems from summer residents and summer business operators who declare Hinsdale County their legal residence.

title: Taxi Light Wins 8th Title
description: NEW Hope, Pa., Oct. 21Taxi Light, a 5yearold chestnut gelding owned by Goshen Stables of West Chester, Pa., won his eighth championship of the year today when he captured the limit working hunter title at the Peacefield Farms horse show.

title: Alfred Wins 15th in Row On Lona Field Goal, 31.28
description: ALFRED, N. Y., Oct. 21Don Hockenberry's eighth field goal of the season, a 40yarder in the second period, was the margin of difference today as Alfred University's Saxons defeated Hobart, 3128, in their muchheralded clash for smallcollege football honors.

title: 4th in Row for Idaho State
description: POCATELLO, Idaho, Oct. 21 (AP)Tom Lee passed for 266 yards as Idaho State whipped Idaho, 357, in a Big Sky Conference game today. Lee, a senior from Yorktown, N. Y., threw two touchdown passes to Dave Shulz and one to Mike Davis to lead the Bengals to their fourth straight victory, The game was televised regionally and a crowd of 12,000 viewed the indoor battle in person.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Perhaps you should send out a general order to your reviewers to pass up halfremembered stories.

title: Campaign Humor
description: In 1928, despite the vitriolic abuse that was heaped upon his head, Al Smith kept what may be one of the most important virtues of all in American politicsand that was his sense of humor. Thus, last Thursday night, George McGovern recited the quadrennial litany: Whatever else it may be, politics should be fun.

title: Art
description: President, The Metropolitan Museum of Art

title: Two inevitables
description: Although someone dies every 16.5 seconds in the United States, death is one of the great American taboos, rarely discussed, little understood and hence fearsome. For young people especially life seems so boundless that thought of its finitude is repugnant, a state of misplaced bliss that can be traumatically jolted when one of those deaths every 16.5 seconds happens to a close relative or friend. Or when that death may be one's own.

title: Recipes to Make Oyster Even Better
description: The oyster was an epicure's delight long before the Romans began gathering them from beds as far away as Great Britain. For oyster lovers like Casanova (who reportedly needed a minimum of 50 oysters a day to keep going) or Diamond Jim Brady (who demanded five dozen at Manhattan's Delmonico's before he'd even consider dinner) a topping of cocktail sauce, horseradish or tobasco would be, in the words of one English authority, the thin wedge of the edge of heresy.

title: U.S. Data Are Outdated On 4,600 Governments
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 21 The Federal revenuesharing program, which President Nixon signed into law yesterday, has already hit a snag, it was disclosed here today by Caspar W. Weinberger, director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The Republicans are having good sport at McGovern's expense on the amnesty question, but in the long run it can only make them seem graceless and meanspirited to their posterity.

title: Bill to Protect Reporters Pledged by Ervin for 1973
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 21 (UPI) Expressing fear that the Nixon Administration was undermining press freedoms, Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, said Thursday that his subcommittee would give top priority next year to legislation to strengthen the rights of reporters.

title: News of Dogs
description: It will require only a subway token to reach an allbreed dog show next Saturday. The Queensboro Kennel Club will be staging its 45th fixture at the State Armory, 93d Avenue and 168th Street, Jamaica. The site may be reached by taking either the E or F train of the IND to 169th Street and walking south. Queensboro holds two shows a year, having added an outdoor event In 1971.

title: 2 CONSERVATIVES VYING IN QUEENS
description: Two conservative candidates are competing for the votes of equally conservative  minded voters in the 15th Senatorial District of western Queens.

title: A Palm Beach Guest House for Presidents and Kings
description: WASHINGTONThere's going to be a new guest house available for visiting heads of state and, if any President of the United States wants it, a winter White House, too.

title: Two inevitables
description: Yes, but how would you go about it if you were given the job of writing a biography of Richard M. Nixon for the 12 and up group? It is, after all, Horatio Alger in the Age of the Tube. Small town grocer's son makes it through college; wins scholarship to Duke University, is president o the law school. Lands job with a hometown law firm. Pearl Harbor. Joins the Navy (even though his Quaker mother's heart may break). Overseas service. Demobilization. A telegram out of the blue. Will be run for Congress? He will, does, slays his first dragon, Jerry Voorhis. The House. ChambersHiss. Congressman Nixon emerges with a national name, and a lot of powerful enemies. Will he run for the Senate? He will, does, slays his second dragon, Helen Gahagan Douglas. It's Chicago 1952 and (again out of the blue) he is picked for Veep by Ike. So far it's been up all the way for Richard Nixon. Then disaster. (The Hero must have a major setback: days, weeks, years in outer darkness during which his resolution and will are tested.) The paper thin loss to John Kennedy in 1960. The humiliating loss to Pat Brown in 1962. The ultimate loss, in dignity this time, when he blows up at the press after that defeat. (You won't have Nixon to kick around any more.) Then back from nowhere six years later to win. The boy next door has become President of the United States: courage, hard work, decency, love, patriotism, intelligence have paid off. Love him or hate him, it's quite a tale.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Oct. 21President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania left for home today without having met President Idi Amin of Uganda to discuss the strained relations between the two countries. The friction had resulted in recent fighting.

title: McGovern to Answer Questions on TV Show
description: George McGovern, the Democratic Presidential candidate, will answer viewer's questions on his record and beliefs in a statewide, hourlong television broadcast tomorrow, it was announced yesterday by People for McGovernShriver.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALL professionals know that many dollars can be saved in the care of any building by following a regular program of preventive maintenancethat is, by periodically checking for potential trouble spots and making minor repairs if needed before major breakdowns can occur, as well as by taking every precaution to be prepared for emergencies before they actually happen.

title: HOUSEWIFE LEADS BATTLE FOR PARK
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Oct. 21 A housewife leading a troop of volunteers is attempting to halt a builder's plans for a housing development and protect a corridor of woods abutting the densely populated business area of Great Neck. Similar citizens efforts saved two other park sites in the town in the last two years.

title: BirthViewing Right Asked
description: LOGANSPORT, Ind., Oct. 21 (UPI)  Mr. and Mrs. Robert Brandstatter have filed suit in Federal Court in South Bend, Ind., to force Memorial Hospital here to allow Mr. Brandstatter in the delivery room when his wife gives birth to their second baby, due about Dec. 8.

title: Local
description: St. Francis Prep won its fifth consecutive Catholic Schools Football League game yesterday, 266, over Cardinal at. Mount St. Michael's field. Hayes now has a 41 record.

title: Oklahoma Shocked By Colorado, 2014, For First Defeat
description: BOULDER, Colo., Oct. 21 Colorado's firedup defense intercepted three passes and recovered a fumble today while quarterback Ken Johnson was sparking the offense through the air and the ninthranked Buffaloes upset secondranked Oklahoma, 2014.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. on Senegal's complaint of Portuguese aggression.

title: CAIRO DENIES REPORT OF ATTEMPTED COUP
description: CAIRO, Oct. 22Egyptian Government officials today denied reports published abroad that military officers had unsuccessfully attempted to stage a coup against the Government of President Anwar elSadat 10 days ago.

title: Mission to Moscow
description: Egyptian Premier Aziz Sidky's recent mission to Moscow does not appear to have been a notable success, which is just as well for everyone concerned with the future of the Middle East, including the Egyptians.

title: Election Helps Canada Realize She, Too, Has Urban Ills
description: TORONTO, Oct. 20  Mrs. Beth MacDonald, an unemployed widow who lives on a pension in a shabby rooming house here, is not planning to vote in the Canadian parliamentary election Oct. 30.

title: Eagles Surprise Chiefs With Liske Bombs, 2120
description: Pete Liske, who replaced John Reaves as the starting quarterback for the Philadelphia Eagles, engineered one of the most surprising upsets of the National Football League season yesterday, throwing three long touchdown passes as the Eagles downed the Kansas City Chiefs, 2120.

title: CONVICTED BLACK SHOWED 2 IMAGES
description: BURGAW, N.C., Oct. 22He was always just as polite and nice in court, a courtroom spectator said of the Rev. Ben Chavis last week. I guess I just never got to see the other side.

title: Inhumane Puppy Mills a Growing Blight
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 22 The stench starts about halfway down the hill.

title: Infant Slain During a Party Celebrating His Christening
description: A sixweekold baby boy was found murdered in his bassinet late Saturday night while a party, attended by 30 relatives and friends, was being held in an adjacent room to celebrate the infant's christening a few hours earlier.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The solution that would make the Tudor City parks public, rather than private as they are now (your editorial of Oct. 4), I am afraid would provide a cure that would be worse than the disease. The tiny parks would then attract an element that the mostly elderly tenants now using the parks would have reason to fear.

title: Michele Marshall Wed to S. J. Mathes
description: Miss Michele Naomi Marshall and Stephen Jon Mathes, who received bachelor's and law degrees from the University of Pennsylvania, were married last evening at the St. RegisSheraton by Rabbi Charles Agin.

title: Foreign Policy, Postwar Division
description: WASHINGTONAs we wearily emerge from the war in Vietnam, one might wish for the easy choice we had after World Wars I and II. But the obvious fact is that we cannot choose isolation. And we cannot choose simplistic policy like containment. We cannot even count on the rest of the world to pay as much attention to us as it has in the past.

title: Veterans Day Parade Is Highlight of Holiday
description: Veterans, young and old, will march down Fifth Avenue today but the, likelihood is that they may have to combat rainy weather. The National Weather Service predicted intermittent showers and temperatures in the low 60's.

title: LIFE BACKING NIXON; CITES FOREIGN POLICY
description: Life magazine, in this week's issue, endorses the reelction of President Nixon, citing the Administration's impressive record of accomplishments in foreign policy.

title: FOUNDATION HEAD QUITS OVER POLICY
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 22Merrimon Cuninggim, president of the Danforth Foundation since 1961, has resigned from the philanthropic organization based in St. Louis, citing policy differences with the foundation's trustees.

title: HARRINGTON QUITS AS SOCIALIST HEAD
description: Michael Millington, whose 1962 book The Other America sparked the Federal antipoverty crusade, made public yesterday his resignation as cochairman of the Socialist PartyDemocratic Socialist Federation.

title: Italy, 50 Years After Mussolini's March on Rome, Sees Some 1972 Parallels
description: ROME, Oct. 16As the 50th anniversary of Mussolini's March on Rome approaches, Italians are being barraged with reminiscences of the events that led to the Fascist dictatorship.

title: HARRIS SURVEY PUTS NIXON AHEAD, 5934
description: Louis Harris, the pollster, reported yesterday that President Nixon led Senator George McGovern by 59 to 34 per cent on the basis of his latest survey, made Oct. 1719, United Press International said.

title: Cleveland Printers Accept Contract With Plain Dealer
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 22 (AP). The printers union has agreed today to a 28month contract with The Cleveland Plain Dealer, which calls for increases totaling $46.05 weekly.

title: American Politics: I Am a Grass Root
description: WASHINGTONAmerican politics this year have got everybody guessing, Even the famous columnists are stumped. Political discussion is beginning to run around in circles because the mystery can't be solved with any of the old conceptual kits; even the vocabulary is being undermined as such shorthand words as radical, liberal, WASP and even Democrat cease to have precise meaning.

title: M'GOVERN TAKES SECURITY STEPS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 George McGovern's Presidential campaign has tightened defense security at its national headquarters here following reports of bugging of the Democrats Watergate offices in June, according to members of the Senator's campaign staff.

title: The People's Schools
description: The ruling by State Supreme Court Justice Arnold Fraiman that all community school board vacancies must be filled through special elections represents costly and inconvenient but necessary solution to serious dilemma. The problem is simply that as long as local boards retain the right to fill vacancies with interim members of their own choice, special interest groups are encouraged to seize power by making the lives of their opponents so uncomfortable that they eventually resign. In the case of deep local divisions, this can lead to tactics of intimidation and coercion.

title: Balloon Swoops Low, Tying Up Traffic and Raising Ire of Police
description: A hotair balloon on a weekend of lowlevel flying caused traffic jams in Putnam and northern Westchester Counties and prompted at least 50 calls to police departments, including reports of plane crashes and unidentified flying objects.

title: Kenyatta, at 81, Defends Achievements And Warns Growing Ranks of Critics
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 22After almost nine years of intiopendence, Kenya appears to most observers to be a tranquil island of relative prosperity and great stability in the poor and troubled continent of Africa. Nonetheless, the Government of President Jomo Kenyatta has been the recent target of unexpectedly vociferous and bitter criticism.

title: Bache Importing Cashew Nuts
description: Bache & Company, one of the nation's largest investment firms, has gone into the nut business. To be more specific, Bache is importing cashew nuts from India and Africa to meet a growing demand for the nuts, which sell at prices below almonds, pecans and walnuts.

title: Sewers In Rockland Are Fought As Harbingers of Urbanization
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Oct. 22classic suburban battle with a new twist has been raging for months in the rustic, sparsely settled Hackensack River Valley a few miles north of this Rockland County seat.

title: Transit Policemen Begin A RuleBook Slowdown
description: A rulebook work slowdown that may reduce police protection on subway trains and stations by about 15 per cent was started yesterday afternoon by the 3,200member Transit Patrolman's Benevolent Association.

title: Speed Boats Stir Flushing Meadows And Park Officials
description: Speed boats came to Flushing) Meadows Lake, Queens, yesterday, the first time such a regatta has been held in New York City since 1939. But despite the 200 drivers, 156 boats and 17 classes of outboards, more excitement took place on shore than on the water.

title: Thai Cites Optimistic Report
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 22 (UPI)Thailand's head of government, Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn, said today that he had been told by a Kissinger aide there was a possibility of a settlement soon.

title: Bank Change Approved
description: Stockholders of the First American National Corporation, a Nashville, Tenn., bankholding company, approved yesterday a change in the company's name to the First Amtenn Corporation and a twoforone split of the company's stock. The changes will be effective Nov. 7.

title: Jersey Notes
description: FREEHOLD, Oct. 22  In the bribery and conspiracy trial of Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin, which resumes here Tuesday, an unusual seating arrangement permits Mr. Sherwin and two codefendants to sit among the courtroom spectators, instead of alongside their attorneys and in front of the jury. The codefendants are Michael J. Manzo, a highway contractor, and William C. Loughran a Republican fundraiser. They usually sit from the middle to the rear of the courtroom, while Mr. Sherwin sits in the first row flanked by his wife and at least four of his six children.

title: Manila Says Troops Put Down an Attack By Rebels in South
description: MANILA, Oct. 22 (Reuters)The Philippine Government has flown 300 soldiers, including marines, to the soullern island of Mindanao to put down an assault by guerrilla forces, it was announced here today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Quite as disheartening as the unprecedented hypocrisy of the Nixon plutocracy is the widespread public apathy at the very time when change for the better is possible. The recent scandals are shrugged off as part of the political game; the older ones are forgotten. Getting away with it is more admired than castigated. Even the professional gambler cannot expect such tribute.

title: The Drug Scene Surfaces in Courtyard of Historic Trinity Church
description: Since Trinity Episcopal Church was founded in 1697, its courtyard at Broadway and Wall Street has been a lot of things: A cemetery where Alexander Hamilton rests, a stopover for migrating birds and tourists, the setting for noonday concerts and a green refuge from the financial district's towering grayness.

title: News Analysis
description: An aide of Representative Herman Badillo was refreshingly frank as he recounted the Congressman's campaign for Senator George McGovern. We decide which appearances are good for Herman as well as McGovern, said the aide. He added that high on the good appearance list were Jewish groups. Mr. Badillo is already off and running for Mayor next year and is trying to corner the liberal end of the political spectrum. To be a viable candidate, he will have to convince many liberal Jewish voters to support him rather than several very likely Jewish contenders, including City Controller Abraham D. Beame and City Council President Sanford D. Garelik. The convincing is already underway, even though it may be masquerading as campaigning for Senator McGovern.

title: THIEU ACCEPTABLE TO EXILE LEADERS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The head of the leading Vietnamese exile federation in Paris declared today that his group traditionally anti  Communist, antiAmerican and antiThieuwas now willing to accept President Nguyen Van Thieu as participant in a coalition government in Saigon.

title: EVIDENCE MOUNTS OF PM FOR PEACE IN ALL INDOCHINA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Indications mounted today that intensive negotiations were under way for a ceasefire, to end not only the Vietnam war but also the fighting in neighboring Laos and Cambodia.

title: RAPID RISE FOUND IN BROOKLYN CRIME
description: Organized crime has achieved a record of sustained and dynamic growth in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, largely because of a breakdown in law enforcement, an elaborate economic and legal study has concluded.

title: Fraternities Aren't Only for Brothers
description: BRUNSWICK, Me.Most of the freshmen women who were wooed by mail throughout the summer to consider membership in eight of the nine fraternities operating on the Bowdoin College campus here thought it was a hoot.

title: Kissinger Meets Thieu Again, Then Prepares to Quit Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Oct. 23Henry A. Kissinger made preparations to leave Saigon today after another twohour meeting with President Nguyen Van Thieu this morning, a United States Embassy spokesman said. Mr. Kissinger's destination was not disclosed.

title: WORSENING IS SEEN IN PAYMENTS DEFICIT
description: The United States international balance of payments, as measured on the official settlements basis, deteriorated sharply in the third quarter, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York estimated yesterday.

title: Hanoi Says U.S. Bombing Of Mission Was Deliberate
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Oct. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)A North Vietnamese inquiry into the United States bombing that destroyed part of the French mission and other foreign missions on Oct. 11 said today that the attack was deliberate.

title: A'S BEAT REDS, 32, IN SEVENTH GAME AND TAKE SERIES
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22 The Oakland A'sthe only team in baseball with 19 mustaches and one mule  finally won the World Series today when they defeated the Cincinnati Reds in the seventh and last game, 32.

title: CENTER SAVINGS BAR CONFIRMED BY F.H.L.B.
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board confirmed over the weekend that it had approved a cease and desist order barring the Center Savings Association, Houston, from certain practices that allegedly had violated the board's regulations.

title: Shriver, in Jersey, Makes 2 Appeals To Ethnic Groups
description: ORANGE, N.J., Oct. 22Sargent Shriver told a black rally here this afternoon that President Nixon is going to win this electionand then, after a dramatic pauseunless we get off our seats and do something about it.

title: PLAY IT AS IT LAYS AT THE BEEK NAN ON SUNDAY. ADVT.
description: PLAY IT AS IT LAYS AT THE BEEK NAN ON SUNDAY. ADVT.

title: Black Assembly Seeks Wider Support
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 22  Three hundred blacks ended today a twoday meeting that kept alive the political aims of the National Black Political Convention, which was held in Gary, Ind., last March.

title: Exchanges Are Open Today, But Banks Close for Holiday
description: Most of the domestic and foreign securities markets will be open today, the Federally designated Veterans Day. Banks here, however, will be closed.

title: BUCKS DOWN CAVS; DANDRIDGE NETS 27
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 22 (AP)Bob Dandridge scored 27 points land pulled down 14 rebounds as the Milwaukee Bucks defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers, 10484, tonight in the National Basketball Association.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 22 (Reuters)Stan Smith of the United States Army and Ilie Nastase, of Rumania the two topseeded players, were beaten today in the semifinals of the Count Godo tennis tournament.

title: Canucks Edge Bruins
description: BOSTON, Oct. 22 (UPI)Bobby Schmautz made two goals and assisted on a third tonight as the Vancouver Canucks scored four time in the second period for a 5.4 upset triumph over the Boston Bruins. The victory was Vancouver's first ever in Boston Garden.

title: News Analysis
description: Effective Friday and through Election Day, Geraldo Rivera will be on leave of absence, without pay, from WABCTV's Eyewitness News to campaign for Senator George McGovern. This arrangement presumably settles a policy disagreement that arose among Mr. Rivera, WABCTV and the American Broadcasting Company.

title: NEWMAN CONCERT A GLORIOUS EVENT
description: It was the best of times at Philharmonic Hall Friday night, possibly the very best evening thus far in what is shaping up as a musically fascinating season. Randy Newman was the performer, and the funny thing was that he didn't even show up with any new songs. He did, however, bring out a 50piece orchestra and proceeded to demonstrate that he is every bit as gifted an orchestrator as he is a songwriter.

title: WARREN L. DIXON JR.
description: SADDLE RIVER, N. J., Oct. 22Warren L. Dixon Jr., a lawyer in Hackensack, died yesterday in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood. He was 72 years old and lived here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In 63 B.C., Quintus Cicero gave the following advice to his famous brother Marcus Cicero, the orator, on how to campaign for Consul of Rome: Be all things to all men while electioneering, and if possible indicate that your opponents are criminals, grafters or morally low.

title: ALLISON TAKES 500 IN NORTH CAROLINA
description: ROCKINGHAM, N. C., Oct. 22 (AP)Bobby Allison broke out of a fierce battle with Richard Petty and four other drivers shortly after the halfway point today to win the American 500 stock car race.

title: McGovern Compared Ho Chi Minh to Washington
description: An article in Saturday's New York Times, quoting former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally's attack on Senator George McGovern, gave the erroneous impression that there was no published evidence that Mr. McGovern had compared Ho Chi Minh to George Washington.

title: Theater: Yoshe Kalb
description: For years New York was one of the homes of the Yiddish theater. There were many great Yiddish actors and, of course, an enormous Yiddishspeaking population. In more recent years, the Yiddish theater, like some other New York traditions, has declined. Now a group of producers, called generically Jewish Nostalgic Productions, Inc., is trying to restore the Yiddish theater to New York.

title: EVIDENCE MOUNTS OF PUSH FOR PEACE IN ALL INDOCHINA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Indications mounted today that intensive negotiations were under way for a ceasefire, to end not only the Vietnam war but also the fighting it neighboring Laos and Cambodia.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Grazino Mancinelli of Italy, the Olympic gold medal winner, will make his first start in the United States tomorrow at the opening session of the sevenday Washington International Horse Show. Grazing who will

title: Ceiling Unlimited
description: The sharp rise in the Government's index of consumer prices for September dispels any illusion that the inflationary rattlesnake has been defanged. No single month can fairly be taken as reflective of a breakdown in the price control machinery; but the size of the most recent increases only emphasizes the unreality of politically motivated suggestions that quick abandonment of controls is a serious possibility.

title: Dance: A Mixed Series
description: To workshop or not to workshop is a perennial question in moderndance circles, and the answer usually depends on the last workshop performance the viewer has seen. Some can be quite dreadful but most are a mixture of the promising and the disastrous. Dance Theater Workshop's two programs Thursday and Friday in its 20th studio series were strongly mixed, but on the side of the affirmative.

title: Raiders Bow to Fighting Saints, 54
description: The New York Raiders squandered a threegbal lead and let the Minnesota Fighting Saints beat them, 54, in a World Hockey Association game yesterday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Young Oars and Old, All 1,490, Enjoy HeadofCharles Regatta
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 22 And now here comes No. 19, the loudspeaker crackled. That's Ed Witte, oldest man in the regatta at 77, dropping his blades beautifully as he goes through the Eliot Bridge arch and into the last halfmile.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 22 (AP)The Coalition for Penal Reform for New Jersey has criticized Governor Cahill's appointment of a special prison task force to decide how to isolate incorrigible prisoners.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MILLVILLE, N. J., Oct. 22About 8,000 people gathered at the Millville Airport this afternoon for a preview of New Jersey's second public television station, which begins its broadcasts tomorrow night.

title: Second Public TV Unit In Jersey Starts Today
description: New Jersey's second public television station will begin broadcasting this evening when WNJSTV goes on the air at 7:30.

title: DR. IRVING R. NELSON
description: Dr. Irving R. Nelson, a physician in North Woodmere, L.I., died Saturday night of cancer in Memorial Hospital. He was 51 years old.

title: MISS VONDRA SHINES IN TULLY HALL SONGS
description: A light, lyric soprano and a fresh, unaffected platform manner were the chief attributes of Marilyn Vondra's Tully Hall recital yesterday afternoon. On a purely technical level Miss Vondra still has a few basic problems to clear away before sustaining an entire program of art songs, but the essentially attractive quality of her voice and interpretive instincts are most appealing.

title: KIM KIR CAPTURES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: CHESTER, N. Y., Oct. 22 Kim Kir, a black gelding owned and ridden by Julie Monica of Englewood, N. J., rallied today to win the limit jumper championship by a single point at the Spring Brook horse show.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 22 (AP)Jerry West hit 23 points in the final period tonight, enabling the Los Angeles Lakers to beat the Chicago Bulls, 10499. In all West scored 35. The Bulls were hurt by five technical fouls.

title: Sabres Rout Flames
description: BUFALO, Oct. 22 (UPI)Rick Martin scored four goals and Gil Perreault had two and four assists to give Buffalo a 72 victory over the Atlanta Flames tonight and keep the Sabres in a tie for first place in the East. The Sabres have played seven games without a loss, winning all five at home.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a trial judge assigned to the criminal term having the duty of penal sentencing and, further, as a proponent of the pilot project of the threejudge sentencing consultations, I must correct Mr. Moerdler as to his understanding of this program expressed in his letter of Oct. 13.

title: Jets Win, Bordeleau Stars
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Oct. 22 (UPI)  Chris Bordeleau scored two goals tonight as the Winnipeg Jets beat the Philadelphia Blazers, 63. The goals by the Jets center, who jumped to Winnipeg from Chicago of the National Hockey League, were Nos. 7 and 8 in six games.

title: Bridge:
description: Tournament titles in New York City are perhaps harder to win than anywhere else in the United States, partly because of the strength of the competition and partly because of the size of the entries. It is therefore rare for a pair to defend a title successfully.

title: Ulster Militiaman Is Killed In an Ambush by Gunmen
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 22. (Reuters)  A member of Northern Ireland's parttime army was killed today when gunmen ambushed his car near the border with the Irish Republic.

title: DRINAN'S FOE USES TV DESPITE WASTE
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Oct. 22 The conventional wisdom of 1972 holds that television is essential to a national or statewide political campaign, but a conspicuous waste of money and effort for a House candidate with a compact urban or suburban district.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a visitor passing through New York, I was interested to read your two articles on Concorde. [OpEd Oct. 10.] I was, however, puzzled by some of the statistics advanced by Charles Gessner for which he gives no source. He quotes $58 million as the price of a Concorde, while the price currently quoted by the manufacturers, British Aircraft Corporation / Aerospatiale, is $33.4 million.

title: House Contest
description: There's a run in the Silk Stocking.

title: MORE GUARDS DUE FOR CITY SCHOOLS
description: Dr, Harvey B, Scribner, the City School Chancellor, said yesterday that the Board of Education would allocate $6million this week to hire at least 1,200 security aides for patrol duty in the city's schools.

title: REA Offers Striking Union Pay Rises of 16% to 24%
description: A new contract offer was made last night on negotiations here between REA Express and the Brotherhood of Railway and Airline Clerks, representing 15,000 employes who struck the company last Thursday.

title: Hawks on Top, 42
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 22 (AP)Stan Nlikita poured in two goals and added an assist Ito lead the Chicago Black Hawks to a 42 victory over the California Golden Seals tonight.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: DETROIT, Oct. 22 (UPI)Marcel Dionne and Al Karlander scored two goals apiece tonight to lead the undefeated Detroit Red Wings to their sixth National Hockey League victory, 62, over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: TOKYO IS MOVING TO STEM DOLLARS
description: TOKYO, Oct. 22The Finance Ministry, in a move to check the rising influx of dollars, has begun enforcing new measures restricting foreign investment in Japanese securities and debentures and prohibiting Japanese foreign exchange banks abroad from making loans without license.

title: Rapid Rise Found in Brooklyn Crime
description: Organized crime has achieved a record of sustained and dynamic growth in the Bedford  Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, largely because of a breakdown in law enforcement, an elaborate economic and legal study of the area has concluded.

title: MEMORIAL PLAN STIRS BELGIANS
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 22  The dedication by a Flemish veterans group of a park in the north Belgian town of Stekene to their comrades who fell fighting the Russians in World War II has touched off a round of recriminations in this culturally divided country.

title: TALKS ON TRADE POSSIBLE BY JULY
description: PARIS, Oct. 22Following the ninenation conference of the heads of government of the enlarged Common Market, it now looks as if a new round of negotiations to liberalize world trade could get under way as early as July 1.

title: Kostelanetz Leads Philharmonic Concert
description: Although Andre Kostelanetz usually likes to spice his programs with offbeat material, the closest thing to a novelty at the New York Philharmonic concert Saturday night was the Scriabin Etude he conducted as an encore. Still, the musical offerings were substantial Mozart Overture, Haydn's Symphony No. 88, Ravel's G major Piano Concerto and suites by Prokofiev and Straussand the crisp, stylish performances added up to a highly satisfying evening.

title: PRESIDENT PRAISES RETURNING G.I.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 President Nixon, in his second nationwide radio speech of the weekend, built today on a Veterans Day theme to praise young Americans who have served in Vietnam and to detail his Administration's achhievements in their behalf.

title: 75 Lost on Kashmir Slope
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, Oct. 22 More than 50 mountain porters were feared killed in a snowstorm near the 12,500foot high Rajdhan Pass, 43 miles north of Srinagar, according to official reports today. Seventyfive porters were carrying supplies across the pass yesterday when the storm struck and strong wind hurled them down the mountain, burying them in the snow.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TIME CHAMBER An evening of medieval and Renaissance chamber music, played on recorders, viola da gamba, sackbutt, lute, psaltery, the lungs and other ancient instruments, starts off a new monthly series, Music for a While, at the Synod Hall of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, 110th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, tonight at 8:15.

title: Sports of The Times
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22And so, as Bobby Tolan contemplates a plunge into the turgid Ohio, we tiptoe silently away from Riverfront Stadium and a love scene of almost unbearable tenderness. The athletes have quit the field following the seventh and last match of the 69th World Series, the Oakland A's to douse one another with champagne in celebration of a 32 victory, the Reds to sip a weary beer and lay plans to go kill some quail. The stage is empty now save for the stars of the piece. Charles O. Finley, proprietor and operator of the baseball champions of creation, leaves his seat behind the Oakland bench and springs to the dugout roof, pulling his wife Shirley up behind him. They clinch.

title: Bleak Day for Favored College Elevens
description: There may be many explanations why Colorado upset Oklahoma and Missouri did the same to Notre Dame Saturday  none of which sound completely satisfactory.

title: McGovern Schedules Speech
description: Senator George McGovern will make his third political broadcast of the Presidential campaign at 7:30 P.M. Wednesday over the American Broadcasting Company network. Aides said yesterday that he would discuss the Administration's record of corruption and deceit.

title: Bank Acquisition Approved
description: William B. Camp, the Controller of the Currency, announced over the weekend that he had approved the acquisition of the North Mecklenburg Bank, Cornelius, N. C., by the First Union National Bank of Charlotte. Mr. Camp said that he had acted under emergency procedures to prevent the probable failure of the Mecklenburg bank.

title: HERBERT H. MILLS, CONSERVATIONIST
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Oct. 22 (AP)Herbert H. Mills, former board chairman of the National Audubon Society, died here of a heart attack yesterday, while addressing a Corriell, University ornithology group. He was 62 years old and lived in Greenwich Township, N. J.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A kind of doityourself mass was celebrated in the cafeteria of the Stamford (Conn.) Catholic High School. The liturgy followed basic Roman Catholic canonical requirements to the letter, but worshipers were free to extemporize if they so desired. The Rev. David Riley called it playing by ear, in order to give churchgoers and their families an opportunity to participate.

title: McGovern Replies To Question Posed By the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Senator George McGovern expressed surprise today when he found himself confronted on a nationally televised program with a question that the interviewer said had been submitted by the White House.

title: Saigon Official Says Thieu Prepares Plans for Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 22A high Government official said today that President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered his Government to start preparing detailed plans for a ceasefire two weeks ago, and has told Cabinet officers that he and Henry A. Kissinger have been discussing intricate details of a proposal for a ceasefire in place.

title: California Episcopalians Favor Women Priests
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 22 (UPI)A convention of the Episcopal diocese of California expressed support today for ordaining women as priests.

title: Betsy Rawls Scores a 141 To Win Tourney at Tucson
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Oct. 22 (AP) Betsy Rawls, a 21year star of the Ladies Professional Golf Association tours, came back after a twomonth absence to win the $30,000 GAC Classic today.

title: P.O.W. Airlift Alerts Reported Coiled Off
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (AP)Sources at two United States Air Force bases reported today that special alerts of air transport units, which they had said were possibly in preparation for the evacuation of American prisoners held by North Vietnam, had been canceled. The Pentagon, meanwhile, said that no unusual action had been taken with regard to the prisoners.

title: Judges Accept Class Suit on Indian Preferences
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Oct. 22A suit by four nonIndians charging that a new Indian preference policy of the Bureau of Indian Affairs is being unconstitutionally applied has been ruled a proper class action by a threejudge panel. The panel has set Nov. 29 for a final hearing.

title: Cambodia: A Fear of Forces Beyond Control
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 15Cambodia has passed her second anniversary as a republic and there is a general feeling here that even if the Vietnam war were to end quickly, Cambodia would be broken apart and dominated by forces beyond her control. There is also a feeling of resignation and a sense that resistance to inevitable historical forces is futile.

title: Personal Finance: Determining PE's
description: Now that many newspapers are supplying their readers with priceearnings ratios in the stock market quotation columns, there probably will be much more specific interest in figuring earnings growth.

title: McGovern Replies To Question Posed By the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Senator George McGovern expressed surprise today when he found himself confronted on nationally televised program with a question that the interviewer said had been submitted by the White House.

title: Saigon Official Says Thieu Prepares Plans for Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 22A high Government official said today that President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered his Government to start preparing detailed plans for a ceasefire two weeks ago, and has told Cabinet officers that he and Henry A. Kissinger have been discussing intricate details of a proposal for a ceasefire in place.

title: 25 BLACKS ACCUSED IN FIGHT ON CARRIER
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 22 (UPI) The Navy announced today that 25 black men aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk are charged with assault and rioting connected with racial disturbances Oct. 12 and 13 while the ship participated in air strikes against North Vietnam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The bread that the Parisians of the 1790's were deprived of was baked, as it is today, freestanding, with no pans to cake in. On the other hand, every French child learns in school, as I did in my time, that the Queen exclaimed, Qu'ils mangent de la brioche! Contrary to the Oct. 14 letter by Dr. Samuel Epstein, there is no common error perpetuated by continued erroneous usageas in, the case of Cinderella's glass slipper, for example, which was made of vair (a fur), not verre; the word cake conveys the right idea: brioche is not cake bread. As for the Queen, it remains that she spoke with the arrogance of the haves and their lack of compassion for the havenots.

title: JOHN HARRIMAN, ECONOMIST, DIES
description: Dr. John W. Harriman, economist and former vice dean of the New York University Graduate School of Business Administration, died Saturday in the BeekmanDowntown Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 37 Washington Square West.

title: LI.R.R. TRAINMEN END JOB ACTION
description: Trainmen on the Long Island Rail Road voted last night to end their threeday job action in protest against the Pay Board's decision to cut wage increases in their recent agreement with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: CAMBODIA OFFICIALS TALK TO GUERRILLAS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 22 (UPI)  A high Cambodian official said today that members of his Government held a series of meetings recently with Cambodian Communist guerrillas, aimed at ending the war here.

title: Jets Pleased With Colts Plan Of Benching Unitas for Domres
description: In his office, John Sandusky, the new coach of the Baltimore Colts, assessed Marty Domres, the new quarterback yesterday.

title: WORSENING IS SEEN IN PAYMENTS DEFICIT
description: The United States international balance of payments, as measured on the official settlements basis, deteriorated sharply in the third quarter, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York estimated yesterday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark reiterated yesterday his contention that only a statewide income tax would ease the burden of individual property taxes and alleviate the financial woes of the state's largest city.

title: NETS BEAT STARS ON 2DHALF RALLY
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 22Johnny Roche's 28foot jumper with 12 seconds to go, a shot good for 3 points, helped the New York Nets clinch a 119116 victory over the Utah Stars in an American Basketball ASsociation game at Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: Yemeni Premiers to Meet
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Oct. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Premiers of Yemen and Southern Yemen are to meet at the Arab League headquarters in Cairo Thursday for talks on the Yemeni conflict, the Iraqi press agency announced tonight. Highlevel delegations from both countries are currently engaged in a peace conference in Cairo.

title: TOKYO IS MOVING TO STEM DOLLARS
description: TOKYO, Oct. 22The Finance Ministry, in a move to check the rising influx of dollars, has begun enforcing new measures restricting foreign investment in Japanese securities and debentures and prohibiting Japanese foreign exchange banks abrdad from making loans without license.

title: Sensors Attune U.S. Base in Thailand To Movements on Ho Chi Minh Trail
description: NAKHON PHANOM, Thailand, Oct. 22The infiltration of North Vietnamese troops and war material through Laos and Cambodia into the western flank of South Vietnam appears to have dropped almost to the vanishing point, according to American pilots at this base adjoining the Ho Chi Minh trail.

title: On the Occasion of a Death in Boston
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass.After the doctor had left, the medication was stopped and for the first time in more days than she could remember her mind was clear. But her body, all weakness and random pain, was something alien to her, a stick figure under the bedspread and the sheet.

title: Books of The Times
description: In a period when most public leaders are soggy concoctions of mush and cardboard, George Meany has the solidity (and sensitivity) of a bulldozer. Untroubled by selfdoubt, constantly reinvigorated by the intensity of his hatreds, the 78yearold president of the A.F.L.C.I.O. exercises total rule over organized labor with no more solid power base than his imperious cigar. He tells off Presidents of the United States, treats Congressmen and Cabinet officers as dimwitted errand boys and generally vents his scorli or enthusiasm with the same bumptious exuberance he once employed in wielding a Stillson wrench as a union plumber in the Bronx.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BUFFALO, Oct, 22 (UPI)The Buffalo CourierExpress gave its editorial endorsement today to the reelection of President Nixon.

title: NEWCOMBE DOWNS RIESSEN IN 4 SETS
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 22 (UPI)John Newcombe staged a spectacular show of shotmaking today to defeat Marty Riessen of Chicago 67, 76, 7.6, 75, and win the $50,000 Rothman's international tennis tournament.

title: Political Sabotage, a Murky Tradition Stretching Far Back From Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The fake letter, the political spy, the smear, the twisted fact, the theft of documents, the malicious prank, the sabotage of an opponent's campaignalmost all are as old as American government itself.

title: Evening Classes for Adults Are Gaining Wider Popularity in the Suburbs
description: Now that children and college students are pretty well set in their education routines, older men and women are trooping back to evening classes where they don't expect to earn credits but may take a course in anything from Inside Mao's China to Creative Egg Shell Art.

title: UNIT CELEBRATES NEWSTYLE MASS
description: STAMFORD, Conn. Oct, 22A kind of doityourself mass was celebrated today in the cafeteria of Stamford Catholic High School. The liturgy followed basic Roman Catholic canonical requirements to the letter, but worshipers were free to extemporize if they so desired.

title: McGovern's World View
description: Of all the myths generated in this election campaign, one of the most deceptive and groundless is the notion that Senator McGovern would try to lead the nation back Into isolationismas if such a thing were possible in the world of jet travel, satellite communications, international commerce and ICBM's. Nothing in the McGovern campaign record conveys any sense that the United States should or could retreat from the position of world leadership which it has held during the greater part of three decades.

title: MASSENGALE VICTOR BY 2 SHOTS WITH 280
description: PINEHURST, N.C. Oct. 22 (AP)Don Massengale, a former pro who teaches at the Elmwood Country Club in White Plains, N.Y., carded a 68 today with four birdies on the incoming nine and won the $100,000 Professional Golfers' Association club pro championship.

title: An Appraisal
description: EXETER, N.H.They're big on making movies and buildings at Phillips Exeter Academy. Currently it's A Separate Peace and the new library.

title: Levitt Attacks State Buying Of Supplies as Rigid, Costly
description: In a highly detailed criticism of New York State's purchasing practices, State Controller Arthur Levitt reported yesterday that restrictive specifications and the corresponding limited competition caused the state to pay higher prices than the Federal Government and some other states for many supplies.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTONOne of the highestranking American prisoners in North Vietnam is James Mulligan, a Navy captain who was shot down over Vinh on March 20, 1966. His wife, Louise, has waited for six and onehalf years now with astonishing strength, wisdom and even humor. As many Government officials have learned, she is a rare person so courageous and so straight that she makes one ashamed of one's own petty worries.

title: 125,206 at Games Here
description: The Giants beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 2721, before 62,258 fans at Yankee Stadium and the Jets downed the Baltimore Colts, 2420, before 62,948 at Shea Stadium yesterday. (Page 43.)

title: The Sick Foundations
description: The philanthropic foundations are often attacked for the wrong reasons and defended on the wrong grounds. The attack usually comes from political quarters which consider any grant in support of innovation or progress as a sign of subversion. The defense generally takes refuge in the theory that foundations if left to their own devices will just naturally serve the public good.

title: Veterans Day Parade Is Highlight of Holiday
description: Veterans, young and old, will march down Fifth Avenue today but the likelihood is that they may have to combat rainy weather. The National Weather Service predicted intermittent showers and temperatures in the low 60's.

title: Price Commission Finds Profit Rise Within Rules
description: Sharply higher profits have been reported by hundreds of corporations in the last two weeks, but the Price Commission says there still appears to be good conformance with its rules restricting profit margins.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: A task force of the Scott Commission yesterday urged the creation of nine regional entities to deal with problems such as transportation, housing solidwaste disposal and of water and power supply that vex New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Detectives of the Nassau County vice squad seized a roulette wheel, a Big6 wheel, dice, blackjack tables and chips Saturday night at Temple Emmanuel on Neptune Boulevard in Long Beach. The detectives said they saw no one gambling and none of the 200 people present was arrested.

title: Jets Defeat Colts, 2420, on Late Pass; 2dHalf Giant Rally Tops Cards, 2721
description: Trailing by 217 at intermission because they yielded two touchdowns in the last 65 seconds, the New York Giants took command in the second half anti defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 2721, at Yankee Stadium yesterday for their, fourth straight victory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Concordes are not coming for the reasons given by Mr. Gessner's excellent OpEd article [Oct. 10]. In my view, it is irresponsible for some aviation enthusiasts such as Mr. Masefield, whose article appeared on the same day, to continue to force this unwanted and uneconomic aircraft on the public. The public needs many things aviation can deliverlower costs, safety, improved airtraffic control, quiet highcapacity jet ports, shorthaul air systems, improved general aviation, etc. For some reasons, the aviation community is not being adequately responsive to these needs. The American jumbo jets seem to be one indication of such responsiveness, while the BritishFrench Concorde is an example of nonresponsiveness.

title: Analyst Regards Utilities as Promising
description: QUESTION: On the matter of relative market value, what lends some attraction to utility stocks at the present time?

title: Kuwait Plans to Withhold Signature on Oil Agreement
description: KUWAIT, Oct. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)  Kuwait will withhold her signature this week from the longnegotiated agreement on participationownership by the Gulf oilproducing countries in the capital of the Western companies that operate in their territories.

title: Inhumane Puppy Mills a Growing Blight
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Oct. 22 The stench starts about halfway down the hill.

title: An Appraisal
description: EXETER, N.H.They're big on making movies and buildings at Phillips Exeter Academy. Currently it's A Separate Peace and the new library.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 22 (AP)Jim Fox came up with a clutch performance to lead the Seattle Supersonics to a 120119 overtime victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight. Fox scored 24 points and cleared 17 rebounds.

title: CHOPIN PIANO WORKS PLAYED BY BARBOSA
description: His way paved by three successful Chopin recordings and a sonata appearance here last season with the Polish violinist Wanda Wilkomirska, Antonio, Barbosa made his formal recital debut yesterday afternoon before a large and friendly audidnce at the Hunter College Playhouse. In the first of three Chopin programs, the young Brazilian pianist played three polonaises, six waltzes and the B minor Sonata.

title: Boggs Air Hunt, in 6th Day, Hampered by Clouds
description: ANCHORAGE, Oct. 22 (AP)  Tracking and backtracking, rescue airplanes dodged lowflying clouds today in the sixth day of a search for the missing House majority leader, Hale Boggs, and three other men.

title: Wilds of Asphalt jungle Explored by Sierra Club
description: Most Sierra Club outings are strenuous hikes in places with names like Great, Swamp and Breakneck Ridge. On Saturday night, however, the conservation  minded group sponsored a sevenhour trek through the flashing lights and sleeping streets of Manhattan Island.

title: Kahn Defines Aim Of Exeter Design
description: PHILADELPHIA  Building by building his laurels grow, and the fates, which once glowered implacably, now finally beam.

title: Big Brokerage Houses Face Earnings Squeeze
description: Hard times have fallen on Wall Street again, and profits in the brokerage business are once more becoming elusive.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 22 President Nixon will be visiting largely friendly territory when he comes to Westchester Coun6 ty tomorrow, but the Republicans here are leaving nothing about his visit to chance.

title: The President's Itinerary for Today
description: The President and Mrs. Nixon plan a motorcade through 12 communities in Westchester, following their arrival sometime after noon at Westchester County Airport in Purchase.

title: Warsaw Audience Hails City Ballet as Tour Ends
description: WARSAW, Oct. 22The New York City Ballet ended monthlong tour of the Soviet Union and Poland last night before a delighted Warsaw audience that lavished its affection on George Balanchine, the director.

title: Scott Report Proposes Tristate Units To Control Services on an Area Basis
description: A task force of the Scott Commission yesterday urged the creation of nine regional entities to deal with problems such of transportation, housing, solidwaste disposal and of water and power supply that vex New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: KNUDSON VICTOR IN KAISER ON 271
description: NAPA, Calif., Oct. 22 (UPI)George Knudson scored a twounderpar 70 today and won the $30,000 first prize in the $150,000 Kaiser International open golf tournament. He won by three strokes in spite of a record 64 round by Bobby Nichols.

title: ALFRED TURK DEAD; NEWSMAN, CITY AIDE
description: Alfred Turk, a veteran newspaperman who retired last February from the City Traffic Department, died yesterday of heart attack at his home, 11 East 31st Street, Brooklyn. He was 68 years old.

title: McGovern and President Win Newspaper Support
description: The Sunday Record, which is circulated in Bergen County and elsewhere in northern New Jersey, yesterday endorsed Senator George McGovern's Presidential candidacy because of what it called his unwavering commitment to end the bombing of Vietnam and withdraw all American forces from it.

title: MORE GUARDS DUE FOR CITY SCHOOLS
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the City School Chancellor, said yesterday that the Board of Education would allocate $6million this week to hire at least 1,200 security aides for patrol duty in the city's schools.

title: TRANSIT DEMANDS ON POWER STUDIED
description: A special state committee has begun considering ways to reduce drains on fuel and energy for transportation, including possible taxing of automobiles based on size and power and a ban on use of cars in the central business districts of cities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your criticism of President Nixon (editorial Oct. 14), in which you charge him with hiding from the issues raised by candidate McGovern, carries your partisanship beyond the limits of goad sense and reasonable understanding.

title: Dick Durham Duo of Jazz Piano And Drums Is Versatile Combo
description: Piano and drums are about as bareboned and basic as a jazz combo can be. But Dick Durham, the pianist in the Dick Durham Duo, which played at the weekly Jazz Adventures session Friday at the Playboy Club, has managed to expand the usual concept of a jazz pianist into something approaching a quintet or a quartet.

title: Health Fairs
description: A community health fair can be a good way to let people know what health servnospital Fund of New York. Whole families were given free tests to detect such diseases as cancer, sickle cell disease, anemia, and glaucoma.

title: A'S BEAT REDS, 32, IN SEVENTH GAME AND TAKE SERIES
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22The Oakland A'sthe only team in baseball with 19 mustaches and one mule  finally won the World Series today when they defeated the Cincinnati Reds in the seventh and last game, 32.

title: Man in the News
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22 When Pete Rose's fly settled in Joe Rudi's glove in left field in the ninth inning today, Charles O. Finley grabbed his wife, Shirley, and gave her the biggest kiss since we were married. Then the controversial owner of the Oakland A's jumped on top of the dugout, helped his wife up with him and waved his arms in jubilation over his team's World Series victory. Several minutes later, he walked into the team's clubhouse, his shoulders slumped from nervous fatigue and his hoarse voice filled with sobs. The first player he saw was Gene Tenace, the Series hero, and he embraced him warmly. Then several other players saw Finley and they began pouring California Blanc de Pinot champagne over his baldish head and green blazer.

title: Credit Markets
description: In sharp contrast to the attitude that prevailed as recently as Labor Day, a majority of Wall Street credit analysts now expects to see no major advance in interest rates in the foreseeable future.

title: Advertising: Waiting for Exxon
description: About 1,000 shareholders in Standard Oil (New Jersey) are expected at the Roosevelt Hotel tomorrow to vote for the new name, the Exxon Corporation. If they don't, they'll ruin some fine corporate planning.

title: Cornell Takes First Place In McMillan Cup Sailing
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 22With consistent good sailing, Cornell moved from yesterday's third place to win the McMillan Cup regatta today.

title: Cambodia: AFear of Forces Beyond Control
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 15Cambodia has passed her second anniversary as a republic and there is a general feeling here that even if the Vietnam war were to end quickly, Cambodia would be broken apart and dominated by forces beyond her control. There is also a feeling of resignation and a sense that resistance to inevitable historical forces is futile.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MORRISTOWN, Oct. 22Leaders of the Jail Chaplaincy Council of Morris County called tonight for a complete restructuring of governmental regulation of the county jail and the creation of a professional county department of corrections.

title: ADMIRAL REFORMS NAVY WAR COLLEGE
description: NEWPORT, R. I.The Naval War College here has changed its curriculum drastically to teach future admirals how to cope with the Soviet Navy in an era of limited resources, public criticism and, in some areas of the service, lingering overconfidence.

title: Oakland Bridges BayAreaGap
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22Perhaps Oakland found both an identity and a measure of pride today. For more than a century it has been on the wrong side of the bay from that glorious city of glamour, romance and nostalgia, San Francisco. Oakland was the poor relation, the peasant scorned by the aristocrats across the bridge. That was only when San Franciscans lowered their sights to sufficient degree to concede that Oakland even existed.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Redskins Win FirstPlace Battle With Cowboys, 2420
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The unsung Charlie Harraway scored the winning touchdown for Washington against Dallas today, but Tom Landry, the Cowboy coach, sang the praises of Larry Brown, the Redskins' persistent star. Brown was key man in almost every play except Harraway's 13yard weakside end run in the final period that gave Washington 2420 victory.

title: PASSPORT CHIEF ASKS MORE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 Frances Knight, the director of the State Department's Passport Office, has charged before Congress that her superiors are denying her the funds and staff she needs while passport frauds are steadily rising particularly in the international drug traffic.

title: Wells Fargo Terminates Bid for $1.25Billion Bank
description: The Wells Fargo Bank, San Francisco, announced over the weekend formal termination of its agreement to buy the $1.25billion First Western Bank and Trust Company, Los Angeles, from World Airways, Inc. for $95million in cash and notes.

title: U.S. Planes Bomb Heavily In North and Near Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Oct. 23 (AP)The allied commands reported sustained United States bombing of North Vietnam and ground action in the South yesterday as toplevel diplomatic consultations continued on the subject of peace.

title: Marsha Cohen Officer's Bride
description: WEST PATERSON, N. J., Oct. 22Miss Marsha Nan. Cohen, daughter, of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Cohen of Paterson, and Capt. Robert Paul Feyer, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. George Feyer of New York, were married here today in the Westmount Country Club. Rabbi Edwin Soslow of Beth Sholom Reform Temple in Clifton performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. John C. Katonah of the Church of the Brethren in Melrose Park, Ill.

title: Tenace's Joy Is Diminished by Manager's Strategy
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22 Gene Tenace was upset that Manager Dick Williams took him out of today's seventh World Series game in the sixth inning, but Joe Morgan was more upset that the Cincinnati Reds let one guy [Tenace] beat us.

title: OLIVIA STAPP SINGS DEBUT IN CARMEN
description: Good performances of Carmen are not to be found under every rock, though it sometimes appears as if opera companies look for them there. Being the masterly score it is, we tend to demand more of it in performance than of lesser works, just as the experienced wine drinker demands something special when he opens a famous bottle. However, against all the odds, we have two quite satisfactory Carmens running concurrently at Lincoln Center.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP, Oct. 22 The state police were looking today for two holdup men who ordered food and robbed the man who delivered it to them at a vacant store.

title: DANIEL DEMAREST, DEVISED MACHINES
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Oct. 22Daniel Douglas Demarest, machinery manufacturer and inventor, died yesterday in the Manhasset Medical Center. He was 80 years old and lived here.

title: HUNTER RECITAL BY JANET BAKER
description: Janet Baker is capable of achieving greatness as a singer, and it is difficult to understand why she ever settles for something less. In her recital at Hunter College Assembly Hall Saturday night, the English mezzosoprano began sensationally with an astonishing performance of Haydn's Arianna a Naxos, but by the time the evening ended, she had long since turned to characteristically pretty singing that, though attractive, was much less compelling.

title: PRESIDENT PRAISES'. RETURNING G.I.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 President Nixon, in his second nationwide radio speech of the weekend, built today on a Veterans Day theme to praise young Americans who have served in Vietnam and to detail his Administration's achievements in their behalf.

title: Young Oars and Old, All 1,490, Enjoy HeadofCharles Regatta
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 22 And now here comes No. 19, the loudspeaker crackled, That's Ed Witte, oldest man in the regatta at 77, dropping his blades beautifully as he goes through the Eliot Bridge arch and into the last halfmile.

title: 2 Street Musicians Migrate to a Warmer Clime, Staten Island Ferry
description: It was Handel and Telemann outwardbound and Vivaldi on the way back yesterday for Staten Island ferry riders. They heard miniconcerts by an oboist and a bassoonist, along with their coffee and hot dogs.

title: Woman Mental Patient, 64, Found Bludgeoned to Death
description: A 64yearold woman mental patient missing from the Bronx State Hospital was found bludgeoned to death yesterday in Bronx Park after she apparently had been sexually assaulted.

title: Walk to Aid Charity Is Halted by Police As Some Get Unruly
