description: MIAMI, Oct. 27After a day of legal maneuvering, the Florida trial of Bernard L. Barker on charges of misusing his notary public seal has been rescheduled to next Wednesday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Oct. 27Sincel nobody seemed to speak up for plowshares, the Federal Government and Bergen County cooperated today to turn swords into bridle paths when the Government formally presented part of a defunct Nike missile base to the county.

title: Missouri Bent on Another Upset
description: Colorado and Missouri really set things up for their meeting today when the Buffaloes surprised Oklahoma, 20.14, and the Tigers moved through the rain to a 3026 victory over Notre Dame last week in two of the biggest upsets of the season.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BERLIN, Oct. 27 (UPI) Ambassadors of the United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and France met for three hours today to discuss their occupation rights in Berlin. The session was the third since the talks began Monday.

title: Music: Polish Concerto
description: Onethird of the New York Philharmonic's program on Thursday evening was threethird's Polish. Karol Szymanowski, the Polish composer who died in 1937, was represented by his Violin Concerto No. 2, as played by the Polish violinist Henryk Szeryng and conducted by the Polish maestro Stanislaw Skrowaczewski. The other two works on the program were Olivier Messiaen's Les Offrandes oubliees and the Symphony in D minor by Cesar Franck.

title: WILLIAM D. WELCH
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 27 William D. Welch, a lawyer here for more than 50 years, died yesterday in a local nursing home after a brief illness. He was 83 years old.

title: People and Business
description: After 63 years there has been a change of guard at Burns International Security Services. D. Bruce Burns, 51yearold grandson of the company founder stepped down as chairman and passed executive leadership to the first nonBurns in the company's history. Mr. Burns will be chairman of the executive committee.

title: Talks Shift to New York In Pacific Maritime Strike
description: Federal efforts to end a strike by merchant marine deck officers shifted here from Washington yesterday, The Associated Press reported.

title: In A Giant Michigan Region, Personal Contact Is Key
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Oct. 27Hi! I'm Congressman Philip Ruppe, the man said for maybe the 250th time that day. I wonder if we've met.

title: By Andre Beaufre
description: PARIS  Now that the cold war is easing, and taking more ambiguous forms, and Europe is picking herself up, the United States, which has imprudently dispersed its forces in an ambitious world policy, strongly feels the need to limit its efforts: domestic inflation, and the balance of payments deficit impose a reduction in military expenses in the domain of nuclear strategy as in that of foreign engagements.

title: Soviet Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)The Soviet Union launched today another weather satelite in the Meteor series, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported here.

title: Asks Business Support
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The new head of the Justice Department's Antitrust division said today that his agency was taking steps to make sure it could move swiftly to seek injunctions against planned mergers that companies keep secret until the last minute.

title: Canarsie Fears Values Are Beginning to Erode
description: It used to be, when the rest of the country was laughing at Brooklyn, that Brooklyn residents were laughing at Canarsie, for it was then a sparsely settled marshland broken only by weedy lots and small truck farms and scattered homes.

title: Missile Crisis Plus Ten
description: A decade has now passed since the Cuban missile crisis, perhaps the most dangerous week the world has ever known. Never was the world so close to thermonuclear Armageddon as it of then. Faced with the secret Soviet emplacement of nuclear weapons in Cuba, President Kennedy gave a measured responsethe quarantine of Castro's islandthat allowed Soviet Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev time to ponder the President's demand for withdrawal of the offensive missiles. In the most important decision of his career, Khrushchev decided to back down, despite the predictable attacks this retreat would bring him from Communist militants at home and abroad.

title: WINE TALK
description: BORDEAUX, France They finished picking at Chateau Lafite on Tuesday at Mouton and Latour on Wednesday. The only activity in the vineyards of the Medoc now is the distant pop of shotguns as the peasants (and some of the proprietors) hunt quail in the early morning mist.

title: Thieu Insists That a CeaseFire Hinges on Hanoi Troop Pullout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27  President Nguyen Van Thieu insisted today that his minimum demand before accepting a ceasefire was the total withdrawal of all North Vietnamese troops from South Vietnam.

title: Federal Union Chief Quits
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI) John F. Griner resigned today as president of the 300,000. member American Federation of Government Employes, citing ill health. Clyde M. Webber, the union's executive vice presiHlent, was sworn in as Mr. Griner's successor at a meeting of the union's national executive council.

title: Walker Sparks Rockets
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Jimmy Walker of Houston turned on his former teammates tonight as the Rockets beat the Detroit Pistons, 130118. The victory put the Rockets on top of the Central Division.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CONTINUE TO RISE Rain in. Harvesting Areas and Sales to China Cited
description: Soybean futures prices continued to gain yesterday, bolstered again by rain in the harvest areas and confirmation of a report that mainland China had bought soybeans recently.

title: Postmen Accused Of Shaking Down Relief Recipients
description: Federal postal authorities are investigating charges by a Hispanic civil rights group that several Bronx postmen are shaking down recipients of welfare and social security checks for as much as $5 each to insure safe delivery of the checks.

title: Escapee Posed as Lawyer
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 27 (AP)The, police said a man wanted for murder in California and charged with kidnapping a West Hartford policeman walked out of a policetation detention area here yesterday afternoon by posing as a lawyer. The man is Edward McZeal, 27 years old, of Hartford.

title: Apollo 17 Geologist Looks Forward to Moon Sampling
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 The geologistastronaut who will go to the moon on Apollo 17 said today there was a good chance that the mission would uncover both some of the youngest and some of the oldest lunar rocks ever examined by man.

title: Return to Paris Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27High Administration officials said today that, despite North Vietnam's latest statements in Paris, they remained confident that an Indochina agreement would be concluded in a matter of weeks.

title: Yeats's Son Finds Poetry Leaves Him Cold
description: The story is told in my family that when I was 5 years old I came downstairs one evening at our house in Merrion Square in Dublin and announced in a stentorian voice, I hate boetry, said Michael Yeats, chairman of the Senate of the Republic of Ireland, barrister and only son of William Butler Yeats.

title: Business Briefs
description: LAPAZ, Bolivia, Oct. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)The Bolivian peso was devalued today and is now valued at 20 to the dollar as against the previous 12 to the dollar, Information Minister Guillermo Fortun Suarez announced. He said the devaluation, the first since 1956, would be backed up by several measures aimed at increasing the nation's economic growth.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Michael Cilmi hopes to become the first unhyphenated Conservative in the City Council.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Governor Cahill has selected an architectural firm from St. Louis to explore the possibility of creating a separate facility for incorrigible state prisoners.

title: INVESTORS AWAIT NEWS ON VIETNAM
description: Wall Street sat back yesterday and waited for signs of further progress toward peace in Vietnam, but none came and the stock market slid lower.

title: Key to the Mint Gold Cup Choice Today
description: The Jockey Club Gold Cup will have an expanded field of 10 contestants in its 54th running today at Aqueduct. A late addition to the twomile raceSigmund Sommer's Perry Masonhas increased the gross value to $115,200. The winner's share now amounts to $60,120.

title: McGovern Daughter Barred
description: GRANITE CITY, Ill., Oct. 27 (UPI)Mrs. Ann McGovern Mead, daughter of Senator George McGovern, was refused admittance to a steel plant today to campaign for her father. She campaigned outside in the rain. A spokesman for the Granite City Steel Corporation said company policy did not alow campaigning inside the plant.

title: Antiques: Record Prices
description: Prices for topquality American furniture are beginning to rival those set at auction by important paintingsa fact borne out by the new highs for superb 18thcentury furniture at two spectacular auctions in New York kind Detroit over the Veterans Day weekend.

title: Bridge:
description: The most disappointed player in the Metropolitan Championships a week ago was West after the diagramed deal from the open pairs final.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: City Orders Inquiry Into Death of Three At Coney I. Hospital
description: The president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation said yesterday that he had ordered an investigation into three deaths at Coney Island Hospital that have caused intense community protest.

title: PARK CALLS CHANGES TAILORED TO KOREA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 27 President Park Chung Hee said today that his proposed constitutional amendments were designed to develop South Korea's own style of democracy to suit the nation's realities and ideals.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 27 (AP)Standing under a sign saying, Welcome Home Mr. Vice President, Spiro T. Agnew said tonight he was confident that Maryland would not let down the national Republican ticket as it did in 1968.

title: HORACE F. KELLEY
description: Horace F. Kelley, a member of the retail advertising department sales staff of The New York Times, died yesterday as a result of injuries suffered in ah accidental fall on Sunday. He was 30 years old and lived at 17030 130th Avenue, Jamaica, Queens.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAGIN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct, 27Court recdrds here show that in 1962, Richard M. Nixon and his aide, H. R. Haldeman, personally, approved a direct mail campaign later found illegal in a lawsuit brought by Democrats.

title: Nyack Art Students Substitute Paint Brushes for Pranks on Halloween
description: NYACK, N. Y., Oct. 27Shop windows here are crawling with goblins, devils and other ghoulish creatures that seem to emerge from the nether reaches of the imagination every year around Halloween.

title: Amtrak Doubles Train Service For New YorkFlorida Travel
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)  Amtrak announced today that it would double its New YorkFlorida passenger train service, this winter, but that it had canceled a winter season tradition of 84 years, the Florida Special.

title: 68 DERBY IS GIVEN TO FORWARD PASS
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 27 (AP)  The Kentucky State Racing Commission named today Calumet Farm's Forward Pass as the winner of the controversial 1968 Kentucky Derby.

title: Seeking Something They. Say They Can't Find in a Synagogue
description: CROMPOND, N. Y.There was once a Jewish grand, mother in Philadelphia who received a telephone call from her grandson in distant Yorktown.

title: Vietcong Pledge
description: HONG KONG, Saturday, Oct. 28The Vietcong pledged in a radio broadcast monitored here today to absolutely respect and carry out all provisions of the reported peace agreement worked out by United States and North Vietnamese negotiators in secret talks in Paris.

title: Cairo Names New Navy Chiefl
description: CAIRO, Oct. 27 (AP)President Ahwar elSadat appointed Commodore Fuad Zekry as commander of the Egyptian Navy today, replacing Mahmoud Fahmi Abdul Rahman.

title: 23 Jurors Named To Pick Winners Of 7 Book Awards
description: The names of 23 jurors who will choose winners of net year's National Book Awards were announced yesterday by a spokesman for the National Book Committee, Inc., which makes the awards annually.

title: MARK TORY, AUTHOR AND TV WRITER, DIES
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., Oct. 271 Mark Toby, novelist, radio and television writer, and a former teacher, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 19 Manchester Road. He was 59 years old.

title: MISS HAYNIE TIES FOR LEAD WITH 66
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Oct. 27 (UPI)Marilynn Smith and Sandra Haynie fired fourunderpar 66's today to tie for the firstround lead in the $20,000 Corpus Christi Civitan open. Miss Smith's lastnine 31 was the best ninehole effort of her career. Miss Haynie had frontnine 32 over the 6,300yard Pharaoh's Country Club course.

title: TV: 2 Stars Welcomed
description: Its a fine idea to have the First Lady of the American Theater gracing a television suspense thriller. As for good old Charlie Brownwelcome back, kid, anytime. Tomorrow night it's No. 8 in the homeset specials.

title: New Forest Hills Plans Are Ready, Golar Says
description: Simeon Golar, the chairman of the city's Housing Authority, said yesterday that architects and engineers of the authority had already formulated contingency plans to implement the compromise on the controversial Forest Hills lowincome housing project.

title: Talks Termed Necessary
description: PARIS, Oct. 27The Soyiet Ambassador to France, who is a member of the Soviet Communist party's Central Committee, said today that he thought that further ceasefire negotiations were necessary because it was essential that the agreements be signed, and that otherwise they might not be signed.

title: Merger News
description: The Brown & Williamson Tobacco Company announced yesterday it had purchased the majority interest in the Kohl Corporation of Milwaukee, operators of more than 65 supermarkets, department stores and drug stores in Wisconsin and Illinois. Edwin P. Finch, president of Brown & Williamson, said its interest in Kohl was purchased from the Kohl family. Terms were not disclosed. Kohl is privately owned.

title: Further Economic Gain, Less Inflation Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The Government reported today fresh indications that the expansion of the economy was continuing and that inflationary pressures might be abating.

title: MGOVERN WARNS UNIONS ON NIXON
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27Senator George McGovern charged here today that the Nixon Administration was preparing a major assault on American labor while it talks friendship with its leaders.

title: Maddox Backs Schmitz
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27 (AP)Lieut. Gov. Lester Maddox said today that he had endorsed the American party Presidential ticket headed by Representative John G. Schmitz, Republican of California.

title: Schmidt Predicts Gain
description: BONN, Oct. 27 Economics Minister Helmut Schmidt said today that peace in Vietnam could lead to a downright reversal of the dollar flow on international money markets toward the direction of the United States next year.

title: F.C.C. TO REVIEW PRIMETIME RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The Federal Communications Commission announced today that it plans to review its primetime access rule. The rule, adopted a year ago and fully in effect only since the first of this month, was aimed at forcing TV stations affiliated with networks to broadcast more nonnetwork programs.

title: Daylight Time Will End At 2 A.M. Tomorrow
description: Daylight saving time for this year will end tomorrow at 2 A.M., and most of the nation will get back the one hour's sleep lost in April when the clock was turned ahead.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Satellite Launching Put Off
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)  Technical difficulties have forced a postponement of at least two weeks in the Nov. 2 Indian Ocean launching of the Small Astronomy SatelliteB, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 27 (UPI)  Lee Trevino, who was at 142, said he almost obit the tournament because of slow play of other pros and urged officials to penalize the culprits.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Sculptured in the gray granite of the Riverside Church, a row of angels overlooked the entrance. Once they had been almost white, but through the years, exhaust from automobiles and buses had streaked most of the angels faces black. Behind gray wooden horses on the sidewalk and on the grass across Riverside Drive, most of the faces were black, too. The hearse was parked in front of the church. Nearby, its driver, 57yearold Charles Patterson, stood in his black jacket, white shirt, a thin striped gray and black tic, and thin striped gray and black pants. His job is driving hearses for a Harlem undertaker, but he wasn't scheduled for a funeral yesterday, and he was asleep in his Harlem apartment when the phone rang.

title: 2 With Knives Take Court Officer's Check
description: A uniformed Brooklyn Traffic Court officer was robbed of his $271 paycheck yesterday, according to the police.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)A major revision of the overthecounter stock tables furnished newspapers was proposed today by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The association furnishes the bid and asked quotations from its automated quotations system known as NASDAQ. The new criteria for quotation in the National List for newspaper publication would result in some changes of the stocks on the selected list.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW MEXICO TO SUE ON OIL SPILL HARM
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Oct. 27 (UPI)The New Mexico EnvironmentalImprovement Agen cy will file suit against the Texas owner of a truck that overturned and spilled thousands of gallons of diesel fuel into the Cimarron River this week, causing a fish kill of between 10,000 and 15,000.

title: Black Pupils Enter 211 As Police Quell Disorder
description: Twentyeight black and Puerto Rican children from the Brownsville section of Brooklyn entered John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie amid boos and catcalls from more than 1,000 demonstrators after police had routed protesting parents from the entrance and pushed back others who broke through barricades.

title: HELP SEEN NEAR FOR SOVIET DEAL
description: Henry Kearns, president and chairman of the ExportImport Bank, said here yesterday that he expected the bank to extend the first credit in support of United States export sales to the Soviet Union within weeks.

title: News Analysis
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 President Nixon warned in January that he would pull the rug out from under any opponent who might seek to make an issue of the Vietnam war. But the talk in the campaign of Senator George McGovern here today was that by waiting until the last days before the election to proclaim that peace Was in sight, Mr. Nixon may have pulled the carpet from beneath him self. It is an unconventional attitude, but the McGovern candidacy is unconventional.

title: 2 Donors of Food To Poor Children Beaten and Robbed
description: Twenty children showed up yesterday at the New Hope Baptist Church in the Hammels sections of Rockaway Beach, Queens, for their usual free hot breakfast but were turned away. The reason: three muggers got there first.

title: NUMBERED ACCOUNT UPSETS CHOU CROUTE
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 22 (AP)Numbered Account, racing in a steady drizzle but over a fast track, matched Round Table's course record today in winning the $59,800 Spinster Stakes at Keeneland.

title: XRays Hint Black Hole Exists in Sky
description: After almost a year of observation and analysis several astronomers believe they have confirmed the existence of a black hole in the sky.

title: AIR FORCE MAY END SEARCH FOR BOGGS
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska Oct. 27 (UPIThe Air Force gave the first indication today that the search for Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, the House majority leader, and three others might be called off.

title: Teachers, Escorted Inside by Police, Make Black Pupils Feel Welcome
description: While white Carnarsie parents booed and jeered outside John Wilson Junior High School 211 yesterday, black youths from Brownsville spent their first full day inside school since it opened. It was, said 12yearold Anthony Pride of Brownsville, a pretty good day.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PATERSON, Oct. 27  One of the things Thomas C. Rooney Jr., the Democratic candidate for Mayor, and Edwin J. Englehardt, his Republican opponent, agree on is that each is the man to beat.

title: Hyndman, Person in Golf Final
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Oct. 27 (UPI)Bill Hyndman and Curtis Person swept two matches today to reach the final of the North and South senior golf tournament.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27  In a strange election, this must have been the strangest moment: George McGovern about to leave Detroit for his day of campaigning, and suddenly the accompanying press hears that Henry Kissinger is talking on television about peace in Vietnam. Everyone piles out of the buses to watch in the cocktail lounge of a Howard Johnson's motel.

title: Record Puerto Rican Vote Foreseen in 2Party Race
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Oct. 27A record total of 1.2million Puerto Ricans are expected to vote on Nov. 7 in what is shaping up as one of the most hotly contested gubernatorial and legislative elections in the island's history.

title: MGROVERN WARNS UNIONS ON NIXON
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27Senator George McGovern charged here today that the Nixon Administration was preparing a major assault on American labor while it talks friendship with its leaders,

title: ElevenOfficer Rule in Dahomey Is Set Up Following Army Coup
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Oct. 27An 11man military Government was named today to lead the West African nation of Dahomey, less than 24 hours after a coup d'6tat in the capital city of Cotonou.

title: Hollis W. Grathwohl Dies; Retired Advertising Official
description: NEW SUFFOLK, L. I., Oct. 27Hollis W. Grathwohl, a retired advertising executive who had been on the staffs of The Brooklyn Daily Times and The New York Herald Tribune, died of cancer today at his home here. He was 64 years old.

title: SOUTHERN UTILITY RAISES EARNINGS Revenues for Nine Months Also Register Gain
description: The Southern Company and subsidiaries reported yesterday operating revenues of $743million for the first nine months: This compared with $615million a year earlier. Net income rose to $90.8million, or $1.45 a share, from the $75million, Or $1.35 a share, on fewer shares, in the first nine months of 1971. Southern is a holding company with operating subsidiaries in parts of Alabama, Florida, Georgia and Mississippi.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place:
description: In 1897, news flashed across the continent that gold had been discovered in the Klondike. Miners and wouldbe miners rushed North to seek their fortunes. In all, $170million worth of gold was extracted over a 30year period.

title: Yonkers Witness Is Silent on Fire In Which 12 Died
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 27 Thomas A. Ruppert, once convicted of setting a fire that killed 12 people at the Yonkers Jewish Community Center, declined during a civil trial today to answer questions about the blaze.

title: Nuclear Plant Hearings
description: BRATTLEBORO, Vt., Oct. 27 (AP)The Atomic Energy Commission has ended its Vermont hearings on permanently licensing the Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corporation plant. The agency's Safety and Licensing Board adjourned the hearing until Nov. 9, when a brief session will be held in Washington to discuss the costbenefit analysis of Vermont Yankee's operation.

title: POLICE OPERATION GUARDS STUDENTS
description: Just after dark, on Thursday, the New York City Police Department put into operation a plan to protect the black and Puerto Rican children who Were to enter Junior High School 211 the following morning.

title: P.B.I. Stops Collecting Candidate Data
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27L. Patrick Gray 3d, the acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, disclosed today that for 22 years the bureau had been compiling biographical data on major Congressional candidates, He said he was ending the practice immediately.

title: City Opera
description: The Now York City Opera's muchreviled and much  revised Don Giovanni continues to undergo changes, yet it has not lost the startling but plausible point of view that guided Frank CorSaro's production from the start. Mozart's Don Juan is mythicized as a rather fearsome, irresistible sexual force, and at no time glazed over in the 19thcentury manner.

title: Teacher Is Robbed In Brooklyn School; The 14th in 16 Days
description: A teacher was robbed in Public School 19 in Brooklyn yesterday by a man who seized her handbag containing $35 and personal papers.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: A Federal judge in Trenton said that the trial cit Louis Tonti, the former executive director of the New Jersey Highway Authority, on extortion charges would begin early next year.

title: New Trees in Brooklyn
description: Long under the domination of oldline party leaders, Brooklyn is not known for the large number of independent legislators it sends biennially to Albany. This year, however, could mark the beginning of a change. A group, of unfettered, dynamic young candidates seeks election to the State Legislature from this borough.

title: Books of The Times
description: Out of the events surrounding one of the pivotal moments in Western history the transition of the Roman republic to an imperial dictatorship, John Williams has fashioned an always engaging, psychologically convincing work of fiction. He has done so without employing the usual attentioncatching devices. There are no sex  and  saberscenes, no examples of Hollywood pageantry, not much in the way of individual derringdo. In fact; in its restraint and literary severity, the novel suggests those qualities that the old schoolhooks told us were the proud possessions of the ancient Romans.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Port Commissioner Named
description: Robert R. Douglass, a lawyer with the firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley and McCloy, has been appointed by Governor Rockefeller as a commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. Mr. Douglass, a former secretary to Governor Rockefeller, replaces Hoyt Ammidon, who resigned last May.

title: Giants Put Theories in Practice
description: While their players spent another quiet day working themselves into the small frenzy that must be detonated in any important football game, Coach Alex Webster and his staff looked ahead to Sunday's game with the Washington Redskins and sharpened their theories.

title: SHRIVER DENOUNCES 9 VETOES BY NIXON
description: Sargent Shriver, denounced President Nixon's nine vetoes yesterday as previews of generation of injustice in second Nixon Administration.

title: Thieu Insists That a CeaseFire Hinges on Hanoi Troop Pullout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27  President Nguyen Van Thieu insisted today that his minimum demand before accepting a ceasefire was the total withdrawal of all North Vietnamese troops from South Vietnam.

title: Equity Financing
description: The secondary offering of 60,200 common shares of the Kirsch Company at $38.25 a share was completed yesterday, the E. F. Hutton and Model Roland Company announced. The company's stock closed at 37 down  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Personalities: Texas Gets Carty
description: Several trades marked the professional sports front yesterday, but none was bigger than the one involving Rico Carty, the controversial slugger with the Atlanta Braves. Carty, with a lifetimeaverage of 317, was traded to the Texas Rangers for Jim Panther, a littleknown relief pitcher with a wonlost record of 59 last year, his first in the major leagues.

title: Reds List Accord Items
description: PARIS, Oct. 27North Vietnam's spokesman in Paris said today that the points of agreement reached by Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho in Paris went far beyond those issued by the Hanoi Government yesterday. He termed Hanoi's lengthy statement merely a summary.

title: Jackie Goes Home to Brooklyn
description: Jackie Robinson received hero's burial here yesterday, mourned as a man of courage by those who knew him and solemnly saluted as a legend by strangers who never saw hnn play.

title: Hawks Face Islanders, Rangers Here
description: The Chicago Black Hawks may not win any popularity contests outside their home town, but they do gladden the hearts of club owners all round the National Hockey League because they Invariably fill the house.

title: Canarsie Fears Values Are Beginning, to Erode
description: It used to be, when the rest of the country was laughing at Brooklyn, that Brooklyn residents were laughing at Canarsie, for it was then a sparsely settled marshland broken only by weedy lots and small truck farms and scattered homes.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 27 (AP)Senate Majority Leader Mike Mansfield Democrat of Montana, said today that he takes Henry A. Kissinger, the President's national  security adviser, at his word that peace and not politics is the main concern of the Administration in the current negotiations for peace in Vietnam.

title: MARINER 9 MISSION OF. MARS ORBITS ENDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Mariner 9 ended its Marsorbiting mission today when it ran out of attitudecontrol gas during its 698th orbit of the planet. The spacecraft had been expected to run out of gas about this time.

title: F.B.I. Investigating Airline ExAides
description: George A. Spater, chairman and chief executive officer of American Airlines, confirmed yesterday that Federal agents had been investigating allegations that certain employes of the airline had accepted money from several of our suppliers.

title: BROTHER MURPHY, 78, HISTORY PROFESSOR
description: Brother Donatian Joseph Murphy, who retired in 1967 as moderator of athletics and asistant professor of history at Manhattan College, died Thursday at the Christian Brothers Center, Narragansett, R. I. He was 78 years old.

title: PALMER, WITH 134, SHARES GOLF LEAD
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev. Oct. 27 (AP)Arnold Palmer, seeking to end a 15month victory drought, shot a twounderpar 69 today and retained a share of the lead in the second round of the $135,000 Sahara invitation golf tournament.

title: U.S. REPORT FINDS FOOD PRICES DOWN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The Agriculture Department reported today an overall decline of onetenth of 1 per cent in food prices in September, the first monthly decline since last April.

title: CELTICS CONQUER CAVALIERS, 12397
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)The unbeaten Boston Celtics, led by Paul Silas and Dave Cowens, posted their ninth National Basketball Association victory of the season, beating Cleveland Cavaliers, 12897, tonight.

title: BOSTON U. POSTS TRIUMPH, 3113
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Al Rich, operating out of the wishbone offense, ran for. 1.21 yards and two touchdowns tonight in leading Boston University to 3113 victory over Rhode Island.

title: OIL NATIONS BACK PLAN ON SHARING
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Oct. 27A conference of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries approved today a plan by four Persian Gulf nations to gradually take over foreign  owned oil  producing companies in their territories.

title: Rockefeller and Lindsay Break Ground for 2d Avenue Subway
description: Ground was broken yesterday for the Second Avenue subwaya line first proposed in the nineteentwenties.

title: Tornadoes Touch Down In 3 Southeastern States
description: Tornadoes touched down in Georgia, Florida and Alabama yesterday, causing widespread property damage but only one report of minor injuries.

title: City Orders Inquiry Into Death of Three At Coney I. Hospital
description: The president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation said yesterday that he had ordered an investigation into three deaths at Coney Island Hospital that have caused intense community protest.

title: NIXON USES VETO TO BLOCK 9 BILLS HELD TOO COSTLY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 President Nixon vetoed today nine bills that he said would breach the budget by some $704million in this fiscal year and $1.9billion in the next.

title: Hawks Here for 2Game Stand
description: The Chicago Black Hawks may not win any popularity contests outside their home town, but they do gladden the hearts of club owners all round the National Hockey League because they Invariably fill the house.

title: 5 FLEE ALBANY JAIL IN SHERIFF'S VEHICLE
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27Five prisoners on a kitchen detail overpowered guards tonight and escaped from the Albany County Jail in a station wagon stolen from the County Sheriff's Department.

title: PATRICK CLANCY, 71, EXPOLICE INSPECTOR
description: Patrick J. Clancy, a retired Deputy Chief Inspector of the Police Department, died in Flushing Hospital yesterday of a liver ailment. His age was 71.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: DENVER  Advocates of a partial and unilateral withdrawal of American forces from Europe advance the argument that the Soviet Union has become a status quo power and will not commit an act of aggression against West Europe. On the surface, the argument appears plausible.

title: A New Trial Date Is Set In Dare to Be Great Case
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Oct. 27 (AP)Monday, Nov. 13, was set today for the beginning of a new trial in the securities violation case of a selfproclaimed millionaire, Glenn W. Turner.

title: Red Tide Powers Eased
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent said today that there was no longer any need for the emergency state powers used to ban the sale and harvest of softshell clams and mussels suspected of being contaminated by the red tide of toxic algae. Some restrictions on harvesting remain, howver. The ban on sales was ifted last week.

title: 4 FILE OBJECTIONS TO DU PONT MERGER
description: Four stockholders of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. and the Christiana Securities Company, including one du Pont family member, have filed objections with the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington to the proposed merger of Christiana into du Pont.

title: North Vietnamese Are Expected to Picture CeaseFire as an American Defeat
description: TOKYO, Oct. 27Well before any ceasefire announcement, North Vietnam is carefully preparing its future relationship with the United States: unqualified friendship for the American people and uncompromising condemnation of the United States Administration.

title: NINE TALK
description: ROME, Oct. 27Italy, the world's largest wine producer, has ben plagued by one of the worst vintages in years.

description: Washington officials remained optimistic yesterday on an Indochina settlement, Hanoi offered additional details on the agreement, Saigon continued balking what some observers saw as a delaying tactic and Moscow supported further negotiations.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The (overnment reported today fresh indications that the expansion of the economy was continuing and that inflationary pressures might be abating.

title: DR. LUKE A. MULLIGAN, DIRECTOR OF SURGERY
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Oct. 27Dr. Luke A. Mulligan, director of surgery at Holy Name Hospital, Teaneck, and Bergen Pines Hospital, Paramus, died yesterday at his home, 25 Howard Park Drive.

description: The Nixon Administration hopes to end the Government's controls over the International movement of capital once general agreement is reached on reform of the international monetary system, a member of the President's Council of Economic Advisers said yesterday.

description: The New York Mets acquired Randy Sterling and John Glass, righthanded pitchers, yesterday. Sterling played with Memphis of the Texas League and Glass with Tidewater of the International League last season.

description: A distinguished visitor to the United States delivered a timely warning to Americans who contribute innocently to the Irish Republican Army in sympathy with the grievances of the Catholic minority in Northern Ireland. Citing the generous sums of money which have come from Americans to help alleviate distress in the North, he said:

title: McGovern Says He Is Opposed To Forced ScatterSite Housing
description: Senator George McGovern said yesterday that he opposed Federal efforts to force lowincome, scattersite housing projects on communities.

title: BACK PAY ORDERED IN SUGAR HARVEST
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 27A Federal judge in Washington told the sugar growers of Louisiana today that they must pay their workers a disputed back wage, and he ordered the growers Federal subsidy payments held up until they did so.

title: Hanoi Declares Issues Kissinger Cited Were Settled EarlierSoviet Backs More Talks

title: Sitting On The Fence
description: LONDONThere are one or two points of interest in the response over here to the Presidential election. Perhaps the chief point of interest is that there should be so much interest. The primaries, the conventions, the opinion polls have been covered in detail, not only in papers such as our Times but also in the mass media. A few hours before I wrote this, Senator McGovern was to be heard delivering a speech, on both the main TV evening news bulletins. Nowadays anyone in this country who is at all interested in politics has at least a nodding acquaintance with your electoral system, and quite a number are wellinformed.

title: Black Pupils Enter 211 As Police Quell Disorder
description: Twentyeight black and Puerto Rican children from the Brownsville section of Brooklyn entered John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie amid boos and catcalls from more than 1,000 demonstrators after police had routed protesting parents from the entrance and pushed back others who broke through barricades.

title: Senate Contest
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Oct. 27In his bid for a seat in the United States Senate, Jesse Helms, Republican, has coined a new name for his Democratic opponent: McGovernGalifianakis.

title: Business Briefs
description: The turnover of checking accounts at the nations banks rose sharply in August to a new high, the Federal Reserve Board reported yesterday. Many economists believe that the rate at which money is usedin technical terms, its velocityis equally as important as its quantity in influencing overall economic activity. Thus, rising velocity should imply heightened demands for goods and services.

title: GROSS AIDE TELLS OF BUYING LICENSE
description: The driver for Ted Gross, the city's former Youth Services Commissioner, said he had paid $50 or $75 for the counterfeit and forged chauffeur's license that Mr. Gross was arrested for carrying last July 31.

title: F.D.A. Asks Limits On Food Bacteria That Are Nontoxic
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration is proposing the Government's first maximum limits on non  harmful bacteria in foods as an effort to insure the: quality of draw materials, processing and storage.

description: Beckley, W. Va.Jimmy Ellis, Louisville, Ky., knocked out Harold Carter, Cleveland, 7 rounds, heavyweights.

title: REV. DR. A. A. HASTINGS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 27 The Rev. Dr. A. Abbott Hastings, former rector of St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Troy, N.Y., and archdeacon of the Albany diocese, died today in Greenwich Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: General Electric to Dismiss 350 in Syracuse in Cutback
description: SYRACUSE, Oct. 27 (AP)The General Electric Company said 350 production workers in its heavy military electronics systems division here were being discharged today because of a cdtback in work on the Safeguard missile defense system.

title: American Motors Raising Its Production of Jeeps
description: DETROIT, Oct. 27 The American Motors Corporation plans another increase in Jeep production in Toledo to 350 a day in January from 300 a day now.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Chief Judge John J. Sirica of the Federal District Court here, announced today that his physician had advised him to postpone from Nov. 15 to Jan. 8 the trial of the seven men charged in the breakin and alleged bugging of the Democratic National Committee's headquarters.

title: The Talk of Lewistown, Pa.
description: LEWISTOWN, Pa.  I'd sooner pluck chickens in Mifflintown than go on welfare, said Richard Hambright. He spoke with fervor, and the other unemployed textile workers gathered in the office of the local union nodded in solemn agreement. The plight of some 2,200 textile employes has deepened since June, when the Juniata River, swollen by the tropieal storm known as Agnes, virtually destroyed the huge plant of the American Viscose Division of the F.M.C. Corporation. The corporation decided not to reopen the plant except for few subsidiary operation s, The plant, which made yarn, had a $22million annual payroll.

title: Warriors Rout Lakers
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 (AP) Jeff Mullins and Cazzie Russell led the Golden State Warriors to a 11991 trouncing of the National Basketball Association champion Los Angeles Lakers tonight. Mullins scored 28 and Russell 26 and Nate Thurmond pulled down 19 rebounds as the Warriors broke the Lakers fivegame winning streak. Jerry West of the Lakers missed 16 of 19 shots.

title: Lew Parker, Comedian, Dead; Father of That Girl on TV
description: Lew Parker, comedian of Broadway's musicals, Hollywood's movies and radio and television, died of cancer yesterday at St. Clare's Hospital. He would have been 65 years old tomorrow and he made his home in Hollywood when he was not on tour or playing in New York.

title: Ban on Military Recruiting Ended at Boston University
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)The president of Boston University, John R. Silber, announced yesterday the end of a sixmonth moratorium on military recruitment at the school.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay signed into law three tough bills to combat graffiti and curb the activities of licensed and unlicensed street peddlers. In signing the graffiti bill, he warned manufacturers of spraypaint cans to selfregulate their sales or I won't hesitate to impose upon them legislation to make it illegal, to sell the spray cans to anyone under 18.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 27 (UPI)Lee Trevino, who was at 142, said he almost quit the tournament because of slow play of other pros and urged officials to penalize the culprits.

title: Nixon Endorsed by Yorty; McGovern Held Demagogue
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 (UPI)Mayor Sam Yorty, who unsuccessfully sought the Democratic Presidential nomination, endorsed President Nixon for reelection yesterday.

title: Kitchen Work Got Her Out of the House
description: WASHINGTON  At a champagne dinner for Mrs. George McGovern, a lively, young woman In a miniskirt and dark bangs bounced around the hostess kitchen concocting 180 portions of Eleanor's Chicken. That was on a Friday night.

title: EXF.H.A. APPRAISER GIVEN EIGHT YEARS
description: NEWARK, Oct. 27 (AP)Theodore Bednarz, the former chief appraiser of the Federal Housing Administration here, was sentenced today to eight years in prison for bribery and conspiracy. The 54  year  old Bednarz, a resident of Passaic, and four others, had been convicted on charges that they profited from false appraisals of homes purchased with F.H.A. mortgages.

title: Lawyer Sworn In as Judge
description: Arthur E. Blyn, a Manhattan lawyer, was sworn in yesterday by Mayor Lindsay to an interim term on the Civil Court bench, Mr. Blyn will serve until Dec. 31, 1973; filling a vacancy created by the resignation of Judge Daniel M. Kelly. Mr. Blyn lives at 470 West End Avenue.

title: Notes on People
description: Chess Move Studied The president of the World Chess Federation, Max Euwe, said he favored a change in federation rules to permit a revenge match between Bobby Fischer, the champion, and Boris Spassky, the exchampion. The match would take place, if the federation approved, before Fischer is required officially to defend his title in 1975. Noting that Soviet chess authorities seemed lukewarm to the revenge match, Euwe said, Possibly Moscow no longer puts faith in Spassky but think that is wrong.Bernard Boteln, former presiding justice of the New York State Supreme Court's Appellate Division. Judge Botein, now a senior partner in a Manhattan law firm, will be given the award at a dinner next month by Harold R. Medina, senior circuit judge of the United States Court of Appeals. The award is given to jurists deemed to have perpetuated the spirit of liberty under law.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Mrs. Rose Kennedy and Mrs. Eleanor McGovern who was making her first campaign appearance after an illnesshelped a band of women entertainers stage a McGovernforPresident fundraiser at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: 20 Survive Crash of French Plane Carrying 68
description: CLERMONT  FERRAND France, Oct. 28 (Reuters) About 20 survivors were found early today in the wreckage of a French airliner carrying 68 people that crashed last night into a mountain near here.

title: JOSEPH L. WHITE, A RAIL EXECUTIVE
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Oct. 27Joseph Lyman White, a railroad executive and former Government official, died at his home, 177 Lorraine Avenue, Wednesday after a long illness. He was 88 years old and had lived in this community for 50 years.

title: Art:
description: If you have been a little depressed lately, you might feel better after a visit to the Stephen Hahn Gallery, 960 Madison Avenue at 78th Street, where a herd of entrancing cows, numbering a good baker's dozen and gathered together from as many collectors, are in temporary pasture. They represent the majority of a series of cows painted by Jean Dubuffet in 1954, and the occasion for their, reunion is the installation and unveiling of the large Dubuffet sculpture at Chase Manhattan Plaza that took place last Wednesday.

title: Ulster Election Delayed As Friction Is Feared
description: LONDON, Oct. 27  The British Government, under pressure from both Protestants and Roman Catholics in Northern Ireland, today announced postponement of local elections in the province, scheduled for Dec. 6.

title: ARCH FOES MEET IN PACING DERBY
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 27  Harness racing's archrivals of 1972, Albatross and Nansemond, and three other pacers will meet tomorrow night in the $50,000 National Pacing Derby at Roosevelt Raceway.

Traffic in the comparable week of 1971 was affected by dock and coal strikes.

title: REV.W.P.MULCAHY, CHINA MISSIONARY

The ruling, delivered from the bench, was made on an action brought by the city against the 2,800member Correction Officers Benevolent. Association. In effect, Justice Murtagh extended and strengthened a court order issued late Wednesday to prohibit what had been called a work rule slowdown that began earlier that day.

title: But on That Dash Is Where We Live
description: Sculptured in the gray granite of the Riverside Church, a row of angels overlooked the entrance. Once they had been almost white, but through the years, exhaust from automobiles and buses had streaked most of the angels faces black. Behind gray wooden horses on the sidewalk and on the grass across Riverside Drive, most of the faces were black, too. The hearse was parked in front of the church. Nearby, its driver, 57yearold Charles Patterson, stood in his black jacket, white shirt, a thin striped gray and black tic, and thin striped gray and black pants. His job is driving hearses for a Harlem undertaker, but he wasn't scheduled for a funeral yesterday, and he was asleep in his Harlem apartment when the phone rang.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Oct. 27Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin met today with legal advisers to discuss an appeal of his bribery and conspiracy conviction and his future as the top member of Governor Cahill's cabinet.

Alioto ended in a mistrial for the second time when a Federal jury reported today that it was hopelessly deadlocked over whether Look magazine was guilty of malice in publishing an article linking the Mayor with the Mafia.

title: Assert Real Issues Are Overcrowding and Quality of Their Schools
description: Many of the Canarsie parents who stood shivering behind barricades in front of John Wilson Junior High School 211 at dawn yesterday said they were bitter because they felt they had been misunderstood, misquoted and misrepresented to the world as racists, which they adamantly say they are not.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27A person presenting a credit card may some day be able to prove his identity through a computer's memory of his voice. Scientists at Bell Telephone Laboratories were granted a patent this week for a system of automatic speaker verification. The voice sample is recorded using several repetitions of the same phrase. The inventors utilized we were away year ago, because it had served in other research. But my children are Mary, Ann and Herbert would probably do as well.

title: Screen: Coda to a Career
description: Probably the most extreme, and among the most interesting, of the very new generation of German movie makers is 26yearold Werner Schroeter, who has staked out for himself in film an area that fits somewhere between the sensibilities of Oscar Wilde and Andy Warhol. It is a strange territory, consisting mostly of quicksand, and Schroeter occupies it with a kind of circumspect audacity that is often instructive and sometimes fun to watch. You can watch it in The Death of Maria Malibran, which opened last night for a twoweekend run at the Film Forum.

title: Letter From a Homefront P.O.W.
description: DANBURY, Conn.I write this from a Federal correctional institution under relaxed provisions whereby Federal prisoners can comment on contemporary topics. My mail can now be sent sealed and uncensored. It is my first piece formally written for publication in 37 months of imprisonment.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Senator George McGovern's charge today that President Nixon was planning a major assault on American labor is evidently based, at least in part, on two memorandums written for the Employment Standards Administration of the Departmat of Labor.

Ray Moore made it an allSouth African final by beating Britain's Stephen Warboys, 62, 63, in the other semifinal.

title: Stage: American Indian Repertory
description: It is obvious that the theater can offer two important things to American Indians. The first is the opportunity to preserve a cultural heritage clearly in danger of erosion and to present it ass part of the general American legacy. And.secpndly, to use the theater as a Modern means of expression, a platform for propaganda, or simply a mirror to contemporary Indian life. These seem to be the successfully accomplished aims of the American Indian Theater Ensemble, which is now giving its inaugural season at the La Mama Theater con East Fourth Street.
