Mrs. LaFarge's childhood and family life were the subject of Behind the Mountains, one of her husband's books. Surviving are a son, Pen LaFarge, and three

title: COMMUNITY LEADERS A SK NIXON RESPONSE
description: A group of business, academic and religious leaders has urged President Nixon to respond publicly to allegations of political espionage and sabotage involving people associated with his reelection committee, White House officials and former Cabinet members.

title: Tricks and Treats
description: Trick or Treat? shout the children, and Carapace Clavicle Moundshroud, mover and shaker of Ray Bradbury's THE HALLOWEEN TREE (Knopf. $3.95. Ages 11 to 14) roars his response. Not Treat, boys, no, not Treat! Trick, boys, Trick! Trick! The pace is breathless in this curiousand not wholly successfultale that attempts to trace the historical sources of Halloween within a fictional framework. Bradbury's gang of boys who have mysteriously lost their leader, Pipkin, are blown, flown, flung and hurled through time and space in search of Pipkin and the secret that will save him. Pipkin is everywhere and everywhen: transformed into mummy and gargoyle; imprisoned in a mad dog  but slippery and elusive as quicksilver. What danger threatens Pipkin? What dark power threatens them all? Bradbury celebrates Halloween: revels in gloom and doom, then disappointingly backs off to lay the splendid ghosts of man's imaginings with an uncharacteristic burst of sentimentality. There is, however, great treat in Bradbury's frenetic imagery, and in artist Joseph Mugnaini's brilliant, haunting illustrations.

title: A gentleman and a gentleman's slave
description: Arthur Joseph Munby was the son of a Yorkshire solicitor. An obscure civil servant and a minor poet, he died in 1910 at the age of 82, leaving behind three deedboxes, with instructions that they not be opened for 40 years. His verses had earned him brief entries in the Oxford Companion to English Literature and the Dictionary of National Biography. But the contents of those three boxes will earn him a permanent place in the Victorian landscape. They contained his secret diary which, brilliantly abridged and edited by Derek Hudson, a biographer and former literary editor of The Spectator, will henceforth be compulsory as well as compelling reading for anyone seriously interested in the social history of 19thcentury England.

title: RITA OTWAY, SINGER, PUBLICITY AGENT, 85
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 28 Rita Otway, a retired New York publicity woman and former actress and singer, died here Wednesday at the age of 85. She lived in Old Greenwich and was the widow of Wilfred Seagram, an actor.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WHY WALL STREET and investors have been so gloomy recently in the midst of so much upbeat economic news is one of the great enigmas of the day. The stock market's malaise recently prompted a leading economist to ask: Is the market just a hypochrondriac, or is there a hidden malignancy gnawing at its vitals?

title: The Soybean Boom
description: CALLENDER, Iowa  One of the new delights Garland C. Hanson has found this fall is a batterypowered calculator he can carry around in his pocket.

title: Who Is Angela Davis?
description: On the other hand, who is Regina Nadelson and why is she behaving like Harriet Beecher Stowe, another simpatico white girl who felt she was privy to the secret of how black revolutionaries got that way? How Liza could get to the point of actually crossing the ice or how Angela Davis got to the point of actually joining the Communist party was quite naturally that white intelligence informed them both; and since Harriet was prey to the scientific racism of her day, she attributed Liza's feistiness to the genetic transference of information via white blood; but Regina lives in the 20th century and is an enlightened racist who knows about cultural determinism, which is to say Angela got her courage not from white blood but white culture and that her sublime militancy was spawned by white teachers, white boyfriends, white psychoanalysts, and a special brand of white terror perpetrated on some respectable colored folks for how else could she daily with Black Panthers and fight Ronald Reagan and carry the Card, for surely no black folks influenced her (except abstract victims and her middle class  read whiteorientedfamily) which is why Miss Regina who knew Angela at Elisabeth Irwin High School didn't take the trouble

title: Letters
description: Forgive me, please, for reading a good portion of the story Who is this Crumb? (Oct. 1) with tongue in cheek. Mr. Thomas Maremaa tells us that the phrase Keep on Truckin', so popular in the thirties, has returned again as a current slogan, thanks mainly to the efforts of R. Crumb, the cartoonist. He points out that the slogan can now be found almost everywhere, scrawled on subway walls and on sidewalks, plastered on bumperstickers and imprinted on posters, buttons, Tshirts, baseball caps and sneakers, even in the remotest corners of the country.

title: PUBLIC CALLED KEY TO PRISON REFORM
description: A Federal judge warned the legal profession yesterday that the public would not give the necessary support for efforts to reform prison conditions until it was convinced that prisoner rehabilitation was important for its protection.

title: FUMBLE IS COSTLY
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 28 A Haryard publicist said today, Dartmouth's football team has a habit of coming here undefeated and leaving the same way.

title: RAYMOND SONTAG, HISTORIAN, DEAD
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Oct. 28Dr. Raymond J. Sontag, professor of European history at the University of California, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home. He was 75 years old.

title: Sharks Post 43 Victory
description: The Los Angeles Sharks, with sharp teeth and dorsal fins emblazoned on their red jerseys, bit off the New York Raiders' comeback and won, 43, in a World Hockey Association game yesterday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Bingo Is Feeling Bite Of Lottery and OTB
description: ALBANY, Oct. 28 (AP)Ira M. Ball, chairman of the State Bingo Control Commission, said yesterday that offtrack betting on horse races and the weekly lottery apparently were taking a bite out of profits from bingo games in New York State.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR: The article, Driving in Africa Needn't Be Beastly (Travel section, Oct. 1), brought back many memories. My husband is also an ordinary American driver, but thank goodness he does know the difference between a distributor and a carburetor and he does know how to change a flat tire. We rented a Volkswagen bug on our own and traveled for 2,500 miles, visiting 10 different game parks in Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda. We got close to mating lions, a cheetah and three cubs, two lions with a cheetah kill, and zillions of elephants.

title: Bronx Cab Driver Charged With Dispatcher's Murder
description: A 27yearold driver of a gypsy cab was arrested and charged with the murder of his dispatcher in the Bronx yesterday, the police reported.

title: School on Saturdays? It's Fun!
description: GLEN ROCKMore than 400 youngsters are happily going to school on Saturdays as part of a special program at the Glen Rock Community School.

title: FourYear Cateway Effort Ends As Nixon Signs the Bill Into Law
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28A fouryear effort to establish a Gateway National Recreation Area at the entrance to New York Harbor became a reality today when President Nixon signed into law a bill authorizing the 26,172acre urban park.

title: Mrs. Walsh Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Daniel A. Walsh Jr. of Brooklyn on Oct. 17 at the Victory Memorial Hospital in Brooklyn.

title: Photography
description: ALILL day of photographic instruction and demonstration is planned for next Sunday, Nov. 5, by the Cosmopolitan Chapter of the Photographic Society of America at the Hotel Commodore (42d Street and Lexington Avenue). Entitled Photo In 4, the event is open to the public and will run from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. The program will include an illustrated lecture, Light and Shadow, by George W. Parker; a nature slide show and demonstration, Don't Kill That BugPhotograph It, by William J. Tribelhorn; an essay presentation, My Book of Grecian Essays, by Mike Stamoulis; and a howto slide presentation, Alteration of Reality, by Leonard Gordon.

title: KEATING ON TOUR AS NIXON BACKER
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L.I., Oct. 29Kenneth B. Keatiog, the former United States Representative, Senator and Ambassador to India, smiled benevolently on the 1,500 Long Island Republicans gathered in the banquet room and remarked, I am one of the surrogates of President Nixon here in New York.

title: BUILDERS PROPOSE BARGAINING UNITY
description: As talks continue toward ending the last of a series of construction strikes that began here nearly four months ago, the head of one builder group proposes that labor and management aim jointly at abandoning the crazyquilt pattern of negotiations that often lead to costly work stoppages.

title: MORE U.S. TALKS WITH SAIGON SEEN BEFORE ANY PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28  A high Administration official said today that even if North Vietnam agreed to President Nixon's request for an additional negotiating session between Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho in Paris, the United States would not sign the settlement until it had again consulted with South Vietnam.

title: Alan Bates, or Who Says Nice Guys Finish Last?
description: THERE'S no facet of his work Alan Bates won't discuss. He'll talk about Women in Love, where he wrestled, naked, with Oliver Reed (If you've read the book, you know you can't do the film without it), or the French picture, King of Hearts, where he took off everything except his crown. To me, nudity's no problem. I mean, it's one of the great things about the end of King of Hearts. Though I didn't think I was particularly well shot. Suddenly he roars with laughter. It was shot from too low down, and it was too bright, but that's something else.

title: Soviet Press, After Ignoring the Campaign, Indicates Moscow Favors Nixon
description: MOSCOW, Oct, 28After almost entirely ignoring the American Presidential campaign for weeks, the Soviet press has suddenly blossomed with election reports that indicate Moscow is content to cast its lot with Richard M. Nixon.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Two decades ago my brother and I gorged ourselves on a white marlin steak we had flung uncovered and unseasoned into the fireplace.

title: Writer Takes a Fresh Approach to L.I. Cooking
description: WAINSCOTT, L. I.In the last, five months Florence Fabricant has emerged as a name, indeed the name, that is talked abdut among the cooks and cuisiniers of the Town of East Hampton, which occupies the eastern tip of Long Island's South Fork. Go to a dinner party and you are likely to be served at least one dish prepared from Mrs. Fabricant's recipes, the dish accompanied by conversation about its deviser.

title: Proposition No. 1: Yes
description: Every New Yorker who steps into the voting booth on Nov. 7 will have an opportunity to do something more for the environment than bewail its deterioration. He can vote to authorize the State to borrow $1.15 billion for improving the quality of its water and air, for buying up fastdisappearing lands to be included in the Adirondack and Catskill Forests, for saving the state's remaining wetlands, especially on Long Island, and for making a start toward a better system than we now have for disposing of solid wastes.

title: Passaic Center Tackles Latins Problems
description: PASSAICUsing what was a small storeroom for an adjoining tavern, the first Spanish community center has opened here to help solve the varied problems of Passaic's growing Latin population.speaking population, which is estimated at 500,000, in the last few years. As the black community did previously, the Spanish community is uniting and grouping to achieve goals.

title: Public Hearings Slated By City Council Units
description: Following are meetings of City Council committees at City Hall that are open to the public this week:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I was mildly amused by Gerald Adler's critique entitled Buy a Buglar Alarm, Press a Button and Panic [Oct. 15], but I must take issue with its point of view.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, who came in his wheelchair today to visit the medical staff that labored for his life, said he harbored no bitterness against the man who shot him. I would go over those campaign days again, he told newsmen. Those are risks a person in public life takes. Arthur H. Bremer has been convicted of shooting Mr. Wallace as he campaigned at a shopping center in suburban Maryland May 15.

title: Hitler and the Beer Hall Putsch
description: The idea, said Lenin, becomes a force when it captures the masses Not quite so. What captures the masses is not so much the idea as the emotions it engenders. Ideology in the marketplace trails

title: Beatrix Hauser Planning Nuptials
description: Baron and Baroness Bernhard Dominik Hauser of Vienna have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beatrix Hauser, to Gregor Medinger. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Hans Medinger, also of Vienna.

title: Child for Parlatores
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., Oct. 28  A daughter was born last Monday to Capt. Carl P. Parlatore, who served three tours of duty with the Air Force as a fighter pilot in Vietnam, and Mrs. Parlatore at the Homestead Air Force Base Hospital. The child has been named Christine Michele.

title: 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The editorial autonomy of several papers of the Cox newspaper chain was scuttled this year as the papers owner, James M. Cox Jr., ordered them to back President Nixon for reelection.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa. Oct. 28 (AP) Joe Pinkos kicked a 26yard field goal with 27 seconds remaining in the game to give Gettysburg a 30.28 upset victory over Lehigh today.

title: TEXAS TECH HANDS SIU, 17 TO 3 LOSS
description: DALLAS, Oct. 28 (UPI)A Texas Tech defense anchored by Donald Rives stymie d Southern Methodist's running attack today as Tech scored a 173 decision over the mistakeprone Mustangs.

title: C. JOHN KINGSTON
description: C. John Kingston, a vice president of S. D. Fuller & Co., investment bankers, died Friday of cancer in Duxbury, Mass. He was 35 years old and lived at 458 Greenwich Street.

title: Purdue Nips Illinois, 2014
description: WEST LAFAYETTE; Ind., Oct. 28 (AP)Purdue held off a determined fourthquarter bid by winless Illinois today and escaped with a 2014 Big Ten football victory.

title: Westchester
description: Rye, which had won four straight, played a scoreless tie with Westlake and dropped out of the deadlock for first place in the Central Western League.

title: Home Improvement
description: WHEN an old entrance door is badly cracked, warped out of alignment, or simply outdated and ugly looking, the surest way to solve the problem is to replace the entire door and its frame with a new assembly.

title: Not the Silence
description: Hard frost comes and on a still, starshot night the countryman wakens at two in the morning and listens and wonders what happened. The quiet is so deep the only sound he hears is the throb of his own pulse against the pillow. No cricket chirps, no katydid or any other insect scratches the darkness. He lies there, tense, until he hears the rustling of crisp leaves, the faroff hooting of a barred owl.

title: DOCTORS PROTEST IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: The Pennsylvania Medical Society called last, night for the ouster of the state's insurance commissioner, Herbert S. Denenberg, because of what it called his irresponsible activities.

title: The calls come around the clock
description: A friend of mine who was recently summonsed for removing a flyer from a subway platform wastebasket wondered aloud whether the police didn't have something better to do with their time. Many people feel the same way if they are stopped by a patrol car for a traffic violation. They believe that the police have been hired to catch criminals and prevent major crimes, not to interfere with those who basically obey the law. Actually, cops spend most of their day on matters that have nothing to do with serious crime. In placing so many men on patrol, the police are doing no more nor less than responding to the demands placed on them by the public.

title: Ruth Gallahue Bride
description: Miss Ruth Joan Gallahue, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel P. Gallahue of Richmond Hill, Queens, was married there yesterday morning to John Francis Maguire, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. John T. Maguire of Brooklyn. The Rev. John Power perfprmed the ceremony in the Holy Child Jesus Roman Catholic Church and concelebrated the nuptial mass with the Rev. James Tully.

title: The Mounting Problems in Venezuela Produce Election Fever 13 Months Early
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Oct. 16  In a lovely tropical garden near the edge of this capital city, a 1954 British sports car sits on a little pedestal between two palm trees. The car is completely beyond redemption. Exotic plant life has crept into the space formerly occupied by a powerful engine. The car has stood like this for more than a dozen years.

title: HOME FURNISHINGS
description: The $30billionayear furniture industry is enjoying its strongest seller's market in years. But, unfortunately, this spells bad news for the many American consumers who had hoped to see improved deliveries and bettermade furniture.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 28At Ron Stiver's downtown service station on Laurel Street, where the employes always wear earmuffs, an, elderly woman was buying gasoline one evening when an American Airlines DC10 jumbojet from Boston thundered by 75 feet overhead on its way to a landing at Lindbergh Field.

title: Syracuse Defeats Pitt, 106, on Piaetoritis's Score and Ruoff's Field Goal
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., Oct. 28 (AP) Roger Praetorius rammed over from the 2yardline and Bernie Ruoff booted a 34yard field goal to give Syracuse a 10.6 victory over Pittsburgh today in a defensive football battle played in steady rain.

title: Political Activists Win Round in Court Against Police Surveillance
description: Political activists won a preliminary battle last week in their court fight against extensive police surveillance of protest activities.

title: Education
description: All New Yorkers must be dismayed at seeing the specter of Little Rock, Ark., surface in our city. We were all appalled at that incident. As Americans we were ashamed before the world that the army of the United States had to be used to permit children to enter schools safely.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When the news reached Sonny Jorgensen during the winter of 1969 that the Washington Redskins had just hired Vince Lombardi as coach, the first impulse of the slick Skin quarterback was to flee into retirement. Instead, he phoned Paul Hornung, a fellow swinger and a Lombardi pet during Paul's years with the Green Bay Packers. Hornung assured Jurgy that Vince was not only a great coach, but a most understanding man. So Christian Adolph Jurgensen 3d (doesn't he sound like a Norwegian king?) remained to form a mutual admiration society with Vincent Thomas Lombardi. Unhappily, the shocking death of the brilliant coach abruptly ended the association after ono season. But each had seen enough to form strong opinions.

title: Doe Day Cancellation Asked
description: HAMMONTON  State Senator Joseph McGahn said he had asked Governor Cahill to cancel a deer hunt in seven southern New Jersey counties now set for Dec. 13.

title: Campaign
description: Campaign

title: Photography
description: THERE is no doubt that Max Waldman, who is showing more than 200 Photographs of Theatre and Dance, at the New York Cultural Center through Nov. 26, was meant to be a photographer of the stage. Even his nontheatrical photographs have the bravura rhetoric of a stage work observed from up close.

title: Deborah Beach And a Physician Set June Bridal
description: ROCHESTER, Oct. 28 The engagement of Miss Deborah Ellen Beach of New York to Dr. Robert Alan Stanton, son of Dr. and Mrs. Jay Stanton of Great Neck, L. I., and Petersburgh, N. Y., has been announced by the prospective bride's patents, Mr. and Mrs. Norman F. Beath of Rochester and Nantucket, Mass. Mr. Beach is a vice president and director of the Eastman Kodak Company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I have just finished reading the article Buy A Burglar Alarm, Press a Button and Panic and am in full agreement with Gerald Adler. We installed a burglar alarm in our home 18 months ago, and to this day have had nothing but aggravation from it. The alarm has gone off on its own many times in the middle of the night. We didn't know which way to turn, run or hide. There were no signs of entry; it was evidently just some faulty wiring.

title: CATHOLIC REFORM ON BISHOPS URGED
description: The Canon Law Society of America asked the American bishops of the Roman Catholic Church last week to approve a new method of electing bishops that would give priests, nuns and laymen a formal and collective voice for the first time.

title: World News Briefs
description: DJIBOUTI, Afars and Issas Territory, Oct. 28More than 5,000 people were homeless today in the wake of a cyclone, the first ever known here, that swept the capital of this territory yesterday.

title: TULANE LOSES, 217, TO GEORGIA TECH
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 28 (AP) Eddie McAshan connected with Mike Oven on a 67yard touchdown pass play and Randy Rhino raced 40 yards with an interception for another score today as Georgia Tech trimmed Tulane, 217, In a battle of southern independents.

title: Preps
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 28 Worcester Academy welcomed Exeter with a group of stickyfingered defenders who intercepted five passes today in a 130 upset of previously unbeaten Exeter. Steve Ciccolini, a linebacker, snared two of the interceptions.

title: Timothy Smith Weds Ilia Salomone
description: ROCHESTER, Oct. 28 Miss Ilia Salomone, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. A. William Salomon of Rochester, was married here this morning to Timothy Clarke Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton C. Smith of Whispering Pines, N. C.

title: Local
description: Brooklyn Tech clinched the Public Schools Athletic League Brooklyn Division I title yesterday, by defeating Midwood, 208, at Midwood.

title: PANEL ASKS ACTION ON CHILD SUPPORT
description: A legislative committee has asked the state's Welfare Inspector General, George F. Berlinger, to explore what to do about an estimated backlog of $35million in dependent support ordered by the Family Court here but not collected from deserting fathers.

title: U. S. Burglar Insurance An Overlooked Bargain
description: A Federal insurance program that offers any New Yorker inexpensive, noncancellable, easytoget burglary and robbery coverage for his home is being virtually ignored by the state's 18 million residents.

title: N. C. STATE CONQUERS SO. CAROLINA, 4224
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Oct. 28 (AP) Stan Fritts, a fullback, provided the power as North Carolina State scored four secondhalf touchdowns and came from behind to defeat South Carolina, 4224, today.

title: Bank of England Said to Use Reserves to Boost the Pound
description: LONDON, Oct. 28 (AP)The first signs appeared today that Britain is likely to try to steady the pound's steep, weeklong slide at around $2.35, just above record lows, before other currencies are weakened and another world monetary crisis is threatened.

title: Art in London
description: DURING the last World War, I was now and then asked by distinguished foreign exiles to recommend some bohemian place of resort where British artists, novelists and poets could be observed at close quarters. I was obliged to reply that there was no such placenothing that resembled those Parisian cafes of the Left Bank which once provided a homefromhome for garrulous and gregarious intellectuals. Although in the 17th and 18th centuries, we had taverns and coffeehouses regularly frequented by a great manat Will's, we are told, Dryden would sit all day, occupying the same chair beside the fire or next to a windowthe tradition had long since died out. And whereas a successful young French writer instantly rushed off to Paris, his British equivalent usually left London, either retiring to a secluded country cottage or, if the international situation permitted, taking refuge on some Mediterranean island.

title: Utah Routs New Mexico
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 28 (AP)Utah converted three New Mexico fumbles into touchdowns in the first quarter today in a 5914 Western Athletic Conference football victory. New Mexico fumbled eight times and Utah recovered seven of them.

title: Balance Sheet
description: In trading major concessions to achieve their ninepoint accord, North Vietnam and the United States have each attained important national goals: the Nixon Administration has found the formula, if not yet the reality, ending the Vietnam fighting and arranging a total United States pullout from an illfated conflict a decade after we entered it. Hanoi has obtained the chance acquire the legitimacy and political stature in South Vietnam that it has sought for more than two decades. Both sides have reason for satisfaction in their achievement; the United States for at least shortterm consideration, North Vietnam for the longterm potential. Such balance is no small accomplishment and remaining ambiguities should not overshadow what has been achieved, as even Soviet Premier Kosygin acknowledged in urging North Vietnamese and Vietcong envoys to continue negotiations with Dr. Kissinger.

title: Nassau North
description: Garden City battled favored Bethpage to a 66 tie and Larry Esposito turned in five touchdowns in an electrifying performance that paced Clarke to a 428 victory over Port Washington in North Shore Division H yesterday.

title: Flags Are Blossoming in Saigon Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 28Saigon and most of the tropical countryside around it have suddenly broken out in the red and yellow of thousands of South Vietnamese flags the Government has ordered displayed under threat of arrest.

title: Tam Whidden Plans Nuptials
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 28 Dr. and Mrs. Phillips Whidden of Fox Chapel, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Teresa Ann Marieta Whidden, to the Rev. Elbert Kyle St. Claire Jr., son of the Very Rev. and Mrs. St. Claire of Kennett Square.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: There are times when a review goes beyond the bounds of criticism, when it does damage to both the personal integrity and the professional reputation of the book's author. Joel Novel's comment on my autobiography, A Psychiatrist's Head, is a case in point.

title: Trudeau's Rival: A Mild Man Rides a Bandwagon
description: TORONTO, Oct. 25It was after midnight at the end of 16hour day of campaigning when Robert L. Stanfield's chartered airplane landed at Vancouver, B.C., and his entourage piled out into the misty night.

title: Manila Closes 40 Concerns
description: MANILA, Oct. 28 (AP) Soldiers have arrested nine Chinese businessmen in Cebu city, central Philippines, and have arrested their directors, because of tax violations, they Government said today.

title: We're living in a Hitchcock world, all right
description: At a moderate hour each weekday morningnot too early, not too latea moderate black automobilenot too long, not too short and driven by an unliveried chauffeurslides through the main gate of the Universal City studios in North Hollywood, heading for one of the many unprepossessing stucco bungalows that cluster around Universal's stubby black executive tower as serfs huts once huddled around the baron's castle, trading a degree of freedom for a degree of protection from the wild things beyond the gates.

title: The Buzzards Of Mobile
description: To the Editor: As a tardy reader of Granville Hicks's review of the new Vance Packard book, may I inform him that buzzards fly high in Mobile, not eagles?

title: CHARLES DONAHUE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) Charles. Donahue, a solicitor for the Labor Department from 1961 to 1969, died of cancer yesterday in Dublin. He was 60 years old.

title: More Big Campaign Gifts Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) The part owner of two sports teams, three computer millionaires and, the developer of an prat contraceptive have joined the ranks of sixfigure contributors to the Presidential campaigns.

title: TANAKA IS SEEKING WORLDWIDE TRUST
description: TOKYO, Oct. 28Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan, in his first comprehensive address since taking office in July, said today, I intend to exert all efforts to build a country that will be trusted more than ever by the nations of the world and which will become the joy of each person who was born in it.

title: Home Improvement
description: ANEW model shop or tank  type vacuum cleaner that will pick up water, as well as the usual dust, leaves and other debris, is now available in a convenient eightgallon size at a price that puts it within reach of the average homeowner (previous wetanddry vacuums have been much larger and more expensive). Weighing only 16 pounds, this new model has a one horepower motor and is ideal for use anywhere inside the home, including basements, garages, attics and workshops, as well as around the outside on swimming pool areas, patios, walks and driveways.

title: News of Boating
description: If the New Jersey Outboard Association has its way, a speedboat regatta like last Sunday's on Flushing Meadows Lake, Queens, will become an annual feature. And the optimists in the group envision two regattas a year, as well as the national championships there. It's the most beautiful course I've ever driven on, said Lou Meisel, the spokesman for the outboarders and one of their leading drivers. Not only is Meadows Lake wide enough to eliminate the danger of running into the shore on a turn, but it's also the safest course, with no debris of any kind, no waves, no current, just perfect.

title: Italian Abbey Burglarized
description: VEROLI, Italy, Oct. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)  Thieves broke into the library of the famous Cistercian Abbey of Casamari near here last night and stole several priceless old books and manuscripts. Among the missing items was a gradual of Gregorian Chants, believed to be unique, two 14th century missals and four incunabula.

title: RUTGERS SCORES ON FIELD GOALS
description: Two field goals by John Pesce and the workhorse ball carrying of Jim Jennings, both good enough to set school records, gave Rutgers a 63 victory over Columbia yesterday, during a steady rain at Baker, Field.

title: MISS DUGGAN'S 136 LEADS TEXAS GOLF
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Oct. 28 (AP)Winds that sometimes swept across the Pharahs Country Club at 20 miles an hour pushed scores up today in the Corpus Christi Civitan Open and left Cathy Duggan the leader.

title: East Germany to Handle West Berlin Garbage
description: BERLIN, Oct. 28 (UPI)East Germany has agreed to dispose of West Berlin's garbage, the city government has announced.

title: Shue Aids 1510 Victory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 28Gary Shue, a senior quarterback from Pennsauken, N.J., came off the Pennsylvania bench in the third quarter today to lead the Quakers to two touchdowns in a comefrombehind 1510 victory over Princeton before a rainsoaked crowd of 9,285 at Franklin Field.

title: Preps
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Oct. 28 Greg Vanacore's passing and six firsthalf fumbles by Log; mis helped Hotchkiss win, 44, 20 today. Vanacore completed four scoring pass plays and ran for another touchdown as he hit on 11 passes. Greg Thomas, wide receiver, and C. J. Bchnett, tight end, caught two touchdown strikes each.

title: President Woos the BlueCollar VoteSees Economic Surge Across U.S.
description: SAGINAW, Mich., Oct. 28President Nixon, making a brief airport appearance here after a lon afternoon's motorcade through blue collar suburbs and small towns in northeastern Ohio, predicted tonight that he would have a great win in Ohio and a great win in Michigan.

title: Music: A Chamber Society Program
description: A somewhat augmented Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centerthe center's newest constituent organizationbegan its fourth season on Friday night in Tully Hall. The house was sold out, the program was received with enthusiasm (even a world premiere by Barbara Kolb), and there was even an ad lib speech by Charles Wadsworth, music director of the Chamber Music Society. Mr. Wadsworth said hello, hailed the 30th anniversary of the Koussevitzky Music Foundation and introduced Aaron Copland and Mrs. Olga Koussevitzky.

title: COLONELS TOP NETS FOR 2D PLACE, 10682
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 28 (AP)Louis Dampier scored 25 points tonight as the Kentucky Colonels wrested a second place in the American Basketball Association's Eastern Division from the New York Nets with a 106.82 victory.

title: Preps
description: KENT, Conn., Oct. 28Joe Druzolowski, a senior, scored twice on touchdowns and twice on conversions to pace Kent to a 220 victory over Taft today. Kent has now won five of seven games.

title: The Insant Eiffel, A Comedy in One Unspeakable Act
description: SCENE: the office of Roger Encore, sales manager of Eighth Wonder, Inc. 3, Harold Wentworth, a prospect from Kansas, has just sat clown in Encore's visitor's chair.

title: Lindsay to Submit Package to Albany On Court Reform
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct, 28  A legislative package that would rearrange New York's criminal courts into one statewide, statefinanced system with management structure separate from the judges themselves will be submitted to Albany, Mayor Lindsay said here today.

title: Aide to Thieu Assails Plan For Truce as Surrender
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 28Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam of South Vietnam said today that acceptance of the proposal for a settlement of the war made public by North Vietnam and the United States would amount to a surrender for his country and was therefore unacceptable.

title: Mary A. Mason, Paul Famighetti Married on L.I.
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Oct. 28Miss Mary Anne Mason, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Stayton Mason Jr. of Roslyn Estates, was married here this morning to Paul Anthony Famighetti, son of Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Dominico Famighetti of Glen Head.

title: Digging Deep Into the Recorded Art of Joseph Szigeti
description: WELL, he's no Szigeti, comments one middle aged man to another as they leave a recital by one of the muchadvertised young violinists. No, agrees his friend, and neither was Szigeti. That anecdote, with interchangeable names, has gone the rounds for a long time, probably since little David played on his harp, at least. It still applies, though less so now when historical recordings exist to document how the renowned artists of recent generations played, if not always how they sounded or what impact their personalities had on an audience.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 28The Texas Legislature, which was caught in a dispute between farmers and the Federal Government over rules requiring brakes on trailers, has worked out a compromise that it believes is acceptable to both sides and that may be a model for several other states.

title: Brilliant Bourgeoisie
description: LUIS BUNUEL'S brilliant new comedy, The Discreet Charm of The Bourgeoisie (Le Charme Discret de La Bourgeoisie), is so free in form and yet so lucid and wise that it could give the Surrealists a whole new lease on life. It also reminds us that Surrealism need not be a bleedingwatch bore, a method of cyphering messages with the Freudian equivalent of the Little Orphan Annie Secret Code Ring. That is, the sort of art in which tunnels, cantaloupes, clocks, baby buggies, bell towers, shoes, younameit, are never allowed to be what they seem. They exist only as material for rigid interpretation, for immediate transformation to some higher meaning  if you've been fortunate enough to learn the cocktail party language of the 20th century cabalists.

title: Miss Gaelyn E. Gerow Is Married
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Oct. 28Miss Gaelyn Elizabeth Gerow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Sidney Gerow of Armonk, and David Franklin Robinson, son of Mrs. Elizabeth Robinson and John TrumbullRobinson, both of Hartford, were married here this afternoon in SS. John and Mary Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. John Skelley.

title: Bruins Edge Leafs, 32
description: TORONTO, Oct. 28 (UPI)Fted Stanfield's powerplay goal at 14 minutes 55 seconds of the third period gave the Boston Bruins a 32 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight.

title: Author's View of Bridge Spans Gap in History
description: Until David McCullough came across it one day in 1970 while doing research for his book, The Great Bridge, much of the story behind the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge had been gathering dust in the attic of the library at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, N.Y.

title: Junior Drivers Called Hazard
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  While Nassau County leads the state in registered automobiles, Suffolk County far exceeds it in traffic fatalities. Suffolk permits 16yearolds behind the wheel, and that may be the fatal flaw in its highway record.

title: Preps
description: WOODMERE, L.I., Oct. 28Jim DiCalagero and Rocco D'Alleba played like pros as they passed and ran McBurney to a 286 victory over Woodmere in a televised Metropolitan Athletic Association of Private Schools game played here today. D'Alleba scored touchdowns on runs of 93 and 20 yards while DiCalagero passed for 14 points.

title: Colorado Is Upset By Missouri, 2017
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Oct. 28Greg Hill kicked a 33yarn field goal with six seconds remaining and Missouri scored its second straight upset by beating Colorado, 2017, today.

title: Retiring Envoy Says U.S. Lacks Basic Policy
description: BRUSSELS.  J. Robert Schaetzel, a longtime ambassador who is retiring from the United States diplomatic service, believes that America no longer has a foreign policy strategy.

title: Marsha Reynolds Wed
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Oct. 28Miss Marsha. Veronica Reynolds and Raymond James McMurray were married here this morning in St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. Harrold A. Murray, secretary of the Department of Social Development and World Peace, United States Catholic Conference in Washington. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Gerard Agustine Reynolds of Summit, and the late Mr. Reynolds Her husband's parents are Mr. and Mrs. William Stanley McMurray of Bayside, Queens.

title: About Pro Football
description: Football coaches cannot help worrying even about the past which, one supposes, has little effect on the present. Don Shula, the coach of the undefeated Miami Dolphins, brings his team to Baltimore today to meet the Colts, who have lost five of six, in a game that will be seen on teleyision here, Channel 4 at 4 o'clock. Said Shula last week, We haven't done too well on my two trips to Balimore. We haven't scored a touchdown.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Prof. John P. Carter of the University of California, in commenting on E. Spencer Miller's proposal for incorporating all the railroads into a single privately owned but Government regulated monopoly (A Prescription for Railroad Recovery, Sept. 10), sees Mr. Miller's proposal as intended to benefit Maine, Mr. Miller's home state, at the expense of California. His assertions can hardly fail to have a familiar sound to people who have been through railroad rate cases involving interterritorial divisions.

title: CONGRESS RATED ON JEWISH ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28A new Jewish research organization, whose members refer to themselves as Nat's Gnats, will publish next week the first ratings ever made of Congressional performance on issues of importance to Jews.

title: POTATOES LINKED TO BIRTH DEFECTS
description: LONDON, Oct. 28The possibility that blighted potatoes may cause defects in newborn children is being studied by Britain's Department of Health and Social Security.

title: REUBEN I. ISAACSON
description: Reuben I. Isaacson, who retired as president of the Donmoor Knitwear Corhpany, Inc., here in 1965, died yesterday in the New York Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 101 Central Park West.

title: Ascob Cocker Spaniel Is Best at Queensboro Dog Show
description: The topwinning performer in the East and a favorite to take honors as America's No. 1 dog for 1972 moved a step closer to that pinnacle yesterday when she was named best in a field of 1,252 at the 45th Queensboro Kennel Club show in the armory at Jamaica, Queens.

title: Median Brooklyn Family Income Rises
description: The median family income in Brooklyn was $60 a week higher in 1970 than 1960, according to a new volume of income details issued by the Census Bureau.

title: The Faith of the People of God
description: Readers should not be deceived by the subtitle a lay theology. It doesn't mean that this is theology made simple for the layman, i.e., the nonprofessional. The reference is to the laos as the people of God. Lay theology is, as John Macquarrie defines it, theology of, by and for the people of God. The faith and life of this peopleas distinct from the contents of a sacred book or the decrees of pontiffs or councilsare accepted as the primary data of Christianity.

title: Widener Routs Ursinus
description: CHESTER, Pa., Oct. 28 (AP) Donnie Watkins three touchdowns and Billy Johnson's two scores led Widener to a 326 victory over Ursinus today in a game that featured 12 fumbles. Widener fumbled five times and Ursinus seven in the rain.

title: KNICKS WIN, 9490; REED IMPRESSIVE
description: Local sports fans who have spent their spare time worrying about the condition of Willis Reed's legs had better find themselves a new hobby. The Knick captain played an impressive 32 minutes last night as the New Yorkers topped the Baltimore Bullets, 9490, before a capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Gardens
description: BEGONIAS are the most versatile and satisfying indoor plants. Their variation of form, leaf and flower are of never ending interest to both collectors and novice. The plants are found in warmer regions, perhaps most abundant in Central and South America where they grow in sparse open woodlands, along streams and a few can be found on rock cliffs exposed to the sun.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Albin Krebs Oct. 16 story, A.B.C. Rebukes Rivera for McGovern Speeches, includes incredible revelations that cannot be lightly dismissed.

title: JAMES G. LYONS
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Oct. 28 (UPI)James G. Lyons, former assemblyman, died at Ihis home here Thursday. He was 64 years old.

title: Rome Unit Asks Funds To Save Monuments
description: ROME, Oct. 28 (AP)The monuments of Rome belong not only to Rome but to the world, said a group of archeologists and art lovers as they launched a worldwide campaign for funds to save Rome's ailing antiquities. They set a goal of $7.7million.

title: N. Y. Tech Eleven Wins
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 28Richie Tassello threw three touchdown passes to John Drowica in the second period to day to lead New York Tech's club football team to a 236 victory over Concordia. Tassello's touchdown strikes covered 18, 41 and 13 yards. He finished 10 for 11 for 183 yards, while Drowica caught a total of six for 136 yards.

title: Betty Hyatt Married
description: BEDFORD VILLAGE, N.Y., Oct. 28 Miss Betty Ann Hyatt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Hyatt of Chappaqua, was married here this afternoon to Patrick Breslin Keeny son of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Kenny of Northbrook, Ill., and North Palm Beach, Fla. Msgr. Joseph Blake and the Rev. Thomas Hughart, a Presbyterian minister, officiated in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church. The bride's father is a vice president of the CibaGeigy Corporation, chemical researchers and producers. Her husband's father is president of the Kenny Construction Company of Skokie, Ill.

title: Sex Without Tears
description: To the Editor: I read with some concern Theodore Sturgeon's review of Sex Without Tears by Boyd Cooper.

title: Nebraska Overpowers Oklahoma State, 340, for Sixth Straight
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Oct. 28 (AP) Mercurial Johnny Rodgers scored twice and Nebraska's bruising defense did the rest today as the thirdranked cornhuskers whipped Oklahoma State, 34.0, in a Big Eight football game.

title: Oklahoma Wins, 520
description: NORMAN, Okla., Oct. 28 (AP) Greg Pruitt scored three touchdowns and gained 121 yards today to become the second leading rusher in Oklahoma University history today as the Sooners crushed Kansas State, 520.

title: Diabetes Is Called Basic Cause of Robinson's Death
description: The immediate cause of Jackie Robinson's death last week at age 53 was apparently a heart attack. But to many doctors a more fundamental process was involved: diabetes and its complications.

title: Sadat Names New Naval Chief, Continuing Military ShakeUp
description: CAIRO, Oct. 28  President Anwar elSadat, continuing his shakeup of Egypt's military command, has named a new navy comander, Vice Adm. Fuad Zikry.

title: House Races in State Cost $1.6Million
description: The first newly required reports on campaign spending chow 120 candidates running for Congress in New York State have raised nearly $2million and spent $1.6million.

title: Music: Rally for McGovern
description: A few moments before Shirley MacLaine appeared on stage to announce the first act on the StarSpangled Women for McGovernShriver concert at Madison Square Garden Friday night, the giant hall looked disturbingly empty. But before Dionne Warwicke was halfway through her set of familiar BacharachDavid standards, the Garden was nearly full and this largest political fundraising rally ever planned, ptesented and performed by women looked like a winner.

title: November Bridal For Sue Salinger
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Oct. 28Mr. and Mrs. Julius Salinger have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sue Rose Salinger, to Douglas Benach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Benach. The wedding will take place Nov. 17.

title: U.S. Pushed On L.I. Jobs
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I.The Long Island Congressional delegation is prepared to take every step short of firing Mel Laird, to assure that the Island will not lose the next major aerospace contract to be awarded by the Department of Defensethe billiondollar AX fighter contract  Representative James R. Grover Jr., Republican of Babylon, said last week.

title: ALABAMA ROUTS SO. MISSISSIPPI
description: BIRMINGHAM, Alabama, Oct. 28 (AP)28 Steve Bisceglia, fullback for two touchdowns to shake Alabama from its lethargy and the secondranked Crimson Tide overwhelmed Southern Mississippi, 4811, tonight.

title: Knudson Leader; Trevino Picks Up
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 27 George Xnudson, seeking his second victory in two weeks, took a threeshot lead today in the third round of the $135,000 Sahara invitation golf tournament but was upstaged by the abrupt and unexplained departure of Lee Trevino.

title: Why Do They Rave So Over Rohmer?
description: IREMEMBER seeing one of those inept first movies made by an avantgarde filmmakerthe kind that cinematheques are quite right to show, for who else would?and thinking that this one was more than usually contrived, clumsy, oldfashioned and boring even for its genre. It was the sort of thing where you lay hold of a vacuous story line and a vacant apartment, a few private friends for actors and the public streets for the outdoors, and go ahead and shoot your first feature. This one was by a noted auteurist critic from the Cahiers du Cinma, and one of his colleagues, JeanLuc Godard, had a bit part in it. The film was called The Sign of the Lion, and I said to myself I would be very surprised if its maker, Eric Rohmer, ever made it. Well, Rohmer has made it, but I have long since given up being surprised by anything.

title: Call Her New But Not Hot
description: THE taxi was crawling along, jammed in the sprawl of midtown traffic. Inside the cab, choreographer Patricia Birch, energy momentarily leashed, shifted impatiently. She was heading for the Alvin Theater to hold auditions for dancers for the new Hal Prince musical, A Little Night Music, based on the Ingmar Bergman movie, Smiles of a Summer Night. She had worked all morning in a chilled TV studio on The Electric Company, the successful children's series for which she stages thebmusical numbers, had gulped a hamburger and was now late.

title: GreekTurkish Progress Is Reported on Cyprus Talks
description: ATHENS, Oct. 28Qualified diplomatic sources said today that there had been a breakthrough in the GreekTurkish negotiations on the future of Cyprus.

title: A Class Aids the Colosseum
description: MENDHAMA handful of teenage girls in this small Morris County town are raising funds to help save Rome's Colosseum, which is threatened by pollution, thefts and traffic vibrations and is now closed to the public.

title: Art
description: GOD, an assemblage perpetrated in 1918 by the littleknown American dadaist Morton Schamberg, is scarcely one of the crowning highlights of Philadelphia in New York, a magnificent new exhibition of 90 modern works loaned to the Museurn of Modern Art by the Philadelphia Museum of Art. And yet it symbolizes, at least for me, a certain essence of this show, which was drawn almost exclusively from the celebrated former collections of A. E. Gallatin and Walter and Louise Arensberg. It also recalls a time, during which these collections took shape, when modern art was considered, in America, to be alien and shocking.

title: A Young Asia Hand Points an Accusing Finger (With Love)
description: This is a hopelessly biased piece of personal journalism, full of petty outrages that individually aren't worth a letter home. But after three and a half years of coping with Asia and its dirty airplanes, rude visa officers, bad taste, misinformation and general bungling, I lust don't think those Asians responsible should be allowed to get away with it given the way prices are rising. Besides, for someone who loves Asia to complain is good personal therapy. I don't care if things are worse elsewhere. This isn't about elsewhere. It is not even really about Asia, which is the spectacular world beyond the bluetinted tourbus windows. It is about the airporthotetrestaurantshopping districttouristtrap Asia where both rushed businessmen and rushed tourists spend most of their time regardless of what they say over slides back home.

title: Promises Is Due at Meadowbrook
description: CEDAR GROVE  The house lights dim. The stage, in the center of the theater, lights up. The star of the production enters, to the hearty round of applause that bespeaks an unusually live house.

title: MorrisSomerset
description: Running backs Mike O'Connor and Barry Robinson each rushed for 6130 yards yesterday as undefeated Madison blanked Caldwell, 100, to set the stage for a Suburban Conference showdown next Saturday with unbeaten Summit.

title: The Myth Of the Master Race
description: With a certain appropriateness, this is a dull book about a dull man. It testifies, the author notes, to the extraordinary impact National Socialism made on him when he was a student in Bavaria. He was equally impressed by the extraordinary evanescence of the Nazi experience as he experienced it 20 years later when he was a British diplomat in Hanover and Bonn.

title: Mailbox:
description: Let me tell you about one summer Sunday long ago. It was 1956. My son had just turned 7 and to celebrate we had obtained tickets for a Brooklyn  Cincinnati doubleheader. It was to be his first major league game and his first outing since recovering from a case of mononucleosis.

title: AROUND THE
description: Dig, dry and store dahlia tubers; keep varieties separate. Dig, dry and store gladiolus corms.  Start composting leaves; mechanical shredding will hasten decomposition. Continue planting bulbs. Move deciduous trees and shrubs when the leaves have fallen.

title: Popularity Grows For Cheese Shop
description: RIDGEWOOD  Around noon each day a line begins to form at the counter of The Cheese Shop in Ridgewood. Housewives and businessmen sample creamy Brie, Camembert or Coulommiers spread on freshly baked sour dough bread or Norwegian flat bread.

title: Roger and The Devil
description: I found this book exceedingly strange, and though I am perfectly willing to admit that the fault lies with me, I do wonder what children will make of wicked little Roger: a child whom Marian Parry has drawn as a bird. All of the people in this story, as a matter of fact, look like birds  and it does not add to their coherence.

title: V.S.C. Routs Oregon
description: EUGENE, Ore., Oct. 28 (AP) Topranked Southern California, its offense stalled by nine fumbles, shook loose Anthony Davis twice on long touchdown runs in the third period today and the unbeaten Trojans stopped Oregon, 180, in Pacific8 Conference football game.

title: New Headmaster Named
description: The resignation of Walter F. Sheehan as headmaster of the Canterbury School in New Milford, Conn., a Roman Catholic boarding school for boys and girls operated by Catholic laymen, was announced yesterday by the school's trustees. The resignation of Mr. Sheehan, now in his 25th year as headmaster, will take effect next June 30. Mr. Sheehan will occupy the newly created post of president of Canterbury and will be in charge of development, fund raising and public relations.

title: Vietcong Cite Truce Order
description: SAIGON, Oct. 28 (Reuters)The Vietcong leadership announced in a radio broadcast today that it had ordered its troops to observe a ceasefire if the draft agreement between North Vietnam and the United States is signed on Tuesday, as Hanoi has insisted that it should be.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: A proposed amendment to the State Constitution that would create a new judicial department on Long Island has divided members of the legal profession on the need for the change, as well as on its cost.

title: Views of Review
description: To THE EDITOR: Professor Mark in The Week in Review Oct. 22 questions the reasoning that led a number of academics to support the reelection of President Nixon in an advertisement in The New York Times. I should like to answer for myself.

title: Senator Proposes a Greater Reliance on United Nations to Keep the Peace
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Oct. 28Senator George McGovern called upon the United States today to make the United Nations once more the first stop on the road to crisis, rather than a last resort.

title: In Kuwait, Sights at Every Turn Reflect Enormous Oil Wealth
description: KUWAIT, Oct, 20  Kuwait is very much part of today's world, and oil has put her there.

title: Bridge
description: Napoleon and other great commanders of bygone days could usually sense when the enemy was in difficulty. Small signs of weakness would be sufficient to indicate the winning strategy. Those who wish to play the role of Napoleon in bridge battles should watch for signs of distress, especially on the opening lead.

title: Concert
description: The Paniagua Quartet, an ensemble of, specialists in Medieval and,. Renaissance music that performed just a year ago in the Metropolitan Mtisetrm's velez Blanco Patio, returned to the museum's larger Medieval Court Thursday night to offer another program of music on the fascinating array of old instruments they play so well.

title: Thirteenth District
description: As I have campaigned through the 1,800 square of our 13th District I have been distressed over the fact that people just do not believe in their government.

title: Man Is Convicted of Usury
description: CATSKILL, N. Y., Oct. 28 (UPI)Andrew M. D'Apice, 43 years old, of Brooklyn was convicted of loansharking by Greene County jury today, in a plot to extort $15,000 from a Kingston grocer who had allegedly fallen behind in a gambling debt. D'Apice, one of three men indicted in the case, was found guilty of criminal usury by the jury in its second day of deliberations.

title: A Japanese businessman hops a cab from J.F.K. to Manhattan. The driver says: That'll be $18.50. The Japanese asks: How much is that in real money?
description: BANGKOK: In a way, it's sour grapes, the kind of gut feeling that comes when a father can no longer win on the chessboard he gave his son, or when a daughter starts fooling around the way her mother always said she never did.

description: People who know John Weitz, the men's wear designer, talk about him a lot. Here are some sample commen ts:

title: WALSH COUNTERS CRITICS OF RDA
description: In a report issued on the eve of his departure, Albert A. Walsh says that the Housing and Development Administration hag made enormous progress in solving the city's housing problems during the five years of its existence.

title: Mailbox:
description: I am wondering if this might not be a good time to start working on a U.N.sponsored athletic team for the next Olympics.

title: 4 City Residents Reelected To Save the Children Board
description: Four New York City residents have been reelected as directors of Save the Children Federation and its cooperating agency, the Community Development Foundation, the agencies announced yesterday at their international headquarters 345 East 46th Street.

title: Kerr on Six Rms Riv Vu
description: HAPPILY married Jerry Orbach desperately needs to have an affair with happily married Jane Alexander because, as he explains to her, he has no hobbies. And 6 Rms Riv Vu, the comedy in which the two are making cagey love at the Helen Hayes, comes out an acceptably entertaining business in spite of the fact that it is steadily written at a level just below wit because Mr. Orbach can make that kind of an excuse seem entirely reasonable, even winning.

title: $18MILLION ALLOTED TO TRAIN CHICANOS
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif. Oct. 28 (UPI)  The Labor Department has announced an $18million contract to provide training for more than 7,200 jobless or underemployed Spanishspeaking persons.

title: Gentle Sage of Ecology Draws Disciples to Home on L.I.
description: EAST MARION, L. I., Something of the Galapagos Islands can be found in spirit, if not in fact, at the Bennett complex at the Rocky Point section of this North Fork community. It has become a gathering place for naturalists, conservationists and students who are drawn by the gentle wisdom of Franklin (Judd) Bennett toward a deeper understanding of ecology.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent announcement by Jack M. Sable, the New York State Commissioner of Human Rights, that a survey of more than 100,000 state employes has shown that workers over the age of 65 performed their work equal to and sometimes noticeably better than younger workers raises question that merits the attention of the press and governmental agencies throughout the land.

title: Legislation
description: Sorry about that, President Nixon seemed to be saying, Some of the nine Congressional measures before him contained attractive features. But last Friday, rather than breach the budget, he bit, the bulletvetoing them all.

title: Preps
description: SOUTH BYFIELD, Oct, 28  Groto won its third game, defeating Governor Dummer today, 296. Will Bundy ran for two scores, and Bill Gray caught a short pass from Cabot Lodge for another touchdown.

title: Albert D. Osborn, 76, Testified On Hughes Case Handwriting
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Oct. 28Albert D. Osborn, senior partner in Osborn Associates, handwriting experts, at 233 Broadway, New York, died yesterday in Mountainside Hospital, Glen Ridge. He was 76 years old and lived at 215 Midland Avenue.

description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 28Two California college students say that they worked for Donald H. Segretti collecting information about political activities in their areas.

title: Communist Units in Laos Reported Gaining Land
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Oct. 28Pathet Lao and North Vietnamese forces were reported on the attack in many parts of Laos today, taking a number of towns and large amounts of territory.

title: Hanrahan
description: CHICAGO  Cheers and applause broke out as Judge Philip Romiti finished reading his decision and the aisle was jammed with relieved relatives, happy cops and Democratic courthouse payrollers. They were pushing their way toward the men in the dock Cook County State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan, one of his chief assistants and 12 policemen. The judge's ruling: No defense witnesses were needed because evidence is simply not sufficient to establish or prove conspiracy against any defendant.

title: Irate Italian Fans Mob Disqualified U.S. Boxer
description: NETTUNO, Italy, Oct. 28 (AP)  An angry Italian crowd turned or an American boxer, Johnny White, thst night after he was disr qualified for a low blow.

title: Fourteenth District
description: The most important issues in the 14th District of New Jersey are unemployment and inflation.

description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L, Oct. 28Hoping to win a scat in the Senateand 16 undergraduate creditsGary Serbta, a 21yearold senior at New York University, is campaigning here to capture the Eighth Senate District from the 41yearold Republican incumbent, Norman J. Levy.

title: Article 19  No Title
description: WACO, Tex., Oct. 28 (AP)Baylor's defense set up three scores tonight and the Bears held on to edge Texas A. and M. 1513.

title: Scholar Reassembles 1933 Preface by Faulkner That Reveals the Author's Attitude Toward His Novels
description: A prominent scholar says he has reassembled the typescript pages of an unpublished book preface written by William Faulkner that sheds light on gl4 Mississippi novelist's attitude toward his early works and particularly toward his most admired one, The Sound and the Fury.

title: Suffolk to Get State Aid For Its Narcotics Projects
description: Gov. Rockefeller recently announced that the state Narcdtic Addiction Control Comrhission has approved a $192,577 contract with Suffolk County for drug abuse prevention and educational services.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE TREASURY announced a new $3billion borrowing through an auction of 61/2 per cent fouryear notes on Nov. 1. The British pound lost ground last week, closing at $2.3475 after rumors of a new fixed parity of $2.25 were denied by Britain. America's exports in September fell $44million to $4.16billion [seasonally adjusted] while imports rose $6million to $4.67billion.

title: Local
description: The Queens Public Schools Athletic League title will be up for grabs next Saturday when Far Rockaway plays host to John Adams of Ozone Park. The rivals have identical wonlost records of 50, including league ledgers of 3.0.

title: Sanford, Mrs. Burke Head Democratic Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI)  Former Gov. Terry Sanford of North Carolina and Mrs. Yvonne. Braithwaite Burke, a Califfornia legislator, have been appointed chairman and vice chairman of a special commission to write a permanent charter for the Democratic party.

title: City Gets Grant for Lights
description: A Federal grant of $500,000 has been made to the City Department of Public Works to help finance the installation of highintensity sodium lighting on 2,000 blocks in the South Bronx, Senator Jacob K. Javits announced yesterday. The Federal allocation will augment a similar $500,000 grant from the South Bronx Model Cities program and $250,000 from the Department of Public Works.

title: $2Million Robbery in France
description: MULHOUSE, France, Oct. 28 (AP)Bandits broke into the central post office in this Alsacian city during the night and stole more than $2million from its vaults, the police reported. An investigating judge ordered the police not to disclose any details about the investigation and said, if the slightest element got out, my inquiry would be seriously compromised.

title: A Religious History Of the American People
description: The historian of American reEgion finds it easier to communicate than he has been able to for years, Not that life is ail arranged to his tastes. With his historian colleagues he complains of youth's amnesia, low enrollments and budget cuts in many college history departments, and the nonhistorical or antihistorical attitudes of contemporaries. But these problems are compensated for by the fact that when he finds a clientele he need no longer apologize for his subject matter nor have great difficulties transmitting something of the feel of America's spiritual flowerings. Such possibilities for empathy were not so readily available during the two decades after World War II when the modern United States ProtestantCatholic historical canon was being written. William Warren Sweet, Sidney E. Mead, Winthrop Hudson; John Tracy Ellis, Thomas McAvoy, Clifton E. Olmstead, Franklin Littell, Jerald C. Brauer, and other shapers of the story at a time when the old Protestant culture was breaking up were writing to a straight culture. They found themselves implicitly and instinctively apologizing for the collection of olden day dreamers and dogmatists, crusaders and nuts, persecutors and superstitionists with whom they often had to deal. Contemporary religion, by contrast was more grooved and respectable.

title: All Cars Face Pollution Test
description: TRENTONAbout half the dirt inhaled with those 35 pounds of air these days in the Garden State consists of hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide and smoke particles spewed from more than three million car exhausts.

title: Jets, Favored Heavily, Are Wary Concerning Patriots
description: The secondplace New York Jets, with a 42 wonlost record, are 14point favorites over the New England Patriots at Shea Stadium today in a game that will be blacked out over local television.

title: Asia's Population Seen At 3.8 Billion by 2000
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 28 (Reuters)By the year 2000 Asia's population will increase to more than the 1970 total world population, a study released here yesterday predicted.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: ORONO, Me. Oct. 28 (AP)A finalperiod field goal by Bob McConnell followed by a 4yard touchdown run by Jack Lamborghini led the University of Maine to a 16.6 victory over Lafayette today.

title: Tokyo Guards Arrival Of Pandas From China
description: TOKYO, Oct. 28 (UPI)Two giant pandas presented to Japan by Premier Chou Enlai of China arrived today aboard a jet while riot policemen took positions at the airport to keep the curious from approaching the animals.

title: RALLY BY VERMONT TOPS HOFSTRA, 1610
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Oct. 28A fumble recovery in the end zone by Tim Sullivan with 45 seconds remaining today gave favored Vermont a 1610 victory over stubborn Hofstra.

title: Education
description: A student movie reviewer wrote In the Barnard College newspaper last week: How Bunuel at age 70 can still direct such marvelous, memorable, intelligent and worthwhile films is beyond me.

title: Businessmen Run The Big FoundationsCan They Be Expected To Save Them Too?
description: In the great jungle of American democracy and capitalism, there is no more strange or improbable creature than the private foundation. Private foundations are virtually a denial of basic premises: aristocratic institutions living on the privileges and indulgence of an egalitarian society; aggregations of private wealth which, contrary, to the proclaimed instincts of Economic Man, have been conveyed to public purposes. Like the giraffe, they could not possibly exist, but they do.

title: Tenth District
description: The single mostcrucial domestic issue facing the voters of the 10th District is the lack of response from the current Administration to the needs of urban America.

title: Late Rally Erases Stigma
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 28In this suburban reincarnation of Mudville, joy finally came tonight to the lowly New York Islanders and their distraught fans. The team played a tie.

title: A GOLD CUP UPSET
description: Demonstrating the benefit of a recent outing on the same track, Sigmund Sommer's Auto biography scored a smashing victory in the $113,700 Jockey Club Gold Cup at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: World News Briefs
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Oct. 28The new military Government of Dahomey announced today that a number of deposed national leaders were being held under arrest at the presidential palace in Cotonou, the cappital.

title: LungDisease Problem, Traced to Beryllium Refinery, Plagues Hazleton, Pa.
description: HAZLETON, Pa.  In the grim year of 1956, when unemployment in this wornout coal town hovered near 20 per per cent and the region was one of the most depressed in Appalachia, there was general rejoicing when the Chamber of Commerce enticed a beryllium refining plant to settle four miles east of here.

title: Miss Warnes Wed To W. E. Brennan
description: In the chapel at the Church Center for the United Nations yesterday afternoon, Miss MaryEllen Warnes, fashion Publicist for Bloomingdale's, was married to William E. Brennan, executive vice president of Halpern/ McDevitt, Inc., marketing services here. The Rev. Melvin Hawthorne performed the ceremony.

title: A Day in the Life Of a Travel Agent
description: IT was 10:15 A.M. and Jack, the Park Avenue travel agent, was already deep into the day's calls, looking rather like an overworked octopus as he juggled three telephones (two on the desk, one on the wall behind him), several airline schedules and hotel directories, a wellchewed ballpoint pen and innumerable scraps of notecovered yellow paper that formed a filing system incomprehensible to anyone but Jack himself (if he's lucky). A huge Pan Am route map with time zones marked on it filled the entire wall alongside his desk. Jack's agency, a small and rather special one, caters to a good many large corporations and a small galaxy of celebrities and journalists in addition to

title: StreetLight Bases Stolen
description: Queens detectives and investigators for three other city agencies are investigating the disappearance of 1,600 cast aluminum street light bases, valued at $40,000, from a Department of Public Works storage yard at 4503 37th Avenue, in Long Island City. The bases, valued at $30 each, could have been stolen from the yard over a long period of time, the police said.

title: Julia Hunter Bride of M. A. Galdo
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28Miss Julia Gannon Hunter, director of public relations at Trinity College, was married at noon today to Manuel Alberto Galdo, an electrical engineer with Bechtel Associates, consulting engineers here.

title: SHOP TALK
description: A jewelry, and gift shop in the East Flatbush section of Brooklyn has adopted the goldselling system common in Zurich and London and the result has been tremendous savings for retail buyers.

title: DOUGLASS B. SIMONSON
description: Douglass B. Simonson, a former vice president of the First National City Bank in charge of the branch at Madison Avenue and 42d Street, died yesterday at his home, 1120 Park Avenue. His age was 75.

title: Art
description: FOR nearly 60 years Constructivism has been one of the central movements, or tendencies, of modern art. Drawing its inspiration from the infrastructure of Cubist painting, sculpture and collage, Constructivism promptly turned its back on all attempts to represent the observable worlda task which the inventors of Cubism still held dearin order to create an art of pure form. And not just any form, but forms that could be rationalized and systematized, forms that carry no personal or literary associations, forms stripped clean of all historical encrustations and poetic evocations. In practice, this meant either geometric form or immaculate nongeometric forms that would be as legible and literal to the eye as a circle or a square.

title: TWO YEMENS SIGN UNIFICATION PACT
description: CAIRO, Oct. 28, (Reuters) The two Yemens, north and south, signed an agreement here tonight to unite into one country and called a meeting between their heads of state for Nov. 25.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: OTTAWALast month Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz appeared before the board of governors of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank. The message he sought to convey was clear: Balanceof  payments surpluses and deficits are like bronchitis  unhealthy if chronic.

title: A collection of rock
description: The Fillmore East has been dead for a while bow, but I can still remember the ringing in my ears and what it was like walking out on to Second Avenue with a splitting headache, completely exhausted, feeling great, you know, though the music wasn't always that good. The soundthat rock n roll was everywhere, man, in your eyes, down your pants, pushing you by force of volume into your seat, getting you higher and higher.

title: Gardens
description: PERHAPS leaf cuttings are the most exciting challenge of all. The wedge method is.often used when rooting Rex begonias. Take a good mature, healthy leaf and remove the stem to about one fourth of an inch from the base of the leaf. Cut off the outer edge and make wedges leaving two veins to each wedge.

title: Views of Review
description: To THE EDITOR: In an ad in The Week in Review Oct. 15, fortyfive academicians urged their fellow citizens to vote for Richard Nixon. The endorsement was not very surprising since many of the scholars listed have bee cold war warriors or law and order enthusiasts long before Mr. Nixon occupied the White House.

title: Northwest'n Tops Indiana, 2314
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Oct. 28 (AP)A deflected pass from Mitch Anderson to his end, Jim Lash, for an 81yard scoring play rallied Northwestern today to its first Big Ten victory, a 2314 triumph over Indiana.

title: Colgate Conquers The Citadel, 28 to 26
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Oct. 28 (UPI)Colgate capitalized today on costly Citadel errors to score three firsthalf touchdowns, then hung on to pin a 2826 defeat on the Bulldogs.

title: Ellen Hirsch Fiancee Of Donald Brounstein
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Oct. 28The engagement of Miss Ellen Sara Hirsch to Donald Bruce Brounstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Brounstein of Murray Hill has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Howard A. Hirsch of South Orange.

title: Barbara B. Sayers Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Barbara Beth Sayers and Dr. Kenneth Braun plan to be married Dec. 16 at Temple EmanuEl. Mr. and Mrs. Theodore R. Sayers of New York and West Redding, Conn., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs, Leonard Braun of Pound Ridge, N.Y.

title: Nassau South
description: Freeport took sole possession of first place in South Shore Division II yesterday when it knocked Uniondale from the undefeated ranks, 2012, by turning the game around in the second half.

title: Javits Visits CoOp City in Bid To Attract Jewish Vote to Nixon
description: If ever there was a case for, the other side, it was the Vietnam war, Senator Jacob K. Javits told a rainspattered crowd in CoOp City yesterday. And now that's gone, too.

title: The Talk of Hasbrouck Heights
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS I'm going to have to take in rented cars, said the gasstation owner as he looked at workmen pouring concrete for the foundation of the Sheraton Heights Motor Inn at the border of this community and Hackensack.

title: $750,000 Fund Given For U. of Texas Chair
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 28A $750,000 trust to establish the Distinguished Visiting Tom Slick Professorship of World Peace in the Lyndon B. Johnson School of Public Affairs has been accepted by the University of Texas System Board of Regents.

title: The Pinnacle Of Kitsch. SouthernStyle
description: ATLANTAGeologically speaking, Stone Mountain is quite something, a great and ridiculous outcropping of granite not 16 miles from the heart of this city, sitting there like a huge gray whale in repose. Because it nestles in the rolling Georgia foothillsit is thought to be the southernmost hint of the Appalachiansyou can't see Stone Mountain from a distance at ground level. It always appears of a sudden and fullblown, more or less in your way. To the unsuspecting traveler on Georgia Highway 78, a first sighting of the 825foot mountain from a distance of about three miles must come as a great shock. It's just not something within anybody's frame of experience. It is not a larger version of badlands boulders or anything like that. It's a great nude rock mountain, that's all.

title: Herblock's State of The Union
description: If Herblock had never drawn so much as a rough sketch, his incisive thought and pungent prose would have established him as a leading commentator. As it is, his reputation as a great political cartoonist overshadows his writing.

title: GEORGIA DEFEATS KENTUCKY, 13 TO 7
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 28 (AP)  A spectacular Georgia defense, capped by a passinterception by Gene Swinford, gave the Bulldogs a 137 victory over Kentucky today in a Southeastern Conference football game.

title: GEORGE SPELVIN HANDICAP VICTOR
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Oct. 28 (AP)Mike Hole rode Elberon Farm's George Spelvin and Mrs. Nelson Amiel's Crafty Khale to victories today in the split divisions of the Benjamin Franklin Handicap at Garden State Park.

title: New York
description: New York City is governable. An unlikely comment, save from a man who wants the job of governing. And from all evidence, City Council President Sanford D. Garelik is such a man.

title: EUGENE WRIGHT, 69, A TRAVELERWRITER
description: LONG VALLEY, N. J., Oct. 28  Eugene Wright, an author and adventurer, died of cancer yesterday at his home here. He was 69 years old.

title: 39 Auburn Players Fail MeningitisGerm Test
description: AUBURN, N. Y., Oct. 28 (AP)Throat cultures on 25 more members of the Auburn football team proved positive today, bringing to 39 the number of players shown to be carrying a germ that can cause meningitis.

title: St. Lawrence Ends Streak
description: CANTON, N.Y. Oct. 28 (AP) Jeff Kantor threw two touchdown passes and Scott Menzies scored twice on short runs to lead St. Lawrence to a 2614 victory Over Hamilton today St. Lawrence, snapped a threegame losing streak with the triumph.

title: 6 Protesters on Rails Held
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., Oct. 28 (UM)  Six antiwar protesters were arrested today after trying unsuccessfully to block freight train they thought might he loaded with ammunition hound for Southeast Asia. The six were part of a group of 30 who staged a people's blockage protest along the BurlingtonNorthern Railroad itcks.

title: Airbus Makes First Flight, Over the South of France
description: TOULOUSE, France, Oct. 28 (AP)The Airbus, the biggest aircraft ever built on the Continent, made its maiden flight today, flying at various altitudes over the south of France for an hour and 25 minutes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent debate in your pages about French baking methods and MarieAntoinette's alleged Let them eat cake perpetuates a foolish legend.
