description: Traffic Cop, well regarded as a sprinter, demonstrated his ability by taking the feature event at Aqueduct yesterday. The 3yearold, owned by Mrs. Adele Rand, beat eight rivals in a sevenfurlong sprint, and did so with relative ease.

title: NEW CHARTER SET FOR NORTH KOREA
description: TOKYO, Oct. 30The official North Korean press agency said today that the draft of a new North Korean constitution had been completed to prepare for the reunification of the divided peninsula.

title: Bridge:
description: There comes a time in bridge as in life wnen a routine decision is not good enough. Rules of thumb may have to be abandoned in exceptional cases.

title: Israel Issues Protest
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 30 (Agence FrancePresse)Israel protested today to West Germany in the most energetic terms against what she called capitulation to terrorists.

title: Colangelo Replaces van Breda Kolff as Suns Coach
description: The ax fell for the second National Basketball Association coach in three days yesterday. William (Butch) van Breda Kolff was dismissed as coach of the Phoenix Suns and replaced by Jerry Colangelo, the general manager. Last Saturday night, Earl Lloyd was dropped by the Detroit Pistons and succeeded by Ray Scott.

title: Potato Has Ring Inside
description: SHIMPLING, England (UPI)Arnold Andrews, a gardener, said he had dug up a potato in a backyard plot and had discovered a gold ring set with diamdnds embedded in it.

title: Redskin Quarterback Situation Leaves Ewbank Cautious, Quiet
description: Continued From Page 57 13 straight winning games against the Patriots  Pettis Norman, the San Diego tight end, is out for the season with a dislocated shoulder.

title: COMMUNISTS SEIZE A HIGHLANDS CAMP
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Oct. 31  A South Vietnamese border camp in the Central Highlands was lost Sunday night to a heavy Communist shelling and infantry attack, the Saigon command said yesterday.

title: 44 Die, 320 Hurt as Chicago Commuter Trains Crash
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 30At least 44 persons were killed and more than 320 injured this morning in the nation's worst railroad accident in 14 years when one Illinois Central commuter train was crushed from behind by another.

title: Outrage in the Skies
description: Two more outrageous hijackings in rapid succession provide rude reminders of the feebleness of all efforts to date by the international community to deal with this despicable crime. As the result of these affairs, the only participants who might have been brought to justice for the murder of eleven Israeli athletes in Munich are now enjoying sanctuary in Libya; and three Americans wanted in connection with murder and armed robbery have escaped to Cuba, leaving a fresh trail of blood in their wake.

title: Ford Seeks Honda Tie
description: TOKYO, Oct. 30 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company has proposed a business arrangement with the Honda Motor Company, Ltd., involving the sales tcad technical divisions of both companies, a Tokyo newspaper said today.

title: ALBERT L. REGISTER
description: Albert Layton Register, who retired in 1964 as a sales executive of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., textiles,. died Sunday in Middletown, N. J. He was 73 years old and lived at 530 East 72d Street.

title: Megalopolis Show: Artists and the Urban Scene
description: Artists, they say, are not like you and me. Among other things, they react differently to the problems and frustrations of the urban environment, as evidenced in the New York Cultural Center's current show, Making Megalopolis Matter (to Nov. 9), billed as an artists response to a previous show at the center called Making New York Understandable.

title: LATE RALLY CUTS MARKETS LOSSES
description: A modest rally in the final half hour of trading brought prices back almost to an even keel yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange after earlier losses indicated some uneasiness over delays in signing an Indochina peace accord.

title: If People Won't Eat The Healthful Foods, What Can Be Done?
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.Meals eaten away from home, whether voluntary (say, on an airliner) or involuntary (a worker's lunch), are increasing at such a rate that they are making up the fastestgrowing segment of the food industry. And with these meals the consumer has only a certain amount of leeway, in trying to achieve good nutrition.

title: Copper Decision Delayed
description: VAESTERAAS, Sweden Oct, 30 (AP)A court in Vaesteraas decided today not to take up the question of the two disrupted copper shiploads from the Chilean state  owned copper mines until the ships have reached Swedish territory, The Kennecott Corporation has asked that the copper be embargoed in Sweden,

title: Music. Sari Biro at Piano
description: When Sari Biro made her debut here in 1940 she began with Rameau's Gavotte with Six Variations, from the Pieces de Clavecin, Book Three, Her success on that occasion must have left happy Memories, for when the Hungarianborn pianist returned on Sunday night for her first recital here in 12 years she once again opened with Rameau's glittering harpsichord work.

title: City Health Aide Hears of Care at Coney
description: Mrs. Gabriela Ventura, sitting in a satellite clinic of Coney Island Hospital, yesterday, told through an interpreter of the series of events that ended last week in the death of her 2yearold daughter.

title: Bonn Defends Action
description: BONN, Oct. 30The West German Government adopted cool stance today toward official Israeli accusations of capitulation in the hijacking.

title: Ramon Knocks Out Dwyer
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Oct. 30 (AP)  Charley Ramon of Australia got off the floor in the sixth round tonight to stop Pat Dwyer of England in the eighth and win the vacant British Commonwealth junior middleweight championship.

title: Chess:
description: The fifth Women's Chess Olympics was held conjointly this year with the men's event in Skopije, Yugoslavia, and a record of 23 teams participated.

title: SHOP TALK
description: New Yorkers no longer need to cross the Atlantic to purchase Fortnum & Mason delicacies. Products of the 265yearold London store, which fed Wellington's officers during the Napoleonic Wars and sent 250 pounds of beef tea to the Crimea for Florence Nightingale are now available at B. Altman & Co.

title: State Department Criticism
description: WASHINOTON; Oct.'30 (Reuters) The State Department expressed disapproval today of the West German release of the Arab guerrillas involved in the slaying of. 11 Israelis, at the Olympic Gaines.

title: Benefits of Food Additives Cited by Utah Nutritionist
description: LOGAN, Utah, Oct. 30 (UPI) Food additives can be good for you, according to Flora Bardwell, a food and nutrition specialist at Utah State University.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Nassau County Board of Supervisors voted along party lines to acquire ownership of the county's 10 financially distressed bus lines for $29million to $33million. The law adopted does not stipulate whether the county, which has a Department of Transportation and Franchises, will set up an authority to run the buses or whether there will lie an arrangement with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to operate the lines.

title: Grand Jury to Investigate Killing by Border Officers
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 30 (UPI)An Erie County grand jury will look into incidents surrounding the death of the man shot by two United States border patrol officers Saturday night in the Buffalo Greyhound bus terminal.

title: DELPHINE BROWNLEE MAKES SONG DEBUT
description: Delphine Brownlee, soprano and daughter of the late Metropoliton Opera baritone John Brownlee, made her formal New York debut in Carnegie Recital Hall late Sunday afternoon. While not possessing a particularly beautiful or evenly schooled voiceits steely quality is apt to get out of control occasionally  Miss Brownlee projected the songs on her program with seasoned assurance and a shrewd appreciation of their various moods.

title: Radio
description: The second annual convention of the Society of American VintageRadio Enthusiasts (SAVE) was held last weekend at a Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge in Connecticut. Following several fervent pleas for a revival of radio drama, members attended a Golden Radio Awards Dinner to honor Raymond Edward Johnson, who on Inner Sanctum was both the host and the weekly opener of the squeaking door.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Oct. 30Mayor Gerald Goldman announced today a sixpoint program designed to help Passaic rebound from the announced closing of two of its largest manufacturing plants with a loss of 2,600 jobs.

title: Japanese TV Exports Up
description: TOKYO, Oct. 30 (AP)Exports of Japanese color television sets totaled a record 227,521 units in September, up 41.4 per cent from a year earlier, the Electronics Industry Association of Japan announced today.

title: SANT FATEH SINGH, LED PUNJAB SIKHS
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 30Sant Fateh Singh, a leader of the Sikhs in Punjab, died today of a heart attack in Amritsar. He was 61 years old.

title: Hanoi Says U.S. Pilot Was Killed in AirRaid
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Oct. 31 (Reuters)The Hanoi radio said today that an American pilot whose plane was shot down in North Vietnem on Sunday was killed during an airraid by other American planes soon after he was captured.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Times endorsements for U. S. Senate, announced Oct. 24, contain a number of inconsistencies which ought to be pointed out.

title: Bush Expresses Outrage at Hijacking, an a. U.N. Too Slow on Terrorism
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct, 30George Bush, the United States representative here, said today that Washington was not satisfied with the progress of efforts at the United Nations to counteract international terrorism.

title: Student Environmentalist Is Honored
description: COLD SPRING, N.Y., Oct. 30Several dozen environmentalists and Government lawyers gathered this morning at the edge of a tidal marsh on the Hudson River shore here to plant a tree in memory of a young college student whose investigations led to the first successful cases against industrial polluters of the Hudson.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Remember the allegations last year about politicizing statistics on unemployment, etc.? Well, they have been investigated by a Congressional committee (Committee on Post Office and Civil Service, Subcommittee on Census and Statistics, House of Representatives) and a report was issued Oct. 5. Many news stories have been written about the allegations, but little or nothing on the committee's findings.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. to elect nine members of the Economic and Social Council and to discuss a report of the International Atomic Energy Agency.

title: Chinese Doctors, on Coast, Visit Stanford U. and Birth Pill Plant
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 30 The group of Chinese doctors touring the United States came here today and saw medical slides, a man with a transplanted heart riding an exercise cycle and a giant laboratory where birth control pills are made.

title: PARENTS BOYCOTT NITS 6 SCHOOLS IN CANARSIE AREA
description: A communitywide parents' boycott kept more than 9,000 Canarsie pupils out of classes and forced six schools to close yesterday as 29 black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville, guarded by 200 riotequipped policemen, again attended John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Brooklyn.

title: SIKORSKY IS BURIED NEAR HISTORIC SITE
description: STRATFORD, Conn., Oct. 30 Igor I. Sikorsky, the aviation pioneer, was buried here today only a few miles from the landing strip where he piloted 43 years ago the world's first practical helicopter, a spindly craft he himself had designed.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: MILLBROOK, N. J. Residents facing eviction from the beautiful Delaware River Valley have had nothing but praise for the recent statement by Governor Cahill that has delayed construction of the Tocks Island Dam.

title: joffrey Fulfills a Dream: Reviving Cherished Ballets
description: You are not going to get a nod of agreement from Robert Joffrey by calling his City Center Joffrey Ballet pop company.

title: Communists Take Laotian Town
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Oct. 30 (UPI) North Vietnamese and Pathet Lao forces captured the town of Kengkok, a military camp and a hill position in southern Laos, during the weekend, military sources said today. Refugees reported that three American missionaries and a Canadian were captured by the Communist forces.

title: About Pro Football
description: Sonny Jurgensen went to surgery. Bill Kilmer felt bad. Weeb Ewbank ducked another issue and Sam Wyche emerged from the darkness of the taxi squad. These events came to pass yesterday as Jurgensen's ruptured Achilles tendon was repaired at Georgetown Hospital in Washington. Kilmer, Jurgensen's replacement as the No. 1 Redskin quarterback, said, I'm disappointed.

title: POUND OFF AGAIN AS RUMORS FLY
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 30Karl Klasen, Governor of the West German central bank, tonight denied rumors rampant in Zurich, Switzerland, today that Common Market central banks were supporting the pound to halt its precipitous decline in the foreignexchange markets.

title: MANILA IS OFFERING DETAINEES FREEDOM
description: MANILA, Oct, 30The martiallaw Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that it would release certhin political detainees if they renounced their connections with Communist and other antiGovernment groups.

title: Attacks Reported in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct, 30 (UPI)Enemy gunners fired five 122mm. rockets into an ammunition depot eight miles southwest of Pnompenh early today, killing at least five soldiers and wounding at least 30. A series of explosions shook the Cambodian capital until dawn.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Chromalloy American Corporation announced yesterday that its directors had approved a plan to offer publicly, some time next year, by means of a prospectus and registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission equity participation in several of the company's eight major industrial groups of operating companies. The operating companies, in such fields as metals and metallurgy, consumer goods and services, textiles and others, would be organized as new subsidiaries of Chromalloy. The subsidiaries would continue to be controlled by the parent company but equity shares in them would also be offered to the public. Joseph Friedman, chairman, said that the initial offering would not be filed before next February at the earliest:. Chromalloy closed at 17, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board said today that its 12 reserve banks would now be allowed to act individually on applications form onebank holding companies if those applications met certain guidelines. Previously the full board had to act on all such applications.

title: Appeals Court Rules That Group Seeking to Impeach Nixon Acted Within Campaign Law
description: An injunction against a committee seeking to impeach President Nixon was overturned here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Screen: Two Documentaries on Police Surveillance
description: A cleancut man in a business suit perches atop the roof of a small building in Central Park snapping pictures of the participants at an antiwar demonstration. Excuse me, sir, says a longhaired young man in blue jeans suddenly pointing a microphone at the rather startled picturetaker. Are you a member of the Police Department? The first man smiles sheephishly and shakes his head.

title: ExPolice Head Will Hear Charges Against Fuentes
description: Vincent L. Broderick, a former City Police Commissioner, was named yesterday to hear charges against Luis Fuentes, the superintendent of School District 1 on the Lower East Side who has been accused of antiSemitism by three Jewish community organizations.

title: Arabs Charge Cruelty
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Oct. 30 (Reuters)  The three freed Arab guerrillas have accused West German authorities of illtreatment, the official Libyan News Agency reported today.

title: SHIP ABANDONED IN CARTERET FIRE
description: The German captain of a Liberian tanker testified yesterday that he had given the order to abandon ship at a spectacular fire in Carteret, N.J., last week and that all had left the vessel except himself.

title: ALASKA SNOW HALTS LONG BOGGS SEARCH
description: ANCHORAGE, Oct. 30 (UPI) Wintry weather kept search planes grounded today and hope waned for the House majority leader Hale Boggs, and three other persons lost in a light plane two weeks ago.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Inevitably at this time of year in northern New England and other areas with substantial numbers of ruffed grouse, country editors will get phone calls from householders who have had a sudden and catastrophic visit from one of these birds.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct. 30An upsurge of Democratic interest here in the Presidential campaign in the last two weeks has brought a new element into what even Hudson County politicians see as a most labyrinthine election year.

title: Penn Central Pay Is Raised
description: PHILADEUPHIA, Oct. 30 (AP) A Federal judge approved 5 per cent pay increases today for several thousand employes of the financially troubled Penn Central railroad. Railroad trustees estimated that the increases plus additional benefits would cost about $50million year, the trustees said.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: MGOVERN ASSAILS NIXON AS ELUSIVE
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 30Senator George McGovern charged here tonight that for the first time in the history of this country, we have had a Presidential campaign with only one candidate.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The United Automobile Workers Union yesterday dropped its threat of opposition to the state transportation bond issue after receiving assurances that the state's largest bus company had no plans to buy Belgianmade buses with the bond proceeds.

title: Pilot and Lufthansa Chief Defend Freeing of Arabs
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Oct. 30 (AP)The chairman of Lufthansa, the West German airline; and a Lufthansa pilot took the responsibility today for a controversial decision to release three Arab terrorists in Yugoslavia without winning the simultaneous release of 18 people on a hijacked airliner.
